dialogue: Skyrim opens with an Imperial wagon driving four prisoners down a snowy mountain pass. All are seated and bound; the one dressed in finery is gagged.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Hey, you. You're finally awake. You were trying to cross the border, right? Walked right into that Imperial ambush, same as us, and that thief over there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Damn you Stormcloaks. Skyrim was fine until you came along. Empire was nice and lazy. If they hadn't been looking for you, I could've stolen that horse and been half way to Hammerfell. You there. You and me -- we should be here. It's these Stormcloaks the Empire wants.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We're all brothers and sisters in binds now, thief.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Shut up back there!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lokir looks at the gagged man.
label: ACTION

dialogue: And what's wrong with him?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Watch your tongue! You're speaking to Ulfric Stormcloak, the true High King.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ulfric? The Jarl of Windhelm? You're the leader of the rebellion. But if they captured you... Oh gods, where are they taking us?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't know where we're going, but Sovngarde awaits.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, this can't be happening. This isn't happening.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, what village are you from, horse thief?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why do you care?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A Nord's last thoughts should be of home.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Rorikstead. I'm...I'm from Rorikstead.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They approach the village of Helgen. A soldier calls out to the lead wagon.
label: ACTION

dialogue: General Tullius, sir! The headsman is waiting!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good. Let's get this over with.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Shor, Mara, Dibella, Kynareth, Akatosh. Divines, please help me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look at him, General Tullius the Military Governor. And it looks like the Thalmor are with him. Damn elves. I bet they had something to do with this. This is Helgen. I used to be sweet on a girl from here. Wonder if Vilod is still making that mead with juniper berries mixed in. Funny...when I was a boy, Imperial walls and towers used to make me feel so safe.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A man and son watch the prisoners pull into town.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Who are they, daddy? Where are they going?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You need to go inside, little cub.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why? I want to watch the soldiers.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Inside the house. Now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The wagon stops near the chopping block.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Whoa.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why are they stopping?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why do you think? End of the line. Let's go. Shouldn't keep the gods waiting for us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No! Wait! We're not rebels!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Face your death with some courage, thief.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Under the Imperials' watchful eye, the prisoners start jumping out.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You've got to tell them! We weren't with you! This is a mistake!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Step toward the block when we call your name. One at a time!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Empire loves their damn lists.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ulfric Stormcloak. Jarl of Windhelm.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It has been an honor, Jarl Ulfric!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ralof of Riverwood. Lokir of Rorikstead.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, I'm not a rebel! You can't do this!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He makes a break for it.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Halt!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're not going to kill me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Archers!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lokir is downed with one bowshot.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Anyone else feel like running?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wait, you there. Step forward. Who are you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player picks his/her character, prompting a race-related remark.
label: ACTION

dialogue: • You picked a bad time to come home to Skyrim, kinsman. • Not many wood elves would choose to come alone to Skyrim. • You from Daggerfall, Breton? Fleeing from some court intrigue? • You from one of the strongholds, Orc? How did you end up here? • Are you a relative of one of the Riften dock workers, Argonian? • Another refugee? Gods really have abandoned your people, dark elf. • You're a long way from the Imperial City. What're you doing in Skyrim? • What are you doing here, Redguard? You a sellsword? A sailor from Stros M'kai? • You with one of the trade caravans, Khajiit? Your kind always seems to find trouble. • You're not with the Thalmor Embassy, are you, high elf? No, that can't be right... Captain, what should we do? He's not on the list.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Forget the list. He goes to the block.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: By your orders, captain. • I'm sorry. At least you'll die here, in your homeland. • I'm sorry. We'll make sure your remains are returned to Elsweyr. • I'm sorry. We'll make sure your remains are returned to Cyrodiil. • I'm sorry. We'll make sure your remains are returned to Orsinium. • I'm sorry. We'll make sure your remains are returned to High Rock. • I'm sorry. We'll make sure your remains are returned to Morrowind. • I'm sorry. We'll make sure your remains are returned to Valenwood. • I'm sorry. We'll make sure your remains are returned to Hammerfell. • I'm sorry. We'll make sure your remains are returned to Black Marsh. • I'm sorry. We'll make sure your remains are returned to the Summerset Isle. Follow the Captain, prisoner.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player goes to stand with the other waiting prisoners by the block.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Ulfric Stormcloak. Some here in Helgen call you a hero, but a hero doesn't use a power like the Voice to murder his king and usurp his throne.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (grunting protest)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You started this war, plunged Skyrim into chaos and now the Empire is going to put you down, and restore the peace.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A distant noise rings down the mountainside.
label: ACTION

dialogue: What was that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's nothing. Carry on.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, General Tullius. Give them their last rites.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As we commend your souls to Aetherius, blessings of the Eight Divines upon you, for you are the salt and earth of Nirn, our beloved--
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One of the prisoners from the lead wagon walks forward.
label: ACTION

dialogue: For the love of Talos, shut up and lets get this over with.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As you wish...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come on, I haven't got all morning. My ancestors are smiling at me, Imperials. Can you say the same?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They behead the Stormcloak, eliciting responses from the onlookers.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You Imperial bastards!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Justice!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Death to the Stormcloaks!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As fearless in death as he was in life.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: • Next, the cat! • Next, the Orc! • Next, the lizard! • Next, the Breton! • Next, the Redguard! • Next, the dark elf! • Next, the high elf! • Next, the wood elf! • Next, the Nord in the rags! • Next, the renegade from Cyrodiil!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Another cry rings out on the mountainside, this time much closer.
label: ACTION

dialogue: There it is again. Did you hear that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I said, next prisoner!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: To the block, prisoner. Nice and easy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player is brought to the chopping block. A large creature swoops over the southern peaks, barreling toward Helgen.
label: ACTION

dialogue: What in Oblivion is that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sentries! What do you see?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's in the clouds!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The creature, know seen as a dragon, lands on a tower, surprising everyone.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Dragon!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The dragon uses its voice on the crowd, killing the headsman.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Nngh!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't just stand there, kill that thing! Guards, get the townspeople to safety!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: • Hey, Argonian. Get up! Come on, the gods won't give us another chance! • Hey, Breton. Get up! Come on, the gods won't give us another chance! • Hey, dark elf. Get up! Come on, the gods won't give us another chance! • Hey, high elf. Get up! Come on, the gods won't give us another chance! • Hey, you! Get up! Come on, the gods won't give us another chance! • Hey, Khajiit! Get up! Come on, the gods won't give us another chance! • Hey, kinsman. Get up! Come on, the gods won't give us another chance! • Hey, Orc! Get up! Come on, the gods won't give us another chance! • Hey, Redguard! Get up! Come on, the gods won't give us another chance! • Hey, wood elf! Get up! Come on, the gods won't give us another chance! This way!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ralof leads the player to a tower where the other prisoners are hiding.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Jarl Ulfric! What is that thing? Could the legends be true?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Legends don't burn down villages. We need to move, now!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Up through the tower. Let's go! This way, friend! Move!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We just need to move some of these rocks to clear the way!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The dragon, Alduin, breaks in through the wall, blasting fire everywhere.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Get back!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Toor shul! {"Inferno Sun"}
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They survey the damage when the dragon leaves.
label: ACTION

dialogue: See the inn on the other side? Jump through the roof and keep going! Go! We'll follow you when we can!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player proceeds alone, encountering the list-giver with some refugees.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Haming, you need to get over here now! Thataboy. You're doing great! Torolf! Gods...everyone get back!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They survive a blast of fire breath.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Still alive, prisoner? Keep close to me if you want to stay that way. Gunnar, take care of the boy. I have to find General Tullius and join the defense.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Gods guide you, Hadvar.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Stay close to the wall!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They take cover as a dragon perches right above.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Vol toor shul! {"Horror Inferno Sun"}
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Quickly, follow me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They reach the main gate's carnage. Soldiers are firing arrows in vain.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Tell my family I fought bravely!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hadvar! Into the keep, soldier, we're leaving!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's you and me, prisoner, stay close!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Die, dragon!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How in Oblivion do we kill this thing? Just...die!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Near the keep, Ralof is seen.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Ralof! You damned traitor, out of my way!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We're escaping, Hadvar! You're not stopping us this time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fine. I hope that dragon takes you all to Sovngarde.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You, come on! Into the keep!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: With me, prisoner! Let's go! Come on! We need to get inside!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player can pick who to follow from this point on, which determines the enemies to the chapter's end.
label: ACTION

dialogue: IF YOU PICK HADVAR AS THE GUIDE IF YOU PICK HADVAR AS THE GUIDE
label: ACTION

dialogue: Looks like we're the only ones who made it. Was that really a dragon? The bringers of the End Times? We should keep moving. Come here. Let me see if I can get those bindings off. There you go. Take a look around, there should be plenty of gear to choose from. I'm going to see if I can find something for these burns. You better get that armor on. Give sword a few swings, too. Let's keep moving. That thing is still out there. Come on, this way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We need to get moving! That dragon is tearing up the whole keep!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just give me a minute...I'm out of breath...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hear that? Stormcloaks. Maybe we can reason with them. Hold on now, we only want to...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They draw their weapons.
label: ACTION

dialogue: If you want to die, so be it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They kill the Stormcloaks.
label: ACTION

dialogue: That's the end of that. Let's see if I can get that door open.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They go downstairs, just in time for a collapsing roof.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Look out! Damn, that dragon doesn't give up easy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What are you doing? We need to get out of Helgen now!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Imperials have potions in here. We're going to need them.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: An old storeroom. See if you can find some potions. Might come in handy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Done then? This way!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Downstairs is a torture room where the workers are fighting Stormcloaks.
label: ACTION

dialogue: A torture room. Gods, I wish we didn't need these...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You fellows happened along just in time. These boys seemed quite upset at how I'd been entertaining their comrades.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't you even know what's going on? A dragon is attacking Helgen!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A dragon? Please. Don't make up nonsense...although, come to think of it, I did hear some odd noises coming from over there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come with us. We need to get out of here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have no authority over me, boy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Didn't you hear me? I said the keep is under attack!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Forget the old man. I'll come with you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wait a second, looks like there's something in this cage.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't bother with that. Lost the key ages ago. Poor fellow screamed for weeks.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: See if you can get it open with some picks. We'll need everything we can get.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sure, take all my things. Please.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Grab what you can and let's go.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's no way out that way, you know...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player and his guide go further downstairs.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Alright, let's see if we can find a way out. Let's see where this goes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They open a bridge into the tunnels, passing over before a rock breaks it.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Damn it. No going back that way. I guess we're lucky that didn't come down on top of us. We better push on. I'm sure the others will find another way out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Following the stream leads to a dead end.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Hmm, that doesn't go anywhere. I guess we'd better try this way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They kill a den of spiders nearby.
label: ACTION

dialogue: What next, giant snakes?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nearby...
label: ACTION

dialogue: Hold up. There's a bear just ahead. See her? I'd rather not tangle with her right now. We might be able to sneak by. Just take it nice and slow, and watch where you step. Or if you're feeling lucky, you can take this bow. Might take her by surprise. Go ahead. I'll follow your lead and watch your back.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: At the exit...
label: ACTION

dialogue: This looks like the way out! I was starting to wonder if we'd ever make it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player finally makes it out into fresh air.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Wait!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Alduin flies away overhead.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Looks like he's gone for good this time. But I don't think we should stick around to see if he comes back. Closest town from here is Riverwood. My uncle's the blacksmith there. I'm sure he could help you out. It's probably best if we split up. Good luck. I wouldn't have made it without your help today. Listen, you should go to Solitude and join up with the Imperial Legion. We could really use someone like you. And if the rebels have themselves a dragon, General Tullius is the only one who can stop them.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The two escapees set off down the road.
label: ACTION

dialogue: IF YOU PICK RALOF AS YOUR GUIDE IF YOU PICK RALOF AS YOUR GUIDE
label: ACTION

dialogue: Upon entering the keep, Ralof goes to check on a fallen comrade.
label: ACTION

dialogue: We'll meet again in Sovngarde, brother. Looks like we're the only ones who made it. That thing was a dragon. No doubt. Just like the children's stories and the legends. The harbingers of the End Times. We better get moving. Come here, let me see if I can get those bindings off. There you go. May as well take Gunjar's gear...he won't be needing it anymore. Alright, get that armor on and give that axe a few swings. I'm going to see if I can find some way out of here. This one's locked. Let's see about that gate. Damn. No way to open this from our side.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come on, soldier! Keep moving!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's the Imperials! Take cover!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Get this gate open.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Imperial dogs!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The captain and her associate are ambushed and killed.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Maybe one of these Imperials had the key. Let's see here... Here we are, found a key. Let's see if it opens that door. That's it! Come on, let's get out of here before the dragon brings the whole tower down on our heads.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They go downstairs, almost getting trapped under the collapsing ceiling.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Look out! Damn, that dragon doesn't give up easy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Grab everything important and let's move! The dragon is burning everything to the ground.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just need to gather some more potions.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ralof and his cohort kill the next guards.
label: ACTION

dialogue: A storeroom. See if you can find any potions. We'll need them. Done? Let's get moving.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They go downstairs to the torture room, where Stormcloaks are fighting.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Troll's blood! It's a torture room. Hear that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They kill the torturers.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Is Jarl Ulfric with you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, I haven't seen him since the dragon showed up.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wait a second. Looks like there's something in this cage. It's locked. See if you can get it open with some picks. We might need that gold once we get out. Grab anything useful and let's go.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Downstairs are more soldiers.
label: ACTION

dialogue: The orders are to wait until General Tullius arrives.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not waiting to be killed by a dragon!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Afterwards...
label: ACTION

dialogue: Let's go on ahead. See if the way is clear. Let's see where this goes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They cross a bridge, narrowly avoiding a falling rock.
label: ACTION

dialogue: No going back that way, now. We'd better push on. The rest of them will have to find another way out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They follow a stream to a dead end.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Hmm, that doesn't go anywhere. I guess we'd better try this way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They dispatch some frostbite spiders.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I hate those damn things. Too many eyes, you know?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They come upon a sleeping bear.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Hold up. There's a bear just ahead. See her? I'd rather no tangle with her right now. Let's try to sneak by. Just take it nice and slow, and watch where you step. Or if you're feeling lucky, you can take this bow. Might take her by surprise. Go ahead. I'll follow your lead and watch your back.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They finally reach the exit.
label: ACTION

dialogue: That looks like the way out! I knew we'd make it!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They watch as Alduin flies overhead and away.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Wait! There he goes. Looks like he's gone for good this time. No way to know if anyone else made it out alive. But this place is going to be swarming with Imperials soon enough. We'd better clear out of here. My sister Gerdur runs the mill in Riverwood, just up the road. I'm sure she'd help you out. It's probably best if we split up. Good luck. I wouldn't have made it without your help today. You know, you should go to Windhelm and join the fight for free Skyrim. You've seen the true face of the Empire here today. If anyone will know what the coming of the dragon means, it's Ulfric.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The escapees flee Helgen, heading to the river.
label: ACTION

dialogue: If the player follows Ralof/Hadvar, they'll make conversation en route, even stopping at the Standing Stones along the path.
label: ACTION

dialogue: IF YOU PICK RALOF AS YOUR GUIDE IF YOU PICK RALOF AS YOUR GUIDE
label: ACTION

dialogue: See that ruin up there? Bleak Falls Barrow. I never understood how my sister could stand living in the shadow of that place. I guess you get used to it. These are the Guardian Stones, three of the thirteen ancient standing stones that dot Skyrim's landscape. Go ahead, see for yourself. • Mage, eh? Well, to each his own. It's not for me to judge. • Warrior, good! Those stars will guide you to honor and glory. • Thief, eh? It's never too late to take charge of your own fate, you know. Remember, this isn't Stormcloak territory. If we're ahead of the news from Helgen, we should be fine as long as we don't do anything stupid. If we run into any Imperials, just let me do the talking, alright? I'm glad you decided to come with me. We're almost to Riverwood.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They enter the sleepy village of Riverwood.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Looks like nobody here knows what happened yet. Come on. Gerdur's probably working in her lumber mill.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They find the sister nearby.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Gerdur!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Brother! Mara's mercy, it's good to see you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Gerdur...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But is it safe for you to be here? We heard that Ulfric had been captured...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Gerdur, I'm fine. At least now I am.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Are you hurt? What's happened? And who's this? One of your comrades?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not a comrade yet, but a friend. I owe him my life, in fact. Is there somewhere we can talk? There's no telling when the news from Helgen will reach the Imperials...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Helgen? Has something happened...? You're right. Follow me. Hod! Come here a minute. I need your help with something.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is it, woman? Sven drunk on the job again?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hod, just come here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ralof! What are you doing here? Ahh...I'll be right down.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They go sit by the river.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Uncle Ralof! Can I see your axe? How many Imperials have you killed? Do you really know Ulfric Stormcloak?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hush, Frodnar. This is no time for your games. Go and watch the south road. Come find us if you see any Imperial soldiers coming.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Aw, mama, I wanna stay and talk with Uncle Ralof!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look at you, almost a grown man! Won't be very long before you'll be joining the fight yourself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's right! Don't worry, Uncle Ralof, I won't let those soldiers sneak up on you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Frodnar walks off.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Now, Ralof, what's going on? You two look pretty well done in.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can't remember when I last slept... Where to start? Well, the news you heard about Ulfric was true. The Imperials ambushed us outside Darkwater Crossing. Like they knew exactly where we'd be...that was two days ago, now. We stopped in Helgen this morning, and I thought it was all over. Had us lined up to the headsman's block and ready to start chopping.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The cowards!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They wouldn't dare give Ulfric a fair trial. Treason, for fighting for your own people! All of Skyrim would've seen the truth then. But then, out of nowhere...a dragon attacked!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You don't mean a real, live...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can hardly believe it myself, and I was there. As strange as it sounds, we'd be dead if not for that dragon. In the confusion, we managed to slip away. Are we really the first to make it to Riverwood?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nobody else has come up the south road today, as far as I know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good. Maybe we can lay up for a while. I hate to put your family in danger, Gerdur, but...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nonsense. You and your friend are welcome to stay here as long as you need to. Let me worry about the Imperials. Any friend of Ralof's is a friend of mine. Here's a key to the house. Stay as long as you like. If there's anything else you need, just let me know. There's something you can do for me. For all of us here. The Jarl needs to know if there's a dragon on the loose. Riverwood is defenseless... We need to get word to Jarl Balgruuf in Whiterun to send whatever soldiers he can. If you'll do that for me, I'll be in your debt.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thanks, sister. I knew I could count on you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I ought to get back to work before I'm missed, but...did anyone else escape? Did Ulfric...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't worry, I'm sure he made it out. It would take more than a dragon to stop Ulfric Stormcloak.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll let them into the house, and, you know, show them where everything is.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hmph, help them drink up our mead, you mean... Good luck, brother. I'll see you later.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't worry about me. I know how to lay low.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The sister and her husband walk off.
label: ACTION

dialogue: IF YOU PICK HADVAR AS THE GUIDE IF YOU PICK HADVAR AS THE GUIDE
label: ACTION

dialogue: See that ruin up there? Bleak Falls Barrow. When I was a boy, that place always used to give me nightmares. Draugr creeping down the mountain to climb through my window at night, that kind of thing. I admit, I still don't much like the look of it. These are the Guardian Stones, three of the thirteen ancient standing stones that dot Skyrim's landscape. Go ahead, see for yourself. • Mage, eh? Well, to each his own. It's not for me to judge. • Thief, eh? It's never too late to take charge of your own fate, you know. • Warrior, good! I knew you shouldn't have been in that cart the minute I laid eyes on you. Listen, as far as I'm concerned, you've already earned your pardon. But until we get that confirmed by General Tullius, just stay clear of other Imperial soldiers and avoid any complications, all right? I'm glad you decided to come with me. We're almost to Riverwood.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Riverwood is finally reached.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Things look quiet enough here. Come on, there's my uncle. Uncle Alvor! Hello!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hadvar? What are you doing here? Are you on leave from... Shor's bones, what happened to you, boy? Are you in some kind of trouble?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Shh, uncle. Keep your voice down. I'm fine, but we should go inside to talk.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's going on? And who's this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He's a friend. Saved my life in fact. Come on, I'll explain everything, but we need to go inside.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Okay, okay. Come inside, then. Sigrid will get you something to eat and you can tell me all about it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They go inside.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Sigrid! We have company!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hadvar! We've been so worried about you! Come, you two must be hungry. Sit down and I'll get you something to eat.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now, then, boy. What's the big mystery? What were you doing, looking like you lost an argument with a cave bear?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't know where to start. I was assigned to General Tullius's guard. We were stopped in Helgen when we were attacked...by a dragon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A dragon? That's...ridiculous. You aren't drunk, are you, boy?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Husband, let him tell his story.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not much more to tell. This dragon flew over and just wrecked the whole place. Mass confusion. I don't know if anyone else got out alive. I doubt I'd have made it out if not for my friend here. I need to get back to Solitude and let them know what's happened. I thought you could help us out. Food, supplies, a place to stay.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course! Any friend of Hadvar's is a friend of mine. I'm glad to help in any way I can. Like I said, I'm glad to help. But I need your help. We need your help. The Jarl needs to know there's a dragon on the loose. Riverwood is defenseless... We need to get word to Jarl Balgruuf in Whiterun to send whatever soldiers he can. If you'll do that for me, I'll be in your debt.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hadvar, did you really see a dragon? What did it look like? Did it have big teeth?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hush, child. Don't pester your cousin.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, I better get back to work. You two can make yourselves at home.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's nice to be back in a friendly spot, huh? Listen, I'm going to lay up here for awhile. You can make your own way to Solitude from here. I recommend heading to Whiterun, just down the road from here. From there you can take a carriage to Solitude.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: RALOF/HADVAR SPLIT PATHS REUNITE HERE RALOF/HADVAR SPLIT PATHS REUNITE HERE
label: ACTION

dialogue: The prisoner reaches Whiterun's gates.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Halt! City's closed with dragons about. Official business only.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Riverwood calls for the Jarl's aid.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Riverwood's in danger, too? You better go on in. You'll find the Jarl at Dragonsreach, atop the hill.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have news from Helgen about the dragon attack. (Persuade)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fine, but we'll be keeping an eye on you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Will this change your mind? ( gold)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Welcome to Whiterun, friend. Go right in.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Stand aside, or else. (Intimidate)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Or else what? You think you can stand against the entire Whiterun city guard? The gate's closed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll come back later.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Safe travels.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: At the Dragonsreach castle, the prisoner approaches Balgruuf, already talking with his advisors.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I only council caution. We cannot afford to act rashly in times like these.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What would you have me do, then? Nothing?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My lord, please. This is no time for rash action. I just think we need more action before we act. I just...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who's this, then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: His housecarl approaches.
label: ACTION

dialogue: What's the meaning of this interruption? Jarl Balgruuf is not receiving any visitors.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have news from Helgen. About the dragon attack.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, that explains why the guards let you in. Come on then, the Jarl will want to speak to you personally. Alvor sent me. Riverwood is in danger.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Gerdur sent me. Riverwood is in danger.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As Housecarl, my job is to deal with all dangers that Jarl or his people. So, you have my attention. Now, explain yourself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A dragon has destroyed Helgen.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know about Helgen? The Jarl will want to speak with you personally. Approach.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I was told to give the message directly to the Jarl.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whatever you have to say to the Jarl, you can say to me. I'm starting to think... Balgruuf: It's all right, Irileth. I want to hear what he has to say.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player approaches the throne. The line changes slightly, depending on if one talks about Riverwood and refuses to tell Irileth about it.
label: ACTION

dialogue: What's this about Riverwood being in danger?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A dragon destroyed Helgen. Gerdur/Alvor is afraid Riverwood is next. • Alvor? The smith, isn't he? Reliable, solid fellow. • Gerdur? Owns the lumber mill, if I'm not mistaken... Pillar of the community.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not prone to flights of fancy...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: • So, you were at Helgen? You saw this dragon with your own eyes? • And you're sure Helgen was destroyed by a dragon? This wasn't some Stormcloak raid gone wrong?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. I had a great view while the Imperials were trying to cut off my head.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Really? You're certainly...forthright about your criminal past. But it's none of my concern who the Imperials want to execute. Especially now. What I want to know is what exactly happened at Helgen.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Imperials were about to execute Ulfric Stormcloak. Then the dragon attacked.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I should have guessed Ulfric would be mixed up in this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The dragon destroyed Helgen. And last I saw it was heading this way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: By Ysmir, Irileth was right!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do you say now, Proventus? Shall we continue to trust in the strength of our walls? Against a dragon?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My lord, we should send troops to Riverwood at once. It's in the most immediate danger. If that dragon is lurking in the mountains...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Jarl of Falkreath will view that as a provocation! He'll assume we're preparing to join Ulfric's side and attack him! We should not--
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Enough! I'll not stand idly by while a dragon burns my hold and slaughters my people! Irileth, send a detachment to Riverwood at once.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, my Jarl.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you'll excuse me, I'll return to my duties.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That would be best.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: His advisors leave.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Well done. You sought me out, on your own initiative. You've done Whiterun a service, and I won't forget it. Here, take this as a small token of my esteem. There is another thing you could do for me. Suitable for someone of your particular talents, perhaps. Come, let's go find Farengar, my court wizard. He's been looking into a matter related to these dragons and...rumors of dragons.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Balgruuf leads the player to the Farengar Secret-Fire's office.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Farengar, I think I've found someone who can help you with your dragon project. Go ahead and fill him in with all the details.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So the Jarl thinks you can be of use to me? Oh yes, he must be referring to my research into the dragons. Yes, I could use someone to fetch something for me. Well, when I say fetch, I really mean delve into a dangerous ruin in search of an ancient stone tablet that may or may not actually be there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right. Where am I going and what am I fetching?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Straight to the point, eh? No need for tedious hows and whys. I like that. Leave those details to your betters, am I right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What does this have to do with dragons?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, no mere brute mercenary, but a thinker -- perhaps even a scholar? You see, when the stories of dragons began to circulate, many dismissed them as mere fantasties, rumors. Impossibilities. One sure mark of a fool is to dismiss anything that falls outside his experience as being impossible. But I began to search for information about dragons -- where had they gone all those years ago? And where were they coming from?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So what do you need me to do?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: {skip to "I, ah, learned..."}
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just tell me what you need me to do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You are eager to begin your adventure. Excellent. The sooner begun, the sooner done, eh? I, ah, learned of a certain stone tablet said to be housed in Bleak Falls Barrow -- a "Dragonstone," said to contain a map of dragon burial sites. Go to Bleak Falls Barrow, find this tablet -- no doubt in the main chamber -- and bring it to me. Simplicity itself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, you mean this old stone? (Give Dragonstone to Farengar)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah! The Dragonstone of Bleak Falls Barrow! You already found it! You are cut from a different cloth than the usual brutes the Jarl foists on me. (skip to "So what about my reward" turn-in options)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: • Off to Bleak Falls Barrow with you. The Jarl is not a patient man. Neither am I, come to think of it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player can inquire further.
label: ACTION

dialogue: What can you tell me about Bleak Falls Barrow?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: An old tomb, built by the ancient Nords, perhaps dating back to the Dragon War itself. Ah. Maybe you just want to know how to get there. It's near Riverwood, a miserable little village a few miles south of here. I'm sure some of the locals can point you in the right direction once you get there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How do you know this stone tablet is in Bleak Falls Barrow?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well. Must preserve some professional secrets, mustn't we? I have my sources...reliable sources.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me more about the Dragon War.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not surprised you've never heard of it. Even I used to think it was just a myth. But not anymore. The Dragon War was a real event, although only the barest glimmer of the actual events has come down to us. Far back in the Mythic Era, the dragons were worshipped as gods in Skyrim. Many of the monumental ruins that still dot the landscape were, in fact, built as temples to the dragons. The details are lost, but at some point the Nords rebelled. After a long and terrible war, the Nords overthrew their dragon overlords.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, were all the dragons killed in the Dragon War?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, no. Many were killed, of course. But many survived into historical times. Why, this very palace was built by one of Balgruuf's ancestors to hold a captive dragon. Hence its name -- Dragonsreach.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Have you encountered any dragons?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sadly, no. My work affords me few opportunities for such an adventure. Perhaps some hero will bring one to Dragonsreach, like old Olaf One-Eye once did. What a fascinating conversation that would be!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player travels to the mountaintop dungeon, visible for miles in the Riverwood area. Inside, some bandits are talking.
label: ACTION

dialogue: The dark elf wants to go on ahead, let him. Better than us risking our necks.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What if Arvel doesn't come back? I want my share from that claw!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just shut it and keep an eye out for trouble.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Once they're dead, they find Arvel the Swift moaning downstairs, caught in a spider's netting. A spider attacks.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Is...is someone coming? Is that you Harknir? Bjorn? Soling? No. Not again! Ah, kill it. Kill it! Get me out of here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Afterwards...
label: ACTION

dialogue: You. Over here! You did it. You killed it. Now cut me down before anything else shows up.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Where's the golden claw?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, the claw. I know how it works. The claw, the markings, the door in the Hall of Stories. I know how they all fit together! Help me down, and I'll show you. You won't believe the power the Nords have hidden there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hand over the claw first!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Does it look like I can move? You have to cut me down, first.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fine. Let me see if I can cut you down.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sweet breath of Arkay, thank you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player hacks the webs.
label: ACTION

dialogue: It's coming loose. I can feel it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Once free, he bolts off into the trap-filled dungeon behind him.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You fool, why should I share the treasure with anyone?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The chase leads into a draugr-filled crypt, where Arvel is slain by undead he's conversing with a hooded woman.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You see? The terminology is clearly First Era or even earlier. I'm convinced this is a copy of a much older text. Perhaps dating to just after the Dragon War. If so, I could use this to cross-refernence the names with the other later texts.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good. I'm glad you're making progress. My employers are anxious to have some tangible answers.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, have no fear. The Jarl himself has finally taken an interest, so I'm now able to devote most of my time to this research.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Time is running, Farengar, don't forget. This isn't some theoretical question. Dragons have come back.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, yes. Don't worry. Although the chance to see a living dragon up close would be tremendously valuable... Now, let me show you something else I found...very intriguing...I think your employers may be interested as well... Hmm? Ah, yes, the Jarl's protege! Back from Bleak Falls Barrow? You didn't die, it seems.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He notices the player's prize.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Ah! The Dragonstone of Bleak Falls Barrow! Seems you are a cut above the usual brutes the Jarl sends my way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So what about my reward?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'll have to see the Jarl about that. Maybe his steward, Avenicci. I'm sure one of them will pay you appropriately.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I got you the Dragonstone. What next?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That is where your job ends and mine begins. The work of the mind, sadly undervalued in Skyrim. My...associate here will be pleased to see your handiwork. She discovered its location, by means she has so far declined to share with me. So, your information was correct after all. And we have our friend to thank for recovering it for us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You went into Bleak Falls Barrow and got that? Nice work. Just send me a copy when you've deciphered it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In the middle of the conversation, Balgruuf's housecarl runs in.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Farengar! Farengar, you need to come at once. A dragon's been sighted nearby. You should come, too.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A dragon! How exciting! Where was it seen? What was it doing?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'd take this a bit more seriously if I were you. If a dragon decides to attack Whiterun I don't know if we can stop it. Let's go.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They go to meet with the Jarl upstairs. An anxious guard is with them.
label: ACTION

dialogue: So, Irileth tells me you came from the western watchtower.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, my lord.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell him what you told me. About the dragon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Uh...that's right. We saw it coming from the south. It was fast...faster than anything I've ever seen.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What did it do? Is it attacking the watchtower?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, my lord. It was just circling overhead when I left. I never ran so fast in my life...I thought it would come after me for sure.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good work, son. We'll take it from here. Head down to the barracks for some food and rest. You've earned it. Irileth, you'd better gather some guardsmen and get down there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've already ordered my men to muster near the main gate.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good. Don't fail me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He notices the player standing there.
label: ACTION

dialogue: There's no time to stand on ceremony, my friend. I need your help again. I want you to go with Irileth and help her fight this dragon. You survived Helgen, so you have more experience with dragons than anyone else here. But I haven't forgotten the service you did for me in retrieving the Dragonstone for Farengar. As a token of my esteem, I have instructed Avenicci that you are now permitted to purchase property in the city. And please accept this gift from my personal armory.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I should come along. I would very much like to see this dragon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. I can't afford to risk both of you. I need you here working on ways to defend the city against these dragons.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As you command.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One last thing, Irileth. This isn't a death or glory mission. I need to know what we're dealing with.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't worry, my lord. I'm the very soul of caution.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Irileth and the player go to the main gate, where her men are readied.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Here's the situation. A dragon is attacking the Western Watchtower.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A dragon?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We're in for it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You heard right! I said a dragon! I don't much care where it came from or who sent it. What I do know is it's made the mistake of attacking Whiterun!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But Housecarl...how can we attack a dragon?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's a fair question. None of us have ever seen a dragon before, or expected to face one in battle. But we are honorbound to fight it, even if we fall. This dragon is threatening our homes...our families. Could you call yourselves Nords if you ran from this monster? Are you going to let me face this thing alone?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We're so dead...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But it's more than our honor at stake here. Think of it -- the first dragon seen in Skyrim since the last age. The glory of killing it is ours, if you're with me! Now what do you say? Shall we go kill us a dragon?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yeah!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Damn right!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yeah!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's move out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Together, the team approaches the watchtower. It was always in ruins, but now has a cloak of flames to boot.
label: ACTION

dialogue: No signs of any dragon right now, but it sure looks like he's been here. I know it looks bad, but we've got to figure out what happened. And if that dragon is still skulking around somewhere. Spread out and look for survivors. We need to know what we're dealing with.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A frantic guard flees from the garrison.
label: ACTION

dialogue: No! Get back! It's still here somewhere! Hroki and Tor just got grabbed when they tried to make a run for it!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Guardsman! What happened here? Where's this dragon? Quickly now!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't know! Kynareth save us, here he comes again...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The dragon crests the nearest mountain, making a beeline for the watchtower guards.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Here he comes! Find cover and make every arrow count!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Talos save us! It's a dragon!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Slay it! Slay the dragon!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can't get a bead on him!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come down here and fight, you coward!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The dragon is eventually weakened and grounded. The player deals the coup de grace, causing the dragon to speak.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Dovahkiin! No!!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's make sure that overgrown lizard is really dead. Damned good shooting, boys!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's happening?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Everybody get back!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oddly enough, the dragon's soul is instantly absorbed into the player, which surprises the Nord guardsmen and Irileth.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I can't believe it! You're...Dragonborn...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Dragonborn? What do you mean?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In the very oldest tales, back from when there were still dragons in Skyrim, the Dragonborn would slay dragons and steal their power. That's what you did, isn't it? Absorbed that dragon's power?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't know what happened to me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's only one way to find out. Try to Shout...that would prove it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think you may be right.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's only one way to find out. Try to Shout...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. I think I am. You can Shout now. That can only mean one thing. You must be Dragonborn.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: According to the old legends, only the Dragonborn can Shout without training, the way the dragons do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Dragonborn? What are you talking about?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's right! My grandfather used to tell stories about the Dragonborn. Those born with the Dragon Blood in 'em. Like old Tiber Septim himself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've never heard of Tiber Septim killing any dragons.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There weren't any dragons then, idiot. They're just coming back now for the first time in...forever.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But the old tales tell of the Dragonborn who could kill dragons and steal their power. You must be one!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do you say, Irileth? You've being awfully quiet.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come on, Irileth, tell us, do you believe in this Dragonborn business?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hmph. Some of you would be better off keeping quiet than flapping your gums on matters you don't know anything about. Here's a dead dragon, and that's something I definitely understand. Now we know we can kill them. But I don't need some mythical Dragonborn. Someone who can put down a dragon is more than enough for me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You wouldn't understand, Housecarl. You ain't a Nord.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've been all across Tamriel. I've seen plenty of things just as outlandish as this. I'd advise you all to trust in the strength of your sword over tales and legends.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you really are Dragonborn, like out of the old tales, you ought to be able to Shout. Can you? Have you tried?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player Shouts, almost knocking a guard off his feet with but a word.
label: ACTION

dialogue: By the gods! What manner of power is that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That was Shouting, what you just did! Must be. You really are Dragonborn, then...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That was the hairiest fight I've ever been in, and I've been in more than a few. I don't know about this Dragonborn business, but I'm sure glad you're with us. You better get back to Whiterun right away. Jarl Balgruuf will want to know what happened here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As one walks the steps of Dragonsreach, a strange Shout-like rumble is heard see Balgruuf.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Good. You're finally here. The Jarl's been waiting for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You heard the summons. What else could it mean? The Greybeards...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We were just talking about you. My brother needs a word with you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So what happened at the watchtower? Was the dragon there?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The watchtower was destroyed, but we killed the dragon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I knew I could count on Irileth. But there must be more to it than that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Turns out I may be something called "Dragonborn."
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Dragonborn? What do you know about the Dragonborn?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's just what the men called me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not just the men. The Greybeards seem to think the same thing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I killed the dragon. I think I deserve a reward.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's no question about that. It was a mighty deed. You've earned a place of honor among the heroes of Whiterun. But there must be more to it than that. Did something...strange...happen when the dragon died?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: When the dragon died, I absorbed some kind of power from it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So it's true. The Greybeards really were summoning you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Greybeards?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Masters of the Way of the Voice. They live in seclusion high on the slopes of the Throat of the World.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do these Greybeards want with me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Dragonborn is said to be uniquely gifted in the Voice -- the ability to focus your vital essence into a Thu'um, or Shout. If you really are Dragonborn, they can teach you how to use your gift.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Didn't you hear the thundering sound as you returned to Whiterun? That was the voice of the Greybeards, summoning you to High Hrothgar! This hasn't happened in...centuries, at least. Not since Tiber Septim himself was summoned when he was still Talos of Atmora!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hrongar, calm yourself. What does any of this Nord nonsense have to do with our friend here? Capable as he may be, I don't see any signs of him being this, what, "Dragonborn."
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nord nonsense? Why you puffed-up ignorant...these are our sacred traditions that go back to the founding of the First Empire.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hrongar. Don't be so hard on Avenicci.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I meant no disrespect, of course. It's just that...what do these Greybeards want with him?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's the Greybeards' business, not ours. Whatever happened when you killed that dragon, it revealed something in you, and the Greybeards heard it. If they think you're Dragonborn, who are we to argue? You'd better get up to High Hrothgar immediately. There's no refusing the summons of the Greybeards. It's a tremendous honor. I envy you, you know. To climb the 7,000 Steps again...I made the pilgrimage once, did you know that? High Hrothgar is a very peaceful place. Very... disconnected from the troubles of this world. I wonder if the Greybeards even notice what's going on down here. They haven't seemed to care before. No matter. Go to High Hrothgar. Learn what the Greybeards can teach you. You've done a great service to me and my city, Dragonborn. By my right as Jarl, I name you Thane of Whiterun. It's the greatest honor that's within my power to grant. I assign you Lydia as a personal housecarl, and this weapon from my armory to serve as your badge of office. I'll also notify my guards of your new title. Wouldn't want them to think you're part of the common rabble, now would we? We are honored to have you as Thane of our city, Dragonborn. Back to business, Proventus. We still have a city to defend.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, my lord.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player can inquire further.
label: ACTION

dialogue: What's it mean to be Dragonborn?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, in the old tales, the Dragonborn heroes would use the power of their Voice to defeat the enemies of Skyrim. Wulfharth was Dragonborn. Talos, too -- the founder of the Empire, back in the good old days. In the very oldest tales, back from when there were still dragons in Skyrim, the Dragonborn would slay dragons and steal their power.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who are the Greybeards?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They're the Masters of the Way of the Voice -- of Shouting. They live up on top of the Throat of the World. If you're really Dragonborn, they'll want to talk to you. In the old stories, they always summon the Dragonborn for training.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How can you protect Whiterun from the dragons?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: With good planning and constant vigilance. Even now, my court wizard, Farengar, continues his research into ways we might drive back these terrors. We must also have ample reserves of water to combat the fires that will surely spread after an attack. But our greatest weapon? Courage. For if we cannot kill the beast, we must at least have the tenacity to drive it back. Until brave heroes step forward to destroy these monsters, that is the best we can do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: With the destination clear, the player reaches Ivarstead, the small village locked, but during this quest, one can enter. A monk goes to meet the player.
label: ACTION

dialogue: So...a Dragonborn appears, at this moment in the turning of the age.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm answering your summons.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We will see if you truly have the gift. Show us, Dragonborn.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You call me Dragonborn. What does that mean?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: First, let us see if you truly are Dragonborn. Let us taste of your Voice.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player shouts, making them stagger backwards.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Dragonborn. It is you. Welcome to High Hrothgar. I am Master Arngeir. I speak for the Greybeards. Now tell me, Dragonborn, why have you come here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who are you? What is this place?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We are the Greybeards, followers of the Way of the Voice. You stand in High Hrothgar, on the slopes of Kynareth's sacred mountain. Here we commune with the voice of the sky, and strive to achieve balance between our inner and outer selves.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I want to find out what it means to be Dragonborn.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We are here to guide you in that pursuit, just as the Greybeards have sought to guide those of the Dragon Blood that came before you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You mean I'm not the only Dragonborn?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You are not the first. There have been many of the Dragon Blood since Akatosh first bestowed that gift upon mortalkind. Whether you are the only Dragonborn of this age...that is not ours to know. You are the only one that has been revealed thus far. That is all I can say.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm answering your summons, Master.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We are honored to welcome a Dragonborn to High Hrothgar. We will do our best to teach you how to use your gift in fulfillment of your destiny.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is my destiny?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That is for you to discover. We can show you the Way, but not your destination.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm ready to learn.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have shown that you are Dragonborn. You have the inborn gift. But do you have the discipline and temperament to follow the path laid out for you? That remains to be seen. Without training, you have already taken the first steps toward projecting your Voice into a Thu'um, a Shout. Not let us see if you are willing and able to learn. When you Shout, you speak in the language of dragons. Thus, your Dragon Blood gives you an inborn ability to learn Words of Power. All Shouts are made up of three Words of Power. As you master each Word, your Shout will become progressively stronger. Master Einarth will now teach you "Ro," the second Word in Unrelenting Force. "Ro" means "balance" in the dragon tongue. Combine it with Fus -- "Force" -- to focus your Thu'um more sharply.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ro...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One of the monks inscribes his knowledge on the floor. The player learns the information immediately.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You learn a new word like a master...you truly do have the gift. But learning a Word of Power is only the first step...you must unlock its meaning through constant practice in order to use it in a Shout. Well, that is how the rest of us learn Shouts. As Dragonborn, you can absorb a slain dragon's life force and knowledge directly. As part of your initiation, Master Einarth will allow you to tap into his understanding of "Ro."
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player absorbs some information from the fellow Greybeard.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Now let us see how quickly you can master your new Thu'um. Use your Unrelenting Force shout to strike the targets as they appear.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Flik Lo...Sah!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player defeats Borri's target.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Well done. Again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Flik Lo...Sah!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player snaps the second target.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You learn quickly. Once more.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Flik Lo...Sah!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He smashes the final monk's target.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Impressive. Your Thu'um is precise. You show great promise, Dragonborn. We will perform your next trial in the courtyard. Follow Master Borri.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They enter the snowy expanse outside the living quarters.
label: ACTION

dialogue: We will now see how you learn a completely new Shout. Master Borri will teach you "Wuld," which means "Whirlwind."
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wuld...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Like a previous master, Borri inscribes the word on the ground for the player to learn immediately.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You must hear the Word within yourself before you can project it into a Thu'um.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player learns it.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Approach Master Borri and he will gift you his knowledge of "Wuld."
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One absorbs the information like a dragon's soul.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Now we will see how quickly you can master a new Shout. Master Wulfgar will demonstrate Whirlwind Sprint. Then it will be your turn. Master Borri.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Bex!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Borri opens a gate.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Wuld. Nah...Kest!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wulfgar quickly runs through it before it closes, only a moment later.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Now it is your turn. Stand next to me. Master Borri will open the gate. Use your Whirlwind Sprint to pass through before it closes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Bex!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mimicking Wulfgar, one dashes through like a pro.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Your quick mastery of a new Thu'um is...astonishing. I'd heard the stories of the abilities of Dragonborn, but to see it for myself...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I thought it was this easy for everyone.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. Indeed not. But beware that your skill does not outstrip your wisdom. You are now ready for your last trial.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't know how I do it. It just happens.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You were given this gift by the gods for a reason. It is up to you to figure out how best to use it. You are now ready for your last trial.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you. What's next?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You are now ready for your last trial. Retrieve the Horn of Jurgen Windcaller, our founder, from his tomb in the ancient fane of Ustengrav. Remain true to the Way of the Voice, and you will return.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One can inquire further.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Why are the dragons returning? Does it have something to do with me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No doubt. The appearance of a Dragonborn at this time is not an accident. Your destiny is surely bound up with the return of the dragons. You should focus on honing your Voice, and soon your path will be made clear.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you, Master. I will continue my training.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good. Then you will be ready for whatever lies ahead.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Surely there's more you can tell me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There is indeed much that we know that you do not. That does not mean that you are ready to understand it. Do not let your easy mastery of the Voice tempt you into the arrogance of power that has been the downfall of many Dragonborn before you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What does it mean to be "Dragonborn"?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Dragons have the inborn ability to learn and project their Voice. Dragons are also able to absorb the power of their slain brethren. A few mortals are born with similar abilities -- whether a gift or a curse has been a matter of debate down through the centuries. What you have already learned in a few days took even the most gifted of us years to achieve. Some believe that Dragonborn are sent into the world by the gods, at times of great need. We will speak more of that later, when you are ready.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why are Shouts in the dragon language?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Dragons have always been able to shout. Language is intrinsic to their very being. There is no difference in the dragon tongue between debating and fighting. Shouting comes as naturally to a dragon as breathing, or speaking. In mythic times, when mortalkind was in great need, the goddess Kynareth granted us the ability to speak as dragons do. For most people, long years of training are required to learn even the simplest Shout. But for you, the dragon speech is is in your blood, and you learn it almost without effort.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There are only four of you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Five. Our leader, Paarthurnax, lives alone on the peak of the Throat of the World. When your Voice can open the path, you will know you are ready to speak to him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: When can I meet your leader, Paarthurnax?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As I said, you will know you are ready when your Voice can open the path to him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me about the Greybeards.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We study the Way of the Voice, according to the teachings of our founder, Jurgen Windcaller. Very few are permitted to study with us here at High Hrothgar. But in your case, Dragonborn, it is a privilege to guide you towards mastery of your Voice.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why don't the others talk?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Their Voices are too powerful for anyone not trained in the Way to withstand. Even a whisper could kill you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who was Jurgen Windcaller?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He was a great war leader of the ancient Nords, a master of the Voice, or Tongue. After the disaster at Red Mountain, where the Nord army was annihilated, he spent many years pondering the meaning of that terrible defeat. He finally came to realize that the gods had punished the Nords for their arrogant and blasphemous misuse of the Voice. He was the first to understand that the Voice should be used solely for the glory and worship of the gods, not the glory the men. Jurgen Windcaller's mastery of the Voice eventually overcame all opposition, and the Way of the Voice was born.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is the "Way of the Voice"?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Voice was a gift of the goddess Kynareth, at the dawn of time. She gave mortals the ability to speak as dragons do. Although this gift has often been misused, the only true use of the Voice is for the worship and glory of the gods. True Mastery of the Voice can only be achieved when your inner spirit is in harmony with your outward actions. In the contemplation of the sky, Kynareth's domain, and the practice of the Voice, we strive to achieve this balance.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But I don't follow your philosophy. Why help me learn the Voice?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Dragonborn is an exception to all the rules -- the Dragon Blood itself is a gift from the gods. If we accept one gift, how can we deny the other? As Dragonborn, you have received the ability to Shout directly from Akatosh. We therefore seek to guide you on the proper use of your gift, which transcends the restrictions which bind other mortals.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I will try to follow the Way of the Voice.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That is commendable. But remember, the Dragon Blood itself is a gift from Akatosh. Do not try to deny that gift. Your destiny requires you to use your Voice -- why else would Akatosh have bestowed this gift upon you? If you remember to use your voice in service to the purpose of Akatosh, you will remain true to the Way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: At Arngeir's behest, one visits Ustengrav, a barrow near Morthal's marshes. Necromancers are walking around the main hall.
label: ACTION

dialogue: These thralls of yours are slower than Argonians in a blizzard.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Feel free to grab a pick and help them out. I prefer not to sully myself with manual labor.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There goes another one.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Bah. Weak-willed rabble. Even dead they're almost useless.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They seem less intelligent each time you raise them, if that's even possible.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As long as they can swing a pickaxe where I tell them, they're as smart as we need them to be.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You hear that? The others must have found something!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We'd better go see. These can tend to themselves for a few minutes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Shadowing them reveals they've uncovered a crypt of high-powered draugr. The by renting the inn's attic room. One goes there to investigate.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I'm the innkeeper. It's my business to keep track of strangers.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'd like to rent the attic room. (10 Gold)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Attic room, eh? Well...we don't have an attic room, but you can have the one on the left. Make yourself at home.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player checks out the room, only for Delphine to enter in after them.
label: ACTION

dialogue: So you're the Dragonborn I've been hearing so much about. I think you're looking for this. We need to talk. Follow me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Eventually one will have to give the horn back to Arngeir.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Ah! You've retrieved the Horn of Jurgen Windcaller. Well done. You have now passed all the trials. Come with me. It is time for us to recognize you formally as Dragonborn.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Him and the other monks gather in the vestibule.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You are ready to learn the final word of Unrelenting Force, "Dah," which means "Push."
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Dah...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: With all three words together, this Shout is much more powerful. Use it wisely. Master Wulfgar will now gift you with his knowledge of "Dah."
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One gets the final word and its knowledge.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You have completed your training, Dragonborn. We would Speak to you. Stand between us, and prepare yourself. Few can withstand the unbridled Voice of the Greybeards. But you are ready.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Arngeir, Wulfgar, Borri and Einarth chant at one in the dragon language.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Lingrah krosis saraan Strundu'ul, voth nid balaan klov praan nau. Naal Thu'umu, mu ofan nii nu, Dovahkiin, naal suleyk do Kaan, naal suleyk do Shor, ahrk naal suleyk do Atmorasewuth. Meyz nu Ysmir, Dovahsebrom. Dahmaan daar rok.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Dovahkiin. You have tasted the Voice of the Greybeards, and passed through unscathed. High Hrothgar is open to you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One can ask Arngeir about it afterwards.
label: ACTION

dialogue: What was that ceremoy all about? Were you Shouting at me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We spoke the traditional words of greeting to a Dragonborn who has accepted our guidance. The same words were used to greet the young Talos, when he came to High Hrothgar, before he became the Emperor Tiber Septim.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What did you actually say?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah. I sometimes you forget you are not versed in the dragon tongue as we are. This is a rough translation: "Long has the Stormcrown languished, with no worthy brow to sit upon. By our breath we bestow it now to you in the name of Kyne, in the name of Shor, and in the name of Atmora of Old. You are Ysmir now, the Dragon of the North, hearken to it."
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She gives Windcaller's horn, then leads one into her room.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Close the door.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Delphine opens up a hidden passage in the opposite room's wardrobe, revealing a basement filled with training dummies, weapon racks, and a planning table.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Now we can talk. The Greybeards seem to think you're the Dragonborn. I hope they're right.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're the one who took the horn?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Surprised? I guess I'm getting pretty good at my harmless innkeeper act.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I was expecting someone...taller.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good. The point of being in hiding is to appear to be someone you're not.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's with all the cloak and dagger?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You can't be too careful. Thalmor spies are everywhere.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Here I am. What do you want?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I didn't go to all this trouble on a whim. I needed to make sure it wasn't a Thalmor trap.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sorry, I'm supposed to be meeting someone here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I hope you're just playing dumb. I'm the one who left the note in Ustengrav.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Greybeards are right. I am Dragonborn.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I hope so. But you'll forgive me if I don't assume that something's true just because the Greybeards say so. I just handed you the Horn of Jurgen Windcaller. Does that make me Dragonborn, too?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do you want with me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I didn't go to all this trouble on a whim. I needed to make sure it wasn't a Thalmor trap. I'm not your enemy. I already gave you the horn. I'm actually trying to help you. I just need you to hear me out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'd better have a good reason for dragging me here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It was the only way I could make sure it wasn't a Thalmor trap. I'm not your enemy. I already gave you the horn. I'm actually trying to help you. I just need you to hear me out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I just came here for the horn.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And now you have it. No harm done. I knew the Greybeards would send you for the horn if they thought you were Dragonborn. Taking it was the only way I could be sure this wasn't a Thalmor trap.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Go on. I'm listening.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Like I said in my note, I've heard that you might be Dragonborn. I'm part of a group that's been looking for you...well, someone like you, for a very long time. If you really are Dragonborn, that is. Before I tell you any more, I need to make sure I can trust you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'd better start explaining. Fast.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll explain what I want when I want, got it? You'd already be dead if I didn't like the look of you when you walked in here. But I had to know if the rumors about you were true... I'm part of a group that's been looking for you...well, someone like you, for a very long time. If you really are Dragonborn, that is. Before I tell you any more, I need to make sure I can trust you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't have time for this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I shouldn't let you walk out of here, knowing what you know. But I guess even my paranoia has its limits. You know where to find me when you change your mind. Because you will. You have to.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So what's the part you're not telling me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Dragons aren't just coming back, they're coming back to life. They weren't gone somewhere all these years. They were dead, killed off centuries ago by my predecessors. Now something's happening to bring them back to life. And I need you to help me stop it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do you know how crazy this sounds?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ha. A few years ago, I said almost the same thing to a colleague of mine. Well, it turned out he was right and I was wrong.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What makes you think dragons are coming back to life?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know they are. I've visited their ancestral burial mounds and found them empty. And I've figured out where the next one will come back to life. We're going to go there, and you're going to kill that dragon. If we succeed, I'll tell you anything you want to know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How did you figure all this out?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You should know. You got the map for me. The dragonstone you got for Farengar, remember?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Right, you were at Dragonsreach when I gave it to him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So you were paying attention. I arranged to have Farengar recover the dragonstone for me. It's what I do. I make things happen from behind the scenes. After all, here you are.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The dragonstone was some kind of map?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. A map of ancient dragon burial sites. I've looked at which ones are now empty. The pattern is pretty clear. It seems to be spreading from the southeast, starting in the Jeralls near Riften. The one near Kynesgrove is next if the pattern holds.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So where are we headed?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Kynesgrove. There's an ancient dragon burial mound there. If we can get there before it happens, maybe we'll learn how to stop it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know that mound -- high on the hill east of Kynesgrove.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good. Good. Now we won't have to spend time searching for it. We should get moving. There's no time to waste.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's go kill a dragon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I need to get into my traveling gear. Give me a minute and I'll be ready. That's better. Let's get on the road to Kynesgrove.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hold on. I'm not ready to go yet.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can't wait around for you to make up your mind. I'll meet you at Kynesgrove. Don't waste time getting there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If one inquires further before committing to Delphine's plan:
label: ACTION

dialogue: How do I know I can trust you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you don't trust me, you were a fool to walk in here in the first place.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why did you take the horn from Ustengrav?
label: CHARACTER
