dialogue: I knew the Greybeards would send you there if they thought you were Dragonborn. They're nothing if not predictable. When you showed up here, I knew you were the one the Greybeards sent, and not some Thalmor plant.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why are you looking for a Dragonborn?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We remember what most don't -- that the Dragonborn is the ultimate dragonslayer. You're the only one that can kill a dragon permanently by devouring its soul. Can you do it? Can you devour a dragon's soul?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, that's how I first learned I was Dragonborn.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good. And you'll have a chance to prove it to me soon enough.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I absorb some kind of power from dragons. That's all I can say.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This is no time to play the reluctant hero. You either are or aren't Dragonborn. But I'll see for myself soon enough.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's none of your business.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're wrong. It is my business. You may be the only one that can stop these dragons. But you'll understand that soon enough.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You said the Thalmor are after you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. We're very old enemies. And if my suspicions are correct, they might have something to do with the dragons returning. But that isn't important right now. What is important is that you might be Dragonborn.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't need to prove anything to you. I'm done here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I shouldn't let you walk out of here, knowing what you know. But I guess even my paranoia has its limits. You know where to find me when you change your mind. Because you will. You have to.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Finally, they agree to visit the hill.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Orgnar, I'm traveling. You've got the inn 'til I get back.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Right. Happy trails.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Kynesgrove is this way. We can travel together or split up and meet there, your choice.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They travel together, the leader making small talk.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I hope you're Dragonborn, I really do. But we'll find out soon enough. We may both end up dead, but at least it gets me out of Riverwood. I don't really think I'm cut out for the quiet life. I doubt the Thalmor are aware of you yet. So we should be safe from them, at least.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They come upon Valtheim Towers.
label: ACTION

dialogue: This is a notorious bandit hideout. But it's also the shortest way to Kynesgrove, so...we may have to kill a few bandits.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Afterward the bloodletting...
label: ACTION

dialogue: We'll cross the White River and follow it to Windhelm. Then we can swing south to Kynesgrove. There's an inn near Kynesgrove -- the Braidwood. I hear they serve a nice dark ale. Nothing on the Sleeping Giant, of course. I'm glad you were willing to trust me. I know it probably wasn't the best way to introduce myself. But old habits... you know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Once the player agrees on the journey to Kynesgrove, Delphine dons her badass the small mining community, a woman runs out of the longhouse.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Wait. Something's wrong.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, you don't want to go up there! A dragon...it's attacking!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A dragon is attacking Kynesgrove?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, I don't know. Not yet...it flew over the town and landed on the old dragon mound!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Where's this dragon?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It flew over the town and landed on the old dragon burial mound. I don't know what it's doing up there, but I'm not waiting around to find out!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come on. Hurry. It might be too late.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One ventures up there to where Delphine is waiting. Alduin, the dragon that attacked Helgen, is up there, speaking at the mound.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Sahloknir! Ziil gro dovah ulse!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lorkhan's eyes! Look at that big bastard! Keep your head down, let's see what it does.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sahloknir! Ziil gro dovah ulse! Slen Tiid Vo! This is worse than I thought...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A skeletal dragon crawls from the mound, Alduin's power giving him flesh.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Alduin, thuri! Boaan tiid vokriiha suleysksejun kruziik?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Geh, Sahloknir, kaali mir.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He notices the player watching.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Ful, losei Dovahkiin? Zu'u koraav nid nol dov do hi. You do not even know our tongue, do you? Such arrogance, to dare take for yourself the name of Dovah. Sahloknir, krii daar joorre.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look out!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The newly-arisen Sahloknir takes flight.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I am Sahloknir! Hear my Voice and despair!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This one's mine!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Dovahkiin, your Voice is no match for mine!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Eventually, the dragon is felled.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I'll be damned, you did it! That was well done. Come on. I've been wanting a closer look at one of these buggers. Wait. Something's happening...gods above!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: His soul is quickly absorbed.
label: ACTION

dialogue: So you really are... I...it's true, isn't it? You really are Dragonborn. I owe you some answers, don't I? Go ahead. Whatever you want to know. Nothing held back.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who are you and what do you want with me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm one of the last members of the Blades. A very long time ago, the Blades were dragonslayers, and we served the Dragonborn, the greatest dragonslayer. For the last two hundred years, since the last Dragonborn emperor, the Blades have been searching for a purpose. Now that dragons are coming back, our purpose is clear again. We need to stop them.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Blades? Who are they?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Exactly. Nobody even remembers our name these days. We used to be known across Tamriel as the protectors of the Septim Emperors. Those days are long gone, though. For the last two hundred years, we've been searching for the next Dragonborn to guide and guard, as we are sworn to do. But we never found one. Until now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's our next move?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The first thing we need to do is figure out what's behind the dragons. The Thalmor are our best lead. If they aren't involved, they'll know who is.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Remind me...who are the Thalmor?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The faction that rules the Aldmeri Dominion. The ones who almost destroyed the Empire during the Great War, thirty years back. There's no worse enemy to humankind in Tamriel. The Empire barely survived the last war. The Thalmor don't intend to lose the next one.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What makes you think the Thalmor are bringing dragons back?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nothing solid. Yet. But my gut tells me it can't be anybody else. The Empire had captured Ulfric. The war was basically over. Then a dragon attacks, Ulfric escapes, and the war is back on. And now the dragons are attacking everywhere, indiscriminately. Skyrim is weakened, the Empire is weakened. Who else gains from that but the Thalmor?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why are the Thalmor after you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Before the Great War, the Blades helped the Empire against the Thalmor. Our Grand Master saw them as the greatest threat to Tamriel. At the time, that was true. Maybe it still is. So we fought them in the shadows, all across Tamriel. We thought we were more than a match for them. We were wrong.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do you know about the dragons coming back?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not a damn thing. I was just as surprised as you to find that big black dragon here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've seen that dragon before, the one that got away.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Really? Where?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It was the one that attacked Helgen, when Ulfric escaped from the Imperials.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Interesting. Same dragon... Damn it, we're blundering around in the dark here! We need to figure out who's behind it all!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, we need to find out what the Thalmor know about the dragons. Any ideas?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If we could get into the Thalmor Embassy...it's the center of their operations in Skyrim... Problem is, that place is locked up tighter than a miser's purse. They could teach me a few things about paranoia...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So how do we get into the Thalmor Embassy?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not sure yet. I have a few ideas, but I'll need some time to pull things together... Meet me back in Riverwood. If I'm not back when you get there, wait for me. I shouldn't be long. Keep an eye on the sky. This is only going to get worse.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She takes off down the hill.
label: ACTION

dialogue: As directed, one reunites with the Blade at Riverwood.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I don't think you were followed. Come on. I have a plan.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They return to the hidden basement.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I figured out how we're going to get you into the Thalmor Embassy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're not coming?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That would be a bad idea. I'd be too likely to attract the wrong kind of attention. But they don't know you at all, yet.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That didn't take long.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've been doing this a long time, remember? While the Thalmor's been looking for me, I've been watching them.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why not just fight our way in?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So that's your plan, huh? Even if you could survive, by the time you got inside, whatever documents they had would be long gone. We're there for information, remember? Trust me, I've been doing this for a long time. My way is better.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So what's your plan? How do I infiltrate the Thalmor Embassy?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Thalmor ambassador, Elenwen, regularly throws parties where the rich and connected cozy up to the Thalmor. I can get you into one of these parties. Once you're inside the Embassy, you get away and find Elenwen's secret files. I have a contact inside the Embassy. He's not up for this kind of high-risk mission, but he can help you. His name's Malborn. Wood elf, plenty of reason to hate the Thalmor. You can trust him. I'll get word to him to meet you in Solitude, at the Winking Skeever -- you know it? While you're doing that, I'll work on getting you an invitation to Elenwen's little party. Meet me at the Solitude stables after you've arranged things with Malborn. Any questions?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who's this contact of yours? You're sure I can trust him?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't worry about Malborn. He's not a dangerous character like you, but he hates the Thalmor at least as much as I do. He's a wood elf -- the Thalmor wiped out his family back in Valenwood during one of their purges that we never hear about. Luckily they don't know who he really is, or he wouldn't be serving drinks at the Ambassador's parties.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How am I going to get into this party?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let me handle that. You'll have a real invitation, don't worry. As long as you can act the part of a Thalmor toady, you'll get past the guards.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Once I'm inside the Embassy, then what?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's when the fun starts. You'll have to slip away from the party without raising the alarm. Then you'll need to find Elenwen's office and search her files. Malborn should be able to point you in the right direction.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll see you in Solitude after I meet Malborn.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sounds good. Be careful.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One seeks out Malborn at Solitude's local watering hole.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Our mutual friend sent me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Really? You're who she picked? I hope she knows what she's doing. Here's the deal. I can smuggle some equipment into the Embassy for you. Don't plan on bringing anything else with you. The Thalmor take security very seriously. Give me what you can't live without, and I'll make sure it gets into the Embassy. The rest is up to you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What kinds of things should I bring?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're asking me? She promised that she was sending someone who knew what they were doing... If you actually want to get out alive, I'd bring whatever you need to move quietly, and kill quickly.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hold on, I need to get a few things ready.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll give you a few more minutes. I can't wait here all day. It's my neck on the line, remember.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm ready. Here's what I'll need.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Once the swap occurs, one tracks down Delphine at the farms.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Have you given Malborn the gear you want to smuggle into the embassy?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, Malborn's all set.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good. I have your invitation to the party. But the only way you're going to get past the guards is if they really believe you're an invited guest. Which means you need to look the part, and not be armed to the teeth. Here, put this on. When you're ready, I'll keep the rest of your gear safe until you get back. You'll only have what Malborn smuggled in for you, plus whatever you can pick up inside.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player puts on the party clothes Delphine picked out, then puts away all weapons and heavy armor that would give the disguise away.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Hmm. I guess that will have to do. You should pass for a real guest, at least until you open your mouth. Ready to board the carriage to the embassy?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hold on a minute.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This is no time for cold feet. I've put everything in your hands here, not least Malborn's life. Now do whatever it is you need to do, and let's get going before we miss our chance!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm ready. Keep the rest of my things safe for me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't worry, it will all be waiting for you when you get back. Just make sure you get back out of there alive with the information we need. Good luck.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A short while later, one arrives at the embassy gates. A man walks in nearby.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Ah! A fellow latecomer for Elenwen's little soiree. And arriving by carriage, no less! I salute you, sir! My lateness is due more to getting lost on the way up this gods-forsaken mountain than to any desire to actually arrive late. I prefer to arrive early. Often the day before the party. So as not to miss out on any of the drinking. There's not enough drinking in the world today, wouldn't you agree?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A Thalmor wizard nearby acts as a bouncer.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Welcome to the Thalmor Embassy. Your invitation, please.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Here you go. (Show invitation)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you, sir. Go right in.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is there a problem?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course not. Purely a formality. Now, I need to see your invitation.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just a minute. I think I left it on the cart.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course. Just bring it to me when you find it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now then. Here's my invitation, I don't have a poisoned dagger strapped to my thigh, et cetera, et cetera.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm just doing my duty, sir. Everything's in order. Welcome back, sir.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, yes. Now to find myself a drink.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Go right on in. The party has already started.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Inside, my friend, inside! Where only the women and drinks are cold.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player enters the bustling main hall.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Welcome. I don't believe we've met. I am Elenwen, the Thalmor Ambassador to Skyrim. And you are...?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My name is (name). Pleased to meet you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah yes. I remember your name from the guest list.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Quite a party. It's my first time, you know. Where can I get a drink?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't worry, my parties are always well-stocked with the finest food and drink available in this country. But first, you were introducing yourself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're Elenwen? I've heard so much about you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Have you? All good, I trust. But you have met at a disadvantage. I'm afraid I know nothing about you... Please, tell me more about yourself. What brings you to this...to Skyrim?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Madame Ambassador, I'm so sorry to interrupt...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is it, Malborn?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's just that we've run out of the Alto wine. Do I have your permission to uncork the Arenthia red...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course. I've told you before not to bother me with such trifles.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, Madame Ambassador.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He leaves.
label: ACTION

dialogue: My apologies. We'll have to get better acquainted later. Please, enjoy yourself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: When she leaves, Malborn is approached.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You made it in. Good. As soon as you distract the guards, I'll open this door and we can get you on your way. Let's hope we both live through this day.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player can talk to the guests, mostly random luminaries from around the map. They have interesting things to say, so I'll put 'em here.
label: ACTION

dialogue: The degeneracy of the Empire is on display here in this room.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What brings you to this party?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There are those in the Empire who would wish to evade their obligations to help root out the Talos heresy. Fortunately, those most opposed to the Emperor's wise policy have no branded themselves traitors as well as heretics. I am here to remind the ruling classes of Skyrim that their loyalty to the Emperor requires cooperation with the Thalmor.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Great War is long past. It's time the Empire and the Aldmeri Dominion put aside their differences. Prosperity is good for everyone.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What brings you to this party?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You must be new to Skyrim, or you'd already know who I am. I have a stake in most anything of importance in Solitude. I feel that it's time to put aside the grievances of the past, and let peace and prosperity flourish between the Empire and the Aldmeri Dominion. I try to do my little part. Besides, just between you and me, it's making me pots of money, hahaha.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You sound like quite the businessman.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not every Nord is obsessed with strength, honor and skill at arms. A rare few are born with a gift for making money. My investments are my strength and my wealth is my weapon. As for honor, well, there are some luxuries even I can't afford.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't recall seeing you at one of these before. And I know everyone who's anyone in Skyrim.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I didn't know you had dealings with the Thalmor.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Have you learned nothing about me? I have dealings with everyone. Now, leave me. I don't want to arouse suspicion by talking to someone that clearly does not belong here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Are you here on guild business?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't mention the Guild. In fact, it's better if you don't speak to me at all. This is not the place.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm ready for this party to be over.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What brings you to this party?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ill luck. I'm a busy man and I don't have time for this sort of frivolity. But at the same time, I don't dare refuse an invitation from Elenwen.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You don't look happy to be here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is it that obvious? I should take pains to seem more happy. I wouldn't want to upset our host. But the truth of it is, I have a mountain of paperwork back in Windhelm and it's not getting any smaller. I just hope this party doesn't drag on all night.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If your eyes and your ears are open and your mind is free of judgment and expectation, you might learn much in this chamber.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Having a good time?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fair faces and fine food are well and good, but honesty is rarely so pleasing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do you visit the embassy often?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There are words spoken, and words unspoken. Beware these Thalmor, for they are adept in both languages. For this reason, I avoid them when I can.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I hope you're enjoying yourself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do you host these parties often?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Quite often, yes. The only thing I enjoy more than luxury is sharing that luxury with those who can appreciate it. But I also enjoy learning the latest gossip and hear the most intriguing rumors.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can see you spared no expense.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course not. One does not gather the most important men and women of Skyrim and then serve them cheap ale and stale bread. This is only a taste of the benefits that accrue to those who align themselves with Thalmor interests.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What does your position as Thalmor Ambassador involve?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One of my main duties is to foster a better understanding between the Aldmeri Dominion and the people of Skyrim. I also oversee the activities of the Thalmor Justicars throughout Skyrim, although this has been unfortunately disrupted by the war.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've never quite understood exactly what the Justicars do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Thalmor Justicars are so often misunderstood. Our primary goal is to preserve the peace between the Empire and the Aldmeri Dominion. The worship of the false god Talos contributed to the unfortunate friction that led to the Great War. Following the Great War, the White-Gold Concordat set out the terms for peaceful coexistence between the two powers. The Empire and the Dominion agree that the worship of Talos was a relic of the past, and must be eliminated in the interests of peace. But I'm sure you didn't come here for a lecture on high politics.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's your position on the civil war?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As long as the Empire continues to uphold its treaty obligations, my government does not concern itself with the internal politics of Skyrim.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After awhile, one goes back to the barkeep.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I'm ready.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course. Let me see if we have another bottle of that. I'll be waiting by the door for everyone to be distracted.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One has to find someone to cause the distraction.
label: ACTION

dialogue: RAZELAN DISTRACTION
label: ACTION

dialogue: What does a fellow need to do to get a drink around here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You look thirsty.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My friend, you are very perceptive! I have a powerful thirst that cannot be slaked! And none of the waiters will bring me a drink. Elenwen must have told them to cut me off, the frigid bitch. Afraid I'll cause another scene, I suppose...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Here, I brought you a drink.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, the one generous soul among a gathering of pinch-pennies and lick-spittles! If there's anything I can ever do for you, do not hesitate to call upon me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thanks. I'll let you know if I need anything.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your wish is my command! As long as it doesn't involve much physical activity. I seem to be having trouble standing on my feet at the moment.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Actually, there is something you could do for me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wonderful! I can begin to repay your generosity immediately. Say on, friend.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I need you to cause a scene. Get everyone's attention for a few minutes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is that all? My friend, you've come to the right person. You could say that causing a scene is somewhat of a specialty of mine. Stand back and behold my handiwork.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He walks to the center of the room.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Attention, everyone! Could I have your attention, please! I have an announcement to make! I propose a toast to Elenwen! Our mistress! I speak figuratively, of course. Nothing could be more unlikely than someone would actually want her in their bed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The guards draw their blades.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Although...most of you are already in bed with her! But again...I speak figuratively, of course! Fine, fine. Get your hands off me. I'll be a good boy now. Wouldn't want to offend our Thalmor overlords, would we? Someone bring me a drink, quick!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ERIKUR DISTRACTION
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Did you see that serving girl? I hear elf women are insatiable...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Maybe I can talk to her for you. See if she's interested.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Really? Yes, maybe that would be just the thing. She seemed to be playing hard to get when I last spoke to her. Go on. See what she says. Now you've gone and gotten my hopes up again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One finds the serving girl.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I hope you're enjoying yourself, sir.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That fellow over there asked me to talk to you...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ugh. Erikur, right? He was talking to me earlier. I could tell what he was after. I hate working these parties. Some of the guests are nice, but there's always a few like Erikur. Please tell him to leave me alone. Politely. I'm sure you'll have better luck getting through to him than I would.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One goes back to the thane.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Have you talked to Brelas yet? I'm not a patient man, you know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not yet. These things can't be rushed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ha. Don't toy with me. I may just have to seize my opportunity with both hands, ha ha ha. But we'll play it your way for now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. She said she can sneak you up to her quarters right now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Haha. I knew it! No woman yet born has been able to resist my charms for long. Thank you, my friend. I owe you one.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. She wants you to leave her alone.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What? That little tease! Leading me on and turning cold at the last minute. I don't think so.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If one lies about her advance:
label: ACTION

dialogue: Hello, my dear. I got your message. Where shall we go?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What? I'm sorry, sir, but you must have misunderstood. I'm not permitted to leave the party.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, I don't think so. I think I understand perfectly. Don't worry, my dear, I will make any necessary excuses to your employer.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He goes over to Brelas. If one tells him the truth:
label: ACTION

dialogue: So. You think you can toy with me, is that it? No, my dear. I have my heart set on you, and I always get what I want.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm sorry, sir. I didn't mean to give you the wrong impression earlier. I meant no disrespect.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, don't worry. I'll let you make it up to me. Now, where can we go for a litle privacy, hmm?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The conversation always ends with:
label: ACTION

dialogue: No, I'm sorry, but I can't go anywhere with you. I won't. Please, I must get back to my duties.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't you dare walk away from me, you slut! Do you know who I am?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Please, sir, leave me alone!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now you're going to be sorry you crossed me. Elenwen! This servant girl has been throwing herself at me in a most disgusting manner.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is that so, Erikur? And you with such delicate sensibilities. It must have been most upsetting.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I demand that you have this wench removed from my presence at once!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well. Whatever the truth of it, I'm sure a few words with Master Rulindil will have a salutary effect. Take her downstairs.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, Madame Ambassador.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No! Mistress Elenwen, it's not true! I did nothing! Sir, you must tell her! You don't know what they'll do to me! Please!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The girl is lead downstairs with a guard.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Well, I'm glad that little unpleasantness is over.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ONDOLEMAR DISTRACTION
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I need your help with something.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is it, my friend?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I need you to cause a scene. Get everyone's attention for a few minutes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This is very irregular. I trust that whatever you're doing doesn't compromise my position in any way?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Never mind.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't presume upon our friendship. My first loyalty is to the Thalmor, as you well know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I promise. Just a joke I want to play on someone. (Persuade)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hmm. Very well. I'm putting my reputation on the line for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This is neither the time nor the place for such things. I'm surprised you would ask it of me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ondolemar goes over to Razelan.
label: ACTION

dialogue: How dare you speak of the Thalmor in such a disgusting manner!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What? I didn't...hmm? No listen, you must have misunderstood... I would never openly insult your...that is to say...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your insults and provocations have gone far enough! I'd kill you where you stand if I wasn't bound by my oath as an officer of the Aldmeri Dominion.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Razalan. And you promised to behave yourself this time. Remove him. He's disturbing the other guests.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I protest! This is an insult to the dignity of my person! This time I'm completely innocent!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Forgive me, Ambassador. I allowed this...fool to provoke me. The fault is mine. There is no need for further disruption on my account.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That is absolutely untrue! Uh, that is, yes, of course. What...I don't understand why everyone...never mind.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ORTHUS DISTRACTION
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I need your help with something.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course! I mean...assuming you don't want me to kill someone for you. I might have to draw the line there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I need you to cause a scene. Get everyone's attention for a few minutes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's it? Sure. Shouldn't be too hard. I usually end up making a fool out of myself without even trying. Watch this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Orthus goes to Razelan.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Hey, Razelan, remember when you told me I'd never amount to anything? Well, I don't think you should say things like that about the Ambassador!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What? I didn't...hmm? No, listen, you must have misunderstood... I would never openly insult your...that is to say...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know you're drunk as usual, but that's no excuse for insulting our hostess. I don't think anyone deserves that kind of abuse! I've known plenty of elves who were perfectly decent people.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Razelan. And you promised to behave yourself this time. Remove him. He's disturbing the other guests.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, Madame Ambassador.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I protest! This is an insult to the dignity of my person! This time I'm completely innocent!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm sorry, Ambassador. I didn't mean to cause such a commotion. There's no need to have him thrown out on my account.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Absolutely not! I protest...uh, that is, yes, of course. I still don't understand what just...oh never mind.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: JARL IDGROD DISTRACTION
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now here is a face I did not expect to see. Be mindful, for you walk among adders.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I need your help with something.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My ears are always open to a friend's request
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I need you to cause a scene. Get everyone's attention for a few minutes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nothing would please me more. I'll keep their eyes away while you do what you came here for. An old woman can get away with almost anything.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She walks over to Razelan's bench.
label: ACTION

dialogue: No harm is meant to you, happy fool.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She prepares her distraction.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Right here! I see it in your face! The snakes writhe behind your eyes! Get away, get away from me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hmm? Did you say snakes? Where? I hate them, always slithering they way they do...what? Are they on me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Begone, serpent! Begone from this house and trouble it no more! Beware of the serpent in your midst! Beware, oh people of Skyrim!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Razelan. And you promised to behave yourself this time. Remove him. He's disturbing the other guests.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, Madame Ambassador!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I protest! This is an insult to the dignity of my person! This time I'm completely innocent!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Dear me. All this trouble over me? I think I was confused. There's no harm in him. Please, let him go.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That is absolutely untrue! Uh, that is, yes, of course. What...I don't understand why everyone...never mind.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: AFTER THE DISTRACTION
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's go, let's go! Before anyone notices us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They hide in the pantry.
label: ACTION

dialogue: So far, so good. Let's hope nobody saw us slip out. We need to pass through the kitchen. Your gear is hidden in the larder. Just stay close and let me do any talking, got it? Follow me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The two enter the kitchen. A khajiit is sweeping up.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Who comes, Malborn? You know I don't like strange smells in my kitchen.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A guest, feeling ill. Leave the poor wretch be.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A guest? In the kitchens? You know this is against the rules...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Rules, is it, Tsavanni? I didn't realize that eating Moon Sugar was permitted. Perhaps I should ask the Ambassador...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tss! Get out of here. I saw nothing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your gear is in that chest. I'll lock the door behind you. Don't screw this up. Good luck.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player sneaks into the embassy corridors. Guards talk nearby.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Did you see those robes march in this morning? Who're they with? More of the Emissary's treaty enforcers?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. They're high mages, just in from Alinor. I guess Herself is finally getting worried about all the dragon attacks.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, good. I've been wondering how we were supposed to defend this place from a dragon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If a dragon does show up, maybe we'll get lucky and it will eat the mages first. Might give us enough time to kill it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ha! I'd like to see those arrogant bastards taken down a notch. Always looking down their noses at us lowly footsloggers.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, we'd better get back to our rounds.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If one is Altmer and wearing a Thalmor disguise, it's possible to have an extra conversation with the Solar's door guard.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Why aren't you at your post, Justiciar?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Emissary Elenwen was asking for you inside. (Persuade)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why didn't you say so? Take over my post. Make sure nobody enters the Solar.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes sir. Sorry, sir.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well? Get out of here and mind your rounds.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Eventually, one sneaks into Elenwen's solar. A conversation occurs nearby.
label: ACTION

dialogue: But, I need that money! I earned it. I have my own expenses you know...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Silence! Do not presume, Gissur. You are most useful, but do not presume. We have other informants who are less...offensive.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But no one else has brought you such valuable information, have they? Etienne, he's talked, hasn't he? He knows where that old man is you're looking for, he told me himself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'll get the rest of your money when we confirm his story. As agreed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So he has talked! I knew it!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Everyone talks, in the end. Now, I have work to do. Leave me to it, if you ever want to see the rest of your payment.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Can I...I could help you. He'd talk to me. He trusts me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'd like to come downstairs with me, is that it, Gissur? Shall we loose his bonds and put you in a cell together? You can ask him anything you like, and see how he answers.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, no. I'll...I'll wait outside.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That would probably be best. Now get out!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After dealing with the Thalmor ruffians, one takes their dossiers on Ulfric, time to overhear a convo with a Thalmor soldier and Etienne.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Stop. Please. I don't know anything else. Don't you think I'd have told you already?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Silence. You know the rules. Do not speak unless spoken to. Master Rulindil will ask the questions.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's begin again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No... for pity's sake... I've already told you everything...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know the rules.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Noooooo!!!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Start at the beginning, as usual. If you persist in this stubbornness I'll have...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, wait! I was just... catching my breath... why wouldn't I tell you again? I don't even know anything... There's an old man. He lives in Riften. He could be this Esbern you're looking for, but I don't know. He's old and seemed kind of crazy. That's all I know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And his name is...?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't know his name. Like I've told already a hundred- Ahhhh!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know the rules. Just answer the questions. And where can we find this nameless old man?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Like I said, I don't know! I've seen him down in the Ratway. Maybe he lives down there, but I don't know for sure.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That will be all for now. I must say I continue to be disappointed in your lack of cooperation. I hope next time you will do better.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What else do you want from me? I've already told you everything. Listen, if you let me go I can take you to Riften, show you where-- Gaaaaah!!!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Silence, prisoner!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One slays the remaining guards. Brelas, if she was captured, is nearby.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You've got to help me! Please!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come on, you'd better get out of here. (Free her)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh...thank you. I don't understand what's happening. I can't stay here. What will I do now?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can't help you right now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No...please, you have to help me! You don't understand what they do to people here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Another cell holds Etienne.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I told you, I don't know anything else about it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not here to torture you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What? Who...what do you want then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No time to explain. Let's get out of here. (Free him)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yeah, sure, okay. Come on, this way. I've seen the guards use it to get rid of bodies. It must lead somewhere.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sounds good. I'll follow you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whatever you want. But let's go, now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You go ahead. I'm not done here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I guess you know what you're doing. I've got to find a way out of here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No problem. Thanks for springing me. I owe you. Look me up in Riften if you make it out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who are you? What are you doing here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, haven't I seen you around the Flagon? I never expected to see another Guild brother down here. They grabbed me in the Ratway. The nerve of these bastards...they need to be taught a lesson.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They grabbed me in Riften. They seem to think I know something. They just kept asking me the same damn questions.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hold on. You may know something important.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I damn well hope so. If it helps you twist them up, I'm glad to help. They're after some old guy named Esbern. Something to do with dragons, I gathered from listening to them talk when they thought I was out. I've seen a guy in Riften who they seem to think is him. Not much to go on -- I don't even know where he lives, or his name. But they seemed pretty excited about it. That's it. Now, let's get out of here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'd like to hear it all one more time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fine. Whatever you want. Can't you just kill me and get it over with? There's this old man. I've seen him around Riften. I don't know where he lives. I don't know his name. Yes, he matches the description of this Esbern guy you're looking for. Maybe it's him. Maybe it isn't. That's all I know, okay?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've been very cooperative. Thanks.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why don't you just kill me already.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As Etienne is freed, two guards enter with Malborn.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Listen up, spy. You're trapped in here, and we have your accomplice. Surrender immediately or you both die.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Never mind, I'm dead already--
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Silence, traitor! Move. Slowly.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Help! I'm being attacked!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player slays the guards, saving everyone in the process.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Now the Thalmor will be hunting me for the rest of my life. I hope it was worth it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I saw guards dragging bodies over here. Might be a way out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They enter the trapdoor into the Reeking Cave, where the Thalmor dispose of their victims. Soon, everyone's out in broad daylight.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You didn't have to help me, so...thanks.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't know where to go. Somewhere far away from here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The three take off as one returns to Delphine in Riverwood.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You made it out alive, at least. Your gear's safe in my room, as promised. Did you learn anything useful?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Thalmor know nothing about the dragons.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Really? That seems hard to believe. You're sure about that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why'd you send me in if you weren't going to believe me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're right, you're right. I just...I was sure it must have been them. If not the Thalmor, who? Or...what?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't know, but the Thalmor are looking for someone named Esbern.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (same as option below)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, I'm sure. They're looking for someone called Esbern.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Esbern? He's alive? I thought the Thalmor must have got him years ago. That crazy old man... Figures the Thalmor would be on his trail, though, if they were trying to figure out what's going on with the dragons.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What would the Thalmor want with Esbern?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You mean, aside from wanting to kill every Blade they can get their hands on? Esbern was one of the Blades archivists, back before the Thalmor smashed us in the Great War. He knew everything about the ancient dragonlore of the Blades. Obsessed with it, really. Nobody paid much attention back then. I guess he wasn't as crazy as we all thought.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So the Thalmor think the Blades know about the dragons...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ironic, right? The old enemies assume that every calamity must be a plot by the other side... Even so, we've got to find Esbern before they do. He'll know how to stop the dragons if anybody does. Do they know where he is?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They seem to think he's hiding out in Riften.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Riften, eh? Probably down in the Ratway, then. It's where I'd go. You'd better get to Riften.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Talk to Brynjolf. He's...well-connected. A good starting point, at least.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ask around the Ragged Flagon, in the Ratway. It's at least a good starting point.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One visits Vekel the Man in Riften's underground tavern. If one's in good with the Thieves Guild, the conversation is much smoother:
label: ACTION

dialogue: Know of any old guy hiding out in Riften, name of Esbern?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lot of people looking for him. Don't know his name, but he's paid good money for nobody to know he's down here. He's holed up in the Ratway Warrens. Hardly ever leaves the place -- has someone bring him food and such. Crazy old coot, from what I've heard. For that to stand out down here, he must really be off his nut.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who else is looking for Esbern?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Dangerous-looking elves who didn't give their names. Draw your own conclusions.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If the player isn't guild-affiliated, the convos are a little rougher. If one talks to Vekel:
label: ACTION

dialogue: I'm looking for an old guy, hiding out somewhere in Riften.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Huh. Lot of old guys around. I don't really know how I can help.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I need to talk to him. I'm a friend. His life's in danger. (Persuade)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Maybe I'm just getting soft in my old age, but I actually believe you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's a touching story. Now get outta my face.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Maybe this will help your memory. ( gold)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well...when you put it that way, I think I do know the old guy you're talking about.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Big talk for someone with a light purse.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Are you going to tell me, or am I going to have to beat it out of you? (Brawl)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's no need for that. Not like he's a friend of mine or anything. Just calm down.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've got a lot of nerve. But not a lot of common sense.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're tougher than you look. You got me, fair and square.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now where's Esbern?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: --- He's holed up in the Ratway Warrens. Hardly ever leaves the place -- has someone bring him food and such. Crazy old coot, from what I've heard. For that to stand out down here, he must really be off his nut.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That old guy hiding out down here... Where does he live?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He's holed up in the Ratway Warrens. Be careful. You're not the only one looking for him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If one interrogates Dirge:
label: ACTION

dialogue: I'm looking for an old guy, hiding out somewhere in Riften.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's interesting. Why do I care? You want a drink, or maybe just a few broken bones?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I need to talk to him. I'm a friend. His life's in danger. (Persuade)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A friend, huh? Well... then it's probably okay if I tell you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I guess you don't hear too well. I never heard of this "friend" of yours.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Maybe this will help your memory. ( gold)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know what? I think I do know the guy you're talking about.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Maybe it would. If you had it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He lives somewhere in the Ratway Warrens. Must be crazy or desperate to live down there. Maybe both.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That old guy hiding out down here... Where does he live?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Down in the Ratway Warrens. Nice place, if you don't mind the strench, the rats, and assorted lowlifes as neighbors.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If one talks to Brynjolf, as Delphine suggested:
label: ACTION

dialogue: Never done an honest day's work in your life for all that coin you're carrying, eh, lad?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Actually, I'm looking for this old guy hiding out in Riften.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Expecting free information, eh? Help me deal with business first, then we'll see how I can help you. Besides, you look like your pockets are a little light on coin, am I right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let me find him first. Dragons are bad for business. (Persuade)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Aye, you've got a point there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Passing on a golden opportunity is worse.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hold on -- I just wanted some information.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And I'm busy. You help me out, and I'll help you out. That's just how it is. Yeah. I bet I know your guy. He's hiding out in the Ratway Warrens. Paying us good coin for nobody to know about it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If Gissur is alive, he will leave the bar and report to Thalmor nearby.
label: ACTION

dialogue: He's in the Flagon right now. Get ready.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're sure?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course I'm sure! He was asking about Esbern.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Doesn't matter. We'll kill them either way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player enters the Warrens, a rathole series of tunnels where vagrants and other types live. There are Thalmor guards searching.
label: ACTION

dialogue: There's the Blades agent! Kill him!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After eliminating the elves, one finds a heavily locked door.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Go away!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Esbern? Open the door. I'm a friend.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What?! No, that's not me. I'm not Esbern. I don't know what you're talking about.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's okay. Delphine sent me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Delphine? How do you...so you've finally found her, and she led you to me. And here I am, caught like a rat in a trap.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Thalmor have found you. You need to get out of here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, how reassuring! Most likely you're with the Thalmor and this is just a trick to get me to open the door.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Delphine needs your help to stop the dragons. (Persuade)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So Delphine keeps up the fight, after all these years. You'd better come in and tell me how you found me and what you want.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm the one the Blades have been searching for. I'm Dragonborn.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's that you said? Dragonborn? Then...there really is hope after all? You'd better come inside. Quickly now. Thalmor agents have been seen in the Ratway.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There are Thalmor agents in the Ratway. Looking for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And no doubt you're one of them. Leave me alone!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Delphine said to "remember the 30th of Frostfall."
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah. Indeed, indeed. I do remember. Delphine really is alive, then? You'd better come in then and tell me how you found me and what you want.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He starts undoing the locks.
label: ACTION

dialogue: This'll just take a moment... This one always sticks...there we go. Only a couple more. There we are! Come in, come in! Make yourself at home! That's better. Now we can talk.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He hurriedly shuts the door. If entrance was gotten by mentioning Delphine:
label: ACTION

dialogue: So, Delphine keeps up the fight, after all these years. I thought she'd have realized it's hopeless by now. I tried to tell her, years ago...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Thalmor have found you. We have to get out of here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, yes, so you said. But so what? The end is upon us. I may as well die here as anywhere else. I'm tired of running.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do you mean, "the end is upon us"?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (same as "What do you mean, "it's hopeless"?)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do you mean, "it's hopeless"?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Haven't you figured it out yet? What more needs to happen before you all wake up and see what's going on? Alduin has returned, just like the prophecy said! The Dragon from the dawn of time, who devours the souls of the dead! No one can escape his hunger, here or in the afterlife! Alduin will devour all things and the world will end. Nothing can stop him! I tried to tell them. They wouldn't listen. Fools. It's all come true...all I could do was watch our doom approach...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Alduin... The dragon who's raising the others?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes! Yes! You see, you know but you refuse to understand!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're talking about the literal end of the world?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, yes. It's all been foretold. The end has begun. Alduin has returned. Only a Dragonborn can stop him. But no Dragonborn has been known for centuries. It seems that the gods have grown tired of us. They've left us to our fate, as the plaything of Alduin the World-Eater.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's not hopeless, Esbern. I'm Dragonborn.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What? You're...can it really be true? Dragonborn? Then...there is hope! The gods have not abandoned us! We must...we must... We must go, quickly now. Take me to Delphine. We have much to discuss.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If entrance was gotten by mentioning being Dragonborn:
label: ACTION

dialogue: You...Dragonborn? Is it really true?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. Delphine seemed to think it was important.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Important? Far more than even she realizes! If you are Dragonborn, then... Then...there is hope after all. For so long, all I could do was watch our doom approach, helplessly.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's what everyone keeps telling me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: {same as above, starting at "Then...there is hope after all."}
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Doom? You mean the return of the dragons?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Dragons, pah. They can be killed. The Blades killed many in their early days as dragon-slayers. No, dragons are merely the final portent of the End of Days.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: "End of Days"? I don't think things are quite that bad.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: {same as "What do you mean, "it's hopeless"?" above, to "Nothing can to him!"}
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're talking about...the literal end of the world?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, yes! The prophecies made clear the signs that will precede the end times. One by one, I have seen them fulfilled. Alduin has returned, just like the prophecy said! Alduin has returned, just like the prophecy said! The Dragon from the dawn of time, who devours the souls of the dead! No one can escape his hunger, here or in the afterlife! Alduin will devour all things and the world will end. Nothing can stop him! I tried to tell them. They wouldn't listen. Fools. It's all come true...all I could do was watch our doom approach...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Alduin... The dragon who's raising the others?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes! Yes! You see, you know but you refuse to understand!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's not hopeless, Esbern. I'm Dragonborn.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're right, I forget myself. I've lived without hope for so long... The prophecies are clear. Only the Dragonborn can stop Alduin. We must go, quickly now. Take me to Delphine. There is much to discuss.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After the conversation, Esbern will scramble around his dwelling.
label: ACTION

dialogue: But, give me...just a moment... I must gather a few things... I'll need this... No, no, useless trash...where'd I put my annotated Anuad? One moment, I know, time is of the essence, but mustn't leave secrets behind for the Thalmor...there's one more thing I must bring... Well, I guess that's good enough...let's be off...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After slaying more pursuers, the two Blades are reunited in Riverwood.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Delphine! I...it's good to see you. It's been...a long time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's good to see you, too, Esbern. It's been too long, old friend. Too long. Well, then. You made it, safe and sound. Good. Come on. I have a place where we can talk. Orgnar, hold down the bar for a minute, will you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yeah, sure.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They go to the secret basement.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Now then. I assume you know about...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, yes! Dragonborn! Indeed, yes. This changes everything, of course. There's no time to lose. We must locate...let me show you. I know I had it here, somewhere...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Esbern, what...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Give me...just a moment... Ah! Here it is. Come, let me show you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He puts a book on the table.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You see, right here. Sky Haven Temple, constructed around one of the main Akiviri military camps in the Reach, during their conquest of Skyrim.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do you know what he's talking about?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Shh! This is where they built Alduin's Wall, to set down in stone all their accumulated dragonlore. A hedge against the forgetfulness of centuries. A wise and foresighted policy, in the event. Despite the far-reaching fame of Alduin's Wall at the time -- one of the wonders of the ancient world -- its location was lost.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Esbern. What are you getting at?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You mean...you don't mean to say you haven't heard of Alduin's Wall? Either of you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's pretend we haven't. What's Alduin's Wall and what does it have to do with stopping the dragons?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Alduin's Wall was where the ancient Blades recorded all the knew of Alduin and his return. Part history, part prophecy. Its location has been lost for centuries, but I've found it again. Not lost, you see, just forgotten. The Blades archives held so many secrets...I was only able to save a few scraps...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So you think that Alduin's Wall will tell us how to defeat Alduin?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, yes, but...there's no guarantee, of course.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sky Haven Temple it is, then. I knew you'd have something for us, Esbern. I know the area of the Reach that Esbern's talking about. Near what's now known as Karthspire, the Karth River canyon. We can meet you there, or all travel together, your call.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's the best way to get there?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: From Riverwood? The road south through Falkreath is the most direct route. Or you could catch the carriage from Whiterun to Markarth and then approach from the west. Either way, the Reach is wild country these days. The Forsworn are everywhere. Best be careful.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll meet you at Karthspire.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your call. Might be safer to travel separately -- attract less attention that way. Don't worry, I'll get Esbern there in one piece. We'll wait for you near Karthspire. Good luck.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's travel there together. Are you ready to go?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Always. Let's go see if we can find this Sky Haven Temple.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Before leaving, Delphine finds Orgnar.
label: ACTION

dialogue: This is it. Orgnar, the inn is yours. I'm probably never coming back here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, now. That's something to think about.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Take care of yourself, Orgnar. Goodbye.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yeah...sure. You, too, Delphine. You be safe.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If one slays a dragon en route.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Ah...the power of the dragon is yours! There can be no doubt that you are the Dragonborn of prophecy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They enter the Karthspire's lower caves, finding old ruins.
label: ACTION

dialogue: This looks promising.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. Definitely early Akiviri stonework here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We've got to get this bridge down. These pillars must have something to do with it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. These are Akiviri symbols. Let's see...you have the symbol for "King"...and "Warrior"...and of course the symbol for "Dragonborn." That's the one that appears to have a sort of arrow shape pointing downward at the bottom.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They solve the puzzle and lower the bridge.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Whatever you did, it worked. Let's see what those old Blades left in our way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They come to a room with many floor tiles.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Wait.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why are you stopping?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We should be careful here. See these symbols on the floor?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hmm. Esbern's right. Look like pressure plates.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We'll cross once it's safe.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Dragonborn crosses and pulls the disarm chain.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Looks safe now. Let's move.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, yes! I think we must be close to the entrance.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They discover the hidden temple's front gate.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Wonderful! Remarkably well-preserved, too. Ah...here's the "blood seal." Another of the lost Akiviri arts. No doubt triggered by...well, blood. Your blood, Dragonborn.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Esbern's probably right. Try using your blood on the carved seal on the floor.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look here! You see how the ancient Blades revered Reman Cyrodiil. This whole place appears to be a shrine to Reman. He ended the Akiviri invasion under mysterious circumstances, you recall. After the so-called "battle" of Pale Pass, the Akiviri went into his service. This was the foundation stone of the Second Empire.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player slits his hand on the seal, undoing the seal.
label: ACTION

dialogue: That's done it! Look, it's coming to life! You did it! There's the entrance. After you, Dragonborn. You should have the honor of being the first to set foot in Sky Haven Temple.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's no telling what we might find inside!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They enter the long-abandoned temple.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Fascinating! Original Akiviri bas-reliefs...almost entirely intact! Amazing...you can see how the Akiviri craftsmen were beginning to embrace the more flowing Nordic style...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We're here for Alduin's Wall, right, Esbern?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, of course. We'll have more time to look around later, I suppose. Let's see what's up ahead.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They find the carved Wall up ahead.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Shor's bones! Here it is! Alduin's Wall...so well preserved...I've never seen a finer example of early second era Akiviri sculptural relief...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Esbern. We need information, not a lecture on art history.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, yes. Let's see what we have... Look, here is Alduin! This panel goes back to the beginning of time, when Alduin and the Dragon Cult ruled over Skyrim. Here, the humans rebel against their dragon overlords -- the legendary Dragon War. Alduin's defeat is the centerpiece of the Wall. You see, here he is falling from the sky. The Nord Tongues -- masters of the Voice -- are arrayed against him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, does it show how they defeated him? Isn't that why we're here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Patience, my dear. The Akiviri were not a straightforward people. Everything is couched in allegory and mythic symbolism. Yes, yes. This here, coming from the mouths of Nord heroes -- this is the Akiviri symbol for "Shout." But...there's no way to know what Shout is meant.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You mean they used a Shout to defeat Alduin? You're sure?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hmm? Oh, yes. Presumably something rather specific to dragons, or even Alduin himself. Remember, this is where they recorded all they knew of Alduin and his return.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So we're looking for a Shout, then. Damn it. Have you ever heard of such a thing? A Shout that can knock a dragon out of the sky?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, I've never heard of anything like that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I was afraid you were going to say that. I guess there's nothing for it. We'll have to ask the Greybeards for help. I hoped to avoid involving them in all this, but we have no other choice.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Greybeards might know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're probably right. I was hoping to avoid having to involve them in all this, but it seems we have no choice.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do you have against the Greybeards?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If they had their way, you'd do nothing but sit up on their mountain with them and talk to the sky, or whatever it is they do. The Greybeards are so afraid of power they won't use it. Think about it. Have they tried to stop the civil war, or done anything about Alduin? No. And they're afraid of you, of your power. Trust me, there's no need to be afraid. Think of Tiber Septim. Do you think he'd have founded the Empire if he'd listened to the Greybeards?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Greybeards may have a point. Power is dangerous.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Only if you don't know how to use it. All the great heroes have had to learn to use their power. Those that shrank from their destiny...well, you've never heard of them, have you? And there are the villains -- those that misused their power. There's always a choice, and there's always a risk. But if you live in fear of what might go wrong, you'll end up doing nothing. Like the Greybeards up on their mountain.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't worry. I'm not afraid of my own power.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good. The Greybeards can teach you a lot, but don't let them turn you away from your destiny. You're Dragonborn, and you're the only one who stop Alduin. Don't forget it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'd better go see what Arngeir knows about this Shout.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (same as "I'll ask Arngeir if he knows what Shout they used")
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll ask Arngeir if he knows what Shout they used.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Right. Good thing they've already let you into their little cult. Not likely they'd help Esbern or me if we came calling. We'll look around Sky Haven Temple and see what else the old Blades might have left for us. It's a better hideout than we could have hoped for. Talos guard you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look, here. In the third panel. The prophecy that brought the Akiviri to Tamriel in the first place, in search of the Dragonborn. Here are the Akiviri -- the Blades -- you see their distinctive longswords. Now they kneel, their ancient mission fulfilled, as the Last Dragonborn contends with Alduin at the end of time. Are you paying attention, Delphine? You might learn something of your own history.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One revisits High Hrothgar to tap Arngeir for knowledge.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I'd like to learn the Shout used to defeat Alduin.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Where did you learn of that? Who have you been talking to?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Does it matter?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. For matters of such gravity, we need to know where you stand. Or who you stand with.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who I stand with is my business.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you wish to stand alone, so be it. If you wish for our help, you'll answer my question.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have nothing to hide. The Blades helped me find out about it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Blades! Of course. They specialize in meddling in matters they barely understand. Their reckless arrogance knows no bounds. They have always sought to turn the Dragonborn from the path of wisdom. Have you learned nothing from us? Would you simply be a tool in the hands of the Blades, to be used for their own purposes?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It was recorded on Alduin's Wall.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (same as "I have nothing to hide...")
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Blades helped me find out about it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (same as "I have nothing to hide...")
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Blades are helping me. I'm not their puppet.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, no, of course not. Forgive me, Dragonborn. I have been intemperate with you. But heed my warning -- the Blades may say they serve the Dragonborn, but they do not. They never have.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So can you teach me this Shout?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (skip down to "No. I cannot teach..." below)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Blades just want to defeat Alduin. Don't you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What I want is irrelevant. This Shout was used once before, was it not? And here we are again. Have you considered that Alduin was not meant to be defeated? Those who overthrew him in ancient times only postponed the day of reckoning, they did not stop it. If the world is meant to end, so be it. Let it end and be reborn.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: At least the Blades aren't keeping secrets from me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do not be so sure about that. Beware -- the Blades may claim to serve the Dragonborn, but they do not. They never have. As for me, I only kept from you what you were not yet ready to know. Are still not ready to know, as your question reveals.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If one picks "The blades just..." or "At least the Blades..." options:
label: ACTION

dialogue: So you won't help me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. Not now. Not until you return to the path of wisdom.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Arngeir. Rak los Dovahkiin, Strundu'ul. Rok fen tinvak Paarthurnax.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Dragonborn...wait. Forgive me. I was...intemperate. I allowed my emotions to cloud my judgment. Master Einarth reminded me of my duty. The decision whether or not to help you is not mine to make.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The dialogue always ends with:
label: ACTION

dialogue: So, you can teach me this Shout?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. I cannot teach it to you because I do not know it. It is called "Dragonrend," but its Words of Power are unknown to us. We do not regret this loss. Dragonrend holds no place within the Way of the Voice.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I thought you knew all the Words of Power.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But not Dragonrend. The knowledge of that Shout was lost in the time before history began. Perhaps only its creators ever knew it. But I am not the one to speak of it to you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's so bad about Dragonrend?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It was created by those who had lived under the unimaginable cruelty of Alduin's Dragon Cult. Their whole lives were consumed with hatred for dragons, and they poured all their anger and hatred into this Shout. When you learn a Shout, you take it into your very being. In a sense, you become the Shout. In order to learn and use this Shout, you will be taking this evil into yourself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If the Shout is lost, how can I defeat Alduin?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Only Paarthurnax, the leader of our order, can answer that question, if he so chooses.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who is Paarthurnax?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He is our leader. He surpasses us all in his mastery of the Way of the Voice.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why haven't I met Paarthurnax yet?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He lives in seclusion on the very peak of the mountain. He speaks to us only rarely, and never to outsiders. Being allowed to see him is a great privilege.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I need to speak to Paarthurnax, then.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You weren't ready. You still aren't ready. But thanks to the Blades, you now have questions that only Paarthurnax can answer.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How do I get to the top of the mountain to see him?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Only those whose Voice is strong can find the path. We will teach you a Shout to open the way to Paarthurnax.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Everyone moves to the snowy courtyard.
label: ACTION

dialogue: The path to Paarthurnax lies through this gate. I will show you how to open the way. Lok... Vah... Koor...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He imprints the words into the ground, letting the player learn them.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I will grant you my understanding of Clear Skies. This is your final gift from us, Dragonborn. Use it well. Clear Skies will blow away the mist, but only for a time. The path to Paarthurnax is perilous, not to be embarked upon lightly. Keep moving, stay focused on your goal, and you will reach the summit.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As the player reaches the summit, a dragon -- Paarthurnax -- swoops in.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Drem Yo Lok. Greetings, wunduniik. I am Paarthurnax. Who are you? What brings you to my strunmah...my mountain?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I wasn't expecting you to be a dragon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am as my father Akatosh made me. As are you...Dovahkiin.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're the master of the Greybeards?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They see me as master. Wuth. Onik. Old and wise. It is true I am old...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think you already know who I am.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. Vahzah. You speak true, Dovahkiin. Forgive me. It has been long since I last tinvaak with a stranger. I gave in to the temptation to prolong our speech.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why live alone on a mountain if you love conversation?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Evenaar bahlok. There are many hungers it is better to deny than to feed. Dreh ni nahkip. Discipline against the lesser aids in qahnaar...denial of the greater. Tell me. Why do you come here, volaan? Why do you intrude on my meditation?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I need to learn the Dragonrend Shout. Can you teach me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Drem. Patience. There are formalities which must be observed, at the first meeting of two of the dov. By long tradition, the elder speaks first. Hear my Thu'um! Feel it in your bones! Match it, if you are Dovahkiin! Yol...Toor...Shul!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He breathes fire on the nearby Word Wall, empowering it for his guest.
label: ACTION

dialogue: The Word calls you. Go to it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's the word for Fire Breath.
label: ACTION

dialogue: A gift, Dovahkiin. Yol. Understand Fire as the dov do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He gives his knowledge to the player.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Now, show me what you can do. Greet me not as • mortal, • khajiit, but as dovah! Do not be afraid. Faasnu. Let me feel the power of your Thu'um.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player breathes fire on him.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Aaah...yes! Sossedov los mul. The dragonblood runs strong in you. It is long since I had the pleasure of speech with one of my own kind. So. You have made your way here, to me. No easy task for a joor...mortal. Even for one of Dovah Sos. Dragonblood. What would you ask of me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Can you teach me the Dragonrend Shout?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah. I have expected you. Prodah. You would not come all this way for tinvaak with an old dovah. No. You seek your weapon against Alduin.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How did you know I came for Dragonrend?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Alduin komeyt tiid. What else would you seek? Alduin and Dovahkiin return together. But, I do not know the Thu'um you seek. Krosis.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Greybeards didn't want me to come at all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hmm. Yes. They are very protective of me. Bahlaan fahdonne. But I do not know the Thu'um you seek. Krosis.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do you know Dragonrend or not?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Krosis. Sorrowfully, no. It cannot be known to me. Your kind -- joorre -- mortals -- created it as a weapon against the dov...the dragons. Our hadrimme, our minds cannot even...comprehend its concepts.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How can I learn it, then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Drem. All in good time. First, a question for you. Why do you want to learn this Thu'um?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's none of your business.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nid. If you wish me to answer your question, you must answer mine.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I need to stop Alduin.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. Alduin...zeymah. The elder brother. Gifted, grasping and troublesome as is so often the case with firstborn. But why? Why must you stop Alduin?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The prophecy says that only the Dragonborn can stop him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: True... But qostiid -- prophecy -- tells what may be, not what should be. Qostiid sahlo aak. Just because you can do a thing, does not always mean you should. Do you have no better reason for acting than destiny? Are you nothing but a plaything of dez...of fate?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I like this world. I don't want to see it end.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Pruzah. As good a reason as any. There are many who feel as you do, although not all. Some would say that all things must end, so that the next can come to pass. Perhaps this world is simply the Egg for the next kalpa? Lein vokiin? Would you stop the next world from being born?
label: CHARACTER
