dialogue: I didn't come here to debate philosophy with you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hahaha! You have much to learn of the dov, then. There is nothing else but philosophy to a dovah. It is no accident that we do battle with our Thu'um, our Voices. There is no distinction between debate and combat to a dragon. Tinvaak los grah. For us it is one and the same.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The next world will have to take care of itself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Paaz. A fair answer. Ro fus...maybe you only balance the forces at work to quicken the end of this world. Even we who ride the currents of Time cannot see past Time's end. Wuldsetiid los tahrodiis. Those who try to hasten the end, may delay it. Those who work to delay the end, may bring it closer.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't believe in destiny. But I will stop Alduin.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And so, perhaps, your destiny will be fulfilled. Who can say? Dez motmahus. Even to the dov, who ride the currents of Time, destiny is elusive. Alduin believes that he will prevail, with good reason. Rok mul. And he is no fool. Ni mey, rinik gut nol. Far from it. He began as the wisest and most far-seeing of us all. But you have indulged my weakness for speech long enough. Krosis. Now I will answer your question. Do you know why I live here, at the peak o the Monahven -- what you name Throat of the World?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. Dragons like mountains, right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: True. But few now remember that this was the very spot where Alduin was defeated by the ancient Tongues. Vahrukt unslaad... perhaps none but me now remember how he was defeated.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I never thought about it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This is the most sacred mountain in Skyrim. Zok revak strunmah. The great mountain of the world. Here the ancient Tongues, the first mortal masters of the Voice, brought Alduin to battle and defeated him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You said you were going to answer my question.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Drem. Patience. I am answering, in my way. This is the most sacred mountain in Skyrim. Zok revak strunmah. The great mountain of the world. Here the ancient Tongues, the first mortal masters of the Voice, brought Alduin to battle and defeated him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Using the Dragonrend Shout, right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes and no. Viik nuz ni kron. Alduin was not truly defeated, either. If he was, you would not be here today, seeking to... defeat him. The Nords of those days used the Dragonrend Shout to cripple Alduin. But this was not enough. Ok mulaag unslaad. It was the Kel -- the Elder Scroll. They used it to...cast him adrift on the currents of Time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: An Elder Scroll? What's that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hmm. How to explain in your tongue? The dov have words for such thing that joorre do not. It is an...artifact from outside time. It does not exist, but it has always existed. Rah wahlaan. They are...hmm...fragments of creation. The Kelle...Elder Scrolls, as you name them, they have often been used for prophecy. Yes, your prophecy comes from an Elder Scroll. But this is only a small part of their power. Zofaas suleyk.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Are you saying the ancient Nords sent Alduin forward in time?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not intentionally. Some hoped he would be gone forever, forever lost. Meyye. I knew better. Tiid bo amativ. Time flows ever onward. One day he would surface. Which is why I have lived here. For thousands of mortal years I have waited. I knew where he would emerge but not when.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How does any of this help me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tiid krent. Time was...shattered here because of what the ancient Nords did to Alduin. If you brought that Kel, that Elder Scroll back here...to the Tiid-Ahraan, the Time-Wound... With the Elder Scroll that was used to break Time, you may be able to...cast yourself back. To the other end of the break. You could learn Dragonrend from those who created it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do you know where I can find an Elder Scroll?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Krosis. No. I know little of what has passed below in the long years I have lived here. You are likely better informed than I.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Lorekeeper at the College of Winterhold might know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Trust your instincts, Dovahkiin. Your blood will show you the way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One can inquire further to Paarthurnax on Alduin's circumstances.
label: ACTION

dialogue: What do I do with the Elder Scroll when I find it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Return it here, to the Tiid-Ahraan. Then... Kelle vomindok. Nothing is certain with such things. But I believe the Scroll's bond with the Tiid-Ahraan will allow you a...a seeing, a vision of the moment of its creation. Then you will feel -- know -- Dragonrend, in the power of its first expression. You will see them...wuth fadonne...my friends -- Hakon, Gormlaith, Felldir.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hakon, Gormlaith, Felldir? Who are they?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The first mortals that I taught the Thu'um -- the first Tongues. The leaders of the rebellion against Alduin. They were mighty, in their day. Even to attempt to defeat Alduin...sahrot hunne. The Nords have had many heroes since, but none greater.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How could an Elder Scroll cast Alduin through time?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Vomindok. I do not know. Perhaps in the very doing they erased the knowing of it from Time itself. The dov are children of Akatosh. Thus we are specially...attuned to the flow of Time. Perhaps also uniquely vulnerable. I warned them against such a rash action. Even I could not foresee its consequences. Nust ni hon. They would not listen.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You mean you were there?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. There were a few of us that rebelled against Alduin's thur... his tyranny. We aided the humans in his overthrow. But they did not trust us. Ni ov. Their inner councils were kept hidden from us. I was far from here on the day of Alduin's downfall. But all dov felt the...sundering of Time itself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What does the Dragonrend Shout actually do?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I cannot tell you in detail. I never heard it used. Kogaan. It was the first Thu'um created solely by mortals. It was said to force a dragon to experience the concept of Mortality. A truly vonmindoraan...incomprehensible idea to the immortal dov.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Optionally, one can ask Arngeir about the Scroll.
label: ACTION

dialogue: So...you spoke to Paarthurnax. The dragonblood burns bright within you. Did he tell you what you wanted to know? Did he teach you the Dragonrend Shout?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, but he told me how to find out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So be it. If he believes it is necessary for you to learn this...we will bow to his wisdom.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I need the Elder Scroll the ancients used. Do you know where to find it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We have never concerned ourselves with the Scrolls. The gods themselves would rightly fear to tamper with such things. As for where to find it...such blasphemies have always been the stock and trade of the mages of Winterhold. They may be able to tell you something about the Elder Scroll you seek.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One journeys to the College's librarian.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I'm looking for an Elder Scroll.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And what do you plan to do with it? Do you even know what you're asking about, or are you just someone's errand boy?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me more about the Elder Scrolls.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I knew it. Everyone comes in here, expecting my help, but they don't even have the proper questions. An Elder Scroll is an instrument of immense knowledge and power. To read an Elder Scroll, a person must have the most rigorously trained mind, or else risk madness. Even so, the Divines usually take the reader's sight as a price.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A price for what?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The simplest way to put it is "knowledge," but there's nothing simple about an Elder Scroll. It's a reflection of all possible futures and all possible pasts. Each reader sees different reflections through different lenses, and may come away with a very different reading. But at the same time, all of it is true. Even the falsehoods. Especially the falsehoods.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who wrote the Elder Scrolls?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It would take a month to explain to you how that very question doesn't even make sense. The Scrolls exist here, with us, but are also beyond and beneath. Before and after. They are bits of Divine made substance so we could know them. Sorry. Talking about the Scrolls, you usually end up in irritating and vague metaphors like that. Some people who study them devoutly go mad.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right. So do you have one that I could use?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ha!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course I do. Do you have one here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You think even if I did have one here, I would let you see it? It would be kept under the highest security. The greatest thief in the world wouldn't be able to lay a finger on it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What about the Dragonborn?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What about...wait. Are you? Were you the one the Greybeards were calling? I'll bring everything we have on them, but it's not much.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do you at least have any information on them?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I need to find one and was told you could help.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't know who told you that, but I'll do what I can. What we do have are plenty of books. I'll bring everything we have on them, but it's not much. So don't get your hopes up. It's mostly lies, leavened with rumor and conjecture.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He gets out a book written by Septimus Signus.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Here you go. Try not to spill anything on them.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This "Ruminations" book is incomprehensible.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Aye, that's the work of Septimus Signus. He's the world's master on the nature of Elder Scrolls, but...well. He's been gone for a long while. Too long.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Where did he go?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Somewhere up north, in the ice fields. Said he found some old Dwemer artifact, but...well, that was years ago. Haven't heard from him since.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He's dead?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh no. I hope not. But even I haven't seen him in years, and we were close. Became obsessed with the Dwemer. Took off north saying he had found some old artifact. Haven't seen him since. Somewhere in the ice fields, if you want to try and find him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This begins the tandem quest "Discerning the Transmundane". However, one only quest ends and the Alduin's Bane begins.
label: ACTION

dialogue: One returns with the scroll.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I have the Elder Scroll.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have it. The Kel -- the Elder Scroll. Tiid kreh...qalos. Time shudders at its touch. There is no question. You are doom-driven. Kogaan Akatosh. The very bones of the earth are at your disposal. Go then. Fulfill your destiny. Take the Scroll to the Time-Wound. Do not delay. Alduin will be coming. He cannot miss the signs.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Reading the Dragon Scroll at the designated spot lets the player look into One can do nothing but glimpse history unfolding.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Gormlaith! We're running out of time! The battle...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Daar sul thur se Alduin vakrii. Today Alduin's lordship will be restored. But I honor your courage. Krif voth ahkrin. Die now, in vain.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: For Skyrim!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hyah!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The two Nords fight the dragon.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Know that Gormlaith sent you down to your death!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They stab the dragon in the mouth; it lies still.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Hakon! A glorious day, is it not!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Have you no thought beyond the blooding of your blade?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What else is there?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The battle below goes ill. If Alduin does not rise to our challenge, I fear all may be lost.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You worry too much, brother. Victory will be ours.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why does Alduin hang back? We've staked everything on this plan of yours, old man.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He will come. He canot ignore our defiance. And why should he fear us, even now?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We've bloodied him well. Four of his kin have fallen to my blade alone this day.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But one have yet stood against Alduin himself. Galthor, Sorri, Birkir...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They did not have Dragonrend. Once we bring him down, I promise I will have his head.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You do not understand. Alduin cannot be slain like a lesser dragon. He is beyond our strength. Which is why I brought the Elder Scroll.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Felldir! We agreed not to use it!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I never agreed. And if you are right, I will not need it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. We will deal with Alduin ourselves, here and now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We shall see soon enough. Alduin approaches!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So be it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The formidable dragon perches on the Word Wall.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Meyye! Tahrodiis aanne! Him hinde pah liiv! Zu'u hin daan!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let those that watch from Sovngarde envy us this day! Gormlaith/Felldir/Hakon: Joor...Zah...Frul!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Shout forcefully binds the dragon, preventing it from flying.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Nivahriin joorre! What have you done? What twisted Words have you created?! Tahrodiis Paarthurnax! My teeth to his neck! But first...dir ko maar. You will die in terror, knowing your final fate... To feed my power when I come for you in Sovngarde!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If I die today, it will not be in terror. You feel fear for the first time, worm. I see it in your eyes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fo...Krah Diin!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Skyrim will be free!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The three Nords continue attacking the bound dragon, but soon Gormlaith is snapped up and thrown aside, dead. Felldir opens the Scroll.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Hold, Alduin on the Wing! Sister Hawk, grant us your sacred breath to make this contract heard! Begone, World-Eater! By words with older bones than your own we break your perch on this age and send you out! You are banished! Alduin, we shout you out from all our endings unto the last!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Faal Kel...?! Niikriinne...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Scroll's magics snare Alduin, promptly banishing him out of the summit, and indeed the era itself.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You are banished!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It worked...you did it...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, the World-Eater is gone...may the spirits have mercy on our souls.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player is transported back to the current time period, just in time to see Alduin approaching the peak.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Bahloki nahkip sillesejoor. My belly is full of the souls of your fellow mortals, Dovahkiin. Die now and await your fate in Sovngarde!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lost funt. You are too late, Alduin!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Suleyki mulaag, Paarthurnax. My power has waxed, while yours has waned.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Dovahkiin! Use Dragonrend, if you know it!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player's ancient Shout snares Alduin, forcing him down to the ground.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Unslaad hakoron! Never again!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You will pay for your defiance!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This is your chance, Dovahkiin! Strike with all your force!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You may have picked up the weapons of my ancient foe, but you are not their equal!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Dovahkiin, vosaraan! Use Dragonrend before Alduin consumes you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player finally defeats the dragon.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Meyz mul, Dovahkiin. You have become strong. But I am Al-du-in, firstborn of Akatosh! Mulaagi zok lot! I cannot be slain here, by you or anyone else! You cannot prevail against me. I will outlast you... mortal!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Defeated kinda-sorta, Alduin flies off. It's possible to get one's bearings from three main people. Paarthurnax is first and closest:
label: ACTION

dialogue: Lot krongrah. You truly have the Voice of a dovah. Alduin's allies will think twice after this victory.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It wasn't really a victory, since Alduin escaped.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ni liivrah hin moro. True, this is not the final krongrah -- victory. But not even the heroes of old were able to defeat Alduin in open battle. Alduin always was pahlok -- arrogant in his power. Uznahgar paar. He took domination as his birthright. This should shake the loyalty of the dov who serve him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I need to find out where Alduin went.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes...one of his allies could tell us. Motmahus... But it will not be easy to...convince one of them to betray him. Perhaps the hofkahsejun -- the palace in Whiterun...Dragonsreach. It was originally built to house a captive dovah. A fine place to trap one of Alduin's allies, hmm?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Jarl of Whiterun might not think so.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hmm, yes. But your su'um is strong. I do not doubt that you can convince him of the need.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Dragonsreach was built to hold a dragon?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. This was ages ago, you understand. There were more of us then. Before the bruniikke -- the Akaviri -- came and killed all my zeymah. I used to visit him from time to time. Nearly crazed by loneliness and captivity. Tiiraz sivaas. He did not even remember his own name. I do not know how he came to be caught. But the bronjun...the Jarl...was very proud of his pet. Paak! The hofkahsejun has been known as Dragonsreach ever since.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're the Master of the Greybeards. Do others come here to train?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have taught the Way of the Voice for centuries and the Thu'um since long before that. But no, Dovahkiin. Others do not come here to train anymore. Saraan. You are the first in over a hundred years. I meditate on the Rotmulaag -- the Words of Power. I counsel in their use. It is enough for me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You meditate on the words? How?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Knowing a Word of Power is to take its meaning into yourself. Contemplate the meaning of a Rotmulaag. You will become closer to that Word, as it fills your inner self. Will I teach you, Dovahkiin? What Word calls you to deeper understanding? There are three to master: Fus, Feim, and Yol.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It is called "Force" in your tongue. But as you push the world, so does the world push back. Think of the way force may be applied effortlessly. Imagine but a whisper pushing aside all in its path. That is "Fus." Let its meaning fill you. Su'um ahrk morah. You will push the world harder than it pushes back.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Feim.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: "Fade" in your tongue. Mortals have greater affinity for this word than the dov. Everything mortal fades away in time, but the spirit remains. Ponder the meaning of spirit. Unslaad zii. Where mortal flesh may wither and die, the spirit endures. That is "Feim." Let that meaning fill you. Su'um ahrk morah. You will find that your spirit will give you more strength.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yol.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In your tongue, the Word simply means "fire." It is change given form. Power at its most primal. That is the true meaning of "Yol." Suleyk. Power. You have it, as do all dov. But power is inert without action and choice. Think of this as the fire builds in your su'um, in your breath. Su'um ahrk morah. What will you burn? What will you spare?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If one seeks out Arngeir instead of the other two:
label: ACTION

dialogue: Alduin...we heard the Dragonrend Shout from here...you defeated him?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, but he escaped. I need to find out where he went.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The old tales say that he is able to travel into Sovngarde to devour the souls of the dead. But they don't say how he does this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One of his dragon allies could tell us...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, of course! But how to force a dragon to talk to you... There is one possibility. But...no, the Jarl would never agree.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Jarl? What are you talking about?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do you know Dragonsreach? The Jarl of Whiterun's palace? Its name is no accident. The palace was originally built to hold a captive dragon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But I thought there weren't any dragons until Alduin came back.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, this was back in the days of Olaf One-Eye, thousands of years ago. In those days, dragons could still be found among the remote mountain peaks. Before the Blades wiped them all out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So if I could lure a dragon into Dragonsreach...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You might be able to trap him there, exactly. You'd require the Jarl's cooperation, of course. That might not be easy to come by. You must trust in the rightness of your cause, and the strength of your Voice.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If one speaks to Esbern instead of the other two:
label: ACTION

dialogue: Did you find the Elder Scroll? What happened when you took it back to the Throat of the World?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I defeated Alduin, but he escaped. I need to find him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He must have returned to Sovngarde to feed on the souls of the dead. If you don't find him soon, he'll return, stronger than ever!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know. That's why I need to find him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, yes. We must think. He must have a means of travelling to and from Sovngarde. But no tale tells where that might be.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: His dragon allies must know where this portal is...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Very true! Hmmm. I wonder...do you know the Jarl's palace in Whiterun?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You mean Dragonsreach?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, exactly! Most people don't know that it was originally built to hold a captive dragon -- hence its name.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's the Jarl's palace have to do with this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, you see, the palace -- Dragonsreach -- was originally built to hold a captive dragon. Hence its name.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I thought there weren't any dragons until Alduin came back.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, this was thousands of years ago, before the Akiviri crusaders cleansed Skyrim of dragons. Skyrim's mountains were still infested with dragons. One of the early Nord kings caught a dragon and kept it in Dragonsreach.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So if I could lure a dragon into Dragonsreach...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You could trap him there, exactly. Although...it might be difficult to persuade the Jarl to allow you to use his palace as a dragon trap... I'm sure you'll manage, though. If you can defeat the World-Eater, surely sweet-talking the Jarl of Whiterun isn't beyond you. I'm afraid there's a further problem. A serious one. I've discovered who the Greybeards' leader really is.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've discovered...what?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He's a dragon. Not just any dragon, but the right hand of Alduin, responsible for many atrocities during the ancient Dragon War.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Turns out he's a dragon. But he helped me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All well and good. But did you know that he was Alduin's chief lieutenant in ancient times? Responsible for terrible atrocities? It's true that his crimes are long in the past, but justice does not count the passage of years. The Blades have been hunting him for centuries, but he was protected by the Greybeards and then the Emperors. Justice demands that he die for his crimes. Until he is dead, I'm afraid my oath as a Blade prevents me from offering you aid and comfort.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After getting info on Whiterun, one seeks out the Jarl.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I need your help. I need to trap a dragon in your palace.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I must have misheard you. I thought you asked me to help you trap a dragon in my palace.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know I wouldn't ask if it wasn't important. (Persuade)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course. You already saved Whiterun from that dragon. I owe you a great deal. But I don't understand. Why let a dragon into the heart of my city when we've been working so hard to keep them out?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You heard right. It's the only way to stop the dragons.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What you're asking for is insane. Impossible!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: • You want me to let a dragon into the heart of the city, with the threat of war on my doorstep? • Why would I agree to let a dragon into the heart of my city, after working so hard to keep them out?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The threat is worse than you know. Alduin has returned.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Alduin? The World-Eater himself? But...how can we fight him? Doesn't his return mean it's the end times?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's only hopeless if we give up.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I didn't say anything about giving up.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm Dragonborn. It's my destiny to stop him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't know about such things, but I heard the Greybeards summon you. That's good enough for me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Maybe so, but I plan to go down fighting. What about you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Spoken like a true Nord. I'll stand beside you, Dragonborn. Now, what's this nonsense about trapping a dragon in my palace?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's the only way to find Alduin before it's too late.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: • Then...Whiterun will stand with you, Dragonborn. We will take the risk, whether it be in victory or defeat! • I want to help you, Dragonborn. And I will. But I need your help first. Ulfric and General Tullius are both just waiting for me to make a wrong move. Do you think they will sit idle a dragon is slaughtering my men and burning my city? No. I can't risk weakening the city while we are under the threat of enemy attack. I'm sorry.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If the civil war has ended:
label: ACTION

dialogue: So what's the plan, then? How do you intend to lure a dragon into the trap?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't know yet. But I know some people who can probably help.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh...well, I'll leave that to you. I trust you know your business. Probably for the best. It will give me time to see if that old trap still works -- and break the news to the men.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If the civil war is ongoing:
label: ACTION

dialogue: What if you didn't have to worry about an enemy attack?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then I would be glad to help you with your mad dragon-trapping scheme. But getting both sides to agree to a truce will be difficult at this point. The bitterness has gone too deep. Maybe...hmm...what of the Greybeards? They are respected by all Nords. High Hrothgar is neutral territory. If the Greybeards are willing to host a peace council...then maybe Ulfric and Tullius would have to listen.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Leave that to me. I'll talk to Arngeir about hosting a peace council.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Aye, Dragonborn. Maybe you can stop the dragons -- and this war into the bargain.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If one hasn't learned the Shout needed during "Season Unending," this can be gotten from Paarthurnax at the Throat:
label: ACTION

dialogue: I need a way to lure a dragon to Dragonsreach. Any ideas?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hmm, yes. I have been pondering on exactly that question. Lingrah morah. I have tasted the voices of Alduin's allies on the wind. Pogaan nahlaas, vokrii wah jun. There is one who I remember well. Odahviing. He is the one to tell us where Alduin has gone.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So we know his name. How does that help me get him to Dragonsreach?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, I forget how little you know of the dov. Our names are always made of us three Rotmulaag -- Words of Power. You see -- Paar-thur-nax -- a Thu'um -- a Shout, yes?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why would he come when called?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He is not compelled to come, but the dov are prideful by nature. Few could resist such a challenge. Especially from you, Dovahkiin. But Odahviing, he is...headstrong? Boziik. Rash. Even among the dov, he was known for this. He will not resist the challenge of your Voice, Dovahkiin. He will come. Now -- hear his name. Odahviing. Taste it on the wind. Od-ah-viing. Know it in your su'um. Od-ah-viing!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If "Season Unending" was skipped, one can visit Esbern for help, too:
label: ACTION

dialogue: I need a way to lure a dragon to Dragonsreach. Any ideas?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Interesting problem. Hmmm. Yes. I've been poring over the records here in Sky Haven Temple. An unguessed trove of lost lore...but the important thing is that the Blades recorded many of the names of dragons they slew. Cross-referencing this with Delphine's map of dragon burial sites, and I believe I've identified one of the dragons that Alduin has raised up.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How does that help us?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, don't you see? The names of dragons are always three Words of Power -- Shouts. By calling the dragon with the Voice, he will hear you wherever he might be.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why would he come when called?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He's not compelled to, but dragons are prideful by nature and loath to refuse a challenge. Your Voice in particular is likely to intrigue this dragon, after your victory over Alduin. I think it very likely that he will be unable to resist investigating your call.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So what's this dragon's name?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, indeed. I'm no master of the Voice like these worthy gentlemen, but it is written here in this scroll. Od - Ah - Viing. "Winged Snow Hunter," as I read it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If the war is ongoing, readers should skip to "Season Unending". If the war of this quest can continue.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Are you ready to spring the trap on the dragon?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: • We'll be ready, don't worry. You do have a plan for actually luring a dragon into this trap, don't you? • As I promised, my men stand ready. The great chains are oiled. We wait on your word.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not quite yet.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not that it's upon us, I'm rather looking forward to the challenge. I'll be famouser than Olaf One-Eye!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm ready. Let's trap a dragon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My men know what to do. Make sure you do your part. I'm putting my city in your hands.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Balgruuf, Irileth and the Dragonborn visit the Great Porch, the castle's old dragon-housing area.
label: ACTION

dialogue: • You do have a plan for luring a dragon here, yeah? • Go ahead and call this dragon of yours. We're ready. We're ready when you are.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player shouts Odahviing's name.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Hear that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Odahviing dives in, snatching up the guard in the blink of an eye.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Over there!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Shor's bones, here he comes!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hold your fire until he's close!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Dovahkiin! Here I am!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We may not be trying to kill him, but he sure seems to be trying to kill us!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Steady! Steady, now! Keep under cover until it's down!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Eventually the dragon is weakened, causing him to perch on the Great Porch. He creeps closer inside during the fight.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Ni fas, Dovahkiin!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The guards hit the chains, trapping the dragon under a massive weighted yoke.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Got him!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nid!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think it's holding!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Horvutah med kodnaav. Caught like a bear in a trap... Zok frini grind ko grah drun viiki, Dovahkiin. Ah. I forget. You do not have the dovah speech. My...eagerness to meet you in battle was my... undoing. Dovahkiin. I salute your, hmm...low cunning in devising such a grahmindol -- strategem. Zu'u bonaar. You went to a great deal of trouble to put me in this...humiliating position. Hind siiv Alduin, hmm? No doubt you want to know where to find Alduin?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's right. Where is he hiding?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Rinik vazah. An apt phrase. Alduin bovul. One reason I came to your call was to test your Thu'um for myself. Many of us have begun to question Alduin's lordship, whether his Thu'um is truly the strongest. Among ourselves, of course. Mu ni meyye. None were yet ready to openly defy him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You were telling me where to find Alduin?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Unslaad krosis. Innumerable pardons. I digress. He has travelled to Sovngarde to regain his strength, devouring the sillesejoor...the souls of the mortal dead. A privilege he jealously guards... His door to Sovngarde is at Skuldafn, one of his ancient fanes high in the eastern mountains. Mindoraan, pah ok middovahhe lahvraan til. I surely do not need to warn you that all his remaining strength is marshalled there. Zu'u lost ofan hin laan...now that I have answered your question, you will allow me to go free?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do you promise to serve me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Aam? Serve you? ...no. Ni tiid. If and when you defeat Alduin, I will reconsider.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not until Alduin is defeated.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah. Well. Hmm...krosis. There is one...detail about Skuldafn I neglected to mention.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me what you know, then.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Only this. You have the Thu'um of a dovah, but without the wings of one, you will never set foot in Skuldafn. Of course...I could fly you there. But not while imprisoned like this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We seem to be at an impasse, then.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Indeed. Orin brit ro. I cannot leave here until you defeat Alduin, which you cannot do without my help.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do you expect me to take your word for that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ahraan. You wound me, Dovahkiin. I may not tell the whole truth, but I am no liar. Go and see for yourself. Zu'u ni bo nol het. I will be here...unless Alduin returns before you do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fine. I'll set you free if you promise to take me to Skuldafn.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Onikraan koraav gein miraad. It is wise to recognize when you only have one choice. And you can trust me. Zu'u ni tahrodiis. Alduin has proven himself unworthy to rule. I go my own way now. Free me, and I will carry you to Skuldafn.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Farengar walks over after the conversation.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Incredible! Uh...sir, you have no idea how long I have waited for such an opportunity! I would be most appreciative if you would permit me to perform some, ah, tests on you. Purely in the interests of the advancement of knowledge.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Begone, mage. Do not test my promise to the Dovahkiin.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I assure you, you will not even notice me. Most of them are hardly painful at all on a large dragon such as yourself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Farengar, very bad idea. Even for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Surely you wouldn't miss a fe scales...or a small amount of blood...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Joor mey! What are you doing back there? Yol...Toor...Shul!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He breathes firing, causing Farengar to scamper off.
label: ACTION

dialogue: If the Civil War is still ongoing, one will have to speak to Arngeir about a peace summit.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Alduin...we heard the Dragonrend Shout from here...you defeated him?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, but he escaped. I need to find his portal to Sovngarde.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I feared as much. I thought it was him we saw flying east after your battle.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I need your help. I need to capture a dragon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We are not warriors. What is overlooked in the Dragonborn is not permitted to any other followers or the Way of the Voice.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll worry about capturing a dragon. I need your help to stop the war.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You misunderstand our authority. The Greybeards have never involved themselves in political affairs.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Jarl Balgruuf won't help me while the war rages.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I see. The dragon will lead you to Alduin, but without the Jarl's help...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Both sides respect the Greybeards. They will listen.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Paarthurnax has made the decision to help you. This is the road we have to walk. Even the Greybeards must bend to the winds of change, it seems. So be it. Tell Ulfric and General Tullius that the Greybeards wish to speak to them. We will see if they still remember us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One can pick his mind about other options.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Are you ready to host the peace council?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Deliver the message to the warring parties. If they will listen, I will do what I can to bring them to terms.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Blades want me to kill Paarthurnax.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now you see why I warned you against them! Bloodthirsty barbarians!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is it true what they said? Was he Alduin's ally?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. But understand -- during the days of Alduin's rule, all dragons were his allies. There was nothing else they could be. If not for Paarthurnax, Alduin could not have been overthrown. It was he who first taught men to use the Thu'um.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He still needs to pay for his crimes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The same could be said for any of us, could it not? Are you so guiltless as to stand in judgment upon Paarthurnax? Listen to your inner Voice before acting. Do not allow the Blades to bully you into doing something you will later regret. After all, repentance is something you deny to Paarthurnax by meting out your so-called justice.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I haven't decided what to do yet.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're learning, Dragonborn. Doing nothing can be the wisest choice, although strangely often the most difficult. I trust that you will make the right choice, in the end. Listen to the Voice that Kynareth has placed within you, and your path will become clear.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't worry, I'm not going to kill Paarthurnax.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Kynareth has placed the Voice of wisdom within you, Dragonborn. All you need do is learn to listen to it, and your path will be clear.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Where has Alduin gone?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The old tales say that he can travel into Sovngarde to devour the souls of the dead. You must find out how he does this, before he regains his strength and returns.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One visits Castle Dour in Solitude, the Imperial Legion's seat of power.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I have a message from the Greybeards.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Greybeards? What do those old hermits want with me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They're convening a peace council at High Hrothgar.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's nothing to discuss as long as that traitor Ulfric is in arms against his rightful Emperor.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We need a truce until the dragon menace is dealt with.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They are getting to be a problem. But I wasn't sent to Skyrim to fight dragons. My job is to quell this rebellion, and I intend to do just that, dragons or no dragons.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The dragons are a bigger problem than the Stormcloaks right now. (Persuade)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You may have a point. It's getting difficult to even move troops around without attracting a dragon attack. By all accounts the Stormcloaks are suffering just as badly. Even Ulfric might see the sense of a truce under these conditions.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll be the judge of that. Besides, by all reports the Stormcloaks are suffering just as much a we are from these dragon attacks.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The best time to negotiate is from a position of strength.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fair enough. We're driving the Stormcloaks back well enough at the moment, but we're already overstretched. That's what comes from trying to win a war with bare handful of legions. If the Emperor would just give me the reinforcements I've requested!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why won't the Emperor send more reinforcements?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Most of the Legion is tied down on the border with the Aldmeri Dominion. The Emperor can't afford to risk weakening Cyrodiil's defenses. From the Imperial City, our war here is just a sideshow. An interlude before the main event against the Thalmor resumes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Empire can't afford to snub the Greybeards.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hmm. You may have a point. I'm always surprised by how seriously the Nords take these things.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'll come to the peace council, then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. Yes, fine, I'll come to this Greybeard council. For all the good it will do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player visits Ulfric's Palace of the Kings in Windhelm.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I have a message from the Greybeards.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's about time they turned their gaze from the heavens, back to our bleeding homeland. What do they want?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They want to negotiate a truce until the dragon menace is dealt with.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have the greatest respect for the Greybeards, of course. And the dragon attacks are a growing plague. But the political situation is still delicate. Not all the Jarls are fully committed to supporting me as High King. I can't afford to appear weak. I can't agree to this unless Tullius himself will be there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Politics be damned! Alduin has returned! (Persuade)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Alduin? The World-Eater of song and legend? If that's true...well, it changes the situation doesn't it? Even Tullius may be forced to talk sense in the face of such a threat.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: General Tullius has already agreed to attend.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good. We still hold half of Skyrim despite everything the Empire could throw at us. I doubt the Empire has the stomach for much more bloodletting.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So you'll come to the peace council?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. I'll give Tullius one more chance to quit Skyrim with his tail between his legs.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: With the two players collected, one returns to Arngeir in the main hall.
label: ACTION

dialogue: So, you've done it. The men of violence are gathered here, in these halls whose very stones are dedicated to peace. I should not have agreed to host this council. The Greybeards have no business involving ourselves in such matters.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't worry. I'll get them to agree to peace.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Peace? I doubt it. They may put their weapons down for a moment, but only to gather strength for the next bloodletting. They are not yet tired of war. Far from it. Do you know the ancient Nord word for war? "Season unending"...so it has proved.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This was the only way to get Balgruuf's help.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, yes. Which is why I allowed this...violation of all our traditions. But regrets are pointless. Here we are. Take your seat at the council table and let us see what wisdom we can find among these warriors of Skyrim.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In the adjacent chamber, Skyrim's big shots are gathered: Tullius and Rikke, summit begins:
label: ACTION

dialogue: And so we meet again. But this time I know who and what you really are.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll give you credit for boldness. But associating yourself with the Blades is a choice you will come to regret.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm here to ensure General Tullius does not exceed his authority.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We should get started.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you can arrange an end to the fighting, Dragonsreach is at your disposal.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We should get started.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is everyone here? Let's get this started.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm here because it's requested of me. But there's nothing to be gained by talking to that murderer.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I understand this council was your idea, Dragonborn. I'm afraid I don't hold out much hope for success.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm glad I finally got a chance to see this place.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: When has any good ever come from talking to the Empire?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't know how you convinced Ulfric to talk to the Empire. Worse than a waste of time, if you ask me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I never thought I'd willingly stand in the same room with Tullius again. At least not without a weapon in my hand.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's good to be back at High Hrothgar after all these years.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'd just as soon get this over with.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We should get started. Alduin is only getting stronger.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What are we waiting for?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We must succeed here today.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We must make them see their danger, Dragonborn.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Eventually, Arngeir calls for everyone's attention.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Now that everyone is here, please take your seats so we can begin. I hope that we have all come here in the spirit of...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. You insult us by bringing her to this negotiation? Your chief Talos-hunter?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That didn't take long.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hear, hear!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have every right to be at this negotiation. I need to ensure that nothing is agreed to here that violates the terms of the White-Gold Concordat.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She's part of the Imperial deligation. You can't dictate who I bring to this council.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Please. If we have to negotiate the terms of the negotiation, we will never get anywhere. Perhaps this would be a good time to get the Dragonborn's input on this matter.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: By Ysmir's beard, the nerve of those Imperial bastards, eh? To think that I would sit down at the same table with that...Thalmor bitch. Either she walks or I do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're right. The Thalmor have no business here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm glad we agree on this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's the harm? Besides, Tullius doesn't really want her here either.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Maybe so, but bringing her here is a deliberate provocation. Tullius needs to know I won't be pushed around.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I agree. This will set the tone for the whole negotiation. Elenwen should go.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well said.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let Tullius have his way on this. He'll have to give ground later.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hmm. It feels like a mistake to me, but I'll bow to your judgment on this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If Elenwen gets to stay:
label: ACTION

dialogue: But she is to observe, nothing more. We are not negotiating with her, is that clear?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ulfric, why so hostile? After all, it's not the Thalmor that are burning your farms and killing your sons.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She's supposed to be on our side?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know exactly...no. Not this time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If Elenwen leaves:
label: ACTION

dialogue: Very well, Ulfric. Enjoy your petty victory. The Thalmor will treat with whatever government rules Skyrim. We would not think of interfering in your civil war.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ha! Skyrim will never bow to the Thalmor! Unlike your Imperial friends here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're lucky I respect the Greybeards' council, Galmar!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Legate. We represent the Emperor here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sorry, sir. It won't happen again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After the Elenwen issue is decided:
label: ACTION

dialogue: Now that that's settled, may we proceed?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have something to say first.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Here we go.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The only reason I agreed to attend this council was to deal with the dragon menace. There's nothing else to talk about, unless the Empire is finally ready to renounce its unjust claim to rule over the free people of Skyrim.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I knew he wouldn't be able to resist.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We're here to offer a temporary truce to allow the Dragonborn here to deal with the dragons. Nothing more. I consider even talking to the Empire a generous gesture.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Are you done? Did you just come here to make speeches? Or can we get down to business?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, let's get this over with.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Are we ready to proceed? Jarl Ulfric. General Tullius. This council is unprecedented. We are gathered here at the Dragonborn's request. I ask that you all respect the spirit of High Hrothgar, and do your best to begin the process of achieving a lasting peace in Skyrim. Who would like to open the negotiations?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, let's get down to it. We want control of Markarth. That's our price for agreeing to a truce.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So that's why you're here, Ulfric? You dare to insult the Greybeards by using this council to advance your own position?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Jarl Elisif, I'll handle this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: General, this is outrageous! You can't be taking this demand seriously! I thought we were here to discuss the truce!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Elisif! I said I'd handle it. Ulfric, you can't seriously expect us to give up Markarth at the negotiating table. You hope to gain in council what you've been unable to take in battle, is that it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm sure Jarl Ulfric does not expect something for nothing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, that'd be entirely out of character.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What would the Empire want in return?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wait. General, you don't intend to just hand over Markarth to that... traitor!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This is how the Empire repays us for our loyalty?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Enough! First, let's be clear. This council wasn't my idea. I think it's a waste of time. You are a traitor to the Empire, and deserve a traitor's death. But I at least will negotiate in good faith. Since we're all here at your request, I'd like to hear what you think Markarth is worth.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How about Riften?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hmm. The Rift would help secure our communications with Cyrodiil... and threaten Ulfric's southern flank... You heard the man, Ulfric. We've made you a fair offer. Are you serious about these talks, or are you just here to posture?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Winterhold seems like a fair trade.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In exchange for Markarth, the source of most of Skyrim's silver? Hardly. Riften seems like a better choice to me. Well-fortified, easily resupplied across Lake Honrich. Plus all the mead we can drink.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You asked my opinion. I gave it to you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fair enough. I was hoping you could put aside your loyalties for the greater good, but I see you're firmly in Ulfric's camp. Still... Winterhold would allow us to directly threaten the rebel supply lines out of Windhelm... Better than nothing, I suppose. But Ulfric will need to offer a lot more if he wants me to give up Markarth without a fight.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There are advantages to gaining Winterhold. (Persuade)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ("Winterhold would allow..." to "...Markarth without a fight.")
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not enough to outweigh the loss of Markarth. With the Reach in enemy hands, our whole position in Solitude would be threatened.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're right. Riften is a fair trade for Markarth.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm glad you agree. I was starting to wonder whose side you were on here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If one traded Winterhold:
label: ACTION

dialogue: The Dragonborn has spoken, Tullius. Markarth will be ours. Now we'll see if there's anything behind your talk of good faith.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: • I don't blame you, Dragonborn. You made the best of a bad situation. But I can see now that this is not a negotiation at all. • You disappoint me, Dragonborn. I accepted your invitation on trust in your good name. But it seems you intend to favor Ulfric. I can see now that this is not a negotiation at all. I know you, Ulfric. If I hand over Markarth, you'll be ready with a new demand. You'll never defeat the Empire, and you know it. But you're willing to sacrifice thousands for your own selfish ambition. Soon enough I'll have you back under the headsman's axe, and this time there won't be any dragon to save you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As always, the Empire's fine words are worth nothing!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If one traded Riften:
label: ACTION

dialogue: I expected better from you, Dragonborn. I came here in good faith, and now it seems you help the Empire at every turn. As for you General Tullius, I see now that Galmar was right. Talking to the Empire is just as useless as ever. If you think you can hold Markarth, you're as deluded as your Emperor when he signed away our freedom to the Thalmor. Skyrim will never again bow to your false Empire! Let's go, Galmar. I should have listened to you in the first place.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You always were a fool, Ulfric. You're no better at diplomacy than you are on the battlefield.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Esbern will always interrupt the ongoing argument.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Stop! Are you so blind to our danger that you can't see past your petty disagreements? Here you sit arguing about...nothing! While the fate of the land hangs in the balance!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is he with you, Delphine? If so, I advise you to tell him to watch his tongue.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He is with me. And I advise you both to listen to what he has to say, before you do anything rash.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't you understand the danger? Don't you understand what the return of the dragons means? Alduin has returned! The World-Eater! Even now, he devours the souls of your fallen comrades! He grows more powerful with every soldier slain in your pointless war! Can you not put aside your hatred for even one moment in the face of this mortal danger?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If Elenwen is present, a missable segment plays where she's rebuffed:
label: ACTION

dialogue: A very pretty speech, but what does this have to do with... • Ulfric: Shut up. • Tullius: That's enough out of you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tullius may chime in here:
label: ACTION

dialogue: I don't know about the end of the world, but this dragon situation has gotten out of hand. If this truce will help the Dragonborn put an end to that menace, we both gain. Remember that, Ulfric. Now, back to the matter at hand...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If Tullius doesn't chime in, Ulfric does instead:
label: ACTION

dialogue: If he's right about Alduin...we both have just as much to lose here, Tullius, remember that. Now, back to the matter at hand.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If negotiations favor the Stormcloaks, Tullius will comment now:
label: ACTION

dialogue: You know as well as I do we can't hand over Markarth on these terms.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Shor's bones, where will these demands end?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Out with it, then.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We want compensation for the massacre at Karthwasten.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You slaughtered the very people you claimed to be fighting for! True sons of Skyrim would never do such things.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Damned Imperial lies! My men would never stoop to such methods, even in retaliation for your butchery at...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This is our homeland, Tullius. All the blood spilled in this war is on your head.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, Dragonborn. What do you say?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ulfric should compensate you for Karthwasten.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well said. For once, you'll actually pay for your crimes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who's to say what happened at Karthwasten?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I should have known better than to expect you to give us a fair hearing. Once again, the Empire takes the blame for the crimes of others.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If the Dragonborn decides, but the terms still aren't fair:
label: ACTION

dialogue: You know I can't agree to these terms. The Emperor would repudiate this treaty and I would be recalled.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: • You see what talking to them gets us? • Damn Imperial arrogance!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's hear it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If Tullius doesn't get his sought-after compensation:
label: ACTION

dialogue: We want the Pale returned to Imperial control. The traitor Skald the Elder will be replaced with a more loyal candidate.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What next, Tullius? Shall I just hand over all of Skyrim?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I guess I have no choice but to let the Dragonborn decide. Although I'm starting to doubt your fairness. So, Dragonborn. What do you say?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I agree. Ulfric should turn over the Pale.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I knew I could count on you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ulfric doesn't need to give up any more territory.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As I expected, you favor your friends.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If negotiations favor the Imperials, Ulfric will comment now:
label: ACTION

dialogue: Don't hand me a mug of sheep's piss and call it mead. These terms are still not acceptable.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm sure you have something in mind.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Damn right we do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You surrend Hjaalmarch to us, and take Idgrod Ravencrone with you. Sorli the Builder will take over as Jarl of Morthal.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Where do these demands stop, Ulfric? Do you expect me to surrender all of Skyrim?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It seems I have no choice but to let the Dragonborn decide. Although I'm starting to doubt your fairness. What say you, Dragonborn?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I agree. The Empire should hand over Hjaalmarch.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Spoken like a true son of Skyrim!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Empire doesn't need to give up any more territory.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Even the Dragonborn betrays Skyrim.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: IF THE COUNCIL FAVORS TULLIUS
label: ACTION

dialogue: These terms are not acceptable. You know that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm listening.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't play dumb, Tullius!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Bah! This is a waste of time. I can see that we won't get better terms from this council. So bet it. The sons of Skyrim at least put the greater good above our own interests.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: IF THE COUNCIL FAVORS ULFRIC
label: ACTION

dialogue: Don't hand me a mug of sheep's piss and call it Colovian brandy. These terms are still not acceptable.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm listening.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Never mind. I can see that these are the best terms we'll get from this council. So be it. The Empire at least puts the greater good above our own interests.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: IF THE TERMS ARE EVENLY MATCHED
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I suppose that's the fairest deal we're likely to get.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: THE COUNCIL ALWAYS ENDS WITH...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Arngeir will say applicable bullet points next:
label: ACTION

dialogue: It seems we may have an agreement. Jarl Ulfric... General Tullius... These are the terms currently on the table. • Markarth will be handed over to Ulfric's forces. Jarl Igmund will step down, and Thongvor Silver-Blood will become the Jarl of Markarth. • Ulfric will allow Imperial troops to enter Winterhold. Korir will replace Kraldar as Jarl. • The Stormcloaks will withdraw from the rift, allowing Imperial troops unhindered access. Jarl Laila Law-Giver will step down, and Maven Black-Briar will become the Jarl of Riften. • The Stormcloaks will pay appropriate compensation for the massacre at Karthwasten. • Hjaalmarch will be turned over to Ulfric, with Sori the Builder assuming the Jarlship. • The Pale will be turned over to the Empire. Brina Merilis will assume the Jarlship in Dawnstar.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You both agree to this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: • The sons of Skyrim will live up to their agreements. As long as the Imperials hold to theirs. What about you, Elisif? Are these terms to your liking? Speak up. I'm sure General Tullius is waiting to do your bidding. • I shouldn't agree to terms that so blatantly favor the Empire. I have no choice, though, under the circumstances. But once Alduin is defeated, then it will be the Empire's turn. Remember "Evgir Unslaad." You should be pleased, Elisif. You've done so well for yourself as the Empire's pet Jarl. But beware -- the Empire's loyalty is fickle. They will tire of this war, and then I will be the one dictating terms to you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have nothing to say to that murderer. General, you've proven yourself a good friend to Skyrim. I continue to trust that you will do your utmost to safeguard our interests.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you, Jarl Elisif. I appreciate your loyalty. • The Empire can live with these terms, yes. For a temporary truce, until the dragon menace is dealt with. • These terms blatantly favor the rebels. Everyone here knows that. But the Empire will accept them, until the dragon menace is dealt with. After that, Ulfric...there will be a reckoning. Count on it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No matter the negotiations, Ulfric and Galmar start leaving at this point.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Come on, Galmar. We've have a lot of work to do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Giving up Markarth is a heavy price for this truce, Dragonborn. I hope it was worth it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Jarl Balgruuf, I assume you are familiar with the Dragonborn's plan?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, I'm ready to do my part. Just say the word, and my men will help you spring this trap.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But the difficulty remains -- how to lure a dragon to Dragonsreach at all?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, that's an excellent question. You haven't overlooked that little detail, did you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah. I believe I can be of help here. I anticipated this problem. While you were arranging this meeting, I was busy in the library of Sky Haven Temple. An unguessed trove of lost lore...but the important thing is that the Blades recorded many of the names of dragons they slew. Cross-referencing this with Delphine's map of dragon burial sites, and I believe I've identified one of the dragons that Alduin has raised up.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How does that help us?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, don't you see? The names of dragons are always three Words of Power -- Shouts. By calling the dragon with the Voice, he will hear you wherever he might be.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why would he come when called?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He's not compelled to, but dragons are prideful by nature and loath to refuse a challenge. Your Voice in particular is likely to intrigue this dragon, after your victory over Alduin. I think it very likely that he will be unable to resist investigating your call.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So what's this dragon's name?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, indeed. I'm no master of the Voice like these worthy gentlemen, but it is written here in this scroll. Od - Ah - Viing. "Winged Snow Hunter," as I read it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: With the knowledge in hand, everyone at the table gets ready to leave. They lines as well, although they left earlier.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You did well here today. I don't think the truce will last long, but that will not be on your account.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I hope this truce gives you what you need. It won't last.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'd give a week's pay to see the look on Ulfric's face again, when he had to swallow the terms of the truce.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't know why you gave Ulfric so much. That murderer will never rule Skyrim.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm glad you were able to negotiate a truce, but I still don't trust Ulfric. He'll break his word as soon as it suits him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'd better be able to deliver, Dragonborn. I sacrified a lot here today.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That could have gone worse. Now it's up to you to deliver.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: These terms are satisfactory to my government. The truce is unlikely to last long in any case.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As soon as I get back to Whiterun, I'll get my men ready.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I sacrificed a lot here today for this plan of yours.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We're counting on you to make this all worthwhile.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't much like this truce. Feels like a betrayal to me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The look on Tullius's face while the Greybeard read the terms was worth the trip.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This quest begins after the Blades request one slay Paarthurnax, either at dragon to discuss it.
label: ACTION

dialogue: The Blades say you have to die.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Blades are wise not to trust me. Onikaan ni ov. I would not trust another dovah.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why shouldn't they trust you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Dov wahlaan fah rel. We were made to dominate. The will to power is in our blood. You feel it in yourself, do you not? I can be trusted. I know this. But they do not. Onikaan ni ov dovah. It is always wise to mistrust a dovah. I have overcome my nature only through meditation and long study of the Way of the Voice. No day goes by where I am not tempted to return to my inborn nature. Zin krif horvut se suleyk. What is better -- to be born good, or to overcome your evil nature through great effort?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If one kills Parthy, it's time to tell Delphine the news.
label: ACTION

dialogue: It's done. Paarthurnax is dead.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I knew we could count on you! Glad to have you back on our side.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If one tries talking to Arngeir after the slaying of the Greybeards' leader:
label: ACTION

dialogue: This is how you repay our trust? Paarthurnax's trust? His noble spirit...the wisdom of ages...his deep understanding of our existence...all gone, and for what? A mindless vendetta urged on you by a cabal of Akaviri barbarians! Begone, before even my philosophy is tested beyond the breaking point. We are men of peace, and you are not.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We have nothing to say to each other. Paarthurnax's murder is beyond my powers of forgiveness.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After capturing Odahviing and discussing terms with him, one can free him by talking to the yoke's guard.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Open the trap.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You sure about that? You want to let that dragon loose after all the trouble to catch it there?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, I'm sure.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your funeral. Someone else is going to have to help you get him back in there again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hold on. Not yet.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, when you make up your mind, let me know. I'll be here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One decides to invade Skuldafn.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Get ready to open the trap! This seems like a really bad idea to me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Carry on, soldier. This is all part of the Dragonborn's plan.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They release the yoke, stirring the dragon.
label: ACTION

dialogue: By all the gods...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Faas nu, zint dein ruthi ahst vaal.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They walk to the open-air perch.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Saraan uth -- I await your command, as promised. Are you ready to see the world as only a dovah can?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm ready. Take me to Skuldafn.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Zok brit uth! I warn you, once you've flown the skies of Keizaal, your envy of the dov will only increase. Amativ! Mu bo kotin stinselok.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hold on. I'm not quite ready.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Kreh zini! The freedom of the sky beckons! Yet I stay here, nau gol, as promised.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player flies off on Odahviing's back.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You are either the bravest person I've ever met, or the biggest fool.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: May Kynareth guard you while you pass through her realm!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One finally reaches Skuldafn, the mountaintop stronghold normally inaccessible to on-foot travel.
label: ACTION

dialogue: This is far as I can take you. Krif voth ahkrin. I will look for your return, or Alduin's.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He flies off, letting the player fight the draugr and minor dragons who wait for the player down the fane.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Skuldafn fen kos dinok.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After traversing Skuldafn Temple, one kills the dragon priest guarding the Sovngarde portal. One jumps in...
label: ACTION

dialogue: Stepping into Sovngarde, one sees just what it looks like: like Skyrim's seen in the distance. A Stormcloak approaches out of nowhere.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Turn back, traveler! Terror awaits within this mist. Many have braved the shadowed vale but vain is all courage against the peril that guards the way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who are you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Near Giants' Gap, in the gloom before dawn, we marched, unsuspecting into the Imperials' trap. Then we stood and fought, our shield-wall defending until by dawn's light the Legion's ranks wavered. But I never knew if nights-end brought victory -- a swift-flying arrow to Sovngarde carried me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's this mist?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I do not know -- but none have passed through. Alduin, his hunger insatiable, hunts the lost souls snared within this shadowed valley. Can you lead the way to where Shor's hall waits, beckoning us on to welcome long sought?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, it's at the far end of the valley from here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (skip to "I saw it fair...")
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Shor's hall? What's that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't you know? What drew you here? Surely your dreams showed you the way? The Hall of Valor, where heroes wait to follow Shor to the final battle. I saw it fair when first I trod this long-sought path. The pain and fear vanished, dreamlike, and a vision beckoned. Shor's hall, shimmering across the clouded vale. But quenched was hope by the shrouding mist -- my mind is darkened. I've lost the way and wander blindly. Hurry! Before Alduin your life devours bring word to Shor's hall of our hard fate!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Follow me. I'll lead you through this mist.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll try to hold to your hopeful purpose. Quickly, before this encompassing fog once more snares me in the World-Eater's net.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't worry, I'm here to kill Alduin.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Beware! The World-Eater waits within the mist!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player can find random dead/ghost people along the misty path. Some NPCs questline. They all talk in heroic prose, for some reason...
label: ACTION

dialogue: When I woke from cold death, my doom was lifted -- there was Shor's Hall, my heart's desire. But now I wander, weary and lost. Alduin hunts me as we once hunted our prey -- a bitter payment for many bloody deeds.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: When Ulfric Stormcloak, with savage Shout, sent me here, my sole regret was fair Elisif, left forlorn and weeping. I faced him fearlessly -- my fate inescapable -- yet, my honor is unstained -- can Ulfric say the same?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Skyrim was betrayed, the blood of her sons spilled in doomed struggle against fate. And so in death, too late, I learn the truth - fed by war, so waxed the power of Alduin, World-Eater -- wisdom now useless. By gods' jest in this grim mist together snared, Stormcloak and Imperial, we wander hopeless, waiting for succor.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Dragonborn, even in death you dog my steps? How come you here? The king of this realm will cast you out -- cursed be your name by all sons of Skyrim, with scorn unceasing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The bitter war of the world beyond was all for naught. We are all trapped in Alduin's web -- for our allegiance he cares not, but devours us equally -- doom unescapable. Shor as well -- he welcomes all heroes to his kingly hall, if we could but reach it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Eventually, one finds Shor's Hall and a massive bridge leading to it, crafted from a giant creature's spine. A sentry stands guard.
label: ACTION

dialogue: What brings you here, wayfarer grim, to wonder here, in Sovngarde, souls-end, Shor's gift to the honored dead?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who are you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am Tsun, shield-thane to Shor. The Whalebone Bridge he bade me guard and winnow all the souls whose heroic end sent them here, to Shor's lofty hall where welcomed, well-earned, awaits those I judge fit to join that fellowship of honor.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I pursue Alduin, the World-Eater
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A fateful errand. No few have chafed to face the Worm since first he set his soul-snare here at Sovngarde's threshold. But Shor's restrained our wrathful onslaught -- perhaps, deep-counselled, your doom he foresaw.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I seek entrance to the Hall of Valor.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No shade are you, as usually here passes, but living, you dare the land of the dead. By what right do you request entry?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: By the right of birth. I am Dragonborn.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah! It's been too long since last I faced a doom-driven hero of the dragon blood.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: By right of glory. I lead the Companions of Jorrvaskr.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I welcome the chance to challenge the blade of Ysgramor's heir, honored shield-brother to Kodlak Whitemane, whom I've watched for in vain.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: By right of Cleverness. I am Master of the College of Winterhold.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well met, mage of Skyrim. The Nords may have forgotten their forefathers' respect for the Clever Craft, but your comrades throng this hall. Here in Shor's house we honor it still.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: By right of blood. I Listen for the Night Mother.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You trespass here, shadow-walker. Shor does not know you. Perhaps before the end you will earn the right to pass this way. Welcome I do not offer, but your errand I will not hinder, if my wrath you can withstand.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: By right of plunder. I am a Nightingale of Nocturnal.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do not mistake the night-shrouded thief's stealthily-taken spoils, stolen and unearned, for a warrior's plunder, won in honorable battle. Your doom already binds you to your dark mistress, but your errand I will not hinder, if my wrath you can withstand.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Can I enter the Hall of Valor?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Living or dead, by decree of Shor, none may pass this perilous bridge 'til I judge them worthy by the warrior's test.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player beats Tsun in battle.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You fought well. I find you worthy. It is long since one of the living has entered here. May Shor's favor follow you and your errand.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One crosses the massive bridge into the Hall of Valor, where Nord heroes of entry.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Welcome, Dragonborn! Our door has stood empty since Alduin first set his soul-snare here. By Shor's command we sheathed our blades and ventured not the vale's dark mist. But three await your word to loose their fury upon the perilous foe. Gormlaith the fearless, glad-hearted in battle; Hakon the valiant, heavy-handed warrior; Felldir the Old, far-seeing and grim.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One goes over to the three battle-ready Nords.
label: ACTION

dialogue: At long last! Alduin's doom is now ours to seal -- just speak the word and with high hearts we'll hasten forth to smite the worm wherever he lurks.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hold, comrades -- let us counsel take before battle is blindly joined. Alduin's mist is more than a snare -- its shadowy gloom is his shield and cloak. But with four Voices joined, our valor combined, we can blast the mist and bring him to battle.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Felldir speaks wisdom -- the World-Eater, coward, fears you, Dragonborn. We must drive away his mist, Shouting together, and then unsheathe our blades in desperate battle with our black-winged foe.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: To battle, my friends! The fields will echo with the clamor of war, our wills undaunted.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Dragonborn and his three comrades rush outside.
label: ACTION

dialogue: With the ancient Nord heroes at his back, one crosses the bone bridge.
label: ACTION

dialogue: The eyes of Shor are upon you this day. Defeat Alduin, and destroy his soul-snare.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We cannot fight the foe in this mist!
label: CHARACTER
