dialogue: Clear Skies -- combine our Shouts!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player uses his Clear Skies Shout.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Lok...Vah...Koor!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lok...Vah...Koor!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lok...Vah...Koor!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ven Mul Riik!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Again!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lok...Vah...Koor!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lok...Vah...Koor!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lok...Vah...Koor!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ven Mul Riik!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Alduin's Shouting returns the mist, again.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Does his strength have no end? Is our struggle in vain?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Stand fast! His strength is failing! Once more, and his might will be broken!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One more time, and the World-Eater must face us!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player Shouts a third time.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Lok...Vah...Koor!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lok...Vah...Koor!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lok...Vah...Koor!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This time, the mist dissipates completely. Alduin finally flies into range.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Stand together and we shall defeat him!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No escape this time, foul worm!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Stand fast! The fell worm's death is ours at last, the light returns!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nust wo ni qilaan fen kos duuan.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: For Skyrim! For Shor! For Sovngarde's freedom!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nowhere to hide! Hunter becomes our prey!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You are persistent, Dovahkiin. Pruzeh ol aar. A fine slave you would have made.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player Dragonrends Alduin, and with the other Nords, finally slay Alduin.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Zu'u unslaad! zu'u nis oblaan!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Alduin's flesh explodes off, and his vile soul evaporates, finally ending hi tyrannical reign.
label: ACTION

dialogue: This was a mighty deed! The doom of Alduin encompassed at last, and cleansed is Sovngarde of his evil snare. They will sing of this battle in Shor's hall forever. But your fate lies elsewhere. When you have completed your count of days, I may welcome you again, with glad friendship and bid you join the blessed feasting.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All hail the Dragonborn! Hail him with great praise!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player can talk to them before leaving. Souls that were once lost in the mist are now approaching.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I'll look for you, friend, when at last you return to Shor's hall. The honor will be ours when you rejoin the ranks of Sovngarde.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Our ancient debt for Alduin's reprieve is now repaid -- the long night is ended!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Even here, where heroes throng, few can match this mighty deed. What glory! The gods themselves must envy us this well-earned honor!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I hear your heart beat like the Harbingers of old. Your glories in Skyrim are seen and honored.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: When it's time to go, one returns to Tsun.
label: ACTION

dialogue: When you are ready to rejoin the living, just bid me so, and I will send you back.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not yet.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tarry not too long -- the land of the dead is not meant for mortals to linger.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm ready to return to Tamriel.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Return now to Nirn, with this rich boon from Shor, my lord: a Shout to bring a hero from Sovngarde in your hour of need. Nahl...Daal...Vus!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tsun's Shout returns the player to the Throat of the World. There, many of they say their peace and start circling the summit, almost like last rites.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Alduin mahlaan
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sahrot thur qahnaraan
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Alduin mahlaan
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Dovahkiin los ak dovahkriid
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Alduin mahlaan
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thu'umii los nahlot
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Alduin mahlaan
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mu los vamir
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, it is done. Alduin dilon. The Eldest is no more, he who came before all others, and has always been.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You don't sound very happy about it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Happy? No, I am not happy. Zeymahi lost ont du'ul Bormahu. Alduin was once the crown of our father Akatosh's creation. You did what was necessary. Alduin had flown far from the path of right action in his pahlok -- the arrogance of his power.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have no regrets. Alduin had to be destroyed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course. Alduin wahlaan daanii. I would not have helped you if I thought otherwise. You did what was necessary. Alduin had flown far from the path of right action in his pahlok -- the arrogance of his power.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Alduin brought this on himself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Indeed. Alduin wahlaan daanii. His doom was written when he claimed for himself the lordship that properly belongs to Bormahu -- our father Akatosh. But I cannot celebrate his fall. Zu'u tiiraaz ahst ok mah. He was my brother once. This world will never be the same.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I was just fulfilling my destiny as Dragonborn.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Indeed, you saw more clearly than I -- certainly more clearly than Alduin. Rok funta koraav. Perhaps you now have some insight into the forces that shape the vennesetiid...the currents of Time. Perhaps you begin to see the world as a dovah.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The world is a better place without Alduin.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am glad you believe that. At least it will continue to exist. Grik los lein. Even I cannot see past Time's ending to what comes next. Niid koraav zeim dinoksetiid. We must do the best we can with this world.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Perhaps. At least it will continue to exist. Grik los lein. And, as you told me once, the next world will have to take care of itself. Ful nii los. Even I cannot see past Time's ending. But I forget myself. Krosis. So los mid ahdon. Melancholy is an easy trap for a dovah to fall into. You have won a mighty victory. Sahrot krongrah -- one that will echo through all the ages of this world for those who have eyes to see. Savor your triumph, Dovahkiin. This is not the last of what you will write upon the currents of Time. Goraan! I feel younger than I have in many an age.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He goes to fly with his brethren.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Many of the dovahhe are now scattered across Keizaal. Without Alduin's lordship, they may yet bow to the vahzen...rightness of my Thu'um. But willing or no, they will hear it! Fare thee well, Dovahkiin!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Paarthy flies off with the others. Meanwhile, Odahviing lands nearby.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Pruzah wundunne wah Wuth Gein. I wish the old one luck in his... quest. But I doubt many will wish to exchange Alduin's lordship for the tyranny of Paarthurnax's "Way of the Voice". As for myself, you've proven your mastery twice over. Thuri, Dovahkiin. I gladly acknowledge the power of your Thu'um. Zu'u Odahviing. Call me when you have need, and I will come if I can.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This effectively ends the main quest. One can visit some old friends to bring news of what happened, though. If one finds the Blades:
label: ACTION

dialogue: Please...Delphine has been very worried about you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We heard the news from Whiterun -- that you left the city on the back of a dragon! That's a little...showy, even for you. Since you're still alive, I assume you have good news to report?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, I used Alduin's portal to travel to Sovngarde. He's dead.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Gods above...that's better news than I had hoped! When you walked into my inn that day, I never imagined where it would all lead... dragons out of legend...Sovngarde...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If one visits Arngeir, and Paarthurnax wasn't killed to piss him off:
label: ACTION

dialogue: I can see it in your eyes -- you've seen the land of the gods and returned. Does this mean...it is done? Is Alduin truly defeated?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. I went to Sovngarde and killed Alduin there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: At last. It is over. Perhaps it was all worth it, in the end.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As dead as I can make him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then it is done at last. Perhaps it was all worth it, in the end.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I hope so. But I don't know if Alduin can ever be completely destroyed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Perhaps, perhaps not. Dragons are not like mortal creatures, and Alduin is unique even among dragonkind. He may be permitted to return at the end of time to fulfill his destiny as the World-Eater. But that is for the gods to decide. You have done your part. You've shown yourself mighty, both in Voice and deed. In order to defeat Alduin, you've gained mastery of dreadful weapons. Now it is up to you to decide what to do with your power and skill. Will you be a hero whose name is remembered in song throughout the ages? Or will your name be a curse to future generations? Or will your memory fade from history, unremembered? Let the Way of the Voice be your guide, and the path of wisdom will be clear to you. Breath and focus, Dragonborn. Your future lies before you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player, having heard Nords hate magic, goes to the only place in Skyrim entrance onto a thin bridge, the only route to the learning center.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Cross the bridge at your own peril! The way is dangerous, and the gate will not open. You shall not gain entry!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is this place?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, forgive me. Most who arrive here do so because they have heard of the College beforehand. This is the College of Winterhold, a safe haven for mages in Skyrim. A place of wisdom and arcane knowledge.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why are you out here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am here to assist those seeking the wisdom of the College. And if, in the process, my presence helps to deter those who might seek to do harm, so be it. The more important question is: why are you here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: May I enter the College?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Perhaps. But what is it you expect to find within?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I want to use the power of fire and ice to destroy any who oppose me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I see. That power certainly exists, I assure you. Wield it faithfully, and few can withstand you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I desire to bend the will of those around me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, the school of Illusion can be quite influential. Kings have risen to power because of it, and empires have been razed with it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I want to unravel the mysteries of Aetherius.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, the immortal plane. It is said to be the source of all magic. This is a noble goal, indeed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I just wanted to see what it looks like inside.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ha! Humor is often in short supply here. But I sense that perhaps you're after more than just that. It would seem that the College has what you seek. The question now is what can you offer for the College. Not just anyone is allowed inside. Those wishing to enter must show some degree of skill with magic. A small test, if you will.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If the player completes the test:
label: ACTION

dialogue: Well done, indeed. I think you'll be a superb addition to the College. Welcome, Apprentice.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player completes the test or sweet-talks Faralda.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I'll lead you across the bridge. Once inside you'll want to speak with Mirabelle Ervine, our Master Wizard. Please, follow me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One can inquire further.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Where do I need to go again?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'll need to speak with Mirabelle Ervine. Her quarters are in the Hall of Countenance, but she could be anywhere on the grounds.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who is Mirabelle Ervine?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She's the Master-Wizard here. Arch-Mage Eren may be in charge, but Mirabelle runs the place. You'd do well to remember that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'd like to know more about the College.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We are the only group left in Skyrim dedicated to study of the arcane. There are those who study, to be sure, but they do so in private, and often in secret.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is there any advice you can give about Destruction spells?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Certainly. Destruction spells come in different forms, each useful for various purposes. Concentration spells can be cast immediately, though they're weaker. Good for a tight spot, and less costly if you miss. You'll also need to decide whether to devote yourself to a single type of spell. Focusing solely on flame spells will make them more powerful, but you may find yourself at a disadvantage against foes immune to fire.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The destruction teacher leads one into the College grounds. Mirabelle Ervine is talking with a Thalmor agent near the door.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I believe I've made myself rather clear.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, of course. I'm simply trying to understand the reasoning behind the decision.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You may be used to the Empire bowing to your every whim, but I'm afraid you'll find the Thalmor receive no such treatment here. You are a guest of the College, here at the pleasure of the Arch-Mage. I hope you appreciate the opportunity.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, of course. The Arch-Mage has my thanks.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Very good. Then we're done here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player walks over.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Welcome to the College.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I was told to come see you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Another new student...I'm surprised at how many of you there are lately. Well, first you'll need these. While you're not required to wear them, you may find them more to your liking than your current clothes. I'll give you a brief tour, and then we'll get you to your first class. Are you ready to begin?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'd love to have a look around.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wonderful. Please follow me, and don't wander off.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sorry, I'm not ready for that just yet.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I see. Well, please let me know when you are.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player takes the grand tour.
label: ACTION

dialogue: The College of Winterhold has been a fixture in Skyrim for thousands of years. The prominent feature here is the Hall of the Elements. It's our primary location for lectures, practice sessions, and general meetings. The Arcanaeum is located above the hall, and the Arch-Mage's quarters above that. While technically in charge of the College, the Arch-Mage's responsibilities often keep him occupied. Thus, I run the day-to-day operations. Now, if you'll please follow me, I'll show you to the living quarters. Unfortunately, we've had to implement more stringent entry procedures, due to some problems with the local Nords. We don't anticipate any real violence, but it never hurts to be prepared. Our newest members are housed here at the Hall of Attainment. I'll ask that you please keep your voice down while inside, as others may be working on research or...delicate experiments. Now, I'll show you to your quarters. You're going to be sharing space with your fellow Apprentices, who you'll meet shortly. This is where you'll be staying. This bed and desk are yours. Please try and be considerate of others. Now, let's go back to the Hall of the Elements, where most of the members gather for lectures and study sessions. Initially, you'll be learning from Tolfdir, one of our most esteemed Wizards. Tolfdir is likely already addressing the new Apprentices. Go on in, and if you have any problems, let one of our senior members know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player can inquire further about things.
label: ACTION

dialogue: What's expected of me here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There are no expectations. The College is a place to study and practice magic freely. Hopefully any discoveries made in your pursuits will be shared with members of the College first. That way we all benefit.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Where can I learn new spells?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, that depends on what you're looking for. Faralda can teach Destruction spells, and offers training in that school. Phinis is one of the best Conjurers in all Skyrim, and can help with spells from that school. Don't let Tolfdir fool you; he's the pre-eminent scholar in Alteration. One of the best in Tamriel, and always willing to pass on his knowledge. If you can find him and focus his attention, there's a great deal Drevis can teach you about Illusion magic. And finally, there's Colette. She may be...difficult to get along with, but she's very knowledgeable when it comes to Restoration magic.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player enters the Hall of the Elements and finds Tolfdir with the other rookies: Onmund, J'zargo, and Brelyna Maryon.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Welcome, welcome! We were just beginning. Please, stay and listen. So, as I was saying, the first thing to understand is that magic is, by its very nature, volatile and dangerous. Unless you can control it, it can and will destroy you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sir, I think we all understand that fairly well. We wouldn't be here if we couldn't control magic!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course, my dear. Of course. You all possess some inherent magical ability. That much is not being questioned. What I'm talking about is true control, mastery of magic. It takes years, if not decades, of practice and study.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then what are we waiting for? Let's get started!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Please, please! This is exactly what I'm talking about. Eagerness must be tempered with caution, or else disaster is inevitable.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But we've only just arrived here -- you've no idea what any of us are capable of. Why not give us a chance to show you what we can do?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've been quiet so far. What do you think we should do?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not really sure what to think.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not going to weigh in either way? I admire your restraint, but there are times when you must make decisions, even without all the facts. Rely on instinct. Onmund: We're all pretty new at this, right? Let's just give it a chance. What's the worst that could happen?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think we should learn something practical.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is that so? Brelyna: See? He agrees with us too! Why don't you actually show us something?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Safety should be more important than anything.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, your classmates certainly seem to disagree with you. J'zargo: Oh, don't listen to him. We can do it, just give us a chance!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right, let's settle down. I suppose we can try something practical... In continuing with our theme of safety, we'll start with Wards. Wards are protective spells that block magic. I'll teach you all a ward, and we'll see if you can successfully use it to block spells, all right? Would you mind helping me with the demonstration? Are you at all familiar with ward spells?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't know any ward spells.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's all right. I can teach you a very basic ward, one that's enough for the purposes of this lesson.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have a ward spell, but I've never really used it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's what this lesson is for. Perfect time to try it out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I already know it, and already know how to use it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, then this should be no problem at all for you. Now, if you'll just stand right over there, I'll cast a spell at you, and you block it with the ward. Here we go. Over there, please. Just opposite me. Wouldn't want anyone else in the way. Now, cast the ward spell, and keep it up. You'll have to keep your ward up, or else this won't work. I don't want to hurt you. Hold still...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player blocks the fireball.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Excellent work! Well, I think this is an excellent start. I'd like you all to continue practicing with wards, please. I think perhaps we're ready to begin exploring some of the various applications of magic throughout history. The College has undertaken a fascinating excavation in the ruins of Saarthal nearby. It's an excellent learning opportunity. I suggest we meet there in a few hours, and see what awaits us inside. That's all for now, thank you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player travels to Saarthan in the west Winterhold mountains. The rest of the Apprentices are waiting with Tolfdir.
label: ACTION

dialogue: And here we all are. Shall we step inside?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm ready. Let's go.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right, please stay close to me while we're inside. It should be safe, but it's always better to be cautious.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's so important about this place?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We're particularly interested in the prevalence of magical seals placed on the tombs here. It's rather unlike anything we've encountered.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What are we looking for?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Anything! Anything at all that might be of interest. That's why I adore this location...we have no idea what we're going to find. And if, along the way, my message about the dangers of magic should happen to sink in for a few students, that would be a happy coincidence.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not quite ready to go inside yet.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No? I daresay we don't have all day.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sorry, I'm still not ready to go in there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Still? If I have to wait much longer, you may need to just bury me here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The students enter the barrow excavation site.
label: ACTION

dialogue: As some of you may know, Saarthal was one of the earliest Nord settlements in Skyrim. It was also the largest. Sacked by the Elves in the infamous "Night of Tears," not much is known about what happened to Saarthal. This is an exciting opportunity for us. To be able to study such an early civilization, and the magics they used... Well, are there any questions before we begin?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't have any more questions. What would you like me to do?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, yes. Hmm. Well, why don't you see if you can assist Arniel Gane? He's one of our scholars, here working on cataloging our finds. I expect he'd appreciate some help in locating any additional magical artifacts here in the ruins. Any enchanted items will do; the usefulness of the enchantment is irrelevant. If you find anything, the class can look it over.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now what?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, are there any questions before we begin? Now, let's see. What shall we have the rest of you do? Brelyna, my dear. Why don't you search for warding magics? Anything designed to keep people out. Don't interact with them, just identify them. All right, everyone. Onmund, please search that area over there. See if you notice any...residual energies. Alive or undead. J'zargo...what shall we have you do... Ah! Why don't you verify that we're the first ones here? Look for any amount of tampering with the tombs. All right, everyone. Let's be careful, but have fun! Let's be careful, but have fun!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The others may comment on their journey so far.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I'm not seeing any signs of warding magics at all. Either they're not here, or they were removed long ago.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: To think, my ancestors destroyed the homes of Onmund's ancestors. So much bloodshed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: J'zargo finds nothing but dust in these ruins.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do you think there's treasure here? Something to make J'zargo a powerful wizard?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Can you imagine what it was like, living here so long ago? The first men in Tamriel, here...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I wonder if everyone else would be so happy to rifle through the bones of their ancestors.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Please be careful here. The site isn't entirely secured.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player finds Arniel Gane far below, hunched over a desk.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Don't touch anything!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tolfdir told me to help you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What? Ah, yes. You. I remember you. You're going to help? That's fine. Just... Just don't make a mess of my work. I've only looked through a portion of this section. You, uh, you can look around in the chambers just north of here. Try and be careful, all right? We don't want to damage anything.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What did you need me to do?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just round up the rest of the magical artifacts so that I can catalog them.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player goes into the nearby tombs, picking up enchanted accessories that drops a gate, trapping one inside.
label: ACTION

dialogue: What in the world was that racket? Is everything all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm trapped in here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How in the world did that happen?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I pulled an amulet off the wall.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Really? Perhaps the amulet is important somehow. Is there some way you can use it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player puts it on. A strange red aura leaks from the amulet's niche.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Do you see that? Some kind of resonance...you and the wall. It must be connected to the amulet! I wonder...what effect might your spells have?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hitting the niche with a spell breaks the wall and lowers the trap.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Did you see that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well would you look at that! This appears to lead somewhere. Let's see where it goes. Well, this is highly unusual. And very interesting. Why in the world would this be sealed off? What is this place? I'm not sure what to expect here. Please be on your guard.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They traverse the secret tunnel. As Tolfdir is giving his cautious speech, a for the duration.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Know that you have set in motion a chain of events that cannot be stopped. Judgment has not been passed, as you had no way of knowing. Judgment will be passed on your actions to come, and how you deal with the dangers ahead of you. This warning is passed to you because the Psijic Order believes in you. You, mage, and you alone, have the potential to prevent disaster. Take great care, and know that the Order is watching.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The mage disappears, and the flow of time resumes properly.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I...I swear I felt something rather strange just then. What just happened?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Some sort of ghost or apparition appeared. It spoke to me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm afraid I didn't see anything... Can you tell me more about what you just saw?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It said something about danger ahead, and the Psijic Order.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Psijic Order? Are you quite sure about that? That's very odd. And danger ahead? Why that doesn't make any sense at all. The Psijics have no connection to these ruins. And no one's seen any of their order in a long time. Perhaps we should take a look inside these coffins... Now please do be careful. Who knows what we're going to find.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player can inquire further:
label: ACTION

dialogue: What's the Psijic Order?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They were a group of mages with a history that pre-dates the Empire. Very powerful, very secretive. No one's seen them in well over a hundred years. They vanished, along with their sanctuary on the Isle of Artaeum. I have no idea what connection they'd have to this place.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why is the Psijic Order contacting me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have no idea, but it's fascinating. Assuming it's true, of course. The Isle of Artaeum disappeared over a hundred years ago, and no one has seen them since. And yet now, suddenly, they have chosen to contact you? Why, it's intriguing! If nothing else, I'd take it as a compliment. The Psijics have only ever dealt with those they feel worthy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The two go to inspect the coffins, just as draugr escape. They're re-killed. The situation repeats in the next, larger chamber.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I've never seen anything like this in Nordic ruins before. Why, just look at all these coffins! This bears closer inspection. I'd like to stay a while and examine this. You, however, should press on. See if you can find whatever this vision of yours mentioned. But if it is truly dangerous, be careful. Go on ahead. I'll be sure and catch up with you before long.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As promised, he eventually reunites with the player.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Hold on, my boy. Hold on! I thought it high time I caught up with you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They reach a deep room with an undead guardian and a massive, magical sphere of unknown make.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Well now...would you look at that. I never imagined we'd find something like this. Why is this buried so far within Saarthal?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The boss attacks, but attacks aren't doing anything.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Nothing seems to work! Keep it busy. I'll try to drain some of its power.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Qiilaan us dilon!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They kill the draugr, then marvel at the free-floating contraption.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I'm not the only one seeing this, am I? Why, this is utterly unique.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is this thing?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have no idea! This is amazing. Absolutely amazing. The Arch-Mage needs to be informed immediately. He needs to see this for himself. I don't dare leave this unattended. Can you return to the College and inform Savos Aren of this discovery? Please, hurry.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player can inquire further.
label: ACTION

dialogue: What should I tell the Arch-Mage?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let him know that we've unearthed something... Well, I'm not sure. Something unique, let's say. It's clearly magical in nature, but like nothing I've ever seen before. He should be most interested.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Will you be all right by yourself?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, I think I'll be fine. We seem to have eliminated the most pressing threat. It certainly seems that whoever placed this here intended for it to be well guarded. I wonder why...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: At Tolfdir's behest, one returns to the College to report.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You are relatively new here, are you not? I have noticed you, but we have not spoken.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, we haven't.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then allow me to introduce myself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, sir.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: "Sir"? How quaint. I am Savos Aren, Arch-Mage of the College of Winterhold. I am quite content to see nearly any aspect of magic explored and investigated here. But I do not and will not approve of any research or experiments that cause purposeful harm to your fellow members of the College. Are we clear?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I need to speak to you about Saarthal.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Please don't tell me that another one of the apprentices has been incinerated. I have enough to deal with right now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We found some sort of...orb. Tolfdir wanted you to see it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I...see. I trust that Tolfdir will provide a more...specific explanation.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We've found something in Saarthal, and Tolfdir thinks it's important.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Very well, I trust you wouldn't be here were it not significant. Thank you for bringing this to my attention. Tolfdir normally looks after your little group, yes? Since he's apparently occupied, and I will need to see this discovery for myself, I think perhaps you should begin researching the subject. Speak with Urag in the Arcanaeum. See if he is aware of anything that matches your discovery. And...good work. The next time you find yourself exploring Nordic ruins, perhaps this will be helpful.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player can inquire further about new subjects:
label: ACTION

dialogue: Dangerous research must be a problem here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not often, no. Some risks must be taken, to be sure. I am simply trying to avoid untimely deaths. We also must make an effort to avoid worsening what Skyrim thinks of us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's the purpose of the College?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Purpose? I should think it's self-evident. Magic is a true power, not something to be shunned by commoners or treated as an amusing diversion by politicians. It shapes worlds, creates and destroys life... It deserves proper respect and study. The College is a place where we can focus on that, without the pressures of the world weighing down on us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'd like to know more about the College's history.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've seen documents dating back to the late Second Era. Beyond that, it's hard to say. Events in the last several hundred years resulted in a significant loss of our history, I'm afraid.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What happened in the last few hundred years?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Great Collapse, as it has come to be known. An unfortunate natural disaster that ravaged the area. The College fared far better than the city of Winterhold, but it was not left untouched.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What caused the Great Collapse?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No one is sure of the cause. Some believed the eruption of Red Mountain had far-reaching consequences that were only felt years later. I know there are some who have blamed the College, said that we were responsible. I assure you this is not the case.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me more about the Great Collapse.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Sea of Ghosts practically came alive. No one was expecting it. Monstrous waves battered the shore for weeks on end. Winterhold was ancient and weathered, but it couldn't withstand the sea's fury. Entire districts of the city were lost overnight. The waves receded in time, but the damage was irreversible. Most residents of Winterhold abandoned what was left of the city. The College survived, and so here we remain.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Have you ever met with the Psijic Order?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Personally? No, not I. One of their number used to advise the Arch-Mage when I was but an Apprentice here. But that was a great many years ago, before all the members of the order were called back to the Isle of Artaeum, and it disappeared entirely.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Upon leaving the Arch-Mage's quarters, Faralda approaches.
label: ACTION

dialogue: There you are. I've been trying to find you. I just wanted to let you know Ancano's been asking about you. I think he's looking for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why would Ancano be looking for me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not sure. Just... Well, mind what you tell him, all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is there a problem?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, no. Well, I don't think so. Between the two of us, there are rumors about him. That this "advisor" position he has is a sham, an excuse.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What does it matter what I say to him?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Between the two of us, there are rumors about him. That this "advisor" position he has is a sham, an excuse. That what he's really doing is spying for the Thalmor, trying to feed them information. Whether it's true, I can't say. But it never hurts to be a little suspicious, does it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thanks for the warning.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're welcome.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll say what I like to him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course. That's your choice. I just wanted to let you know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player finds Urag gro-Shub, the orc librarian, in the Artaeum.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You are now in the Arcanaeum, of which I am in charge. It might as well be my own little plane of Oblivion. Disrupt my Arcanaeum, and I will have you torn apart by angry Atronachs. Now, do you require assistance?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I need to learn about something we found in Saarthal.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know what you want. Word travels fast around here. Discovered some big mystery, huh? Well you don't even need to ask. No, I don't have anything for you. Not anymore, anyway.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You don't have anything that can help?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I said not anymore. Orthorn stole a number of books when he ran off to Fellglow Keep to join those Summoners. Some kind of peace offering. I think one of his volumes may have had some relevant information. If you want them, you'll have to talk to Orthorn.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player can ask about pertinent info.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Doesn't anyone care that Orthorn stole things from the College?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not enough to bother with it. Arch-Mage Aren's approach to these things is to just let them sort themselves out. Although now it looks like you'll be doing the sorting. Good luck with that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who is Orthorn?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He was an Apprentice here at the College. Not very skilled, but got involved with a group of mages who took a liking to him. When they left, he took off after them. Stole supplies and books from the College, I suppose as a way to ingratiate himself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why are these mages in Fellglow Keep?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's just call it a "difference of opinion" with the College. They were interested in research that goes outside the bounds of what the College allows, so they were...persuaded to leave.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: On the way out, the player is pulled aside by Ancano.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You there. I have questions for you. You were in Saarthal, yes? It has come to my attention that something was found there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Maybe...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know full well that you have. Please do not insult my intelligence. Tolfdir is still there now, is he? I shall expect a full report when he returns.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, we did. I just informed the Arch-Mage.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am well aware. Tolfdir is still in Saarthal, is he? I shall be expecting a full report from him when he returns.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How do you know anything about this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It is my job to know these things. My role as advisor to the Arch-Mage is aided by knowing everything that transpires here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why does this matter to you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Something was discovered in Saarthal that was significant enough that Tolfdir sent a new member of the College, alone, to deliver word. That sounds precisely like the sort of thing that should matter to everyone. Especially me. Thank you for your help. You may go now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player can grill Ancano a little more afterwards.
label: ACTION

dialogue: There's a rumor that you're spying for the Thalmor.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What? Preposterous, and just the sort of thing I would expect from mages who have nothing better to do with their time. I have made it quite clear that my only here is as advisor to the Arch-Mage. I would suggest that you not further spread this rumor.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is it you do here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am an advisor to the Arch-Mage. The Thalmor wish to promote relations with your College. I am at the Arch-Mage's disposal if he requires advice.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Does the Arch-Mage often ask for advice?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Perhaps not as often as he should. In time, I believe he will be more trusting.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'd like to know more about the Thalmor.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now that stability has been established between the Dominion and the Empire, we seek only to help Skyrim. To guide its people through this time of transition, to help lead them to a better future.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player journeys to Fellglow Keep near Whiterun, slaughtering hostile mages within. Eventually, one finds Orthorn imprisoned within.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Please! Help me! Don't leave me here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, you're Orthorn?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, yes! Did Arch-Mage Aren send you? He sent you to rescue me, didn't he?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm just here for the books you took from the College.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What? The bo... Oh. Oh dear. I shouldn't have taken them, I know! It was stupid. I was stupid. It won't happen again. Help me get out of here, and I'll help you find them. Please!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm here to rescue you and recover the books you stole.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: See? I knew Aren wouldn't leave me in here! Hurry and get me out of this cage before they come for me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player can inquire further.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Where are the books you stole?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't have them anymore. She took them... The Caller. She's the one who put me in here! Please, let me out of here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why are you in this cage?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They threw me in here until they were ready to use me in one of their experiments. This wasn't supposed to happen. I thought they wanted my help, not to use me as a test subject!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is there a key for this cage?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, it's the levers in the center there. Just make sure you don't pull the wrong one. Please, hurry. I don't like being in here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Orthorn gets released, finally.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Thank you, thank you! I promise I'll help. And then I'll go back to the College and I'll beg them to let me back in.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't want your help.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah. I see. Well, then I'll just stay behind you a little bit, and follow along quietly.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now where are the books?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, of course. I said I'd tell you, didn't I? The Caller will have them. She was most interested in one of the volumes. Although not interested enough to keep me from being locked up.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, you saved me! Thank you so much. Who knows what they'd have done if you hadn't come along. I promise I'll help you get out of here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You should get yourself to safety.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't you need my help?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can handle this on my own.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, I... If you're sure... I'll just be on my way then. Please do be careful, and thank you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This will be easier without you getting in my way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, I was only trying to help. Fine, I'll just save myself then. Thank you for letting me out of that cage.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you don't get away from me right now, I may kill you myself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I was only trying to help you, you know! I hope the Caller turns you inside out!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're right. I could use some help.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I shall do my best.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One eventually reaches the boss' chamber.
label: ACTION

dialogue: So, you're the one who barged into my home and laid waste to my projects. How nice to meet you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who are you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Names no longer matter. You may refer to me as The Caller. Now, do you have a reason for making such a mess?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm here for the books from the College.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So you're just one of Aren's lackeys? That's disappointing. You show real promise. You come here, kill my assistants, disrupt my work... You've annoyed me, so I don't think I'll be giving you anything.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: May I please have the books?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, now we're all please and thank you, are we? I'm afraid we're well beyond pleasantries. I'll allow you the opportunity to turn around, walk out that door, and never come back. I suggest you move quickly.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Perhaps we can come to an arrangement.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm afraid you don't have anything worth trading. Now, you can go back to your College and leave me be, or I can kill you. Your choice.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: An arrangement? After you've destroyed so much? Fine. Leave me the elf. You may go with your books.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not going anywhere without those books.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Are you attempting to threaten me? After I've been so hospitable? Well, then you won't be leaving here at all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let me leave with the books, and there won't be any more trouble.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fine. Take them and be gone. Never return here, or else you'll face my full wrath.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Are you attempting to threaten me? After I've been so hospitable? Well, then you won't be leaving here at all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If Orthorn is with and the player strikes a bargain with The Caller:
label: ACTION

dialogue: I, uhh... Wait, what?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He gets the books, I get you. It's very simple.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But why?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This little adventure of yours has cost me a number of test subjects. I need more, and you'll do nicely.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You wouldn't do that, would you? You wouldn't leave me here with her!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm waiting. Well, what's it going to be?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's a deal. You can have Orthorn.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fine. Take your books and leave at once. If you ever come back, I won't be so gracious.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How could you just leave me here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player reclaims the stolen books, one way or another. If Orthorn wasn't cruelly traded away:
label: ACTION

dialogue: Well, everything worked out nicely, didn't it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've got what I came for.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, you certainly do. You'll be going back to the College, then? I, uhh...I think perhaps I'll wait a bit before venturing there myself. Let this whole thing blow over, you know. Give certain parties a chance to forget what I may have done. Still, you've gotten me out of that cage, and I won't forget it. Thank you again, and good luck to you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Eventually, the player returns to the Arcanaeum.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Here are the books that went missing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, well. And you seem to be in one piece! Thank you. I'll look these over, and inform Mirabelle if I find anything relevant. "Night of Tears," eh? I remember this one. Well, isn't that interesting. Did you read it yourself? If I recall correctly, that has some interesting implications. You should mention that to Tolfdir. And...here. I suppose you've earned these.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tolfdir can be found in the Hall of the Elements, inspecting the strange orb that's been transported from Saarthal.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Urag suggested I come see you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Did he now? Does he have information about our wonderful discovery?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I found a certain book, "Night of Tears"...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is that the one about something buried beneath Saarthal? Something that men and mer fought over? I'll have to make a point of re-reading it. I don't recall the details.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's a book he thinks you should read.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, yes. I'll be sure and stop by the Arcanaeum later. I just can't seem to tear myself away. Whatever it is, its beauty is like nothing I've ever seen before. If you'd allow me to indulge myself for a moment, I thought I might make a few observations...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He leads the player to inspect the orb.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I'm sure you've already noticed the markings. They're quite unlike anything we've seen before. Ayleid, Dwemer, Daedric... Not even Falmer. None of them are a match. Quite curious indeed. Now, I'm not sure you're quite as attuned as I am, given my extensive years of experience, but can you feel that? This marvelous object. It practically radiates magicka, and yet it's unlike anything I've felt before. Arch-Mage Aren is already hard at work, and hopefully we'll have more information soon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ancano approaches.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I'm afraid I must intrude. It is urgent that I speak with your associate immediately.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This is most inappropriate! We are involved in serious research here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, I've no doubt of its gravity. This, however, is a matter that cannot wait.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, I'm quite sure I've never been interrupted like this before... the audacity!... I suppose we'll continue this at some later time, when we can avoid interruptions.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tolfdir leaves the two alone.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I need you to come with me immediately. Let's go.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't understand what's going on.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Really? Well, allow me to clarify the situation. I'd like to know why there's someone claiming to be from the Psijic Order here at the College. More importantly, I'd like to know why he's asking for you specifically. So we're going to go have a little chat with him, and find out exactly what it is he wants.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why are you so concerned about this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll be the one asking the questions. All you need to know is that the Psijic Order is a rogue organization, believing themselves to be above the law. They have clashed with the Aldmeri Dominion before, and I have no intention of allowing that to happen here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Aren't you just an advisor here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Technically, that is true. But I still report to the Aldmeri Dominion, and I cannot ignore this situation. Don't worry, you can return to your petty squabbles and meaningless "research" as soon as this matter is resolved. Now, you are going to speak to this...Monk...and find out why he is here, and then he will be removed from College grounds.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ancano leads the player to the Arch-Mage's quarters, where him, Aren and the others' prying.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Please do not be alarmed. I mean you no harm. It is good to meet you in person.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's going on? What happened to everyone?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'd simply like to talk to you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do you want with me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I merely wish to talk to you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What did you do?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: --- I've given us a chance to speak privately, but I'm afraid I can't do this for long. We must be brief. The situation here at your College is of dire importance, and attempts to contact you as we have previously have failed. I believe it is due to the very source of our concern. This object...the Eye of Magnus as your people have taken to calling it. The energy coming from it has prevented us from reaching you with the visions you have already seen. The longer it remains here, the more dangerous the situation becomes. And so I have come here personally to tell you it must be dealt with.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If this is dangerous, then why don't you do something about it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm afraid it's not that simple.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What does this have to do with me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You set this chain of events in motion at Saarthal. You must understand, the Psijic Order does not typically...intervene directly in events. My presence here will be seen as an affront to some within the Order, and as soon as we have finished, I will be leaving your College. I'm all too aware that my presence has aroused suspicion, especially in Ancano, you Thalmor associate. Nevertheless, my Order will not act directly. You must take it upon yourself to do so.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So what exactly is the problem?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As you may have learned, this object...The Eye...is immensely powerful. The world is not ready for it. If it remains here, it will be misused. Indeed, many in the Order believe it has already... Rather, something will happen soon, something that cannot be avoided.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do you expect from me, then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We believe that your efforts should be directed toward dealing with the aftermath, but we cannot predict what that will be.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll help, but I don't know what to do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Unfortunately, the future is as obscured to us as it is to you. The overwhelming power of the Eye makes it difficult for us to see. I fear I have already overstepped the bounds of my Order, but I will offer this: seek out the Augur of Dunlain here in your College. His perception may be more coherent than ours.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who is the Augur of Dunlain?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He was once a student here at the College. Now he is...something different.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Where can I find this Augur?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I...I am unsure. He is somewhere within the College. Surely one of your colleagues must know his location. I am sorry I cannot provide you with further help, but this conversation requires a great deal of effort on my part. Now, I am afraid I must leave you. We will continue to watch over you, and guide you as best we can. It is within you to succeed. Never forget that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why should I trust you or your Order?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I presume you refer to Ancano's distaste for the Psijic Order? The Thalmor see our Order as a threat because we have power, and we will not allow them to control us. I assure you that we mean you no harm.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The conversation done, Quaranir removes the time-stopping effect.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I'm sorry, were you about to say something?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well? What is the meaning of this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm sorry, I'm afraid I don't understand.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't play coy. You asked to see a specific member of the College. Here he is. Now what is it you want?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's been a misunderstanding. Clearly I should not be here. I shall simply take my leave.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What? What trickery is this? You're not going anywhere until I find out what you're up to!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am not "up to" anything. I apologize if I have offended you in any way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We will see about this...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ancano escorts the monk out of the College. The player talks to Aren.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I'm...I'm not sure what happened. A monk from the Psijic Order, here, after all these years, and then he just leaves. I hope we didn't offend him somehow.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Have you ever heard of the Augur of Dunlain?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Has Tolfdir been telling stories again? I thought I made it quite clear that this was a subject inappropriate for conversation. Please don't allow him to continue to discuss the subject.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tolfdir is next asked.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Have you ever heard of the Augur of Dunlain?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well now, there's a name I haven't heard in some time. My goodness, it's been years since I've spoken with him. I suppose he's still down in the Midden, but I haven't checked. Are you going to see him? Do tell him "hello" for me, won't you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Where is the Midden?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Underneath the College. It's not the nicest place, so if you go down there, please be careful.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Can you tell me more about the Augur of Dunlain?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, I suppose he wouldn't mind... It was all before my time, you understand. I've heard the stories, the same as anyone else. He was a brilliant student, an accomplished wizard. Delved into magic in a way none had seen before. But, I think, he became too focused on just how much power he could acquire. That's what led to the accident.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player enters the Midden, the glacial tunnels beneath the College. If one didn't learn the Augur's whereabouts from anyone, a voice speaks:
label: ACTION

dialogue: There is no help for you here. There is no solace in knowing what is to come.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Deep inside is a locked door. A gravelly voice shouts from behind it.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Your perseverence will only lead to disappointment. Still you persist? Very well, you may enter.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Inside, one sees the Augur: not as a student, but as a giant, floating mass of pure energy.
label: ACTION

dialogue: So you're the Augur of Dunlain?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am that which you have been seeking. Your efforts are in vain. It has already begun. But those who have sent you have not told you what they seek. What you seek.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I was told to find you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Indeed. And so you have come looking, though you do not know why. Like others before you, you blindly follow a path to your own destruction. The Thalmor came seeking answers as well, unaware they will be his undoing. Your path now follows his, though you will arrive too late.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And what is it I'm seeking?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You see that which all who wield magic seek. Knowledge. You shall find this: Knowledge will corrupt. It will destroy. It will consume. You seek meaning, shelter in Knowledge. You will not find it. The Thalmor sought the same thing, and it shall lead to his end as it has so many others.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thalmor? What Thalmor?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The one who calls himself Ancano. He seeks information about the Eye, but what he will find shall be quite different. His path will cross yours in time, but first you must find that which you need.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not the first to come see you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, though you may be the last. The one who calls himself Ancano has sought my knowledge as well, through very different questions. Your path differs from most. You are being guided, pushed toward something. It is a good path, one untravelled by many. It is a path that can save your College. I will tell you what you need to know to follow it further.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do I need?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You, and those aiding you, wish to know more about the Eye of Magnus. You wish to avoid the disaster of which you are not yet aware. To see through Magnus' Eye without being blinded, you require his staff. Events now spiral quickly towards the inevitable center, so you must act with haste. Take this knowledge to your Arch-Mage.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player returns to Savos Aren.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I have important information for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Really? And what might that be?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We need to find the Staff of Magnus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm sorry, what? Well...I'd certainly love to have such a powerful staff, but I'm not really sure that any of us need it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's connected to the orb we found.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And how do you know of this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I spoke with the Augur of Dunlain.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Did you really? And he specifically mentioned the Staff of Magnus? I... I'm impressed with your initiative. Of course, someone will need to follow up on this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What should I do next?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A most impressive attitude. Keep this up, and you'll do quite well for yourself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You mean me, don't you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I certainly do. Since you went so far as to seek out the Augur for advice, I thought you'd be more enthusiastic. Something as specific and ancient as the Staff of Magnus...I'm not sure we'd ever find something like that... I seem to recall Mirabelle mentioning the staff somewhat recently. Why don't you see if she can tell you anything? I'm quite pleased with your progress, you know. You've certainly proven yourself to be more than a mere Apprentice. Well done. This circlet once proved invaluable to me. I hope it can be of use to you know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player tracks down Mirabelle Ervine.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Do you know anything about the Staff of Magnus?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well now that's an odd question. Why in the world would you be asking?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Arch-Mage Aren said you'd mentioned it recently.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I see. Well yes, I suppose I did mention it, though I'm not sure what he expects me to tell you. I only brought it to his attention a few months back when the Synod showed up here looking for it. They were apparently under the impression we were keeping it in a closet somewhere.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It may be connected to the Eye of Magnus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The "Eye of Magnus"? I can appreciate that this...thing, this Orb... It's very impressive. Very unique, and definitely worth studying. But let's not jump to any conclusions, or assign it importance beyond what we're certain of.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Augur referred to it as the Eye of Magnus, not me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Augur? Just what have you gotten yourself involved in? Whatever is going on, whatever you're up to... Be very careful.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sorry. So, the Staff of Magnus?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, it's said to be very powerful. Has the capacity to store an incredible amount of magical power, as the story goes. But it's more myth than anything at this point. I've no doubt it actually exists, but no one has seen it in what, decades? Longer? I'm not sure. The only time I've heard it mentioned was when those Synod characters showed up some months ago looking for it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who are the Synod?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mages based out of Cyrodiil. They fancy themselves the Imperial Authority on magic these last few hundred years. My understanding is that all they really do is make noise in an attempt to curry favor from the Emperor. Lots of politics, little magic. I was quite surprised to find them on our doorstep. They seemed amiable enough, but their line of questioning made me...uneasy. It became clear they're trying to hoard powerful artifacts, looking to consolidate power.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So no one knows the Staff's location?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No one here does. The Synod seemed convinced it was somewhere here in Skyrim. They inquired about the ruins of Mzulft, but that's all I remember. It sounded like they were heading there, though they were rather secretive about why. I suppose if you're intent on looking for the staff, there's a chance they might be in Mzulft yet. Just don't expect them to be cooperative.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What else can you tell me about the Staff of Magnus?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not really sure. Made and used by Magnus himself, if you believe those sorts of things. I believe I've heard it said that it's the only thing that could adequately contain his power. The sort of embellishment wizards of ancient times loved to make.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player enters the Dwemer ruins of Mzulft, finding a dying Synod mage just inside.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Crystal...gone... Find...Paratus...in Oculory... Gah...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He dies. Later, they find a door with a voice behind it.
label: ACTION

dialogue: G...Gavros? Is that you? I'd almost given up hope. Let me get the door...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Synod mage Paratus Dicimius opens the door to find newcomers.
label: ACTION

dialogue: What the... What are you doing here? What've you done with Gavros?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your friend Gavros is dead.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It was the Falmer, wasn't it? Curse them! They've ruined everything! If Gavros is gone, there's no hope. He was supposed to return with the crystal... Without that, all our efforts are wasted. And you. If you're here for treasure, or wisdom, or anything, I'm afraid you've wasted your time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I came here looking for the Synod.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And just why would you be doing that? Oh, it doesn't matter now. Gavros is never coming back, and he was supposed to have the crystal. Without that, we're lost. It's all been for nothing. So congratulations, whoever you are, you've found the Synod. Just me, alone, surrounded by angry machines and angrier Falmer.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's this about a crystal?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It didn't work the first time. I tried to tell Gavros, but he wouldn't listen. "No, it won't be too cold" he said. Well, I was right, wasn't I? Focused completely wrong by the time we got here! The cold had warped it! Gavros had to cart it all the way back to Cyrodiil. Left the rest of us here to fend off the damnable Falmer.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's the crystal for?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It was a brilliant idea, really. Mostly mine, though Gavros took the credit. Secret, though. Official Synod business. Can't talk about it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If I find this crystal you're looking for. Will you help me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't know what sort of help you expect from me, but if you can actually find the crystal I'd certainly be grateful.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I happen to have found a focusing Crystal. Is this what you were looking for?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You found...how in the world... That's it. That's it! I don't know who you are, but you may have just saved this little project... In fact, who are you, anyway?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm with the College of Winterhold.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You are, are you? Savos wouldn't even grant us an audience when we came to you, but now you come here expecting something from me? I don't much like this, I'll tell you. But you saved my skin, so maybe I can overlook the past for now. Come on, I'll explain on the way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If one lacks the crystal, further inquiries can be made.
label: ACTION

dialogue: What are you doing here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am on official business of the Grand Council of the Synod. That's all you need to know. I might well ask the same of you, running around by yourself in this dangerous place.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm looking for the Staff of Magnus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Are you? Well. I'm afraid I can't help you with that. I need the crystal to do anything useful, and I don't have it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If one goes to get the crystal after 1st meeting, there's extra dialogue.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Please, tell me you have the crystal. I've no wish to die in this place.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I found your crystal.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ha! So you did. I was almost beginning to think Gavros had gone and gotten himself killed just to spite me. Well, with the Falmer skulking around I can't very well do this on my own. I guess you'll have to come with me. I'll explain on the way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Either way, Paratus leads one further inside.
label: ACTION

dialogue: No matter what Gavros said, this was my idea first. The Council is going to know that when I get back. I was the one who thought of using this...this Oculory. I don't know what the dwarves called it. Something unpronounceable, I'm sure. From all our research, it seems they were intent on discerning the nature of the divine. This machinery, all of it, was designed to collect starlight, and then... I'm not sure. Split it, somehow? It was my idea to replace one of the key elements with our focusing crystal. Months of enchantments went into it. Let's just hope they got it right this time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He leads them to a massive piece of dwarven machinery.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Here it is. Magnificent, isn't it? Took an incredible amount of work to get it running again. Now I'm hoping it'll all be worth it. Place the crystal in the central apparatus, and we can start the process for focusing it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The item is placed, causing the apparatus to flip upside-down.
label: ACTION

dialogue: What do I do?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now the crystal needs to be focused. It was created so far away, we knew that some adjustments would have to be made. Heating and cooling the crystal will cause it to expand or contract, which will change how the light passes through it. You'll need to use spells to do that. Being from the College, I assume you know them already. There should be a few basic tomes around here somewhere in case your training is even more substandard than I've heard.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player uses the suggested method to focus the starlight. When all beams a wall. Two bright spots appear on the map.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Years of work, finally going to pay off... ...but what's this? These results... They're not at all what they should be. This projection should be lit up like the night sky... Something is creating an incredible amount of interference. Something in Winterhold, it looks like. What are you playing at? Is this some attempt to stall my work?! So, what is it? What have you done? Did you know what we were attempting? Are you here to make sure your plan worked, that our efforts have been for nothing? Well, explain yourself!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'd better calm down.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You and your College have ruined years of my work, I've lost friends and colleagues to the Falmer, and you want me to calm down?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Did something go wrong?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Go wrong? Go wrong? Everything is wrong! Everything! Whatever you have at that College has completely interfered with our work here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't know what you're talking about.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You show up here just as our work nears completion, and now I can't get any results from this because of something at your College. Do you think me a fool? Do you think I'm too stupid to make the connection? You've ruined my work! How did you do it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I haven't done anything, I swear.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But it must be something you're doing. There's no other explanation...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I truly have no idea what you're talking about.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Either you're lying to me, or...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't understand why you're so upset.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just look! This should be lit up brighter than the night sky, and it's not! Clearly you've interfered somehow. Or... You have something at your College, don't you? Something immensely powerful. Beyond anything I'd anticipated. What is it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You mean the Eye of Magnus?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Eye of Magnus? Well, I suppose if that means what I think it does... Well, that's interesting...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We might have something, yes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, now. This I hadn't considered. If that's taken into account, these results make more sense.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not going to answer that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So you do have something, then. Whether this was intentional or not, it suggests some interesting results.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Can you help me find the Staff of Magnus or not?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, the staff. Interesting...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What are you talking about?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're looking for something, yes? The...Staff of Magnus. Well, even if you are trying to ruin my work, there's still something to be learned here. I can't explain the details. That would mean giving away many secrets the Synod have learned over the years. Also, I doubt you'd be able to comprehend the details. Have you seen the Orrery in the Imperial City? It was the inspiration for this idea. Instead of projecting the sky, we project all of Tamriel, and then harness the latent energies to overlay the positions of... What's important is that all of this work was designed to reveal to us sources of great magical power. Purely to help safeguard the Empire, of course. And yet, in the end, only two locations have been revealed to us. One is your College. The other... Well, that can only be Labyrinthian. So, mage from Winterhold, despite your intentions I've beaten your little game. Even if all you've said here is lies, I know you have something in Winterhold the Synod Council will be very interested in. So fine, trudge off to Labyrinthian in search of your Staff. I shall return to Cyrodiil and deliver my full report to the Council. This is not over, I assure you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So the Staff of Magnus is in Labyrinthian?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, yes. Probably. I mean, yes. Certainly it is, but that doesn't matter now, because I know you're hoarding something even more important at your College. The Council will be informed of this. They will find out what you're up to.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think you've been in here too long. You're crazy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Am I? Am I? I think I've discovered more here than I could've hoped to. Your trickery won't confuse me! I think we're done here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After backtracking all the way out of Mzulft, it's finally time to report to closer.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I don't know. It's like a ward, but who's casting it? Ancano? How?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't care what it is, I want it down now! I want to know what he's doing in there!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's going on?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ancano. He's in there, doing...something. We don't know what. We're trying to get in now. I will have his head for this, I assure you. Help take this down, will you? We're throwing everything we can at it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know where to find the Staff of Magnus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now's not the time. We need to put a stop to whatever it is that's going on.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: With a magical assault, they destroy the giant ward to reach the Hall proper.
label: ACTION

dialogue: What's going on?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ancano! Stop this at once! I command you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't go near him!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's a massive magical explosion. The player is knocked unconscious, and injured.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Are you all right? Can you walk? I need you on your feet. We're in trouble here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think I'm okay.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ancano is doing something with that thing...the Eye. We can't stop him! I haven't seen Savos since the explosion. He must've been blown clear, and he may have be injured. I need you to find the Arch-Mage, and I need you to do it quickly! Get moving!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What happened?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll be fine. I just need a minute to catch my breath. Find Savos...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player walks outside and finds the Arch-Mage's corpse, having been blown see what occured.
label: ACTION

dialogue: What's happened? He's not...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is he dead?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Everyone please, stand back! Please remain calm! Are you all right? What happened in there?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's Ancano. He's done something with the Eye!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: By the Nine... Is he responsible for this? The Arch-Mage, dead? There's more. Something's happened to Winterhold. It must be whatever Ancano did. You need to get out there and make sure it's safe. Quickly now, quickly! I'll find Mirabelle and see if we can't put a stop to this!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Arch-Mage aren is dead?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can hardly believe it. But there's no time. Whatever happened here has affected Winterhold as well. I need you to get out there and make sure everything's all right. I'll do what I can here. Go now, go!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As Tolfdir rushes inside, the player tries exiting. Faralda is nearby.
label: ACTION

dialogue: What's going on? What happened in there?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Something went wrong. Winterhold may be in danger. Can you help?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It "may be" in danger? Take a look. I don't think there's much question. Let's get down there. We have to do something. Come on, Arniel. Let's go. Arniel: Do we have to? They'd never lift a finger to help us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's no time. We have to make sure Winterhold is safe.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We'll go with you, but when this is all over I want an explanation.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The mages rush into town to protect the citizenry from strange wraith-like attackers. They defeat all ten of the curious creatures.
label: ACTION

dialogue: That looks like it was the last of them. We'll stay here. Get back to the College and let them know what's going on. Arniel, stay on your guard. We can't let harm come to these people.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: With that, it's back to the Hall of the Elements.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Well? Is everything out there all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Winterhold is safe for now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wish I could say the same for us. Tolfdir and I can try and keep this contained. You need to get your hands on the Staff of Magnus. Now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've got to stay here, to see if we can get to Ancano and stop this. I need someone I can trust to do it. Besides, you're the one having all of these visions, aren't you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You really think the Staff will help?
label: CHARACTER
