dialogue: You were told to find it, weren't you? If the stories about the staff are true, if it really can absorb a tremendous amount of power, maybe we can break through Ancano's magic.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then I'm off to Labyrinthian.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What? Are you... Are you sure? The staff is there? That can't be a coincidence.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What are you talking about?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Arch-Mage.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't understand. What coincidence?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Savos. Before...before he died. He... He gave me something just a little while ago. He told me it was from Labyrinthian, and that I would know what to do with it when the time came. I think...I think he meant this for you, then. I'm not sure why, but there was something very personal about it for him. Also, I think you should take this amulet. It belonged to Savos, but I think it would do you the most good now. Take it, and get out of here. Bring back that staff before Ancano brings the whole College down around us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player journeys to Labyrinthian, one of the largest barrows in the entire old students are having a conversation.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Come on, we're finally here! Let's not waste any more time!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Are we truly sure this is a good idea?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We'll be back at the College before anyone even knows we're gone.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You would care about that, since you're the Arch-Mage's favorite!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't forget, this whole idea was Atmah's to begin with.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's just get inside, see what's in there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player finally steps foot inside. The ghosts appear again.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I can't believe we're doing this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Can you imagine the looks on their faces when we come back?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You keep talking like you're sure we'll find something useful in here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Enchanted weapons, tomes of ancient knowledge, Shalidor's secrets themselves -- who knows what we could find!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And what if... What if there are things guarding this place?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Against six College-trained mages? I think we'll be fine.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In a large arena, a skeletal dragon and its undead helpers crawl out of the ghosts' conversation from years earlier.
label: ACTION

dialogue: We...we have to go back. We can't leave Girduin...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We barely made it out alive, and you want to go back in?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What was that thing anyway?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's too late. There isn't enough of him left to back in after.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Gods, what have we done?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We can't go back. Might as well go forward. We can still do this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Savos is right. We can make it if we just stay alert.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Further on, a door is blocked by a magical force. An unearthly voice calls from beyond.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Wo meyz wah dii vul junaar?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Melting the icy door to allows one to continue forward.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Nivahriin muz fent siiv nid aaz het. You do not answer... Must I use this guttural language of yours? Have you returned, Aren? My old friend?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The voice continues taunting the player as one delves further into the crypt.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Do you seek to finish that which you could not? You only face failure once more... You... You are not Aren, are you? Has he sent you in his place? Did he warn that your own power would be your undoing? That it would only serve to strengthen me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One breaks through the next enchanted door to find the ghosts again, the group now pared down to three.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Just another minute, please.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come on, we can't stop now. We have to keep moving!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Where's Elvali? She was right behind me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Dead. Something grabbed her from behind. Gone before I could do anything.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're right. This is all my fault. Should we turn around, head back?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't think going back is a good idea.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Going back would be the end of all of us. We keep pushing forward, and we'll make it. We will!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come on, you can make it. Let's go.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One presses on as well.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Come. Face your end.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Beyond, another conversation with the ghosts plays.
label: ACTION

dialogue: We shouldn't have left her there to die!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What else could we do? Stay there and die with her? She refused to go on, we didn't have a choice!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This is it, you know. Through this door. Can you feel it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We're not going to make it, are we?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We stay together, no matter what. Agreed?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll be right with you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Agreed. We all stay together.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Finally, the deepest chamber is reached. There, the owner of the Staff and the one who did it.
label: ACTION

dialogue: ...I'm sorry, friends. I'm so sorry! I had no choice! It was the only way to make sure that monster never escaped! I promise you, I'll never let this happen again! I'll seal this whole place away...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: On the way out, a Thalmor agent appears.
label: ACTION

dialogue: So, you made it out of there alive. Ancano was right...you are dangerous. I'm afraid I'll have to take that Staff from you now. Ancano wants it kept safe...oh, and he wants you dead. Nothing personal.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Get out of my way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You fool. You don't stand a chance.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have no quarrel with you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm afraid you do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After killing Estormo, it's back to the College. It's being attacked by more pushing the teachers out onto the bridge.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I hope there aren't any more.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You survived! You have it, then? Let's hope it's as powerful as the Psijics believe it to be.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Where's Mirabelle?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She... She didn't make it. When it was clear we were going to have to fall back, she stayed behind and made sure the rest of us were all right.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why are you all the way out here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look for yourself. Ancano's power is growing. We can't crack whatever magic he's using to shield himself. I hope your trip to Labyrinthian was worth it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's get in there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll be right behind you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll be amazed if any of us survive this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We never should have brought that thing here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: With the other specialist mages following, the player leads everyone back to the Hall of the Elements, the seat of Ancano's powers.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You've come for me, have you? You think I don't know what you're up to? You think I can't destroy you? The power to unmake the world at my fingertips, and you think you can do anything about it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Spells have no effect!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am beyond your pathetic attempts at magic. You cannot touch me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Staff! Use it on the Eye!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Enough!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He paralyzes Tolfir and, if applicable, the player's follower.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Still you persist? Very well. Come then. See what I can do now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player caps the Eye's power with the Staff, robbing Ancano of all his of his Thalmor ambitions.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I knew you could do it!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do we do now?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I...I don't know. Ancano is gone, but whatever he's done to the Eye doesn't seem to have stopped. I have no idea what to do!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just then, their old Psijic friend teleports in.
label: ACTION

dialogue: We knew you would succeed. Your victory here justifies our belief in you. You have proven yourself more than worthy to guide the College of Winterhold.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do we do now?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Eye has grown unstable. It cannot remain here, or else it may destroy your College and this world. It must be secured. Ancano's actions prove the world is not ready for such a thing. We shall safeguard it...for now. You now have the opportunity to maintain your College, and carry on with your lives. You have our gratitude, Arch-Mage.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How did you know I'd be able to defeat Ancano?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A great many things obscured to you are quite clear to us. We have long believed you would prevail.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tandil and Gelebros, two other Psijics, teleport in as well, and together they remove themselves and the dangerous Eye.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You've done it! The College is safe again, thanks to your work. I knew you had it in you. I daresay the Psijics are right. There's no one more deserving to be Arch-Mage, in my opinion. Here, consider these yours. And the Arch-Mage's quarters as well. I shall be here for advice, should you need me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After escaping Helgen, the player comes upon Pelagius Farm, a small lot near members, Aela the Huntress, runs over.
label: ACTION

dialogue: • You handle yourself well. You could make for a decent Shield-Brother. • Well, that's taken care of. No thanks to you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You didn't look like you needed help.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Certainly not. But a true warrior would have relished the opportunity to take on a giant. That's why I'm here with my Shield-Brothers.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I tried my best.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ha. Another milk drinker crying about his effort. Glory only awaits those who triumph. And as Companions, our glory must always be hard-fought.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: • Who are the Companions? • What is a Shield-Brother?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: An outsider, eh? Never heard of the Companions? An order of warriors. We are brothers and sisters in honor. And we show up to solve problems if the coin is good enough.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Can I join you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not for me to say. You'll have to talk to Kodlak Whitemane up in Jorrvaskr. The old man's got a good sense for people. He can look in your eyes and tell your worth. If you go to him, good luck.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sounds like a waste of time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well nobody asked you. If you think you're better than we are, go talk to Kodlak Whitemane. See what a warrior of true mettle is like.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Dragonborn arrives at Jorrvaskur, the Companions' Whiterun-based mead hall. A friendly brawl between Njada and Athis is going on.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Are those two at it again? Strike when the shoulder turns. He's giving you openings!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This should be good.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just keep swinging!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Going to enjoy killing you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Azura curse you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After the fight, one finds Kodlak Whitemane downstairs.
label: ACTION

dialogue: But I still hear the call of the blood.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We all do. It is our burden to bear. But we can overcome.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have my brother and I, obviously. But I don't know if the rest will go along quite so easily.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Leave that to me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'd like to join the Companions.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Would you now? Here, let me have a look at you? Hmm. Yes, perhaps. A certain strength of spirit.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Master, you're not truly considering accepting him?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am nobody's master, Vilkas. And last I checked, we had some empty beds in Jorrvaskr for those with a fire burning in hearts.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Apologies. But perhaps this isn't the time. I've never even heard of this outsider.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sometimes the famous come to us. Sometimes men and women come to us to seek their fame. It makes no difference. What matters is their heart.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And their arm.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course. How are you in a battle, boy?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can handle myself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That may be so. This is Vilkas. He will test your arm.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You dare question my skill?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Calm down there, whelp. Don't feel like you need to show off for our sake. Vilkas, here, will be the one testing your mettle.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have much to learn.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's the spirit. Vilkas, here, will get started on that. Vilkas, take him out to the yard and see what he can do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Aye.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player goes to the training grounds.
label: ACTION

dialogue: The old man said to have a look at you, so let's do this. Just have a few swings at me so I can see your form. Don't worry, I can take it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If one uses magic or magic-enchanted weapons:
label: ACTION

dialogue: What do you think this is? We don't do battle with magic around here, new blood. Now come at me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After some swings:
label: ACTION

dialogue: There you go! Not bad. Next time won't be so easy! You might just make it. But until then, you're still just a whelp to us, new blood. So you do what we tell you to. Here's my sword. Go take it up to Eorlund to have it sharpened. And be careful, it's probably worth more than you are.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Up at the forge...
label: ACTION

dialogue: What brings you here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Vilkas sent me with his sword.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm guessing you're the newcomer then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Does Vilkas always send newcomers on errands?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, don't worry about that. They were all whelps once. They just might not like to talk about it. And don't always just do what you're told. Nobody rules anybody in the Companions.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm just doing what I'm asked.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That attitude will get you far, if you were some stuffy merchant or a Jarl's footstool. Around here, you'll want to live your own life. Remember, nobody rules anybody in the Companions.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Someone has to be in charge, though.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, I'm not sure how they've managed it, but they have. No leaders since Ysgramor. Kodlak is the Harbinger, and he's a sort of advisor for the whole group, but every man is his own. Every woman, her own.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll need to be going.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have a favor to ask.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've been working on a shield for Aela. My wife is in mourning and I need to get back to her soon. I'd be much obliged if you could take this to Aela for me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Didn't you just tell me not to be a servant?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This isn't a command...just decency. Help out an old blacksmith. I've got to get back to my work.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm happy to lend a hand.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's a good man.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Aela can be found with Skjor downstairs.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I have your shield.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, good. I've been waiting for this. Are you new around here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I told you, this is the whelp that Vilkas mentioned.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, yes. I heard you gave him quite a thrashing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't let Vilkas catch you saying that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do you think you could handle Vilkas in a real fight?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't care for boasting.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, a man of action.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I would kill him before he drew his sword.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whoa, ease up there. We're rough, but there's no need to kill a Shield-Brother over a dispute. I like your fire though. You'll make a fierce Companion. Let us hunt together sometime. Here, let's have Farkas show you where you'll be resting your head.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Farkas!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Vilkas' brother comes down the hall.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Did you call me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course we did, icebrain. Show this new blood where the rest of the whelps sleep.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: New blood? Oh, hello. I'm Farkas. Come, follow me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They walk down the hall while Farkas gives a rundown on the place.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Skjor and Aela like to tease me, but they're good people. They challenge us to be our best. Nice to have a new face around. It gets boring here sometimes. I hope we keep you. This can be a rough life. The quarters are up here. Just pick a bed and fall in it when you're tired. Tilma will keep the place clean; she always has. Alright, so here you are. Looks like the others are eager to meet you. Come to me or Aela if you're looking for work. Once you've made a bit of a name for yourself, Skjor and Vilkas might have things for you to do. Good luck. Welcome to the Companions.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm looking for work.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Skjor was looking for you earlier.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What does he want?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't know. He just said he needed to talk to you before you do anything else. I don't like making him angry, but there is some work for you if you want it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Dragonborn finds Skjor.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Ah, there you are.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You wanted to see me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I did. Your time, it seems, has come.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do you mean?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Last week a scholar came to us. He said he knew where we could find another fragment of Wuuthrad. He seemed a fool to me, but if he's right, the honor of the Companions demands we seek it out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What does this have to do with me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This is a simple errand, but the time is right for it to be your Trial. Carry yourself with honor, and you'll become a true Companion.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I would be honored to retrieve it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There is a fine line and respect and bootlicking, new blood. But I like your spirit. We've decided this will be your Trial. DO well, and you'll be counted among the Companions. Farkas will be your Shield-Sibling on this venture, whelp. He'll answer any questions you have. Try not to disappoint...or get him killed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Farkas is nearby.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I hope you've readied yourself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're going to be my Shield-Brother?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So I'm told. Let's see if you impress.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who was this scholar?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A smart man came and told us about a blade piece. Skjor thinks you should find it, and I'm supposed to watch you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is Wuuthrad?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ysgramor was the hero who stared the Companions. Wuuthrad was his weapon. He came from the ancient homeland and killed all the elves. But not all of 'em, because some of 'em are still here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why did Skjor call this my Trial?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I watch you to make sure you're honorable. If you are honorable and strong, I can call you brother.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll meet you at Dustman's Cairn.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't delay, Shield-Brother.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The two go to Dustmain's Cairn, a crypt in Whiterun's western plains. Inside is evidence of someone messing up the place.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Looks like someone'd been digging here. And recently. Tread lightly. Be careful around the burial stones. I don't want to haul you back to Jorrvaskr on my back.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In one of the rooms, Dragonborn flips a switch, locking him in an alcove.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Now look what you've gotten yourself into. No worries. Just sit tight. I'll find the release.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: At this moment, several Silver Hand mercenaries rush in, surrounding Farkas.
label: ACTION

dialogue: It's time to die, dog.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We knew you'd be coming here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your mistake, Companion.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Which one is that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It doesn't matter. He wears that armor, he dies.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Killing you will make for an excellent story.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: None of you will be alive to tell it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Farkas transforms into a werewolf, slaughtering the bunch before releasing the gate lever.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I hope I didn't scare you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What was that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's a blessing given to some of us. We can be like wild beasts. Fearsome.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're going to make me a werewolf?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, no. Only the Circle have the beastblood. Prove your honor to be a Companion. "Eyes on the prey, not the horizon." We should keep moving. Still the draugr to worry about.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who are the Silver Hand?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Bad people who don't like werewolves. So they don't like us either.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Companions are werewolves?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not everyone, but all the Circle are. It's a secret to everybody.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Deeper in the crypt is a piece of Wuuthrad. They take it, defeat all the at the training grounds.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Brothers and sisters of the Circle, today we welcome a new soul into our mortal fold. This man has endured, has challenged, and has shown his valor. Who will speak for him?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I stand witness to the courage of the soul before us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Would you raise your shield in his defense?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I would stand at his back, that the world might never overtake us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And would you raise your sword in his honor?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It stands ready to meet the blood of his foes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And would you raise a mug in his name?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I would lead the song of triumph as our mead hall reveled in his stories.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then the judgment of this Circle is complete. His heart beats with fury and courage that have united the Companions since the days of the distant green summers. Let it beat with ours, that the mountains may echo and our enemies may tremble at the call.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It shall be so.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, boy, you're one of us now. I trust you won't disappoint.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is it true that the Companions are werewolves?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I see you've been allowed to know some secrets before your appointed time. No matter. Yes, it's true. Not every Companion, though. Only members of the Circle all share the blood of the beast. Some take to it more than others.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What about you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, I grow old. My mind turns towards the horizon. To Sovngarde. I worry that Shor won't call an animal to glory as he would a true Nord warrior. Living as beasts draws our souls closer to the Daedric Lord Hircine. Some may prefer an eternity in his Hunting Grounds, but I crave the fellowship of Sovngarde.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're looking to cure yourself?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, but it's no easy matter. But you don't need to share the worries of an old warrior. This day is to rejoice in your bravery! And speak to Eorlund if you want a better weapon than...whatever that is.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player goes to Eorlund.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I was told you would have a weapon for me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, lad, you've been raised into the Companions, I hear. I can forge whatever kind of weapon you want. Finest forge in Skyrim, right here before you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'd like a sword.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A blade! It'll be as sharp as Fralia's tongue!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'd like a dagger.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, the sneaky type, eh? I think we can fix you right up.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'd like a battleaxe.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just like Ysgramor himself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'd like a greatsword.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sure you can handle that? Hahaha. Of course you can.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'd like a waraxe.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now that's a smart weapon: light, strong, useful. Crack some skulls for me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After doing another job, the quest-giver directs one to Skjor.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Yes, I have something special for you. But it's not for everyone to hear. Meet me in the Underforge tonight. We will speak more.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Where is this Underforge?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I forget that you've never seen it. Beneath the Skyforge, where Eorlund works. The door is hidden, but I will show you the way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That night, they meet as directed.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Are you prepared?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is this place?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Here's all you need to know. Jorrvaskr is the oldest building in Whiterun. The Skyforge was here long before it was. And the Underforge taps an ancient magic that is older than men or elves. We bring you here to make you stronger, new blood. Now, let's move.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm ready for whatever test is next.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This is no test, new blood. This is a gift. Come inside.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In the Underforge, Aela is already waiting in her werewolf form.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I'm glad you came. It's been a long time since we've had a heart like yours in our numbers. That pitiful ceremony behind the hall does not befit warriors like us. You are due more honor than some calls and feasting. I would hope you recognize Aela, even in this form. She's agreed to be your forebear. We do this in secret because Kodlak is too busy trying to throw away this great gift we've been granted. He thinks we've been cursed. But we've been blessed. How could something that gives this type of prowess be a curse? So we take matters into our own hands. To reach the heights of the Companions, you must join with us in the shared blood of the wolf. Are you prepared to join your spirit with the beast world, friend?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What if I don't want to be a werewolf?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That is your choice. We will not force you. But to join the Circle, your blood must be as ours. Meet us here when you're ready.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm ready.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Very well.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Skjor cuts Aela's hand, letting it bleed into the stone fountain. The player out in the wilderness.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Are you awake? I was starting to think you might never come back. Yours was not an easy transformation, but you're still alive. Congratulations. We even have a celebration planned for you. There's a pack of werewolf hunters camped nearby, at Gallows Rock. The Silver Hand. I think you've met them before. We're going to slaughter them. All of them. Lead on. Skjor's already scouting ahead.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What just happened?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You were born into the pack, brother. I almost envy you, that first time is always the most...intense. You gave us even more trouble than Farkas did in his first turning.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Am I a werewolf now?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have the blood in you. You'll need to build up your strength before you're able to call on it again, though. Just be careful where you do it. Some cowards in this land can't stand the sight of glory before them.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What does it mean to be a werewolf?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nothing, until you choose to use it. Then, well...you got a taste. Stronger, faster. It doesn't last long, though. The blood of your foes can sustain you. If you're willing to feed. The more we feed, the greater our prowess will grow. We could perhaps discover even more gifts than Hircine.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is there a cure?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Cure? Ha. You're sounding like the old man. I...I shouldn't say that. I love Kodlak. I respect and follow him. But he's wrong on this. It's no curse. We're made into the greatest hunters in the land. If he's worried about some mead-swilling afterlife in Sovngarde, he's free to pursue it. I'll take the glories of the hunt right here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Where are we going?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Silver Hand have taken over the old fort at Gallows Rock. They always make such easy prey.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Aela and her wolfy companion enter the fort.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Look at this. Cowards must have locked the place down after Skjor charged in. You can taste the fear.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They proceed onward, finding a dead werewolf chained up.
label: ACTION

dialogue: There's a dead one, isn't there. Thought so. Nobody we know, by the smell. Some can't separate the animal from themselves, go feral. This poor sod could have been anyone. We should keep moving.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Rats are nearby.
label: ACTION

dialogue: No surprise they keep vermin around. Filthy squalor.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: More werewolves are seen caged.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Nothing we can do for these ones now. Don't even want to think about what those cretins did to them before they died.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They near the deepest sanctum.
label: ACTION

dialogue: We're getting close now, be careful. Their leader is a tricky one. They call him "The Skinner". I don't think I need to tell you why.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They defeat Krev the Skinner and his cohorts, but find Skjor's body nearby.
label: ACTION

dialogue: The bastards...somehow they managed to kill Skjor. He's one of the strongest we had, but numbers can overwhelm. He should not have come without a Shield-Brother. Get out of here. I'm going to make sure we got the last of them, and see if there's any information to be gotten from the bodies. You and I have work to do. The Silver Hand will tremble at our sight.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm looking for work.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And there is more work to be done, but I fear that Kodlak has gotten wind of our recent efforts. He's asked to see you. My advice? Always be honest with the old man, but don't tell him anything he doesn't need to know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Down in Kodlak's quarters...
label: ACTION

dialogue: Thank you for coming.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You wanted to see me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, youngling. Have a seat. I hear you've been busy of late.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Aela and I work to avenge Skjor's death.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your hearts are full of grief, and my own weeps at the loss of Skjor. But his death was avenged long ago. You have taken more lives than honor demanded. The cycle of retaliation may continue for some time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I work for the honor of the Companions.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lad, I know what you've been up to. Mind you, it's no business of what each Companion does . But this sneaking around. It doesn't befit warriors of your stature. Aela knows this, and so should you. In any case, I have a task for you. Have you heard the story of how we came to be werewolves?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Skjor said it was a blessing of Hircine.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Aye, that sounds like him. As in all matters of faith, though, the reality is more complicated than one believer would tell you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Vilkas said it was a curse laid upon the ancient Companions.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The boy has a nugget of truth, but the reality is more complicated than that. It always is.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So what is the truth, then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Companions are nearly five thousand years old. This matter of beastblood is only troubled us for a few hundred. One of my predecessors was a good but short-sighted man. He made a bargain with the witches of Glenmoril Coven. If the Companions would hunt in the name of their lord Hircine, we would be granted great power.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And they became werewolves?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They did not believe the change would be permanent. The witches offered payment, like anyone else. But we had been deceived.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But aren't you more powerful now?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The witches didn't lie, of course. But it's more than our bodies.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The witches should be hunted down for their trickery.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We'll get to that. It's not so simple as just killing them, though. The disease, you see, affects not just our bodies. It seeps into our spirit. Upon death, werewolves are claimed by Hircine for his Hunting Grounds. For some, this is paradise. They want nothing more than to chase prey with their mastery for eternity. And that is their choise. But I am a true Nord. I wish for Sovngarde as my spirit home.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is there a way to cure yourself?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's what I've spent my twilight years trying to find out. And now I think I've found an answer. The witches' magic ensnared us, and their magic can release us. They won't give it willingly, but we can extract their foul powers by force. I want you to seek them out. Go to their coven in the wilderness. Strike them down as a true warrior of the wild. And bring me their heads. The seat of their abilities. From there, we may begin to undo centuries of impurity.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Am I to do this alone?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You shall have no Shield-Brother this time. But the spirit of Ysgramor goes with you, to restore the honor of his legacy. Talos guide you, lad.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It shall be done.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good. Now move quickly. And don't leave any of them alive. Talos guide you, lad.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't wish to remove this blessing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This is not about your desires, lad. Your own fate will be your own choice, just as always. Now be gone.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player travels to the coven in Falkreath and slays all the hagravens. On Kodlak.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Where have you been?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I was doing Kodlak's bidding.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I hope it was important, because it means you weren't here to defend him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What happened here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One of the fiercest battles I've ever seen. The Silver Hand. They finally found enough courage to attack Jorrvaskr. We fought them off, but...the old man...Kodlak...he's dead.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Was anyone else hurt?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, but they made off with all our fragments of Wuuthrad. But you and I are going to reclaim them. We will bring the battle to their chief camp. There will be none left living to tell their stories. Only songs of Jorrvaskr will be sung. We will avenge Kodlak...and they know will terror before the end.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The others have probably prepared Kodlak's funeral by now. Come up to the Skyforge to pay your respects.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Kodlak's pyre sits atop the Skyforge. The other Companions stand nearby.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Who will start?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll do it. Before the ancient flame...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We grieve.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: At this loss...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We weep.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: For the fallen...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We shout.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And for ourselves...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We take our leave.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Aela lights the pyre.
label: ACTION

dialogue: His spirit is departed. Members of the Circle, let us withdraw to the Underforge, to grieve our last together.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do you have the fragments of Wuuthrad still? I'll need to prepare them for mounting again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I return them with honor. (Give fragments)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't get too flowery on me, lad.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Here, take them. (Give fragments)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Careful with those. Don't want even more fragments, do we? Of course, I have a small favor to ask of you. There is another piece that Kodlak always kept close to himself. Would you go to his chambers and bring it back for me? I'm not sure I'm the best one to go through his things.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It would be my pleasure.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you. I'll be here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I guess I'll have to.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I appreciate it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Dragonborn claims the final piece and returns to Eorlund.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You're back.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have Kodlak's fragment.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you. Your Shield-Siblings have withdrawn to the Underforge. I think they're waiting for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Aela, Vilkas and Farkas are all in the 'Forge, talking about Kodlak's legacy.
label: ACTION

dialogue: The old man had one wish before he died. And he didn't get it. It's as simple as that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Being moon-born is not so much of a curse as you might think, Vilkas.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's fine for you. But he wanted to be clean. He wanted to meet Ysgramor and know the glories of Sovngarde. But all that was taken from him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And you avenged him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Kodlak did not care for vengeance.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, Farkus, he didn't. And that's not what this is about. We should be honoring Kodlak, no matter our own thoughts on the blood.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're right. It's what he wanted, and he deserved to have it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Kodlak used to speak of a way to cleanse his soul, even in death. You know the legends of the Tomb of Ysgramor.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: "There the souls of the Harbingers will heed the call of northern steel." We can't even enter the tomb without Wuuthrad, and it's in pieces, like it has been for a thousand years.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Eorlund enters.
label: ACTION

dialogue: And dragons were just stories. And the elves once ruled Skyrim. Just because something is, doesn't mean it must be. The blade is a weapon. A tool. Tools are made to be broken...and repaired.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is that...? Did you repair the blade?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This is the first time I've had all the pieces, thanks to our Shield-Brother here. "The flames of a hero can reforge the shattered." The flames of Kodlak shall fuel the rebirth of Wuuthrad. And now it will take you to meet him once more. As the one who bore the fragments, I think you should be the one to carry Wuuthrad into battle. The rest of you, prepare to journey to the Tomb of Ysgramor. For Kodlak.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Circle journeys to the aforementioned tomb in Winterhold.
label: ACTION

dialogue: This is the resting place of Ysgramor. And his most trusted generals. You should be careful.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Are you not coming?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Kodlak was right. I let vengeance rule my heart. I regret nothing of what we did at Driftshade. But I can't go any further with my mind fogged or my heart grieved.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why do we need to be cautious?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The original Companions. Their finest warriors rest with Ysgramor. You'll have to prove yourselves to them. It's not that you're intruding; I wager they've actually expected us. They just want to be sure that you're worthy. Be ready for an honorable battle.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How do we get inside?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Return Wuuthrad to Ysgramor. He should open the way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player puts the axe in the statue's hands, revealing a new passage. They come to a spider's den eventually.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I can't go any further, Shield-Brother.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's the matter?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ever since Dustman's Cairn, the big crawly ones have been too much for me. Everyone has his weakness, and this one is mine. I'm not proud, but I will stay back with Vilkas. Give my regards to Ysgramor.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Eventually, Aela and the player find the hall containing Kodlak's spirit.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Greetings, Shield-Brother.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Kodlak, is that you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course. My fellow Harbingers and I have been warming ourselves here. Trying to evade Hircine.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But there's nobody else here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You see only me because your heart knows only me as the Companions leader. I'd wager old Vignar could see half a dozen of my predecessors. And I see them all. The ones in Sovngarde. The ones trapped with me in Hircine's realm. And they all see you. You've brought honor to the name of the Companions. We won't soon forget it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Vilkas said you could still be cured.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Did he now? I can only hope. You still have the witches' heads? Excellent. Throw one of them into the fire. It will release their magic, for me at least.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player tosses a coven witch's head in, releasing Kodlak's wolf spirit. With Aela's help, they slay it.
label: ACTION

dialogue: We've killed your beast spirit.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And so slain the beast inside of me. I thank you for this gift. The other Harbingers remain trapped by Hircine, though. Perhaps from Sovngarde, the rest of the heroes of old can aid me in their rescue. The Harrowing of the Hunting Grounds. It would be a battle of such triumph. And perhaps someday, you'll join us in that battle. But for today, return to Jorrvaskr. Triumph in your victory. And lead the Companions to further glory.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Kodlak's spirit disappears.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Did I hear right? Did he say you were to lead the Companions?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He did indeed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've earned the right. Your strength and honor are apparent to all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Does this upset you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm just surprised. But your strength and honor are apparent to all. And it's my honor to be first to address you as Harbinger. Let's go tell the others. Nocturnal's quests tie into the Thieves Guild questline, so check there for the full lowdown.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Upon arrival in Falkreath, a guard approaches.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Did you see a Dog out there?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. Some wolves, but no dogs.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, well.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've seen whole packs of dogs.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, this was a specific one.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What sort of dog?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't know really. The blacksmith is offering a reward for a dog he saw on the road. I was hoping you'd seen it. I guess I'll stay on the lookout. Keep your nose clean while you're here, outsider.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One goes to the blacksmith.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Did you see a hound on the road? A fine, strong creature that's been wandering near town.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, sorry. I didn't see a dog.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's one out on the road.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The guard at the gate mentioned a dog.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I asked the gate guards to look for him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've seen whole packs of dogs.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, no, this one's alone on the road outside of town. I can't afford to chase him down but I could use a fierce, loyal beast to keep me company. If you were willing to retrieve him for me, I'd give you some fresh meat to attract him out on the road.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sure, I can catch him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good! There's some gold in it for you if you succeed. Here's the meat -- check the road just outside of town.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I could be convinced to catch him. (Persuade)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's a smart man that demands something up front for his work. Some gold now and some when I have my dog. Here's the meat.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A ways west of Falkreath, the player finds a dog sitting on the road. It approaches and...begins speaking?!
label: ACTION

dialogue: You are exactly what I was looking for.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You were looking for me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yeah, I think you'll be just what I need.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Did you just talk?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Skyrim is now host to giant, flying lizards and two-legged cat-men ...and you're surprised by me? Yes. I just talked. And am continuing to do so. You see, my name is Barbas. And I have a problem I think you can help sort out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've got things to do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know, I know... Wars to fight, dragons to confront, guild business to conduct. Sheesh! Listen, when you're ready to do something useful, find me outside Haemar's Shame, in Falkreath.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, what could a dog need my help with?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My master and I had a bit of a falling out. We got into an argument and it got rather...heated. He's kicked me out until I find someone who can settle our disagreement. That's where you come in.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sounds easy enough. Let's go find him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you. Now, since he banished me, Vile's been rather weak. He can't manifest very far from one of his shrines. I know there's a cult that worships him at Haemar's Shame. We should be able to talk to him there. If this works out, I'll make sure you're rewarded. Just don't trust any offer he makes you...okay?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So you're a lost little puppy?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Very funny. My master is Clavicus Vile, Daedric prince of wishes. As you can imagine, he's quite the important person.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Barbas leads the player to Haemar's Shame, a cave east of Helgen. At the back of the vampire den is a sheltered shrine to Clavicus.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Lord Vile, I have a request of you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: By all means, let's hear it. It's the least I could do, since you already helped me grant one final wish for my last worshippers... They were suffering so from vampirism, and begged me for a cure. Then you came and ended their misery! I couldn't have planned it better myself. So, what's your heart's desire? What kind of deal can we strike?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm just here to reunite you with Barbas.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ugh. That insufferable pup? Forget it. Request denied. No deal. I'm glad to be rid of him. Even if it does mean I'm stuck in this pitiful shrine, in the back end of...nowhere. Well...perhaps there is a way he could earn his place back at my side. Maybe. But no promises.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: An end to the civil war that plagues my land.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, if I had my full power, granting that would be trivial. I'd simply snap my fingers and everyone in Skyrim would die. War resolved.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The power to crush all before me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Really? Power? Haven't you already killed enough of your foes using the more mundane means at your disposal? Swords, magic, etc.? How...uninspired. As much as I hate to say it, you're almost as powerful as I am right now. But that's just because half of my power resides in that mutt, Barbas. Come to think of it, I know of a win-win situation for both of us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Really? Power? You're a Dragonborn; you already have more power than most people who aren't immense, fire-breathing monsters. [It
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's your offer?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's an axe. An incredible powerful axe. An axe powerful enough for me to have quite a bit of fun, indeed. If you bring it to me, I'll grant you my boon. No strings attached. No messy surprises. At least, not for you. As I recall, it's resting in Rimerock Burrow. Barbas can lead you right to it. The little mutt might even earn his place back at my side.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One can actually talk to Clavicus again.
label: ACTION

dialogue: What did you want, again?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In Rimerock Burrow, there's an artifact called the Rueful Axe. Bring it to me, and I'll take Barbas back. Simple as that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player can talk to Barbas at this time.
label: ACTION

dialogue: So what's the story behind the Rueful Axe.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One of Clavicus's little jests. A wizard named Sebastian Lort had a daughter who worshipped Hircine. When the daughter became a werewolf it drove Sebastian over the edge. He couldn't stand to see his little girl take on such a bestial form. The wizard wished for the ability to end his daughter's curse. Clavicus gave him an axe.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After slaying Sebastian Lort and retrieving the axe, it's back to Vile.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Ah, you've got the axe! And my dog. Splendid.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We're back. Now fulfill your end of the bargain.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Excellent work. A hero and his faithful companion, retrieving the ancient artifact for the prince. It's almost...storybook. Ah, but it almost seems a shame to give a weapon like that away, doesn't it? I suppose I could be persuaded to let you keep it... But only if you use the axe to kill Barbas. Simple as that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I sure would like to keep this axe...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And I could absorb the spirit of poor, dead Barbas. He'd still be reunited with me. And I'm sure Barbas doesn't want me to have that axe. He'd want it this way. The choice is yours, friend. We're all counting on you to make the right decision. Put him out of our misery!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No deal. Take the axe and take back Barbas!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hrmph. You're not fun at all. Guess I'll have to make my own fun elsewhere. And with the pup back, I'll be restored to my full power. There's a whole world just waiting for me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If one goes to kill Barbas...
label: ACTION

dialogue: Wait a second, there's another option here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think I want to keep the axe.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The axe isn't the only item dear old Clavicus has. Give him the Rueful Axe and once we're reunited the Masque of Clavicus Vile will be yours.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If the player kills Barbas...
label: ACTION

dialogue: He's dead. Are we done here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Absolutely! Now I can reabsorb his body, and return to full power. All without having to listen to his whining! Oh, sure, he'll be back in a century or two, but think of the fun I can have 'til then. Enjoy that axe! And don't worry about poor old Barbas. After all, he really should have picked a better friend...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If the player forces Clavicus to take back Barbas...
label: ACTION

dialogue: I knew I could trust you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yeah, yeah, dog gets master, master gets cosmic axe, everyone's happy. Just get over here, mutt.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't worry, I'll make sure he sees the light. I trusted you, now you trust me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Barbas disappears, then manifests as part of Clavicus' statue.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Ah, that feels so much better! You forget how nice supreme power feels until you've been stuck in a cave for a few years. • It's a shame you wished for something so dull as me taking back the mutt. Quite a lack of imagination on your part. A lack of ambition like that really ought to be punished. Perhaps by turning you into a worm, or maybe a few decades of... • Now, as for your wish... An end to the war, was it? I'll make sure this war ends, all right. Just as soon as the dragons swarm across Skyrim and wipe out all of you puny... • Now, as for your wish... Power, was it? You can be a part of a tremendous power -- all you have to do is let your soul be absorbed by this axe. I never said it would be your power... Oh, fine. Have my boon and be done with it. I've got more interesting deals to make anyway.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Clavicus, having changed his mind, gives his Masque as a reward.
label: ACTION

dialogue: In one of the city's bars, the player encounters Sam Guevenne.
label: ACTION

dialogue: If you're looking for a challenge, you've come to the right place. A few drinks, a few laughs and a contest. What could be better?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't really feel like drinking...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well come back when you do, my friend. Come back when you do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A drinking contest? You don't stand a chance!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ha! We'll see about that. This is a special brew, very strong stuff. Let's get started. I'll start round one. Down the hatch! Your turn.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Here we go.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One down, my friend. One down.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This was a bad idea.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sorry to hear that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player takes a drink.
label: ACTION

dialogue: And another one for me. And how about you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A second drink. Easy enough.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So says you. I think I've hit my limit on these things. Tell you what, one more and you win the contest.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm done now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Awww, well, maybe next time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player drinks a second brew.
label: ACTION

dialogue: One more. No problemsh.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wow. You've really done it. The staff is yours.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thash grape!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know, you're a fun person to drink with. I know this great little place where the wine flows like water. We should head there. Hey, you don't look so good...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player blacks out and awakens the next day...in Markarth. At the Temple of Dibella. An angry priestess serves as a wake-up call.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Wake up! That's right, it's time to wake up, you drunken blasphemer!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Where am I?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course! You don't remember getting here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Blasphemer?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I see. So you don't remember fondling the statuary, then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Unh, my head.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, your head hurts and you don't remember where you are. I'm guessing you also don't remember coming in here and blathering incoherently about marriage or a goat. Which means you don't remember losing your temper and throwing trash all over the temple.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Was a man named Sam with me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Dibella teaches love and compassion, but that doesn't mean we're just going to tell you what you want to know and let you walk away from this. Pick up your mess, then apologize, and if we think you're sincere we'll consider lending you aid.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm sorry, I don't even remember how I got here. (Persuade)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, you were deep in your cups when you got here. You were ranting but most of it was slurred. You said something about Rorikstead.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, I'd love to help you figure it out, but I'm so busy cleaning up the mess you made of our temple... Now if you were to help tidy up and perhaps apologize afterwards...I might be able to help you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me how I got here and I'll pay for the damages. ( gold)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, we can always use contributions. You were ranting but most of it was slurred. You did say something about Rorikstead. Maybe you should take a look there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh you must be nobility of some sort. Running around partying and paying others to clean it up. I don't think so. Clean up your own mess.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If the player cleans up the Temple:
label: ACTION

dialogue: I suppose that'll do. Dibella teaches us forgiveness, after all. Even for a drunk like you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So do you remember anything I said when I got here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You were ranting when you got here, but most of it was slurred. You did say something about Rorikstead. Maybe you should take a look there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The next step is visiting Rorikstead, the tiny farming community between Markarth and Whiterun. An angry farmer is nearby.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You! You've got a lot of nerve showing yourself in this town again. What do you have to say for yourself?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm sorry?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sorry's not good enough! Not while my Gleda is still out there, alone and afraid. You kidnapped her and sold her to that Giant!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have no idea what you're talking about.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is that so? Does the name Gleda ring a bell? The star beauty of my farm? Kidnapped by a drunk lout and sold to a Giant? You'd better remember her right fast, before I call the guards and have you hauled away.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That sounds pretty bad...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're damned right it does. I'll never breed another prize-winning goat like Gleda! And don't you think of coming back to Rorikstead until you get her back from that Giant.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What happened with Gleda again? I'm a little fuzzy on that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You really don't remember stealing a goat and selling her to a Giant? Are you thick? Go get her! At least she's bound to follow you back -- you smell just like the fermented feed she likes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Did I say anything about where I left a staff?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You mentioned something like that... when you were running off with my goat! Tell you what -- you bring back my goat, and maybe I'll give a damn about your staff.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Help me retrace my steps and I'll pay you for the goat. (1000 gold)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fine, but I'll still be missing my Gleda. Doubt I'll ever have a prize winning goat again. Most of what you said was gibberish but you left a note. The only bit I could read was "after repaying Ysolda in Whiterun."
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's not enough money in the world to replace Gleda.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I need to find Sam and the staff, in order to get Gleda back. (Persuade)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I suppose that makes sense. You didn't mention a Sam and nothing you said about the staff made sense. You left a note but it was mostly gibberish, the only bit I could make out was "after repaying Ysolda in Whiterun."
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You didn't seem to need either to sell Gleda to the Giant in the first place. I think you'll figure it out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me everything and you won't end up like your goat. (Intimidate)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Okay, okay. Most of what you said didn't make sense but you left a note. The only bit that I could read said "after repaying Ysolda in Whiterun." That's all I know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do what you have to do, I'm not giving up on Gleda.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One can go kill the giant to bring Gleda back.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Here's your goat. Now can you help me retrace my steps?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Gleda! And not a scratch on her! Happy day! I still can't figure out why you stole her. You left a note explaining it, but half of it was gibberish and the rest had mead spilled on it. Only bit I could make out was "repaying Ysolda in Whiterun," and even that's mostly scribbles. Guess you could try there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player visits the merchant Ysolda in Whiterun.
label: ACTION

dialogue: So, you're finally back. Look, I've been patient, but you still owe me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Okay, how much do I owe you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's not about the money, really. I wouldn't have given you the wedding ring on credit if you weren't so obviously in love. But if there isn't going to be a wedding, the least you can do is give the ring back. That was one of my best pieces.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yeah, I've been getting that a lot.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Aw, what's wrong? Did the engagement fall through? Look, how about we call it even, as long as you bring back the wedding ring? That's really a shame -- I was so looking forward to the wedding. You said you'd have all the most interesting guests.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do you know what I did with it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You went right out to give it to your fiancee! Don't you even remember where you left her? And after you told me that sweet story of how you met in Witchmist Grove! I can see why she left you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Seriously, let me pay you for the ring. (2000 gold)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Decided to go through with it then? I knew you couldn't have forgotten about your fiance. You spoke of her so glowingly. I don't know much about Morvunskar but it sounded like a lovely place for the ceremony. Congratulations.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think I would prefer my ring back. I put a lot of time into making it and you just gave is away as a joke.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I just need to get to the wedding. Please. (Persuade)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You must have had a wild night if you can't remember that. But I suppose everyone gets the jitters before their wedding. And I did say you could take a bit of time paying me back. You said the ceremony was going to be at Morvunskar. Don't forget you still owe me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm sure your bride-to-be will tell you when you where the ceremony will be. If she still wants to marry you when you tell her you can't afford the ring.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't care about the ring! Tell me what else I said! (Intimidate)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right, all right. You're mean when you're sober. You said you the ceremony was going to be in Morvunskar. You said your friend Sam was going to be your best man.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You think you can bully me. I grew up with five brothers. Go... get...my...ring.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What was that story about my fiancee?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How could you forget? It was the sweetest story I'd ever heard. You met at the full moon, under the biggest tree in Witchmist Grove, surrounded by fireflies. It was straight out of a storybook.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player can go to Witchmist Grove, finding the fiancée: a hagraven...
label: ACTION

dialogue: Darling! I've been waiting for you to return, to consummate our love!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What? You want it for that hussy Esmerelda, with the dark feathers –- don't you? I won't let her have you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now dead, the player takes the ring back to Ysolda.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Eventually, the player heads to Morvunskar, a mage-run fortress. Inside, a revellers are waiting.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You're here! I was beginning to think you might not make it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It was quite a trip. Where are we?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I thought you might not remember your first trip here. You had a big night. I think you've definitely earned the staff.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have all the things needed to repair it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, the Hagraven feather and so on. You can throw all those out. You see...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sam transforms, revealing himself as the Daedric Lord Sanguine.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I really just needed something to encourage you to go out into the world and spread merriment. And you did just that! I haven't been so entertained in at least a hundred years!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So all of this was just a prank?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just a prank? Just a prank? The Daedric Lord of Debauchery does not deal in mere "pranks." This may have begun as a minor amusement, but it wasn't long before I realized you'd make a more interesting bearer of my not-quite-holy staff.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who are you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am Sanguine, Daedric Prince of Debauchery! I know, I know, how could I lie to you? Well, how could I trust you until we've shared a few drinks? But it wasn't long before I realized you'd make a more interesting bearer of my not-quite-holy staff than this waste of flesh.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thanks, I guess.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My pleasure. But I think it's time for you to go. No fun keeping you locked up in here with the staff.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why did you choose me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's be honest, here. I don't always think my decisions through. But you...you're going places. Maybe a little influence from your old uncle Sanguine could help adjust your course a bit...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He teleports the player back to the bar they first bumped glasses at, with his Dremora-summoning staff as a parting gift.
label: ACTION

dialogue: In one's travels, a Boethiah cultist attacks the player, leaving behind a player.
label: ACTION

dialogue: We are Lord Boethiah's faithful. Have you come to test your mettle?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is this some kind of cult?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We are forged by Boethiah's example. We carve our will upon the world through our tongues and our blades. You? You are nothing. An empty vapor, dispersed by the slightest breeze.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not afraid of you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good. Perhaps I've misjudged.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who is Boethiah?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Lord of Plots, Deceiver of Nations, Devourer of Trinimac. The Queen of Shadows, Goddess of Destruction, He-Who-Destroys and She-Who-Erases... Many are our lord's lofty names, but they befit only us mortals. Intone her mighty names from now until the end of time -- it is for naught. Names mean nothing to our Lord. She only cares for those who care for themselves, whose hearts are full of purpose, whose lives are full of deeds.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My heart is full of purpose, and my life is full of deeds.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you desire a glimpse of our Dark Mistress, then this is what you must do. First, prove your tongue can wield a lie. Find someone. Gain his trust. Lead him to the shrine above. Next, instruct your thrall to touch the Pillar of Sacrifice. Its magic will ensnare him, rendering him helpless. Then, girded with certitude, plant the ceremonial blade deeply, so that the waters of his heart wash over you. If your will is strong enough, it will stir Boethiah in her Dark Mansion, and she will appear before us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll do it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That remains to be seen. But if it is so, and if Boethiah appears, then we will welcome you as one of us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll do nothing of the sort.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then you are weak and inconsequential.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Alternately, if one kills all the cultists, Boethiah herself manifests by
label: ACTION

dialogue: Either way, the player sacrifices someone on the Pillar, summoning Boethiah. If the cultists are still alive:
label: ACTION

dialogue: Ahhhhgh. Wearing flesh is so...distasteful. You have caught my attention, mortal. That is most unwise. Tell me, why have you slain this one, who trusted you, here upon my shrine?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who are you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am called Boethiah. Many names have mortals given to me. But I am not interested in names. I am interested only in deeds.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Are you some kind of god?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A god? Assuredly not! When was the last time you saw evidence of Aedra in the world? No, we Daedra are more powerful than any god. And among my brethren, I am the most feared.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have slain Cosnach to gain your favor.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My favor? My good pleasure is not some trophy for mortal sport! I should slay you for such insolence!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My reasons are my own.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Indeed. But I abide only those whose will is aligned with my own. Those who oppose my desires perish in the most dreadful of ways.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I didn't mean to offend.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Were you certain in your purpose, you would have no need to apologize. You have much to learn... But you have proven your will is strong and your heart is devoid of pity. So, perhaps you are not entirely useless... We shall soon find out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not afraid of you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is that so? You should be. Though a heart without fear is something I can use... Perhaps you are the one I seek. We shall soon find out. Listen. All of you! Hear me! I have need of a warrior. Only the most ruthless, cunning, and agile will do. You have gathered here night after night, sacrificing fools upon my shrine, and sparring aimlessly with yourselves. But which among you truly exceeds the rest? Prove yourselves to me! I have a special task for whichever of you is left standing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Once the player kills the cultists at Boethiah's behest, or if they were all killed previously to get her attention:
label: ACTION

dialogue: Well done. You have proven the strength of your will and your tongue's gift for lies. You have shown ferocity and prowess in combat. Now the time has come for a final proving. Are you able to cast aside your honor and strike with the hidden blade?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: "Honor" is a coward's tool.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: An astute observation. Skyrim is a beautiful and harsh mistress, but her people cling to such a petty notion of honor.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll do whatever you ask.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have little need for mindless thralls. My servants serve their own purposes. But, if their will is insufficient, nor suitably aligned with mine, I simply destroy them. Which brings me to my present concern. My previous champion displeases me. It is time he is replaced -- in the traditional fashion.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who is he?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am loath to utter his name...one cannot erase a thing if it has a name to be remembered.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Where can I find him?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You will find him holed up at Knifepoint Ridge, where he plays king to bandits and highwaymen.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What has he done to displease you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: For a time he served his purpose, but that time has ended. He uses my gifts for his own amusement, and the only amusement I tolerate is my own.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Say no more. He's as good as dead.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Kill every single member of his band. Do so as silently and invisibly as you can, for this is not about you. You are to be my instrument in this. Slay him in the coldest of blood. Do not give him the dignity of defending himself. Once his corpse lays cold upon the ground, and all trace of his followers erased, retrieve my Ebony Mail. A gift fit only for my true champion.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player goes to Knifepoint Ridge and slays the ex-champion and his merry band of highwaymen. The player reclaims the Ebony Mail and dons it.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You have done well, my Champion. You have earned my respect, a feat few manage and live to tell about. I shall write your name upon the Tablet of Absolute Darkness. You may keep my Ebony Mail, a token of my appreciation to my new champion. Its gifts will resonate with your talents. Now go. I have strings to pull that require my full attention. You may pursue your own course wherever it leads you. Remember always this: As you will, so it shall be.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Many people in Skyrim will direct the player to a famous landmark, the Shrine one worshipper -- Aranea Ienith -- in attendance.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Azura has seen your coming, traveler. It was not curiosity, but fate, that has lead you here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: "Seen my coming"? What do you mean?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Azura has given me the gift of foresight. I had a vision of you walking up the steps to this altar long before you were born. You have been chosen to be her champion. I know it is unexpected, but do not worry. It will all unfold as she has predicted.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is this place? Who's Azura?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This shrine was built by the Dunmer. As our land was scorched by fire and brimstone, Azura's prophecies led us to safety. She is a Daedra, a powerful being who watches from beyond our mortal plane. She has chosen you to be her champion.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't believe in fate.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Perhaps that is what you are meant to believe. To better serve your role as Azura's champion. Do not fight it. Azura's prophecies always come to pass. To deny them is to go headlong into the darkness with no light to guide you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Very well. What does Azura need?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You must go to a fortress, endangered by water, yet untouched by it. Inside, you will find an elven mage who can turn the brightest star as black as night. It is crytic, I know, but Azura's signs are never wrong. I believe the fortress may refer to Winterhold. Ask if they know this elven enchanter.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not anyone's champion. Find someone else.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There is no one else, but very well. I cannot force you to accept your destiny. Twilight guide your path.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player can inquire further about Azura.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I'd like to know more about Azura.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She is the Goddess of Dawn and Dusk. Azura sees into the Twilight of the future, and guides her followers through it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Where did this shrine come from?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My people, the Dunmer, built it. We fled from Morrowind after Vvardenfell erupted almost 200 years ago. Those of us who were faithful to Azura were given a vision that led us away from the island before the worst came. This shrine is our thanks to her. That none will forget she watches over us all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Are you all alone here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. There were others at first, but Azura's visions tested everyone's faith. One by one, they left. Afraid to know their own future. But I refused to abandon the shrine. The visions are a gift. Azura warns me of tragedy, war, death before it happens. I won't leave her guidance.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In Winterhold, the player goes to the inn to inquire about an enchanter.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Is there an elven mage here that studies stars?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Mages are up in the college. You can ask them, if they'll let you in. Then again, Nelacar might know. He's an old-timer from the College, but he has a room here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player goes to Nelocar.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I don't deal with any College applicants these days, so don't bother asking.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm looking for an elven mage who studies stars.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who sent you? Was it the College? The Jarl? We agreed there would be no more questions.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A priestess of Azura sent me. (Persuade)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Azura? Gods, it's all finally coming back to haunt me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're working with the Daedra? Right. Now tell me the one about the Argonian Maid and the lusty baron.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look, I'm willing to pay. ( gold)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A few coins for my soul? If only you understood the irony.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't think you understand. I'm not answering questions.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I didn't agree to anything. Talk. (Intimidate)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just calm down. I'll tell you everything.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do you think muscling me is going to work? I'm a wizard. An old. Elven. Wizard. Think about it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I misspoke. Forget I asked.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's for the best.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player convinces him.
label: ACTION

dialogue: What do you know about soul gems?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They're for enchanting, correct?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They are. Except the gem is always consumed. They're frail. Except for one.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Soul gems? Why are you asking?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's what caused all the trouble. Soul gems are used in enchanting, but they break afterwards. Except one.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't change the subject.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Soul gems are the subject, friend. They're used in enchanting, then they break. Except one. Azura's Star. A Daedric artifact that allows any number of souls to pass through it. Some of us wanted to find out how. I was working under Malyn Varen, then. If only we knew what he was really planning. Get to the point.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What did Malyn do?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Malyn wanted to alter the Star. He was dying. Disease. He thought he could store his own soul inside. Become immortal. It drove him mad. Students started dying. Eventually, the College exiled him. He took a few loyal disciples to Ilinalta's Deep and vanished. Look, I don't care who asked you to find the Star, but don't take it back to Azura. The Daedra are evil. They're the reason Malyn went insane.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player can inquire further about Nelacar's subjects.
label: ACTION

dialogue: How does Azura's Star work?
label: CHARACTER
