dialogue: I mentioned how the Star is a soul gem, only it never gets depleted? There's another rule the artifact follows. You can only store white souls in the Star, belonging to the lesser creatures. Azura's magic won't allow black souls to enter it. As a mortal, Malyn's soul was black, so part of his work was breaking past Azura's rules. He was close before...well, I already told you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How did the Daedra drive Malyn insane?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Azura is no ordinary Daedra. She commands an entire realm in of Oblivion. The more Malyn worked on the Star, the more she was able to damn him. It started slowly at first. Malyn would see things that weren't there. Then he would yell at students over words they hadn't said. Then one day I walked in and Malyn had...killed a student, and in a horrific moment of inspiration, he started using her soul for his work.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It sounds like Malyn got what was coming to him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The College would agree with you, but do you have any idea how many innocent lives were cut short, just so Azura could have revenge? We're nothing to the Daedra. Pawns to move around, praise, and punish as they see fit.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Dragonborn makes for Ilinalta's Deep, an old ruin along Lake Ilinalta person to give the Star to.
label: ACTION

dialogue: NELOCAR'S PATH NELOCAR'S PATH
label: ACTION

dialogue: Stendarr's Mercy. You found it. Azura's Star. Maybe this is my chance to make things right. I can finish Malyn's work, the way we had meant to before his madness. It would mean cutting the Star off from Azura. Only black soul would be able to enter it once we finished.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's do it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Give me a minute to examine the Star. I'll see what we need to do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'd like to think about it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right, but hurry. Who knows if Azura is watching us? These fissures and cracks aren't encouraging. Malyn was obviously growing more desperate once he left the College. He did it. He actually managed to trap his own soul inside the Star, but it's falling apart. It needs more and more souls to sustain itself. The Star is being used to sustain Malyn's soul. I can't fix it while that fragment of him is inside.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So we need to deal with Malyn somehow.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Precisely. But it's not as simple as enchanting Malyn away. He's put up barriers. Souls are only allowed in, not out. If we were to... somehow...send a soul inside the Star. One that was ready to overpower Malyn from the inside...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't like where this is going.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I could soul trap you. Place you inside the Star. Then bring you back once Malyn has been dealt with.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You want to send my soul inside, don't you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A special type of soul trap. Placing you within the Star without fully killing you. Once Malyn has been dealt with, I'll bring you back. I understand if you need some time to prepare. Let me know when you're ready.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Won't that kill him?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He's already dead. Worse, the enchantment keeping him intact requires black souls. I don't know how many people he must have killed. If we don't do something, the enchantment will eventually fade, and the Star will slip back into Oblivion. Azura will have the last laugh.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player can ask Malyn further about what will happen:
label: ACTION

dialogue: What do I do once I'm inside?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Malyn's soul should be in the Star. Theoretically, purging him will be just like killing a ghost anywhere else. I'll have a magical tether to your soul while you're inside. Once you're done, it'll be as simple as pulling you back into your body.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's to keep me from ending up like Malyn?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Malyn's soul is beyond home because his body is dead. But I'll be keeping you just slightly alive on this end. But be careful. If you die inside the Star, your soul will be disrupted. There's nothing anyone can do for you if that happens.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: When one has the determination to proceed...
label: ACTION

dialogue: I'm ready to enter the Star.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Okay. Stand still. This might sting. First, I'll need to grab hold of your soul. Now, take a deep breath.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player arrives in the Star.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Ah, my disciples have sent me a fresh soul. Good. I was getting... hungry. Wait. There's something different about you. This experiment of yours is over!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You can't escape your fate, Malyn.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And who are you to challenge me? I have conquered mortality itself. I've spat in the eyes of the Daedric Lords. This is my realm now. I've sacrificed too much for let you take it from me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player kills Malyn.
label: ACTION

dialogue: No. Not like this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nelacar can be heard.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Malyn's enchantments are broken. Hold on. I'm going to pull your soul out of there. Brace yourself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player is put back in his/her own body.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Easy there. The numbness will pass. Just don't strain yourself. We've done it. The Star has been cut from Azura, and Malyn's soul finally has some measure of peace, even if it is in non-existence.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do we do with it now?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now? You could use it for what we meant it for. Using black souls for enchanting. The Black Star will never decay, but it can no longer hold the white souls of lesser creatures. You keep it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If it's fixed, then it's mine.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Go ahead. Take it. I'd sooner finally put this chapter of my life behind me. Congratulations. You've altered the fate of a Daedric artifact and lived.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: AZURA'S PATH AZURA'S PATH
label: ACTION

dialogue: The player returns the fractured Star to Aranea.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Azura's Star! I knew the Lady of Twilight had sent you for a reason. Hand it over to me. I will ask Azura to restore teh Star to its original purity.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Here. Take it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I will commune with Azura.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I need a moment. I'll be back later.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I understand. Speaking to a goddess is overwhelming for many. Return when you're prepared.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player hands over the Star.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Azura. Mother of Roses. Goddess of Dusk and Dawn. Your chosen champion has returned your Star to you. She wishes to speak to you herself. Please. Place your hands on the altar, and you will hear her voice.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One does so.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Greetings, mortal. You have followed my guidance through the veils of Twilight and rescued my Star from Malyn Varen. But his soul still resides within, protected by enchantments. Until he is purged, my artifact is useless to you. Is there any way to cleanse the Star?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then why don't you remove it? Aren't you a daedra?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Eventually, the Star will fade into my realm in Oblivion, but I doubt you have the hundred or so years it would take to wait. No, only one option remains. I will send you inside the Star. You will banish Malyn's soul there. Tell me when you are ready, mortal.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm ready to enter the Star.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Have faith, mortal. I will be watching over you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player is sent inside. The dialogue within is the same as on Nelocar's path, so I won't repeat it. After slaying the rogue mage:
label: ACTION

dialogue: The Star is free to purify itself. Don't worry, mortal. I will return you before you are cleansed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player is returned to the shrine.
label: ACTION

dialogue: My Star has been restored and Malyn's soul has been consigned to Oblivion. You have done well, mortal. As was destined, you are free to use my Star as you see fit.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you, Lady Azura.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Farewell, mortal. Know that Azura will be guarding over the threads of your fate in the Twilight.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I dislike the daedra looking into my future.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oblivion has been watching you since the day you were conceived, mortal. Do not think that your life has been served by your will alone. Go now. I have seen the threads of your fate in the Twilight, and you still have much to accomplish.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If one talks to Aranea:
label: ACTION

dialogue: While you were in the Star, Azura gave me a vision. Her last, she said. I have never been without Azura's guidance since escaping Morrowind. I don't know what to do. If you need me, I'd be honored to accompany you, Guardian of the Star. It would give me a purpose.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you, Aranea.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Twilight watch over you, Guardian.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What use would you be?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I was a sorceress of no small skill before I came into Azura's faith. Afterwards, her magic sustained me. I could easily provide my spells to your cause. Protect you from harm. Defeat your enemies.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, Azura isn't giving you any more visions?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. She said my part was over. That my fate had moved beyond the Twilight, and I was on my own. I will tend Azura's shrine when you do not need me. I still have my duties, but for the first time I feel... alone.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: While spelunking in one of Skyrim's many caves, the player finds an odd, round immediately speaks to the player.
label: ACTION

dialogue: A new hand touches the Beacon. Listen. Hear me and obey. A foul darkness has seeped into my temple. A darkness that you will destroy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Or, if one was given the quest by Meridia.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You have found my beacon. But it is not time for rejoicing. The defiler continues to profane my temple. Return to my figure on Mount Kilkreath, and I shall make you the instrument of my cleansing light.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Alternately, the player may encounter the shrine before the beacon, in which case inspecting it give a similar order:
label: ACTION

dialogue: A new supplicant approaches. Listen. Hear me and obey. A foul darkness has seeped into my temple. A darkness that you will destroy. But first, you must restore to me my beacon. I shall guide you unto it. Find it and return here. And great shall be your reward.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player returns the beacon to Mount Kilkreath, west of Solitude.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Look at my temple, lying in ruins. So much for the constancy of mortals, their crafts and their hearts. If they love me not, how can my love reach them?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Restoring the beacon to the statue levitates the player high above the temple, where Meridia holds her dialogue. She manifests as a ball of light.
label: ACTION

dialogue: It is time for my splendor to return to Skyrim. But the token of my truth lies buried in the ruins of my once great temple, now tainted by a profane darkness skittering within. The Necromancer Malkoran defiles my shrine with vile corruptions, trapping lost souls left in the wake of this war to do his bidding. Worse still, he uses the power stored within my own token to fuel his foul deeds. I have brought you here, mortal, to be my champion. You will enter my temple, retrieve my artifact, and destroy the defiler.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me more about this artifact.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mortals call it Dawnbreaker, for it was forged in a holy light that breaks upon my foes, burning away corruption and false life. You will enter my shrine, destroy Malkoran, and retrieve this mighty blade.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It doesn't really sound like I have a choice in the matter.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But a single candle can banish the darkness of the entire Void. If not you, then someone else. My beacon is sure to attract a worthy soul. But if you are wise, you will heed my bidding.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll do it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course you will. I have commanded it! Go now, the artifact my be reclaimed and Malkoran destroyed. Malkoran has forced the doors shut. But this is my temple, and it responds to my decree. I will send down a ray of light. Guide this light through my temple and its doors will open.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player enters the temple, progressing by diverting Meridia's purifying becomes afterward.
label: ACTION

dialogue: It is done. The defiler is defeated. Take Dawnbreaker from its pedestal.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Reclaiming the 1H sword teleports the player high above the shrine again.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Malkoran is vanquished. Skyrim's dead shall remain at rest. This is as it should be. This is because of you. A new day is dawning. And you shall be its herald. Take the mighty Dawnbreaker and with it purge corruption from the dark corners of the world. Wield it in my name, that my influence may grow.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll keep the sword. But find someone else to spread your religion.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It matters not. The plant cares nothing for the rays that bring it the warmth of the sun. As you carry Dawnbreaker, so will my light touch the world.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll wield this mighty blade in your name.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: May the light of certitude guide your efforts.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player is returned to ground level.
label: ACTION

dialogue: The player encounters the orc stronghold of Largashbur, and helps them fight off a giant at their gates.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Halt! You have no business here, outsider. Leave at once.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: By the Ashpit, we can't go on like this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Forgive Ugor's harsh words. She is merely doing as she has been told.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's going on here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It seems like I shouldn't be here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, don't go! Please, our tribe suffers and we need help. Our chief, Yamarz, was once a strong and proud warrior. Now he is stricken, cursed. He is weak, so our tribe is weak. The giants sense this, and intrude on our territory. Now they assault our very home. Yamarz refuses help, but I sense you may be just what we need.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What can I do?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yamarz has demanded we stay inside the walls. We cannot leave. I must petition Malacath for relief. This curse must be lifted. But I cannot travel to Malacath's shrine. The ritual must be done here, and I do not have the materials I need. I beg of you, can you bring me Troll Fat and a Daedra Heart? I have no wish to depend on a stranger, but I have no choice.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Deal with your own curses.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We have been on our own for some time now. I fear we will not survive. I will stay right here and wait for you to bring me what I need.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One soon returns with the needed ingredients.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Here are the things you asked for.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Excellent. Now, you must come with me. You've become a part of this. You must be present for the ritual.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They go to the chief.
label: ACTION

dialogue: It is time, Yamarz.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You bring an outsider here, and now insist I call on Malacath for help, when he has clearly forsaken me? You try my patience, Atub.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Doing nothing will not grant our tribe relief from this curse. We must try.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Grrr. Fine, let's get this over with.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Everyone assembles at the courtyard shrine, scattered with Orc equipment as offerings.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Now, we begin the ritual... Great Malacath, we beseech you, aid us in our time of need...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why are we bothering with this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A voice rings out from somewhere.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You pathetic weakling!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Malacath has heard my pleas! He speaks to us!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You dare summon me, Yamarz?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What? What is this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You don't deserve to call yourself an Orc! You're weak, you're small, and you're an embarrassment. You let giants...Giants!...overrun my shrine! Bring me their leader's club, as an offering and I might release you from this curse!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So it will be. Malacath has spoken, Yamarz. Your path is clear.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Very well. You, outsider, come here! I want a word. This is all your fault, you know. I'm stuck fighting a giant, thanks to you. So you're going to help me. You're going with me, and you're going to make sure I don't have any trouble reaching that giant. Don't worry, I'll make it worth your while.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fighting the giant isn't my job.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thanks to you, I've been issued a challenge in front of my whole tribe, by a Daedric Prince, no less. I can't ignore that. I didn't say I wouldn't fight the giant. I just said you're going to help me get to it. Meet me outside Fallowstone Cave. You clear the way to the giant for me, and I'll make sure you get paid for it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do you want me to do?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This giant... It's not the only thing in Fallowstone Cave. Getting to it isn't going to be easy. You're going to clear a path to the giant, so I can conserve my strength. I'll make sure you're paid for it. So, you meet me at Fallowstone Cave, and I'll get this over with. I can have my tribe back, and you can... You can leave us alone.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The two journey to the cave in the eastern Rift.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Let's just get this over with.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How long has this been going on?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Weeks? Longer? it feels like an age has gone by. I haven't slept in so long.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm just here to help.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, of course! Because Malacath would take pity on us if only a useless outsider would lend us a hand. Let's get this over with.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They proceed inside, fighting off giants and woodland critters, to reach the grove where the giant leader's at.
label: ACTION

dialogue: All right, I'll go kill this giant. Unless, of course, you'd like to make some extra gold.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do you mean?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm tired, I haven't slept well in weeks. You kill the giant, bring me the hammer. We go back to Largashbur, I tell everyone I did it. You keep your mouth shut, and I pay you. Handsomely.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Okay, I'll do it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good. I'll be waiting right here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, you're supposed to do it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fine, then wait here. This should only take a second.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If the player kills the giant in Yamarz' place.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Excellent work. You have a true fighting spirit. Did that better than I could have. Of course, I can't let you leave here alive. Wouldn't want anyone finding out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Either way, Yamarz perishes.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Yamarz was a fool. Always trying to scheme his way out of responsibility. But, you took care of him and the giants. Two problems solved at once. Now, take Shagrol's hammer back to Largashbur, and we'll see about whipping the rest of them into shape.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Upon returning to the stronghold...
label: ACTION

dialogue: Largashbur will not soon forget what you have done. We have a second chance thanks to you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have returned with Shagrol's hammer.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But... What of Yamarz? I see. He did not survive. He... He died well?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He fought bravely, but the giant overwhelmed him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, that is good to hear, then.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He asked me to kill the giant, then attacked me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What? Why would he do such a thing?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yamarz was a coward and a weakling. His deceitful ways have cost you all greatly.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So he has been punished? And what of us? What fate shall we suffer?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'll have to prove yourselves, but I'm willing to give you a chance. Gularzob's in charge now. Let's hope he's a better chief. You, place that hammer on the shrine. You're the only one who's proven worthy in all this...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Placing the giant's hammer on the shrine turns it into the ancient artifact Volundrung, Malacath's reward from ages past.
label: ACTION

dialogue: While exploring Winterhold, one finds an iceberg at sea where a man, Septimus Signus, has made his home. Inside is a magnificent dwarven mechanism.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Dig, Dwemer, in the beyond. I'll know your lost unknown and rise to your depths. When the top level was built, no more could be placed. It was and is the maximal apex.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I heard you know about Elder Scrolls.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Elder Scrolls. Indeed. The Empire. They absconded with them. Or so they think. The ones they saw. The ones they thought they saw. I know of one. Forgotten. Sequestered. But I cannot go to it, no poor Septimus, for I...I have arisen beyond its grasp.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What brings you to this remote place?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The ice entombs the heart. The bane of Kagrenac and Dagoth Ur. To harness it is to know. The fundaments. The Dwemer lockbox hides it from me. The Elder Scroll gives insight deeper than the deep ones, though. To bring about the opening.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have an Elder Scroll? Here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've seen enough to know their fabric. The warp of air, the weft of time. But no, it is not in my possession.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, where is the Scroll?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Here. Well, here as in this plane. Mundus. Tamriel. Nearby, relatively speaking. On the cosmological scale, it's all nearby.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Can you help me get the Elder Scroll or not?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One block lifts another. Septimus will give you what you want, but you must bring him something in return.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't make me hurt you. Just tell me where it is.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, a brutish one. Septimus has no fear of you. But as one block raises another, perhaps ourselves could help us each.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Are you...all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, I am well. I will be well. Well to be within the will inside the walls.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do you want?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You see this masterwork of the Dwemer. Deep inside their greatest knowings. Septimus is clever among men, but he is but an idiot child compared to the dullest of the Dwemer. Lucky then they left behind their own way of reading the Elder Scrolls. In the depths of Blackreach one yet lies. Have you heard of Blackreach? "Cast upon where Dwemer cities slept, the yearning spire hidden learnings kept."
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Where is this "Blackreach"?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Under deep. Below the dark. The hidden keep. Tower Mzark. Alftand. The point of punture, of first entry, of the tapping. Delve to its depths, and Blackreach lies just beyond. But not all can enter there. Only Septimus knows the hidden key to loose the lock to jump beneath the deathly rock.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How do I get in?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Two things I have for you. Two shapes. One edged, one round. The round one, for tuning. Dwemer music is soft and subtle, and needed to open their cleverest gates. The edged lexicon, for inscribing. To us, a hunk of metal. To the Dwemer, a full library of knowings. But...empty. Find Mzark and its sky-dome. The machinations there will read the scroll and lay the lore upon the cube. Trust Septimus. He knows you can know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player can inquire further.
label: ACTION

dialogue: What do I do with this sphere?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The deepest doors of Dwemer listen for singing. It plays the attitude of notes proper for opening. Can you not hear it? Too low for hearings?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do I do with this cube?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: To glimpse the world inside an Elder Scroll can damage the eyes. Or the mind, as it has to Septimus. The Dwemer found a loophole, as they always do. To focus the knowledge away and inside without harm. Place the lexicon into their contraption and focus the knowings into it. When it brims with glow, bring it back and Septimus can read once more.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do you want with the Elder Scroll?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ooooh, an observant one. How clever to ask of Septimus. This Dwemer lockbox. Look upon it and wonder. Inside is the heart. The heart of a god! The heart of you. And me. But it was hidden away. Not by the Dwarves, you see. They were already gone. Someone else. Unseen. Unknown. Found the heart, and with a flair for the ironical, used Dwarven trickery to lock it away. The Scroll will give the deep vision needed to open it. For not even the strongest machinations of the Dwemer can hold off the all-sight given by an Elder Scroll.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is an Elder Scroll?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You look to your left, you see one way. You look to your right, you see another. But neither is any harder than the opposite. But the Elder Scrolls...they look left and right in the stream of time. The future and past are as one. Sometimes they even look up. What do they see then? What if they dive in? Then the madness begins.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player explores the dwemer ruins of Alftand, encountering two bickering spelunkers near the exit.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Sulla, let's just get out of here. Hasn't there been enough death?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, of course you want me to leave. Just waiting for me to turn my back! So you can have all the glory for yourself!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They fight; after, the player picks off the short-lived winner. One activates for Signus' eyes.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I've inscribed the lexicon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Give it, quickly. Extraordinary. I see it now. The sealing structure interlocks in the tiniest fractals. Dwemer blood can loose the hooks, but none alive remain to bear it. A panoply of their brethren could gather to form a facsimile. A trick. Something they didn't anticipate, no, not even them. The blood of Altmer, Bosmer, Dunmer, Falmer, and Orsimer. The elves still living provide the key. Bear you hence this extractor. It will drink the fresh blood of elves. Come when the set is complete.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why are you so eager to open the box?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The box contains a heart. The essence of a god. I have devoted my life to the Elder Scrolls, but their knowledge is a passing awareness when compared to the encompassing mind of divinity. The Dwemer were the last to touch it. It was thought to have been destroyed by the Nerevarine, but my lord told me otherwise.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who is your lord?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Daedric prince of the unknown. Hermaeus Mora. I thought there were no secrets left to know. Until I first spoke to him. He asks a price -- to work his will. A few murders, some dissent spread, a plague or two. For the secrets I can endure. In time, he brought me here. To the box. But he won't reveal how to open it. Maddening.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: On the way out, Hermaeus Mora appears himself, appearing as an abyss with tentacles and floating eyeballs emerging from its portal.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Come closer. Bask in my presence.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who are you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am Hermaeus Mora. • I am the guardian of the unseen, and knower of the unknown. I have been watching you, mortal. Most impressive. • I have been watching you since you defeated Miraak. Your progress is most impressive.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do you want of me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your continuing aid to Septimus renders him increasingly obsolete. He has served me well, but his time is nearing its end. Once that infernal lockbox is opened, he will have exhausted his usefulness to me. When that time comes, you shall take his place as my emissary. What say you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am your servant, my lord.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Indeed. Speak with me when the box has been opened, and all shall be revealed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll never join you, vile demon!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Be warned. Many have thought as you do. I have broken them all. You shall not evade me forever.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After the blood collection's done, one returns to the outpost.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I've brought all the blood you require.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can almost...hear them. I feel their life energy. Come, I will make the mixture.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He injects himself with the blood, opening the magnificent Dwemer lock. They book.
label: ACTION

dialogue: What is this...it's...it's just a book?! I can see. The world beyond burns in my mind. It's marvelous...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Septimus' body turns to ash after reading the book. The player takes it, now knowing it to be the Oghma Infinium, Hermaeus Mora's powerful artifact.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Come, my champion.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What now?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am not your champion, monster.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who do you think brought Septimus here? Who do you think protected you on your journey to open the box and loose my knowledge on this world? Your free will is an illusion. Whether you acknowledge me or not is your own business. But I will be in your mind. Now you have my Oghma Infinium. It contains the knowledge of the ages as revealed to Xarses, my loyal servant. For hundreds of years it's been shut away from the world. Septimus was a useful tool for unleashing it. Now it is in your hands. Let us work wonders together...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In Markarth, the player finds a Vigilant of Stendarr, Tyrannus, loitering in front of an abandoned house.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Excuse me, but do you know anything about this house? Seen anyone enter or leave?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why are you asking?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm with the Vigil of Stendarr. We believe this house might have been used for Daedra worship. Evil rites and so forth.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, I haven't.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Seems no one in this city has.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not sure.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Damn. It's like everyone in this city has amnesia.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do you need any help?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I was actually just about to head on inside. Be good to have someone watch my back. Follow me, and keep your eyes open. Daedra are powerful creatures and tricksters. Never know what you'll find.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sorry. I don't know anything.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you for your time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Together, they enter the house.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Fresh food. No wood rot on the furniture. Someone's been here. Recently. But the people I asked say no one enters or leaves... Wait? Did you hear that? I think it came this way. That's it. Something's inside the house. Come on, we're getting to the bottom of this. Come out! We know you're here! There's another door. See if you can get it open.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The door is locked. Touching it makes furniture fly around and the atmosphere suddenly change to a more...evil one.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Stendarr's mercy! This isn't an ordinary Daedra. We have to get help.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A voice speaks to the player's mind.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Weak. He's weak. You're strong. Crush him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You first. Come on, let's go.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They find the front door is now also locked by supernatural forces.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Get out of my head, Daedra!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You will kill. You will kill, or you will die!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't want to die. I can't die here! The Daedra has us. It's you or me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player kills the attacking Vigilant, which stops the disturbances.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Yes. Your reward is waiting for you, mortal. Further down. Yes. Further. Into the bowels. So close. Your prize is waiting.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Deep inside the basement, through an old tunnel, is the prize: a mace stuck in an altar. Reaching for it traps the player in a demonic-looking cage.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Fool! Did you think Molag Bal, the Lord of Domination, would so easily reward you? What do you see from that little cage? Speak.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's an altar.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. It's an altar. Men would come and sacrifice the wretched in my name. The weak would be punished by the strong. But a Daedric Lord has his enemies, and my rival Boethiah had her priest desecrate the altar. Until you came.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A mace. It's rusted.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Rusted. Dry. There was a time when this mace dripped with the blood of the feeble and the worthless. But a Daedric Lord has his enemies, and my rival Boethiah had her priest desecrate it. Left it here to decay. Until you came.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I only see the spikes of this trap.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sharp, aren't they? This was the last thing many saw before they were sacrificed in my name. But a Daedric Lord has his enemies, and my rival Boethiah had her priest desecrate it. So long since it's tasted blood. Until you came.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You want revenge on Boethiah?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Revenge? No. I want submission. I want the priest who did this to bend his knee and give me his soul. He comes by to perform Boethiah's insulting rites at my altar, but he's been missing. Captured and bound. Left to rot. Save him. Let him perform his rite one more time. And when he does, we will be waiting for him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I never wanted to help you. Let me go!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fine. I offered you a reward. You'll get the freedom your kind enjoys so much. But Boethiah's priest is imprisoned as well. But not by me. He is hurt. Suffering. Save him. Let him perform his rites one more time. And when he does, I will be waiting for him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player finds Boethiah's priest, Logrolf the Willful, captured in the designated location.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You there. Are you here to kill me? Slay the mighty Logrolf while he sits tied and helpless?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm here to rescue you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Rescue? No one knew where I was, when I was taken. Who sent you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Boethiah has sent me. (Persuade)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Dark Mistress? She sent you? Wait. Molag Bal's altar. Of course. I have to get to Markarth at once. Cut me loose.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Dark Mistress? Sent you? Ha. Now tell me the one about the Troll who gives gifts to good little boys and girls.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Does it matter? Here. ( gold)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fine. I won't ask questions. Cut me loose.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You think it's money I need? I'm a prisoner, not a beggar.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Molag Bal. (Intimidate)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So. The King of Corruption sends his messenger to challenge me. Very well. I will meet with Molag Bal, and I will venerate his altar in Boethiah's name, as I did before. Cut me loose, minion of the Hated One. I need to get to Markarth.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You? A servant of the King of Corruption? Has the beast's standards fallen so far? Tell me another one.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Never mind. Stay here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have a choice?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Here. Let me untie those binds.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, freedom. Now get out of my way. I have a task to attend to.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wait here a moment.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's all I can do, you idiot. What are you waiting for?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'll stay that way for now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Coward. You're nothing. Nothing!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The two journey back to Molag Bal's altar in Markarth. As promised, the Lord umpteenth time.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Molag Bal. You think you can best Boethiah's faithful? I have won this contest before!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah. But I have my own champion this time, Logrolf.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What? You!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mortal. I give you my mace, in all its rusted spitefulness. Crush the spirit from Logrolf's bones. Make him bend to me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player is enlisted to beat the man with the rusted, barbed mace, while him.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Ah ha ha! You mortals and your frail, limp, pathetic bodies. Try it again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Molag Bal revives the priest for another beatdown session.
label: ACTION

dialogue: No more... No more... I submit, Molag Bal. I submit!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You bend to me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You pledge your soul to me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You forsake the weak and pitiful Boethiah?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're mine now, Logrolf. Kill him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player slays Logrolf on the altar.
label: ACTION

dialogue: The Mace of Molag Bal! I give you its true power, mortal. When your enemies lie broken and bloody before you, know that I will be watching.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you, Lord Molag Bal.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now, I have a soul in Oblivion that needs claiming. Take care of the house while I'm gone. Ha ha ha!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A mace? This is hardly a fitting prize.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Know your place, mortal. Or Molag Bal may just send another challenger to reclaim his mace from your broken corpse.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In Falkreath, one comes upon a funeral. A man and woman are with a priest.
label: ACTION

dialogue: The god Arkay was once like us, bound to winding mortality. But he willingly gave up this existence that we might better understand the vagaries of life and death. It is through the ebb and flow of this cosmic tide that we find renewal and, in the end, peace. May the spirit of Lavinia and all those who have left this world and its suffering know the beloved serenity of Aetherius...and may we one day join them in eternity.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The service ends.
label: ACTION

dialogue: A sad time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who died?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Our daughter. Our little girl. She hadn't seen her tenth winter.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How did she die?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She was...he ripped her apart. Like a sabre cat tears a deer. We barely found enough of her bury.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who did this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sinding. Came through as a laborer. Seemed like a decent man. He's stewing in the pit while we figure out what to do with him, if you've got the stomach to look at him. What could drive a man to do something like this? I just don't understand what kind of man does that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player visits Sinding in the barracks' jail.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Come to gawk at the monster?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I heard you attacked a little girl.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Believe me, it wasn't anything I ever intended to do. I just...lost control. I tried to tell them, but none of them believe me. It's all on account of this blasted ring.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What ring?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This is the Ring of Hircine. I was told it could let me control my transformations. Perhaps it used to. But I'll never know. Hircine didn't care for my taking it, and threw a curse on it. I put it on... and the changes just came to me. I could never guess when. It would be at the worst times. Like...with the little girl.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What kind of transformations?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't suppose there's a point in keeping the secret if I'm going to die in here anyway. I'm sure you've heard of men who shift to beasts under the influence of the moons. I am one of them. A werewolf. It's my secret, and my shame. That's why I wanted the ring...it was said to give men like me control. Now I may look like a man, but I still feel the animal inside me, as strong as ever.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What will you do now?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've been looking for a way to appease Hircine. There is a certain beast in these lands. Large, majestic. It's said that Hircine will commune with whoever slays it. I tracked it into these woods, but then had my...accident with the child. I want to beg his forgiveness. Give him back the ring. But while I'm stuck in here, the beast wanders free.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll take the ring to Hircine.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh my. You would do this for me? Here, take it. I don't want anything to do with this wretched thing anymore. Seek out the beast. He wanders these woods. Bring him down and...well, the Lord of the Hunt should smile on you. I wish you luck, but should leave here while I still have my skin. Should our paths cross again, I will remember your kindness. Farewell.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who is Hircine?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do you not know the Daedric Lord of the Hunt? He revels in the chase, and also gave the "gift" of lycanthropy to mortals. A powerful force, not to be crossed. As I learned too late.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why did this make you attack the girl?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I had just come into Falkreath. They needed some help working the mill, and I thought that would be something safe. Something I could do. When I saw the little girl, I was just...I could feel it coming on. I could taste the...I needed to hunt. But this pitiful, limited body wasn't meant for hunting. Slow. No claws. Weak, mashing teeth for chewing cud. I held in my rage as long as I could. But it boiled inside of me. She looked so fragile. Helpless prey. And then... I... I feel terrible about what happened. About what I did. It would probably be best for everyone if I just went away.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player takes the cursed ring, which equips itself automatically. After Daedric Lord manifests as its spirit.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Well met, hunter.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Are you Hircine?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am the spirit of the hunt, just one glimpse of the glorious stalker that your kind calls Hircine.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What would you ask of me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your fealty is precious to me. I will make good use of it. You bear my ring.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Will you remove the curse from this ring?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I may consider it. But you must first do a service for my glory. The one who stole it has fled to what he thinks is his sanctuary. Just as a bear climbs a tree to escape a hunt, but only ends up trapping himself. Seek out this rogue shifter. Tear the skin from his body, and make it an offering to me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It shall be done as you ask.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fly, my hunter. There are others who vie for my favor. A bit of competition. Don't dally while the prey flees.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He's done me no wrong. I won't kill him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There is no retribution in the hunt. It is not vengeance I seek, but the blood course of a living hunt. There are others who would gladly accept my favor. They will hunt him while you delay. Your choice.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Didn't I just kill you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And skillfully, too. I've been watching you for ages, it seems. You have the makings of a fine hunter. You may even be my champion. Perhaps.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player arrives at the sanctuary, Bloated Man's Grotto. A wounded hunter's near the entrance bonfire; his companions lays eviscerated.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Has the Bloodmoon called you, fellow hunter?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What happened here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The prey is strong. Stronger than the hunters. But more will come. Bring him down, for the glories of Lord Hircine.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After the Khajiit hunter dies, one sees the transformed Sinding nearby.
label: ACTION

dialogue: ...You! Why?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've been told to kill you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And I would deserve it, wouldn't I? I can't stop you if that's what you want to do. Hircine is too powerful. But if you spare me, I can be a powerful ally to you. And I would promise to never return to civilized life. I know now that I can't live among people.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I will spare your life.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank the gods. Now let's deal with these hunters. We hunt together!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I cannot defy Hircine. You have to die.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So be it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If one agrees to spare Sinding:
label: ACTION

dialogue: What the...we've been betrayed! Look out!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Soon after...
label: ACTION

dialogue: The last of the hunters is dead.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you for your help. I will make my home here, away from anyone I might hurt.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If one kills Sinding:
label: ACTION

dialogue: You've done well, hunter.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I did as you asked.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And found my favor. That skin will serve you well, child. Look more closely at it. My glories shall protect you from all this world's grievances. Good hunting.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If Sinding is spare, the aspect of Hircine approaches after exiting the cave.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Well met again, Hunter.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I failed to bring down Sinding.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not a failure, my servant.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I defy you and your vile tasks.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So you may think. By bringing down my other Hunters, you turned the chase inside out. And they were no base prey. You continue to amuse and impress. Go forth, with my blessing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: While walking in Solitude, the player encounters a strange old man.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Wait, here my plea! My master, he is lost between worlds and I cannot bring him back!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do you need?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My master has abandoned me! Abandoned his people. And nothing I say can change his mind. Now he refuses to even see me. He says I interrupt his vacation! It's been so many years... Won't you please help?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How can I find your master?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Last I saw him, he was visiting a friend in the Blue Palace. But no one as mundane as the Jarl. No, no...such people are below him. No, he went into the forbidden wing of the palace, to speak with an old friend. Said it had been ages since they had last had tea. Oh and you'll need the hip bone...it's very important. No entering Pelagius' Wing without that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why don't you leave your master?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, you just don't understand. Without him, I am not free! Without him, I am doomed! All of his empire shall fall into chaos...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player can question Dervenin more afterwards.
label: ACTION

dialogue: How can I get to your master?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He stays in the Pelagius Wing of the Blue Palace. The doors are locked, and only Falk Firebeard can grant entry. But I hear the maids, Una and Erdi, know how to enter it for cleaning. Surely they can help for such an important matter?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why do you need him back?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Without his guidance, our homeland is falling apart. North wages war against south! The holy flame flickers and dies! We need his return. Oh, but...I'm sure he'll repay you when he comes to his senses! His favor is a powerful, powerful thing. And so very worth any... inconveniences.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who is your master?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He is a great man, but one rarely praised! He rules twin empires that span the length and breadth of our minds! All know him, but few can name him! But...he has forbidden me from saying his name. He says it distracts him, and woe to those who draw his ire. But you will know him when you see him. He's the one who made me like this!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If one seeks out Una:
label: ACTION

dialogue: Got lots of things to take care of. What do you need?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I need to get into the Pelagius Wing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not on your life. It's dangerous in there, and Falk doesn't even like me and Erdi going in every year to clean out the spiders.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Falk asked me to check it out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you really want to... Just be careful of the ghost! He snuck up on me once and scared me sick. It took me a week for me to feel better... You can catch me at the Blue Palace later, if you want to talk again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If one seeks out Erdi:
label: ACTION

dialogue: Are you my gallant hero? Have you come to whisk me away, to a life of adventure and romance?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I need to get into the Pelagius Wing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, I'd get in trouble for that. It's not allowed. Besides, it's scary in there!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Falk asked me to check it out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well...I suppose in that case, it's okay to let you in. But only briefly. Be careful, and come right back!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If one seeks out Falk Firebeard:
label: ACTION

dialogue: Absolutely not. That wing has been sealed for hundreds of years, and for good reason. They say the ghost of Pelagius the Mad still haunts it. Ghost or not, there are reminders of his dark rule that are best left buried away.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Eventually, the player gains access to the wing. While walking the halls, one "master" Dervenin spoke of. He's having tea with Pelagius the Mad.
label: ACTION

dialogue: More tea, Pelly my dear?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, I couldn't. Goes right through me. Besides, I have so many things to do... So many undesirables to contend with. Naysayers. Buffoons. Detractors. Why, my headsman hasn't slept in three days!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You are far too hard on yourself, my dear, sweet, homicidally insane Pelagius. What would the people do without you? Dance? Sing? Smile? Grow old? You are the best Septim that's ever ruled. Well, except for that Martin fellow, but he turned into a dragon god, and that's hardly sporting... You know, I was there for that whole sordid affair. Marvelous time! Butterflies, blood, a Fox, a severed head... Oh, and the cheese! To die for.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, yes, as you've said, countless times before...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hafrumph! Well then, if you're going to be like that... Perhaps it's best if I take my leave. A good day to you sir. I said good day!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, yes, go. Leave me to my ceaseless responsibilities and burdens...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Pelagius vanishes as the player walks over.
label: ACTION

dialogue: How rude! Can't be bothered to host an old friend for a decade or two.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm here to deliver a message.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Reeeaaalllyyyy? Ooh, ooh, what kind of message? A song? A summons? Wait, I know! A death threat written on the back of an Argonian concubine. Those are my favorite. Well? Spit it out, mortal. I haven't got an eternity! Actually...I do. Little joke. But seriously. What's the message?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I was asked to retrieve you from your vacation.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Were you now? By whom? Wait! Don't tell me. I want to guess! Was it Molag? No, no...Little Tim, the toymaker's son? The ghost of King Lysandus? Or was it... Yes! Stanley, that talking grapefruit from Passwall. Wrong on all accounts, aren't I? Ha! No matter! Honestly, I don't want to know. Why ruin the surprise? But more to the point. Do you -- tiny, puny, expendible little mortal -- actually think you can convince someone like me to leave? Because that's...crazy. You do realize who you're dealing with here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think I made a mistake coming here...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, no no no! No mistake at all. What you made was a choice. Granted, not a very wise choice, but these things happens. Ah, the folly of youth... You know, you remind me of myself at a young age. All I cared about was riding narwhales and sleeping in honeycombs and drinking babies' tears... Word of advice if you ride a Narwhale. Mind the pointy end. Ah, but there I go, waxing poetic about my misspent youth. Now where were we? Ah yes. You're the mortal messenger. An I am...? Honestly. Have you any idea?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm afraid I don't know, sir.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wrong! Actually, you do. Sort of. I am a part of you, little mortal. I am a shadow in your subconscious, a blemish on your fragile little psyche. You know me. You just don't know it. Sheogorath, Daedric Prince of Madness. At your service.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All I know is that your people need you to return.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: apologize, it's just that I find myself suddenly and irrevocably... Bored! I mean, really. Here you stand, before Sheogorath himself, Daedric Prince of Madness, and all you deem fit to do is...deliver a message? How sad.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're a madman.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Jolly good guess! But only half right. I'm a mad god. The Mad God, actually. It's a family title. Gets passed down from me to myself every few thousand years. Now you. You can call me Ann Marie. But only if you're partial to being flayed alive and having an angry immortal skip rope with your entrails. If not... Then call me Sheogorath, Daedric Prince of Madness. Charmed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who were you talking to?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Emperor Pelagius III. Now surely even you know about Pelagius' decree? On his deathbed -- oh, and this was inspired -- he forbade...death! That's right! Death! Outlawed!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wait, where are we?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Inside the mind of Pelagius, silly. Oh. Is it your...first time?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player delivers the message.
label: ACTION

dialogue: So does that mean you'll leave? Or not?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now that's the real question, isn't it? Because honestly, how much time off could a demended Daedra really need? So here's what I'm going to do. I'm going to leave. That's right. I'm done. Holiday... complete. Time to return to the hum drum day-to-day. On one condition. You have to find your way out first. Good luck with that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Simple.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Okay, what's the catch?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ha! I do love it when the mortals know they're being manipulated. Makes things infinitely more interesting. Care to take a look around? This is not, I dare say, the Solitude botanical gardens. Have you any idea where you are? Where you truly are? Welcome to the deceptively verdant mind of Emperor Pelagius III. That's right! You're in the head of a dead, homicidally insane monarch. Now, I know what you're thinking. Can I still rely on my swords and spells and sneaking and all that nonsense? Sure, sure. Or...you could use...The Wabbajack! Huh? Huh? Didn't see that coming, did you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He hands the player his artifact for the journey. One picks a path, earning a brief narration from the Mad God.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You've headed down the path of dreams. Unfortunately for you, Pelagius suffered night terrors from a young age. All you need to do is find something to wake our poor Pelagius up. You'll find his terrors easy to repel...but persistent.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player fends off his wicked dreams, using the Wabbajack to turn them into adorable things, like goats and pretty girls.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Well, now that's something to crow about. With Pelagius up and about you're moving right along. We'll both be home in no time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One goes down the next, ice-filled path.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Ah, now this is a sad path. Pelagius hated and feared many things. Assassins, wild dogs, the undead, pumpernickel... But the deepest, keenest hatred was for himself. The attacks he makes on himself can be seen here fully. They are always carried out on the weakest part of his fragile self. The self-loathing enhances Pelagius' anger! Ah, but his confidence will shrink with every hit. You must bring the two into balance.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player finds two Pelagius, one big and one small; the former attacks the latter. The Wabbajack tips the battle's scales.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Wonderfully done. Pelagius is finally ready to love himself...and continue hating everyone else.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One traverses the final path.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Oh, good choice. Well, good for me. I find everyone being out to get you so terribly entertaining. You might find it...less so. You see, Pelagius' mother was...well...let us say "unique." Although, I suppose in the grand scheme of things, she was fairly average for a Septim. That woman wielded fear like a cleaver. Or did she wield a cleaver and make people afraid? I never get that part right... Oh, but she taught her son well. Pelagius learned at a very young age that danger could come from anywhere. At any time. Delivered... by anyone.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He finds a small arena where Pelly is fighting an atronach.
label: ACTION

dialogue: The objective here is simple, you simpleton! Use your Wabbajack to defeat the enemy, while they do the same!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player transforms the fighters, then uses the 'Jack on some spectators, turning them into participants too.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Oho! I thought you'd never figure it out. With the threat gone, Pelagius is under the delusion that he is safe, which means you've helped him out...sort of. And we're that much closer to home.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: With all trials done, it's back to Sheogorath.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I've done it. I've fixed Pelagius' mind.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hmmmm... "Fixed" is such a subjective term. I think "treated" is far more appropriate, don't you? Like one does to a rash, or an arrow in the face. Ah, but no matter. Heartless mortal that you are, you've actually succeeded and survived. I am forced to honor my end of the bargain. So congratulations! You're free to go! I... have been known to change my mind. So...go. Really.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player goes to leave.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Pelagius Septim the III, once the Mad Emperor of Tamriel, now so boringly sane. I always knew he had it in him! Well, I suppose it's back to the Shivering Isles. The trouble Haskill can get into while I'm gone simply boggles the mind... Let's make sure I'm not forgetting anything. Clothes? Check. Beard? Check! Luggage? Luggage! Now where did I leave my luggage?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The "luggage," Dervenin, teleports in.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Master! You've taken me back! Does this mean we're going home? Oh, happy times! I can't wait to...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, yes, that's quite enough celebration. Let's send you ahead, shall we?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He teleports Dervenin out.
label: ACTION

dialogue: And as for you, my little mortal minion... Feel free to keep the Wabbajack. As a symbol of my... Oh, just take the damn thing. You take care of yourself, now. And if you ever find yourself up in New Sheoth, do look me up. We can share a strawberry torte. Ha ha! Ta ta!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player is teleported back to the Blue Palace.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Atop a mountain the Reach, one encounters Peryite's shrine. Kesh the Clean, a Khajiit acolyte, is the only one who lives here.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Ah, a wanderer, yes? No? Pilgrim, perhaps? You have come to commune with Peryite, Taskmaster and blighted Lord, yes?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: May I commune with Peryite?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not everyone has the stomach required to entreat my Lord. But Kesh likes you, friend. There is a way Peryite may speak to us who will take Him in. If you wish to commune with Him, we'll need the incense.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me about this incense.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, the incense. Fetch for me a deathbell flower, one silver ingot, a flawless ruby, and some vampire dust. Then I will show you how.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me about Peryite.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He is the pus in the wound. Oh, proper ones curl their noses, but it's pus that drinks foul humors and restores the blood. I worship Peryite, yes, because sometimes the world can only be cleansed by disease.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player later returns with the ingredients.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I have the items you requested.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, have you? Let Kesh have them. Yes, yes. This will create a fine fume.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He creates a batch of green liquid in a large dwarven container.
label: ACTION

dialogue: That should do. Now -- inhale deeply.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player inhales and their vision blurs; they see strange colors all around. Rat familiars is crawling around, representing the Aspect of Peryite.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Breath deep, mortal. I would have you hear me well, so let these vapors fill your lungs.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do you want with me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have watched you for some time, you know. The decisions you've made intrigue me, and I wonder if you are the proper agent for a task of mine.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is this? Have I been poisoned?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In a sense, but no more poisoned than a fool after too much wine.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What task?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I sent a blessing to Mundus, a wasting plague that infected a scattering of Breton villages. One of my monks, the elf Orchendor, was sent to gather these Afflicted. He shepherded them into Bhtardamz for me, but has since lost his way. I will not stand for betrayal. I want you to go to Bthardamz and kill Orchendor, in my name.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What would I gain from this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The pettiness of mortals. I had almost forgotten. I can grant you a powerful token for this task. An escutcheon of Dwemer make, capable of shielding you from both the spell and sword. Return when the elf lies dead and it will be yours.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why does Orchendor deserve to die?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: An impertinent question. The elf must die. Either carry out my will or do not. You are not the only mortal agent I could choose.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I heard your request. Release me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So you have, mortal. Go now. Kill Orchendor.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The gas evaporates. Kesh can be asked about the task.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Who is Orchendor?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Orchendor? Kesh knew him. He's an Overseer. Shepherd. Gathers the Afflicted, contains the festering wound. Orchendor and his Afficted are meant to stand ready, awaiting Peryite's command to cover the world with his blessing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Where is Bthardamz?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not far, not far. This one looks upon it on clear days. Look to the west, at the foot of the mountain. The Dwarven ruins there. Bthardamz.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Orchendor is located deep within the forgotten city. After killing the man, one returns to Peryite.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Well done, mortal. All things are in their order, and Orchendor roams the Pits. His betrayal will be punished, and your obedience is rewarded.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What happens now?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Go, seek your fate. I will be watching, and perhaps we will meet again -- afterwards.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What will become of the Afflicted?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Did you leave any alive? The Afflicted are mere vessels for my Blessing. It will spread to others through their touch and my own. Another Overseer will replace Orchendor, when the time comes. For now all is cleansed and ordered.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't relish being a Daedra's puppet.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And yet you have done my bidding. Why, I wonder?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Very well. Goodbye.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Embrace order and hard truth, mortal. Good bye.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player receives the Spellbreaker shield, which puts up a 50-point ward when blocking.
label: ACTION

dialogue: When a certain level is reached, a courier delivers a notice about a museum when the player arrives.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Your ancestors wouldn't want this, Silus!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why should I hide from it? This is my family's legacy!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's the past! Dead oaths on dead lips. Let it stay there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The museum is opening, Madena.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She walks off.
label: ACTION

dialogue: And here comes my first visitor. The Museum of the Mythic Dawn is open, friend!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Museum of the Mythic Dawn?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. My collection of artifacts from a group that toppled an Empire.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What was that argument about?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Never mind that. Madena is a good woman, but I have my own reasons for opening this museum, and I'm not changing my mind. I have a collection of artifacts from the group that toppled an Empire. Their importance to history cannot be forgotten. Why don't you come in? You can browse the displays, and we can talk. I have a job you look perfect for.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sounds good.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's talk inside.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not interested.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your loss, but if you change your mind, I'll be here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: His home is now partially renovated to show Mythic Dawn trinkets and curios.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Feel free to look around. Come talk to me when you're ready to discus that job I mentioned.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player can look at the cases, drawing comments from the owner.
label: ACTION

dialogue: The tapestries hung here and outside were found in hideouts where members of the Mythic Dawn would meet and plot. The cult's greatest accomplishment was the assassination of the Septim Dynasty and the opening of the Oblivion Gates.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Those robes were worn during the Mythic Dawn's secret meetings, where they plotted to bring the Daedra Mehrunes Dagon into Tamriel. Each bolt of yarn used to make the robe was colored with a dye made from sacrificial blood.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That burned paper is all that remains of the fabled Mysterium Xarxes. The blasphemous book written by Mehrunes Dagon himself. It's said that Mankar Camoran used the book to open a portal to a Paradise where all his followers would live forever.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The commentaries on the Mysterium Xarxes were written by the Mythic Dawn cult leader, Mankar Camoran. He promised a paradise awaited his followers when they died, that they would be reborn by Mehrunes Dagon's side.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, yes. That scabbard. Notice the insignia? An Oblivion Gate. A key symbol of Mehrunes Dagon, the patron Daedra of the Mythic Dawn.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Eventually, all the displays are observed.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Did you have any questions about the museum, or would you rather talk business?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's talk about this job you want done.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A little history, first. After the Oblivion Crisis, a number of groups cropped up dedicated to wiping out the remnants of the Mythic Dawn. One of these groups found Mehrunes' Razor, the artifact of Dagon. They split it into three fragments and pledged to keep them apart forever. That was almost 150 years ago, and the pieces are still being kept by the descendants of that group. And they're right here, in Skyrim.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You want me to get those fragments?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: At least two of the owners, Ghunzul and Drascua, are dangerous marauders. And the third owner, Jorgen, I only know he lives in Morthal. Here are my notes about them. I'll gladly pay you for getting the pieces any way you can. No questions asked.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Stop right there. I'm not interested.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fine. I can't force you to help me, but the offer is open.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why did you open this museum?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's no secret that my family were once members of the Mythic Dawn. One of my forefathers was even chosen to assassinate Uriel Septim himself. We hid from our past for years, became tradesmen, people of coin and influence. But I realized that the Mythic Dawn's importance -- our importance -- to history cannot be denied. I'll see everyone in Tamriel remember that for a moment, we held the fate of the world in our hands, for good or ill.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So what is this Mythic Dawn cult?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They were worshippers of Mehrunes Dagon, the Daedric Lord of Destruction and Change. The Mythic Dawn killed Uriel Septim VII and his heirs, triggering the events that lead to the Oblivion Crisis, when the Daedra invaded Tamriel. All that remains of the infamous cult, I've gathered in my museum.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who is Mehrunes Dagon?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, an excellent question. Mehrunes Dagon is the Daedric Lord of Change, Destruction, and Ambition. Dagon's Mythic Dawn cult killed the Septim Dynasty and opened the Oblivion Gates into Tamriel. They called it the Oblivion Crisis.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I want to know more about the Razor.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Razor is Mehrunes Dagon's personal artifact. It has always heralded bloody change and carnage. It's held many names: Dagger of Final Wounds, Bane of the Righteous, the Kingslayer. The Mythic Dawn worshipped Dagon as a god. Having his Razor would be invaluable to my collection. Good luck finding the fragments.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player gets two pieces from marauders. The third piece is held by a mill worker in Morthal.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I'm looking for pieces of Mehrunes' Razor.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't know what you're talking about, stranger.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Really? Silus Vesuius says otherwise.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've heard of him. My father had suspicions about his connection to the Mythic Dawn. Guess they were true. I don't need this. My family wasted 8 generation keeping that Razor safe from a dead cult. As far as I care, it can stay locked in my house.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You won't miss it, then. (Persuade)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You want the hilt that bad? Fine. Here's the keys. It's locked in a chest inside my house.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll pay for the hilt. ( gold)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Divines know the mill could use some new blades. All right. It's yours. Here's the keys. It's locked in the chest inside my house.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Give me the hilt, or things get ugly. (Intimidate)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Easy. Here. These are the keys. The hilt is in a chest in my house, just don't hurt anyone.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Never mind, then.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Best leave the past buried, I say.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player revisits Silus after all pieces are reclaimed.
label: ACTION

dialogue: What is it? Do you have one of the Razor fragments?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have all the pieces of the Razor.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All at once! You're efficient. I like that. Here's your reward.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The hilt of Mehrunes' Razor, as promised.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Did you try the grip? Isn't it eerie how it seems to mold itself into your hand? Here's your gold.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Here's the pommel stone of Mehrunes' Razor.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Our master craftsman are nothing compared to the perfection of the Daedra. Look how it shines. Here's your gold, as promised.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have the blade shards of Mehrunes' Razor.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look at them. The legendary sharpness of the deadric weapon. Marvelous. And here's your payment for the shards.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If pieces are given over individually, Silus will have additional comments after each is given. They depend on the order delivered:
label: ACTION

dialogue: • We just need the hilt and pommel now. • We just need the shards of the blade and the hint, now. • We just need the pommel and the shards of the blade, now. • There's only the hilt left to collect. Exciting, isn't it? • There's only the pommel left to collect. Exciting, isnt it? • There's only the shards of the blade left to collect. Exciting, isn't it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After all are given...
label: ACTION

dialogue: Finally, all the pieces of Mehrunes' Razor are in my hands. It's time I let you in on something. There's a fourth piece. That scabbard in the display case. Built to house the Razor. And there's more. I know how to put all the pieces together. We just need to take them to Dagon's shrine and contact the Lord of Change directly.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You think Dagon will repair the Razor?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ever since I was a boy, I felt this strange sense of destiny surrounding the Mythic Dawn cult, and now I know what it is. Don't you see? Fate has led you to me and to the pieces. Dagon has to answer our call. We're so close. I'll meet you at the shrine.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This sounds like a terrible idea...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You don't want to be part of history? Fine. I'll be at the shrine if you change your mind.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They find the Dagon shrine high up on a snowy peak, south of Dawnstar.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Good. You're here. I'll place the pieces on the altar, and Dagon should speak to us. Mehrunes Dagon, the Lord of Change, we have brought your Razor to you. We beg you, please bring the blade's full glory to Tamriel again! It's not working. Why don't you give it a try? Just put your hands on the altar.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Doing so causes Dagon's voice to ring out.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You. Mortal. You are worthy of speaking to. You have claimed the pieces of my Razor. It has been an amusing game to witness. But Dagon does not declare a winner while there is a pawn on the board. Kill Silus. He and his family have served their purpose.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It will be done, Lord Dagon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Kill him. Take your rightful place as my champion, or I will crush you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He helped me find the pieces. He deserves to live.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Only Dagon can declare if a pawn is worth keeping. I. Have. Spoken. Kill him. Take your rightful place as my champion, or I will crush you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wait. Wait. Don't kill me. There's another way. I can take the pieces back to my museum. Seal them in a display case. You get a generous amount of gold, I get to complete my collection, and nobody has to die.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Dagon has spoken.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fine. I'm not dying without a fight!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fine. Get out of here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you. Here's your gold. I'll make a run for it back to Dawnstar.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If the player kills Silus:
label: ACTION

dialogue: I am pleased, mortal. I will give you my Razor. Use it to wreak havoc on Tamriel!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you, Lord Dagon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have been a worthy tool. Fill the world with destruction in my name.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I will use the Razor as I see fit, Dagon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Spare me your pitiful pride. You are but a tool for my ambitions, mortal. Never forget that. Place your hands on my altar one last time, and you will witness the power of Mehrunes Dagon for yourself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: When the reforged Razor is acquired, or Silus flees, the player must contend with summoned Dremora lackeys to fight. Dagon's parting shot will differ:
label: ACTION

dialogue: Before you go, mortal. One final challenge. Ha ha ha.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You think to betray Mehrunes Dagon? Suffer!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In Markarth, one learns the Hall of the Dead is closed, much to the city's chagrin. A priest, Brother Verulus, is arguing in Understone Keep.
label: ACTION

dialogue: What are you hiding, priest?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not hiding anything. It's closed for a reason.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Typical Imperial lies. First you take away Talos, now you're keeping us from seeing our honored dead? You and the Jarl will answer for any desecration of my ancestors' bodies.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's enough, Thongvor. We're done.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Verulus goes to stand guard at the Hall's entrance.
label: ACTION

dialogue: If it's about the Hall of the Dead, no, you can't go in there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why not?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can't talk about it. Rest assured, the Jarl hears everyone's concerns. You will be able to visit the dead again soon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I could help if you tell me. (Persuade)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right. I was going to suggest the Jarl hire someone to sort this mess out, anyway.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Would some coin help? ( gold)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, the Priesthood of Arkay always accepts generous donations.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's not going to work.
label: CHARACTER
