dialogue: I don't like being ignored. (Intimidate)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then my answer is the Hall of the Dead is closed. By order of the Jarl. Understand?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll come back later, then.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Arkay keep you and protect you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's the Hall of the Dead?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: New to Skyrim? I was confused, too, at first. The Nords call their mausoleums the Hall of the Dead. It's where people in the city are buried. Fathers. Forefathers. Mothers. Foremothers.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who's Arkay?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Arkay. One of the Eight Divines. God of the Cycle of Birth and Death. It is his shrine people pray to when they visit the Hall. That his divinity will watch over their ancestors on the way to the next life.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player convinces the priest to discuss more.
label: ACTION

dialogue: We've discovered that some of the dead have been...eaten. Flesh has been chewed off, bones were snapped to get at the marrow inside. We haven't caught anyone or anything yet. It's like it knows when I'm there. If you can get to the bottom of this, the Priesthood of Arkay will reward you. Take my key and be careful... Tread lightly in the Hall. We don't know what's in there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player enters the crypt within the dwemer ruins. A voice rings out.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Not many would walk blindly into a crypt, smelling of steel and blood, but not fear. I feel the hunger inside of you. Gnawing at you. You see the dead and your mouth grows wet. Your stomach growls. It's all right. I will not shun you for what you are. Stay. I will tell you everything you have forgotten.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Soon a woman runs up.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You were young when you first tasted human flesh, weren't you? A brother or sister had died? An accident, of course. Then the hunger set in. Curiosity. What's the harm in just one bite? It's okay, now. You've found a friend who understands you. You can let go of your guilt. Guilt? What are you talking about?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not a cannibal. What are you trying to do to me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A lot of our kind block out the memory of their first meal. The shame is too much. But you don't need to hide anymore. Namira, the Lady of Decay, accepts you for what you are. She has a place for us, where we can sate our appetite without judgment.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Where is this place?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's inside Reachcliff Cave. But the dead have stirred from their slumber recently, and I was forced here. Meet me there. We will fight our way to Namira's embrace together. Until then, tell the people of Markarth that their dead won't be disturbed, anymore. We have bigger plans ahead.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I want no part of this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Very well. But should the hunger call out to you, I'll be waiting outside Reachcliff Cave. Tell the people of Markarth that their dead are safe. My work is done here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your tricks won't help you, monster!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: To Oblivion with you then!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After the encounter, the player can report to Verulus.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You've returned. What happened in the Hall of the Dead?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your cannibal has been taken care of.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't need to know the details. Blessings of Arkay to you for your help. The Hall of the Dead is now safe.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Hall of the Dead is safe now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Divines preserve you, you're a hero. We'll re-open the Hall right Away. Here. Take my amulet as a reward. Arkay protect you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If Eola is alive, the player goes to Reachcliff Cave to join up.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You've come. The draugr infesting Namira's sanctuary are inside.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I could use a hand.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I was hoping you would say that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wait here. I'll take care of them.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then I'll wait.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They all head inside.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Draugr are below. Foul tasting. The shrine of Namira is further inside. Keep going.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Together, the draugr are wiped out.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You've done it. The shrine is ours again. Now we need to prepare a grand feast to welcome you to Namira's coven. You will have the honor of bringing a fresh kill for the main course. And I know the perfect person. Who is it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just tell me who needs to die.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A priest, filled with the taste of an easy life. Brother Verulus, from Markarth. Give him this gold. Tell him you need Arkay's help exploring an old cavern for treasure. And when he stands in Namira's presence, she will take care of the rest. Say hello to Verulus for me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One returns to the rump roast...err, priest.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I have need of a priest in my travels.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You are looking for Arkay's protection while you delve some dank tomb, I take it? My duties keep me busy in Markarth. I don't know if I can help you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There would be treasure to share... (Persuade)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Treasure, you say? I suppose the Jarl won't mind if I'm gone for a little while. Lead on.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know, in the Priesthood of Arkay, we have a joke about an empty pocket being better than a full grave.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm willing to pay. ( gold)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's no small amount of coin, friend. I suppose I can come with you for a short adventure. Lead on.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm just not up for it, sorry. I'd rather stay here, have a glass of wine, and perform my rites to Arkay in peace.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're coming with me. Now. (Intimidate)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think you need to calm down before I summon the guards.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Never mind, then.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Arkay watch over you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They return to Namira's shrine. In the short time the player's been gone, the Red-Arm, Nimphaneth, Sanyon, Lisbet -- are waiting for the cannibal feast.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Who... who are you? What's going on?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Priest of Arkay. I'm your friend.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. I'm your friend, and I've invited you to dinner.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why don't you lay down and rest, while we get the meal ready?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come with me. Our feast is about to begin.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player can talk to the other citizens before proceeding, which reveals how cannibalism has secretly informed their lifestyles.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I'm so glad Eola invited you to dinner.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wait. I know you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One of my customers? Did you know I inherited the store from my late husband? Shame what happened to him. He had such good taste.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I remember my first feast. I envy you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wait. I know you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, yes. The courier. I guess you know my secret ingredient for that spiced beef, now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now this is going to be a good feast.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wait. I know you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: "The bloodiest beef in the Reach!" Ha ha ha.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've brought us quite the meal.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, the new disciple. I hear you have quite the appetite.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player goes over to where Eola has led the hypnotized priest.
label: ACTION

dialogue: The meal is on Namira's table. Go ahead. Carve.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As instructed, the player kills Verulus.
label: ACTION

dialogue: He looks so...sweet. Go ahead. Have the first bite.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Brother Verulus's still warm body lies before you.
label: ACTION

dialogue: The player eats. This elicits a chat with the Daedric Lord herself.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Mortal. I am Namira, the Lady of Decay. Your consumption of the blood and bile of Arkay's own is pleasing to me. I give you my ring. Wear it, and when you feast on the flesh of the death, I will grant you my power.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you, my Lady.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wallow in your wretchedness, my newest champion.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's a lot of work for such a little thing...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your mockery will be the end of you. And on that day, another servant will feast on your entrails and discover a ring clenched in her teeth. Be grateful for what time I give you until then.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I knew when you walked into the Hall of the Dead that you were special. And here you are. Champion of Namira. Keeper of her ring. You're everything I hoped you would be.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you, Eola. For everything.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's an honor, Champion. Feel free to stay and mingle with your new coven.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I feel sick.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There, there. It will pass. Going too long without a proper meal can make the stomach weak. Feel free to stay and mingle with your new coven, if you have the strength.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You started the coven of Namira?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. This coven has existed for thousands of years. Namira is a goddess. She has been worshipped since time began. I'm honored to be leading the latest generation of Namira's faithful. Those who have embraced what they are.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The city of Dawnstar is having trouble sleeping, and eventually, one learns a talking with villagers.
label: ACTION

dialogue: It's a curse! It has to be! I've got to get out of this town.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Irgnir, get a hold of yourself. They're just dreams. Please tell her, Erandur.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Listen to your friend, Fruki. They are just dreams, my dear. I assure you that it is quite normal.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's the same dream over and over. You think that's normal? It's evil I tell you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Erandur, she has a point. You keep telling us no harm will follow these dreams, but they must be an omen.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Give him a chance to speak. He's trying to help us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Everyone, please. I'm doing what I can to end these nightmares. In the meantime all I ask is you remain strong and put your trust in Lady Mara.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I...I will. Thank you...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player approaches.
label: ACTION

dialogue: What troubles you, my son?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's wrong with everyone around here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The entire town is being plagued by horrible nightmares. They're in serious danger but I'm afraid there's little I can do about it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What could you do, anyway? Dreams aren't real.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: These dreams are manifestations created by the Daedric Lord Vaermina. She has an awful hunger for our memories. In return, she leaves behind nightmares not unlike a cough marks a serious illness. I must end her terrible influence over these people before the damage becomes permanent.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't be ridiculous. Dreams are harmless.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In any other circumstance, I'd agree with you. However, these aren't normal dreams. The Daedric Lord Vaermina's voracious hunger for memories is responsible for these visions. The nightmares are an echo of her presence as she feeds.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then leave. This isn't your problem.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Turn my back on these people when their lives could be at stake? I should say not. Those dreams are not just visions, they're a footprint left by the Daedric Lord Vaermina as she drains these people of their memories!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's your plan?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I need to return to the source of the problem, to Nightcaller Temple. Perhaps you'd be willing to assist me in that regard?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do you mean, "return"? You've been there?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've already said too much. If anyone overhears what we're saying, it could start a panic. I would simply ask that you trust me and help me end Dawnstar's problems.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I trust you. How can I help?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wonderful! My lady Mara will be quite pleased! Nightcaller Temple is only a short walk from Dawnstar. Come, we must hurry.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can't trust you. You're hiding something.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your concerns are understandable; trust is a very difficult commodity to come by these days. I can only give you my word as a Priest of Mara that my intentions are honorable.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sorry, I can't.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I understand. If you should change your mind, I'll be here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who is the Daedric Lord Vaermina?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Vaermina resides in a strange realm known as Quagmire...a nightmarish land where reality shifts upon itself in seemingly impossible ways. From her citadel at the center, she reaches forth to collect our memories, leaving nothing in return apart from visions of horror and despair.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What does she do with the memories?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who can say? Perhaps she collects them for display like works of art in a nonsensical art gallery. Whatever the case may be, her intentions are far from benevolent. I promise to answer all of your questions. Follow me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The two walk outside. The destination looms on a nearby cliff.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Follow me, it's this way. It feels good to finally have a chance to help these people. Helplessly watching them suffer's been difficult. The tower on that hill is our destination. People around here call it the Tower of the Dawn. I'm not familiar with the tower's history, but it was deserted for quite a long time before Nightcaller Temple was established inside. When the temple was active the priests would rarely be seen in Dawnstar. They preferred to live a solitary existence. The temple's been abandoned for decades now. Ironic isn't it...a ruin within a ruin? There's a small shrine to Mara I established inside the tower's entry hall. I was hoping to seek spiritual guidance from Her.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They arrive outside the temple.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Before we enter, I must warn you about the dangers that could be lurking within. Years ago, this temple was raided by an orc war party seeking revenge...they were being plagued by nightmares just like the people of Dawnstar.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Were they successful?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. Knowing they could never defeat the orcs, the priests of Vaermina released what they call "The Miasma," putting everyone to sleep.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why is it dangerous if they're asleep?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm concerned that when this place is unsealed, the Miasma will dissipate and they'll awaken; both orcs and priests alike.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What does the Miasma do?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Miasma was created by the priests of Vaermina for their rituals. It's a gas that places the affected in a deep sleep. Because the rituals would last for months or even years, the Miasma was designed to slow down the aging process.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is the gas dangerous?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sadly, yes. The longer an individual is exposed to the Miasma, the more the mind can become damaged. Those who've been under the effect of it for extended periods of time have been known to lose their minds entirely. In some cases, a few never awoke at all. Once we get inside, all will become clear.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They enter the vestibule.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Give me just a moment, and I'll have this open.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He burns part of the wall, revealing the sealed portion of the temple.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Now I can show you the source of the nightmares. Over here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: At the bottom of the temple, they spy Vaermina's relic still active after the last few decades.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Behold the Skull of Corruption, the source of Dawnstar's woes. We must reach the inner sanctum and destroy it. Come, there's no time to lose.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In the stairwell, only to find a mystical barrier blocking passage downward.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Damn it. The priests must have activated this barrier when the Miasma was released.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Looks difficult to breach.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Impossible actually. Hmm, I wonder... There may be a way to bypass the barrier, but I must check their library and confirm it can be done.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You seem to know an awful lot about this place.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I suppose there's no point in concealing the truth any longer. My knowledge of this temple comes from personal experience. I was a priest of Vaermina.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why keep it a secret?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: When the orcs invaded the temple, I fled. I left my brothers and sisters here to die.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You should have told me the truth.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, you're right. I should have, but I didn't know what to say. When the orcs raided the temple, I fled. I left my brothers and sisters behind to die.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I knew it! You're a liar!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And what would you have me say? Sorry for following the misguided teachings of a mad Divine? Sorry for stealing memories from children? Do you realize when the orcs attacked, I was only concerned for myself? I fled...and left my brothers and sisters behind to die. I've spent the last few decades living in regret and seeking redemption from Mara. And by Her Benevolence, I will right my wrongs.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right. I'm ready.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I still have my key to the library. Whenever you're ready, let's move on.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How can the Skull be affecting Dawnstar?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lore holds that the Skull of Corruption holds a constant hunger for the memories of others. The Skull has been out of touch for so long, I fear it's gained the ability to reach out on its own and try to feed. What it does with these memories is just conjecture and an argument for scholars and historians to this very day. We mustn't tarry...the Skull needs to be destroyed as soon as possible.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They head back upstairs.
label: ACTION

dialogue: It's just up here. Be careful...we're certain to find more of the awakened within.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They unlock the library...
label: ACTION

dialogue: This library used to be filled with arcane volumes. Now look at it; almost everything's been burned. I hope the tome we need is still intact.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...and clear out the Miasma-addled sleepyheads.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Barring any more interruptions, perhaps we can locate the information I need.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What am I looking for?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We're looking for a book of alchemical recipes called "The Dreamstride." The tome bears the likeness of Vaermina on the cover. It should be here somewhere.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's on a pedestal upstairs.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Found it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let me take a look... Mara be praised! There is a way past the barrier to the inner sanctum. It involves a recipe for a liquid known as Vaermina's Torpor.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is that some kind of potion?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. The Torpor grants an ability the priests of Vaermina called "The "Dreamstride"; using dreams to travel distances in the real world.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's impossible.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I assure you, the Dreamstride is well known in Vaerminian Lore.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's amazing!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Quite amazing, yes. Alchemy and the blessings of a Divine distilled down into an ingestible liquid. Sadly, I have yet to see it function in person.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm going to be the test subject, then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As a sworn priest of Mara, the elixir won't work for me. The Torpor will only work for Priests or Vaermina, or the unaffiliated.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sounds dangerous. How can you be sure?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I will not lie to you, there is some risk involved. The last time the Torpor was imbibed could have been decades ago. But I swear upon Lady Mara that I will do everything within my power to prevent any harm from befalling you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Forget it! It could kill me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, all my research points in the opposite direction. This is the exact liquid the priests would drink. The only question in my mind is whether you will be granted The Dreamstride. Otherwise, the worst that could happen is a bad aftertaste. I swear upon Lady Mara that I would never let any harm befall you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do you know where we can find the Torpor?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I believe there is a laboratory in the east wing. If we proceed there, we should be able to locate a sample. The laboratory adjoins the library. I'm hoping we'll find a sample of the Torpor left undamaged.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player can inquire further...
label: ACTION

dialogue: What will the Dreamstride feel like?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'll be viewing the memory of another through your own eyes and with your own body. Those around you will perceive you as normal and you will find the words you utter may not be your own. Thanks to all of these odd principles, there is quite a lot of debate about whether this is really a dream or just the machinations of Vaermina.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How will I know when to awaken?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I will watch over you as you slumber to ensure your safety. If I deduce anything is amiss, I will use my arts to bring you back. Otherwise, I am uncertain what will end your Dreamstride. Perhaps when Vaermina's curious appetite has been filled.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They clear out the lab.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Now that they've been dealt with, we need to find the Torpor.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How will I know what it looks like?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It should be in a small bottle, very similar to a potion. I'll begin searching up here. The Torpor should be in a tall bottle with a dark liquid. If you find it, bring it to me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Torpor is on a shelf nearby.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I found the Torpor.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm relieved you found a bottle intact; this place looks as though it were ransacked by the orcs. So...I've taken us this far, but you need to guide us the rest of the way. Drink.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Here? Now?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Dawnstar's fate rests in that tiny bottle. The longer we wait, the more damage Vaermina could be doing to those poor people. I understand your hesitation, but I promise you that it works.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player drinks and sees through the eyes of a priest, decades earlier, stand near the Skull of Corruption.
label: ACTION

dialogue: The orcs have breached the inner sanctum, Brother Veren.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We must hold. We can't allow the Skull to fall into their hands.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But...no more than a handful of us remain, brother.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then we have no choice. The Miasma must be released.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Miasma? But, brother...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We have no alternative. It's the will of Vaermina. And what about you, Brother Casimir? Are you prepared to serve the will of Vaermina?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've made my peace. I'm ready.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then it's decided. Brother Casimir, you must activate the barrier and release the Miasma. Let nothing stop you. Brother Thorek, we must remain here and guard this Skull with our lives, if necessary.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Agreed. To the death.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then let it be done. Farewell, my brothers!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As Casimir, the player bolts upstairs through the fighting, pulling the chain the Torpor has indeed worked as it should. The barrier is deactivated.
label: ACTION

dialogue: It...it worked. Mara be praised! You vanished after drinking the Torpor and materialized on the other side. I've never seen anything quite like it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It was remarkable... As if I were really there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How I envy you. I can only imagine the excitement of seeing history through the eyes of another! Sadly, I am resigned to just reading of its wonders through my research of the Skull.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It served a purpose.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After what you just experienced, are you not amazed? I am at a loss for words.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Are you mad? I could have died!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I thought I was clear regarding the dangers that awaited you within the Dreamstride. However, this hardly matters any longer as you appear to have exited unscathed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We can discuss it later. We need to proceed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Indeed. My reverence for Vaermina's machinations should not take precedence over our mission. My apologies. The inner sanctum lies ahead. We must reach the Skull and put an end to Dawnstar's troubles. Lead on, my friend.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They reach the final room. Thorek and Veren appear.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Veren...Thorek...you're alive!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No thanks to you, Casimir.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I no longer use that name. I'm Erandur, Priest of Mara.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're a traitor. You left us to die and ran before the Miasma took you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. I...I was scared. I wasn't ready to sleep.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Enough of your lies! I can't allow you to destroy the Skull, Priest of Mara.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then you leave me no choice!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They kill the two.
label: ACTION

dialogue: How could you, Erandur...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They walk to
label: ACTION

dialogue: Vaermina speaks to the player's mind after the barrier is removed.
label: ACTION

dialogue: He's deceiving you. When the ritual's complete, the Skull will be free and then Erandur will turn on you. Quickly! Kill him now. Kill him and claim the Skull for your own! Vaermina commands you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player can kill Erandur and take the Skull, but there's no extra chatting the Skull is destroyed.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Forgive me if I don't appear relieved...this temple has taken its toll on me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Are you going to be all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In time, I believe I will.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So we're done, then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. The Skull has been destroyed and Dawnstar is safe.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How about some compensation?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Being a humble servant of Mara, I have little in the way of gold or coin, but perhaps I could offer you something better...companionship. I'd constructed a meager shrine to Mara in the antechamber where we entered. My intention was to spend the rest of my years here, burying the past and praying for forgiveness. But instead, I wish to offer my services to you. If you ever with to journey with me, I'll be here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's no need to thank me. What you did was for the people of Dawnstar. If anyone should be thanked, it should be you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In Whiterun, the player overhears a rumor from the Bannered Mare barkeep.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Been hearing some strange tales of the Jarl's children. Say the one's turning wicked, and the others have an ill-favored look to them. Best to keep clear.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Jarl Balgruuf is spoken to on the matter.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I heard there's trouble with your children.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, my youngest son. He's a dark child. I don't know what to do with him. He was always a quiet lad, but lately...something has changed. He's become brooding. Violent. He won't say a word to me, but I don't know how I upset him. If you could speak with him. Draw out the truth. I would be immensely grateful.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The son, Nelkir, is nearby.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Your father said to speak to you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So the disgusting pig sent you to bother me? One day, I'll tear his face apart so he can leave me alone. My father doesn't know anything about me. But I know about him. And about the war. More than he might think.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What sorts of things?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know that he still worships Talos. That he hates the Thalmor almost as much as the Stormcloaks do. That he worries about being chased from Whiterun. That he...that I'm...that I don't have the same mother as my brother and sister.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How do you know these things?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This castle is old. Lots of places nobody's been in a long while. Places where you can overhear things. See things. And the Whispering Lady.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who's the Whispering Lady?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She won't tell me her name. I've gotten good at listening to keyholes. At the door in the basement, I hear her talking to me. I thought I was caught, but she started telling me even more secrets. But I can't open the door.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Where is this door?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In the basement. Trust me, you'll see it. I bet she'll talk to you, too.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One searches the pantry, finding a half-hidden door near the shelves, faded with age. One tries to open it; a woman's voice speaks from beyond.
label: ACTION

dialogue: (Listen at the door)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: At last. I've been waiting for someone more fit to carry out my will. The child is spirited, but lacks...agency.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is there someone behind the door?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Regrettably, I cannot reach your plane so directly. But I forgive you for not knowing who I am. Few hear my whispers anymore. I am Mephala, the Lady of Whispers. I tug at the web of connections between mortals. Love, hatred, loyalty, betrayal. The boy was good at sussing out secrets. You, I expect to take a more active role.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What could the boy not do?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The boy is good at sussing out secrets, but the corruptibility of children is ultimately too limited for my purposes. You, though, I expect will prove far more malleable.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who are you to expect anything?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I forgive your not knowing my name. Few can hear my whispers anymore. I am Mephala, the Lady of Whispers. I tug at the web of connections between mortals. Love, hatred, loyalty, betrayal.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not so easily molded.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You may think so. But in the end, you mortals will always flit like fire with the winds of your desires and conveniences. And those winds issue from my whispers.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do you want me to do?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: First, you must open this door. A piece of my power has been locked away behind it, and even my eyes cannot see past the seals. I'd much rather it be in the hands of an ambitious and talented person such as yourself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't want to help you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Suit yourself. But those who listen at doors always wonder what is beyond them. Eventually your curiosity will drive you back to me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How do I open the door?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The whole of Whiterun is ripe with paranoia and tensions. The Jarl's court is right to fear the power I hold behind this door. The Jarl trusts few, and they will be his undoing. The dark child knows of what I speak. Let him guide your path.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nelkir is sought out again.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You...you know the Whispering Lady, don't you. I can tell.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do you know how to open the Whispering Door?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I told you, I know everything about this castle. For some reason that door is special. Only two people can open it, Balgruuf and Farengar, the court wizard. How you get it from them is up to you. Nobody would notice if Farengar went missing, I promise you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After getting the key, one returns to the door. Behind it is a small room the blade. The Dragonborn picks it up.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Excellent work. Now, I trust you're sharp enough to see that the sword doesn't match the description of the Ebony Blade you may know. It has languished too long outside the winds of alliance and betrayal. To return to its past glory, it must first drink the blood of deceit. Your world is admirably seeped in lies and inclinations. My blade is a darling leech that feeds on deceptions, and nourishes its master. Seek out those closest to you. The final pluck of their misguided heartstrings will accompany my blade in a song of your grandeur.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Through many means, usually overhearing, one can learn that Aventus Aretino, repeating the rites/mantra:
label: ACTION

dialogue: Sweet mother, sweet mother, send your child unto me, for the sins of the unworthy must be baptized in blood and fear.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player goes over.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You've come at last! I knew you would!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Are you all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It worked! I knew you'd come, I just knew it! I did the Black Sacrament, over and over! With the body, and the...things. And then you came! An assassin from the Dark Brotherhood!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm sorry, boy, but I'm not who you think I am.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course you are! I prayed, and you came, and now you'll accept my contract!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, of course... The Black Sacrament...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It took so long. So very long. But now that you're here, you can accept my contract.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (Remain silent)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You don't have to say anything. There's no need. You're here, so I know you'll accept my contract.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Contract?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My mother, she...she died. I...I'm all alone now. So they sent me to that terrible orphanage in Riften. Honorhall. The headmistress is an evil, cruel woman. They call her Grelod the Kind. But he's not kind. She's terrible. To all of us. So I ran away, and came home. And performed the Black Sacrament. Now you're here! And you can kill Grelod the Kind! • Please don't kill Constance Michel! She really is kind. • Please hurry! To be honest, I'm kind of lonely here. As much as I hated getting sent to Honorhall, I really miss my friends there...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If Grelod is already dead:
label: ACTION

dialogue: Grelod? As it turns out...I already killed her.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You did? Really? This is the best news I've ever gotten! I mean, I knew the Dark Brotherhood was good...just not that good! You killed the old hag before I even asked! Oh, and please, take this as payment. It's an old family heirloom, supposed to be pretty valuable. It should fetch you a nice price. Thank you again!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If Grelod is alive and one inquires further...
label: ACTION

dialogue: Grelod is the headmistress of Honorhall Orphanage. But not for long.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Assassinations don't come cheap, boy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have a family heirloom you can have. Supposed to be sort of valuable. I hope that's all right.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me about your mother. What happened?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She got sick, last winter, when the snows came. And she just...she never got better. Not all year. One night she just fell asleep and... never woke up. So now I'm all alone. And the Jarl said I had to go to Honorhall Orphanage. It's not fair!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Are you sure about this, boy? Murdering this woman?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've never been more sure about anything in my entire life. Someone like Grelod doesn't deserve to live one more day. She's a monster.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player travels to Riften and enters the orphanage. Grelod is yelling at her young wards in the main room.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Those who shirk their duties will get an extra beating. Do I make myself clear?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, Grelod.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And one more thing! I will hear no more talk of adoptions! None of you riff-raff is getting adopted. Ever! Nobody needs you, nobody wants you. That, my darlings, is why you're here. Why you will always be here, until the day you come of age and get thrown into that wide, horrible world. Now, what do you all say?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We love you, Grelod. Thank you for your kindness.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's better. Now scurry off, my little guttersnipes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player walks over.
label: ACTION

dialogue: What do you want? You have no business being here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Dark Brotherhood has come, Grelod.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The what? Why how dare you! I will not be intimidated in my own orphanage! Get out! Get out this instant!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Aventus Aretino says hello.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Aretino? Why that little bastard! You tell him I'm coming for him! And when I find him, it will be the beating of his miserable life!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (Remain silent)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What are you staring at, you worthless piece of gutter trash? I simply must start locking the doors again...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You don't scare me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're trying to frighten me, hmm? Do your worst!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Think you can intimidate me? In my own orphanage? Ha! Not bloody likely.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player kills Grelod, delighting the oppressed orphans. Examples:
label: ACTION

dialogue: Someone has killed Grelod! Ha ha ha ha ha!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Grelod is dead! Aventus did it! Ha ha ha ha ha!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hooray! Grelod the Kind is dead at last! We're saved!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yay!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player returns to Aventus.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Well? Grelod the Kind. Is she...you know?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Grelod the Kind is dead.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Aha! I knew you could do it! I just knew it! I knew the Dark Brotherhood would save me! Here, just like I promised! This should fetch you a nice price. And thank you. Thank you again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Aventus says some funny things if spoken to again.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I'll go back to the Orphanage in a while. I'll give them time to, you know...clean up the mess.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: When I grow up, I'm going to be an assassin. That way I can help lots of children, just like you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After completing Innocence Lost, then sleeping, the player will wake up in a shelf, watching the protagonist.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Sleep well?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What? Where am I? Who are you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Does it matter? You're warm, dry...and still very much alive. That's more than can be said for old Grelod. Hmm?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know about that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Half of Skyrim knows. Old hag gets butchered in her own orphanage? Things like that tend to get around. Oh, but don't misunderstand. I'm not criticizing. It was a good kill. Old crone had it coming. And you saved a group of urchins, to boot. Ah, but there is a slight...problem. A problem? (Remain silent)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't think I like where this is going...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You see, that little Aretino boy was looking for the Dark Brotherhood. For me, and my associates. Grelod the Kind was, by all rights, a Dark Brotherhood contract. A kill...that you stole. A kill you must repay.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You want me to murder someone else? Who?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well now. Funny you should ask. If you turn around, you'll notice my guests. I've "collected" them from...well, that's not really important. The here and now. That's what matters. You see, there's a contract out on one of them, and that person can't leave this room alive. But... which one? Go on, see if you can figure it out. Make your choice. Make your kill. I just want to observe...and admire.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll have no part of this insanity.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now that is a shame. But what you fail to realize is that you involved yourself in this "insanity" when you took Grelod's life. You made your choice. Now it's time to face the consequences of your actions. You don't leave this shack until someone dies.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right, I'll do it. I'll kill one of them.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: See, I knew we could resolve this civilly. A debt owed must be repaid. You understand that. Well, get to it then. Pick your guest, and send the poor fool to the Void. I'll give you the key to this shack, and you'll be on your way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (Remain silent)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Am I to take your silence as acceptance? Then you know where we stand. Make your kill, and we're square. Repayment of your debt is but a discreet knife thrust away.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If the player lets the option time out, or tries to exit dialogue, instead:
label: ACTION

dialogue: I'll cut right to it. You murdered the old woman in the Orphanage. You owe the Dark Brotherhood a kill. I've come to collect. One of these poor sods has a contract out on their life. Which one is it? Any idea? Make your choice. Make your kill. And you get to walk away.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player can talk to the three bound, gagged individuals nearby: Vasha, Alea Quintus and Fultheim the Fearless.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Whoever this is, clearly we got off on the wrong foot. Ah, but no worries. This is not the first time I have been bagged and dragged. Come now. Whatever the problem, we can talk about it like civilized folk, hmm?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who are you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ahhh...Vasha, at your service. Obtainer of goods, taker of lives, and defiler of daughters. Have you not heard of me? Perhaps I will have my people carve my name into your corpse, as a reminder.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Would someone pay to have you killed?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Me? Ha! Are you serious?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Answer me, or I'll paint this room with your blood! (Intimidate)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fool! Don't you get it? I live in the shadow of death every day. A knife in the doorway, a nocked arrow on every rooftop! If one of my enemies wouldn't pay to have me killed, I would take it as a personal insult.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come on, you can tell me. We're all friends here. (Persuade)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He he he he he he. The real question is, "Would someone pay to have me killed...again." A day goes by without someone trying to gut me in the street, I get disappointed. Tell you what. You release me, and I promise my associates won't hunt you down like an animal and butcher you in the street. It is a win-win.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Get these things off me! Cowards! Stealing a woman from her home! For shame!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who are you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: None of your damned business who I am! If you're going to kill me, just do it already! As Mara as my witness, if I didn't have this hood on right now I would spit right in your face...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Would someone pay to have you killed?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Excuse me? What kind of question is that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One last time: Would. Someone. Pay. To. Have. You. Killed? (Intimidate)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm kneeling here with my hands bound and a sack over my head, and you have the gall to ask me that? What do you think, genius?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's all right. Just tell me what I need to know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm a woman living in Skyrim with six children and no husband. I don't have the time or the patience to be "nice". Do some people look down on me? Have I made some enemies? You're damn right. I don't have time for this nonsense. I've got a home to keep and children to feed. Now let me out of here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I...I can hear you talking out there. Please, let me go. I've done nothing to you. Is this about that raid last week? I told Holgrim there was no honor in killing sleeping men, but he wouldn't listen! It wasn't my fault, I swear!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who are you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My name is Fultheim. I'm a soldier. Well, mercenary, really. You know, a...a sellsword. I've lived in Skyrim all my life. That's all! I'm a nobody, really. So can't you just let me go?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Would someone pay to have you killed?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What? Oh gods, I don't want to die...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Answer me, or die! (Intimidate)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Please! I don't know! I mean, I'm a soldier. I've killed people. When I was ordered to. Maybe there were some times...some times I got carried away? But war is war. Right? Nobody could blame me for that. Could they?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Shhh... Don't be afraid. You can tell me. (Persuade)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Okay, well...I guess it's possible. I've been selling my sword arm for years now. Killed a lot of people. Could be someone wanted revenge. But... But you're not going to kill me. Right? What did I do? Please, whatever it is, I'm sorry.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If the player chooses to kill one or more victims, Astrid will comment on the chosen victims. Seven responses total.
label: ACTION

dialogue: • Oh ho. The whimpering Nord, eh? Yes, yes, I can see how you'd come to that conclusion. Interesting choice. • Ah, the feisty goodwife. Quite the mouth on her. Someone must have wanted her dead... right? • The conniving Khajiit. Cat like that was sure to have enemies. It's no wonder you chose him. • The blubbering barbarian and the tenacious mother. Must have been one of them, right? • Hmm. The fearless wife and mother, and the underhanded Khajiit. Had to be one of them, right? Interesting choice. • The timid warrior and the sly Khajiit. Must have been one or the other, right? • Well, well, aren't we the overachiever? Three possibilities, three victims. Must have been one of them, right? So why take chances...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So who was it? Who had the contract?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh. No, no, no. Don't you understand? Guilt, innocence, right, wrong... Irrelevant. What matters is I ordered you to kill someone, and you obeyed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You told me to kill, and I killed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Indeed. For you, my friend, seem to understand what's truly important. When I give an order to spill blood, you follow it. No questions. No remorse.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (Remain silent)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hmph. When most would speak, you listen. You think. You understand that the only thing that matters is you following my orders. To kill.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So...I'm free to go?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course. And you've repaid your debt, in full. Here's the key to the shack. But why stop here? I say we take our relationship to the next level. I would like to officially extend to you an invitation to join my Family. The Dark Brotherhood. In the southwest region of Skyrim, in the Pine Forest, you'll find the entrance to our Sanctuary. It's just beneath the road, hidden from view. When questioned by the Black Door, answer with the correct passphrase: "Silence, my brother." Then you're in. And your new life begins. I'll see you at home.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If the player killed Astrid instead of a gagged victim, she gives a line before the quest fails and "Destroy the Dark Brotherhood!" begins.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Well done...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Eventually, the player enters the Sanctuary. Astrid is waiting.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Ah, at last. I hope you found the place all right.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So what happens now?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, what happens now is you start your new life in the Dark Brotherhood. You're part of the Family, after all. This, as you can see, is our Sanctuary. You won't find a safer place in all of Skyrim. So get comfortable.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am honored to be part of your Family, Astrid.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Our Family, my dearest. Our Family. Together, united as one, the Dark Brotherhood can accomplish anything. But you must be anxious to get to work. I'm arranging a job, but need a bit more time. For now, go see Nazir. He's got several smaller contracts.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: When do I get to kill someone?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Soon, my dearest. Soon. I'm arranging a job for you, but I need some more time. For now, go talk to Nazir. He may have some smaller contracts to tide you over.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (Remain silent)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hmmm... Yes, the silence suits you. Gives you an air of mystery. Now, down to business. I'm arranging a job for you. But in the meantime, go talk to Nazir. He may have some smaller contracts to tide you over. Soon, the Night Mother will arrive. And things around here are sure to get even more interesting. Ah, but one last thing. A welcome home present. The armor of the Dark Brotherhood. May it serve you well in all your...endeavors.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who is the Night Mother?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Unholy Matron, the Shrouded Lady, the Mistress of the Void. She goes by many names. Ages past, Sithis gave a woman five children. She killed them to win his favor, thus becoming the Night Mother. If you believe that sort of thing. Today, she's...well, she's a skeleton. An ancient corpse. But, more importantly, a corpse that's being brought to this Sanctuary by her Keeper.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So the Night Mother is being brought here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. A few months ago I received word from the Night Mother's Keeper that he had arrived in Skyrim from Cyrodiil. The Night Mother's crypt, in Bravil, was destroyed. A result of the chaos caused by the war with the Thalmor. That forced a relocation. I don't know where the Keeper has been these past few months, but I recently received another letter. He's bringing the Night Mother here. Soon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What if I get caught killing someone?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Try not to? But I do realize sometimes it's not that easy. You may want to make a statement, or a contract may require a public killing. Murder is, obviously, a very serious crime, and a very high bounty will be put on your head in the hold where the act was committed. You can run, obviously, but you'll still have a price on your head. If a guard attacks, you can attempt to yield by sheathing your weapon. If the guard accepts, you can serve your time in a cell, or pay off your bounty. We've all gone through it. We do what we must to survive. But, there is another option. Some members of the Thieves Guild in Riften can get their bounties...erased. For a price. Something to think about.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Where do the contracts come from?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They used to come from the Night Mother. Potential clients would perform the Black Sacrament, and she would hear their prayers. The Night Mother would communicate this to the Listener, who would then dispatch a Speaker to arrange the contract with the client. But that was a long time ago. There hasn't been a Listener in years, not since Cyrodiil was overrun in the war with the Thalmor. But people don't know that. So they still perform the ritual...and we eventually hear about it. When someone wants us, we find out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Are there any rules I should be aware of?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Used to be the Dark Brotherhood was bound by Five Tenets, but we stopped following those years ago. All those rules, all that discipline, and look where the Dark Brotherhood ended up. We're the last of our kind, and we live the way we see fit. Bottom line -- respect your Family. Do that, and everything else will fall into place.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What can you tell me about yourself?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This Sanctuary has been my entire life since I was a young woman. That's when I discovered my, shall we call it "aptitude," for elimination. I had an uncle, you see. He made certain...unwanted advances. So I killed him. And liked it. Then, I killed again. And liked it even more. And so on. I was recruited by the Dark Brotherhood and have been here ever since. I met my husband Arnbjorn, rose to leadership. And now here we are. Be sure and introduce yourself to your new Family members. They're all very eager to meet you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ha ha ha ha! Again! Again! Do the part where he tries to buy you some candy!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Okay, okay. Wait. Here we go. "Ooh, you're such a pretty little girl. Would the sweetie like a sweetie? Oh yes, how about some chocolate?" Oh yes, please kind sir! My mama and papa left me all alone, and I'm so very hungry. I know a shortcut to the candy shop. Through this alley. "Oh ya, very good. Very good. My it is dark down here. Oh, but you are so beautiful. Such a lovely smile. Your teeth...your teeth! No! Aggghh!!"
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ha ha ha ha ha ha ha!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh Babette, but you are so wicked.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What about you, Festus? How did that last contract turn out?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, yes, please, old man. Regale us with your tales of wizardry...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, the young and stupid. Always mocking the experienced and brilliant. My contract went very well, I'll have you know. Tried a new spell. Little something I've been working on in my spare time. Came "this" close to turning that priest inside-out. Damned messy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And what of your latest, Arnbjorn? Something about a Khajiit? Merchant was it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, a big doggy chasing a little kitty! How adorable!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am not adorable, it was not funny, and he wasn't a merchant. He was a Khajiit monk, a master of the Whispering Fang style. But now he's dead...and I have a new loincloth.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player can do introductions with all the other members. This is optional, when they appear, give the same answer, excepting Nazir's.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Well, well. It's raw meat. Oh, my beautiful wife has told me all about you. Let me guess -- Astrid failed to mention I'm her husband? She has a tendency to do that. Doesn't want the others thinking she plays favorites. (Remain silent) It's nice to meet you, Arnbjorn.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know nothing about me, or my abilities.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll give you a week before you end up dead in a ditch.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What can you tell me about yourself?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look. If you're trying to get to know me -- don't. I don't like you, and I never will. It's nothing personal. But... My wife trusts you, and I trust her judgment. So you can't be all bad. Here's what you need to know: I'm a werewolf. I like killing things. I love Astrid. I hate annoying people. And the color blue gives me a headache.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I might ask the same of you. For you are more than mortal. You are moon-born. You are wolf. So, you're a Companion, then? I can't imagine you got your gift anywhere else. I hope you have better luck with them than I did. Oh yes, I was once brother to the Companions. Let's just say they found my methods "unsettling". The Dark Brotherhood, obviously, feels differently.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There you are! Astrid's told me all about you. Heard she pulled the ole "Choose your victim" gag with you. Ah, I love that one... Don't let my appearance throw you off. I'm older than you. A lot older. Getting bitten by a vampire when you're ten will do that to a girl. (Remain silent) It's nice to meet you, Babette.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I will kill anyone who stands in my way. Anyone.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're going to love it here. We have a lot of fun, and we look out for each other. Just like any family.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What can you tell me about yourself?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm just a little girl! The Dark Brotherhood killed my mama and papa, and then they took me captive! Please, please help me! Rather convincing, don't you think? In truth, I'm no more a little girl than you are. I was once, of course. Three hundred years ago. Vampirism tends to keep one remarkably...fresh. Can't wait to hear all about the next person you murder.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, yes, you're the new Family member. Let's make this easy -- consider me the cranky old uncle nobody talks to. You go your way, I'll go on mine. There's too much of an obsession these days with knives and arrows. You can kill someone just as easily with a well- -placed spell. (Remain silent) It's nice to meet you, Festus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fine. I'm not here to make friends, old man.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hmph.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What can you tell me about yourself?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hmph. I like to say I was born with a wand in my hand. Well, not literally -- you can see how painful that would have been for mother. But I was a prodigy! Casting simple spells by one, completing complex incantations by three. Resurrecting corpses by seven! Ha. When I was thirteen, I accidentally burned down the family home. A bit of lightning gone awry. Ah, but soon after I mastered my gifts. Completely. I went on to teach at the College -- left after two years. Too simple. Too safe. None of them truly understood the glory of the Destruction school... Remember, fireballs. You can never go wrong.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: New brother. May I offer my most sincere welcome to our Family. Does death not come to us all? Is it not a certainty? I am, therefore, honored to be doom's herald. To play some part in a being's inevitable end. (Remain silent) It's nice to meet you, Gabriella.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am an assassin without equal. I belong here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You certainly have a strange energy about you. I look forward to following your progress.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What can you tell me about yourself?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What a curious question. Well, I enjoy moonlit nights, taking long walks on the beach, knitting and unicorns. In fact, I once took a seaside stroll, on a moonlit night, and discovered a unicorn... which I proceeded to stab in the throat with a crochet needle. I'm a woman of refined, yet simple tastes. Until next time, brother.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Welcome, my brother. Welcome to our Sanctuary. You have made the right choice joining us, I assure you. Me, I have been part of the Dark Brotherhood from the day I first hatched. I am Shadowscale, you see. Born under the sign of the Shadow. (Remain silent) It's nice to meet you, Veezara.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Dark Brotherhood will return to greatness. With my help.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You just trust in Astrid, follow her orders, and you'll do fine here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What can you tell me about yourself?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Once, I was a Shadowscale. An assassin in service to the King of Black Marsh. Trained by the Dark Brotherhood since the day of my hatching. Ah, but that was a lifetime ago. Today, I am the last of my kind. My order is extinct. Now, I happily serve Astrid, and this Sanctuary. I am a trained killer, and once again have been given purpose. Life is good. Stay safe.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player finds Nazir, the Redguard swordsman.
label: ACTION

dialogue: So, you're the newest member of our dwindling, dysfunctional little Family. I've heard quite a bit about you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's a pleasure to meet you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Save the niceties for now. I have no intention of getting invested in someone who may be dead tomorrow. If you're still breathing in a few weeks, I'm sure we'll be the best of friends.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You will hear more, I assure you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ooh, cocky. I give you three days before you screw up and someone runs a knife across your throat. But who knows? I've been proven wrong beofre.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (Remain silent)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ahh, going for the mysterious and brooding thing, hmm? That may work for your targets, but you'll find I'm not so easily impressed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Astrid said you'd have some work for me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Did she, now? Well, as it turns out, there are a few lingering we haven't had the chance to complete just yet. And more, dribbling in from time to time. I'll assign them to you as they become available. To be completed at your leisure.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sounds simple enough.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It is. These aren't particularly glamorous assassinations, I'll be honest. Don't pay much, either. But they'll keep you busy. Just do them as you're able. There's no real time limit -- the targets aren't going anywhere. You can turn each one in as it's completed, or wait and turn in the whole group when all the targets have been eliminated. Whichever works for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What can you tell me about yourself?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, well, I'm a Redguard, as I'm sure you've noticed. Though not like most of my kind in Skyrim, that's for damned sure. I am a child of Hammerfell, born on the sands of the mighty Alik'r. In that great desert, blood is a shade of crimson I can scarce describe. My past is long and storied, and not altogether proud. The Dark Brotherhood saved me from myself. And I have never looked back.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm ready for the first set of contracts.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well then, let's get started. I've got three available right now. Your targets are the beggar Narfi, an ex-miller named Ennodius Papius, and Beitild, a mine boss. When you've completed all those, we'll see if I might have some more.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me about Narfi.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He's a hapless beggar living in some ruins just outside the village of Ivarstead. Easy even for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me about Ennodius.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He lives just outside Anga's Mill, in the woods. He was once the miller. Now Papius is just a paranoid recluse who thinks someone is out to get him. And he's right.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me about Beitild.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She separated from her husband several months ago. Now the two run competing mining operations. Beitild's angry and desperate. A fighter. Happy hunting.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player goes to each assassination target, having unique dialogue.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Who are you? What do you want?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Beg! Beg for your miserable life!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No! Oh, by the gods, please no!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your pathetic existence has come to an end, Narfi.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh... Oh no... Please, please...I ain't never harmed no one... Old Narfi just wants to be left alone...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (Remain silent)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do...do you want something? Look, if you ain't gonna talk, or spare no coin, just go away...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why are you here? Get away from me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You were right to paranoid, Ennodius.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What? What do you mean? Oh! Oh...no... No!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Die, worm!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Aiiiiiiiieeeeeee!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (Remain silent)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who are you? You...you're with the Dark Brotherhood, ain'tcha? I knew it. I knew you'd come for me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm really not in the mood. State your business, or take your leave.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Someone wants you dead, Beitild.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And let me guess, that so-called someone is my husband Leigelf? Well the feeling's mutual.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I represent the Dark Brotherhood. Your death is at hand!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What? Well, we'll see about that, won't we?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (Remain silent)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've a mine to run, so if you'll excuse me...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nazir will comment on each contract when it's completed.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Narfi is dead.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Congratulations. You slaughtered an emaciated beggar in cold blood. You are truly an opponent to be feared. Here's your payment.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ennodius is dead.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good. And I hope you were careful in that lumber mill. Those splinters and rusty nails can be quite nasty. Your payment, for a job well done.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Beitild is dead.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course she is. I hear the mining business is extremely cutthroat. And those hours...they're murder. I could do this all day. Here's your payment.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After at least one contract is done, returning to the Sanctuary reveals a new of some. The player stumbles upon them mid-argument.
label: ACTION

dialogue: But the Night Mother is mother to all! It is her voice we follow! Her will! Would you dare risk disobedience? And surely...punishment?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Keep talking, little man, and we'll see who gets "punished".
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh be quiet, you great lumbering lapdog. The man has had a long journey. You can at least be civil. Mister Cicero, I for one am delighted you and the Night Mother have arrived. Your presence here signals a welcome return to tradition.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, what a kind and wise wizard you are. Sure to earn our Lady's favor.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You and the Night Mother are of course welcome here, Cicero. And you will be afforded the respect deserving of your position as Keeper. Understood...husband?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hmph.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, yes yes yes! Thank you, thank you, thank you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But make no mistake. I am the leader of this Sanctuary. My word is law. Are we clear on that point?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh yes, mistress. Perfectly! You're the boss.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The crowd disperses.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Ah, there you are. Good, I was done speaking to that muttering fool anyway. We've got some business to discuss.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do you have a contract for me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I do indeed. You must go to the city of Markarth, and speak with the apothecary's assistant. You'll probably find her in the Hag's Cure, when the shop is open. The girl's been running her mouth, wants an ex-lover killed. She's apparently performed the Black Sacrament. Her name is Muiri. I need you to talk to her, set up the contract, and carry it out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Anything else?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just do whatever the contact wishes. Be professional, represent us well, and get the job done. Since it's your first contract, I'll let you keep whatever Muiri pays. She'll be generous, I'm sure. They always are.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The other DB members can be asked to comment on the current contract and the insight into the mission, so I'll list it anyway.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Just be yourself. Eliminate the targets any way you see fit. Quiet, loud, quick, slow -- whatever you feel is best. Occasionally I'll give you a contract with certain parameters. Stay within them, and you'll earn yourself a bonus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Very little. You have my word on that. The Night Mother represents a chapter in the Dark Brotherhood's history that has long since been closed. Today we live by our own rules. We're the last Sanctuary in all of Tamriel, and only by forgoing the old ways have we survived this long. My only worry is her "Keeper." I'm not sure what Cicero expects to gain by bringing the Night Mother here, but he'll soon learn this is my Sanctuary.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yeah. Follow my wife's orders, and don't do anything stupid.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The witless fool and his pet corpse? Take a guess.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're headed to the Hag's Cure, right? It's a good shop. You should examine their wares. Never pass up the chance to buy a good potion... or poison. And one more thing. Have fun. You'll be committing a dark deed, but there's no reason you shouldn't enjoy yourself. You're only young once. Trust me, I know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Two hundred years ago, I would have lain down my life for the Unholy Matron. But that age has long since passed. Astrid is my matron now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. Just because you're now a professional assasin, don't think you have to skulk around in the shadows like a skeever and stab people. Do what I do. Walk up to your target, introduce yourself, melt their skin off, and then run like the wind. Works every time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Their arrival is the best thing that's happened to this Sanctuary in years. Astrid is an effective leader, but we've been rudderless for too long. Scrounging for contracts, abandoning the Tenets. The Dark Brotherhood has been reduced to a group of common cutthroats. Frankly, it's embarrassing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're being sent to meet with the contact directly, is that correct? What a most unusual occurrence. Astrid usually performs this duty herself. I can only assume she wants to test the full breadth of your abilities. So. Be polite, and professional, and represent us well.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Without the Night Mother, there is no Dark Brotherhood. The Matron deserves our unwavering support and respect. Though I admit, I find her Keeper a bit too exuberant for my liking.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You must speak to that Muiri woman, correct? I have heard rumors in Windhelm. She was recently implicated in a thievery, along with her lover. The lover will likely be your target. If memory serves me correctly, he leads a group of bandits. So this may be rather interesting for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Truthfully? I'm not entirely sure. It's not that I don't have the utmost respect for Sithis, and the Night Mother, and the ancient ways. I do. But I've never been much for religion. I kill because it's what I've been trained to do. It's all I know. So long as Astrid is happy, I'm happy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The contracts I dole out are fairly simple -- go to a location, and kill the target. But this is different. The jobs Astrid gives you will be more important, and usually more complex. Just keep your wits about you. And for Sithis' sake, don't get killed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't like mimes, minstrels, thespians, acrobats, jugglers, troubadours or tumblers. Flutists give me a headache. I particularly hate jesters. As a rule, I'm also not crazy about the corpses of old women. For the Night Mother, I'll make an exception. But Astrid is the only mistress I serve.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If one talks to Cicero after having met him in "Delayed Burial", there'll be a conversation that replaces the usual three-option DB line:
label: ACTION

dialogue: Wait, oh wait. I know you! Yes, yes. From the road! Cicero never forgets a face.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're the man with the wagon! Transporting his mother...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am! I am! But not just my mother. Our mother, hmm? The Night Mother! Oh yes! • And you helped me! You helped poor Cicero! You talked to Loreius, got him to fix my wheel! Oh, you may have pleased me, but you have surely pleased the Night Mother. And our mother, she will never forget. • But you disappeared! You were there...then you weren't! Did you mean to help out poor Cicero or not? I'm left to wonder... Ah, it doesn't matter. What's done is done, right? Cicero is here! As is the Night Mother! Joy of joys!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If the player speaks with Cicero without having met him before:
label: ACTION

dialogue: Another member of the Family! Hello, hello. So very good to meet you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's good to meet you too, Cicero.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So polite! So nice! Cicero likes you. The Night Mother is sure to like you too. Oh, we're going to be fast friends. Fast friends.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Keep your distance, jester, and we'll get along just fine.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do you mistrust poor Cicero? I am, as you say, just an innocent jester. A fool! Oh, but my work is not foolish, no. For I am our mother's Keeper.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (Remain silent)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oooh... So silent. So menacing. A true assassin of the old ways. Cicero likes you. Oh yes, Cicero likes you, indeed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why did you come to the Sanctuary?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Night Mother's crypt in Bravil was...desecrated. The Imperial Province is ravaged by strife. Nowhere there is safe, at present. So Cicero brought our Lady to her new home. Here! This is the only Sanctuary left in all of Skyrim, you see. Such was my...honor. As Keeper.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who is the Night Mother?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What? Who is the Night Mother? Oh! Oh, you jest! You jest with gullible Cicero! You of course know that the Night Mother is our Unholy Matron. The undying spirit of a great woman who birthed the children of Sithis. And killed them. In his honor.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me about Sithis.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hmmm... That's like telling you about the cold of space, or terror of midnight. Sithis is all those things. He is...the Void.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What are the duties of a Keeper?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, Cicero takes care of our Lady's body. Oils it, preserves it, keeps it safe. Makes sure nobody disrespects our Matron's coffin.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What can you tell me about yourself?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Me? Oh, Cicero is just the Keeper! I...keep! I look after our matron, you see. The Night Mother. I keep her clean, and protected, and happy... But I am not the Listener. Oh no. There is no Listener. Not yet! But some day, some day, some day I pray that one will come to hear her say... The words.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Listener? What's a Listener?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, well, the Listener is the only person the Night Mother speaks to. It is the highest honor attainable by a member of the Dark Brotherhood. Of course our Lady is dead, so she doesn't talk with words, since her lips are...rotted. But inside the Listener's head. I hear it's...intimate. Ah, but there has not been a Listener in years and years. Our Lady has not chosen Cicero, and certainly not Astrid. Or...anyone. But some day... Farewell, farewell!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player goes to Muiri at the apothecary in Markarth.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Why are you looking at me like that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Dark Brotherhood has come, Muiri.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Dark Brotherh... Oh. Oh! I...my goodness, you're really here! The Black Sacrament. It actually worked?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Obviously. Now tell me what you need.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What I need? What I need is for Alain Dufont to die! I want him hunted down and murdered like the dog he is! (Remain silent) I'll need more to go on than that...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: By Sithis, I need details. Get to the point.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I didn't know when we were...with each other...but Alain is actually a leader of a band of cutthroat bandits. They're holed up in some old dwarven ruin -- Raldbthar. It's near Windhelm. They use it as their base. It's where they stage their raids. I want you to go to that ruin, find Alain Dufont, and kill him. I don't care about his friends. Do whatever you want with them. But Alain has to die!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Actually, Alain Dufont is already dead. I killed him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What? Alain is...is dead? I...I'm grateful. It's just this...this isn't at all how I imagined things would play out. There was Alain, but I was considering more, and... Ah, well. Dead is dead. Right? My thanks to you, assassin. Here's the gold I was going to pay you for the job. You earned it, after all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It will be done.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Excellent. Once Alain is dead, I'll pay you. In gold. I've saved up a bit. I hope that'll do. But, well... There is one more thing. If you're interested?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm listening.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you can...I want you to kill someone else, as well. You don't have to -- it's not part of our deal. But if you do...I'll pay you even more. It's Nilsine Shatter-Shield, in Windhelm. If Nilsine dies, too...I'll make it worth your while.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me the full story. Why do you want Alain dead?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I went to Windhelm to see the Shatter-Shields. They were old and dear friends, and...in mourning. Friga was killed recently. Murdered... I met Alain at the tavern, while I was...drinking my sadness away. He was handsome, and charming. He said I was the "beautiful lily" of his dreams. Alain made all the pain just...go away. But it was all lies! Alain used me. He ruined my name, destroyed my friendship with the Shatter-Shields... Do you know why Alain was in Windhelm? He heard about Friga's murder.
