He wanted to befriend the family in their grief ...and rob them blind. Alain used me to get close to my friends. And now they all think I'm some kind of...monster. Alain Dufont took my life. And now I'm taking his.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And Nilsine Shatter-Shield? Why must she die?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't you see? I was like a daughter to Tova. A sister to Nilsine and Friga. But the family refuses to believe my innocence. No matter what I say. Couldn't they understand that I was used? That I was grieving for Friga, too? No...they treated me like garbage, threw me away. With Nilsine dead, maybe then Tova will realize what she's lost, hmm? Maybe then she'll see that I was just as much a daughter as the others. And if not, may she drown in her own tears.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is there anything else?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I planned to kill Alain myself, you know. Nilsine, too. But lost my nerve. I even brewed a special poison, Lotus Extract. Maybe you could use it? Just coat your weapon with it. Then...you get the idea. Make them all pay for what they've done to me...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player confronts Alain.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Well. You must have all those annoying gods on your side to have made it this far, whoever you are. Even I have to admit, that's pretty impressive.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If the player goes to Nilsine Shatter-Shield...
label: ACTION

dialogue: What? Did...you need something?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Muiri sent me. She is quite unhappy...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Muiri? I can't believe my family trusted that backstabbling little strumpet. You tell her she's dead to us. You hear me? Dead!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do you hear that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's the sound of your sister, screaming in the Void...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What kind of cruel, horrible person are you? My sister was murdered. Do you have any idea what that's like? What I'm going through?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (Remain silent)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You just going to stand there, gawking? Go away. You're starting to ...frighten me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player returns to Muiri after slaying Alain.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Well, what news? Is Alain...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Alain Dufont now lies dead.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That bastard got exactly what he deserved. • But last I heard, Nilsine is still alive. So I guess you decided not to kill her as well. I have to admit...I'm disappointed. Here's the payment for killing Alain. And nothing for letting Nilsine live. Just remember, that was your decision. • And...I heard about Nilsine. You have more than fulfilled your part of the bargain. Please, take this -- as payment, and a symbol of my affection. I'll never forget you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: When the quest is over, it's back to the Sanctuary.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Ah, you're back. So, how went our first real contract? A bit more exciting than what Nazir's been offering, I'd wager.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I did what had to be done. Nothing more.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course, dear. Of course. And, from what my little ravens tell me, you handled yourself quite well.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I live only to serve. Hail Sithis!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, very good. Very good indeed. You, my dear, are going to fit in here quite nicely...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (Remain silent)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Very well. I respect your discretion. Now, I need your assistance with a matter of a more...personal nature.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is something wrong?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's Cicero. Ever since he arrived, his behavior's been... Well, erratic would be an understatement. I do believe he is truly mad. But it's worse than that. He's taken to locking himself in the Night Mother's chamber, and talking. To someone. In hushed, but frantic tones. Who is he speaking with? What are they planning? I fear treachery.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Astrid, you're being a bit...paranoid.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Maybe so, but healthy paranoia has saved this Sanctuary before, and my gut's telling me the demented little fool is up to something.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: By Sithis, we must stop them!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So you understand my fear. If Cicero's planning something, and conspiring with one of our own, it would be disastrous.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (Remain silent)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You must understand. If Cicero is turning the others against me... against us... Our Family would not survive such division.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do you want me to do?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Dear brother, I need you to steal into that chamber, and eavesdrop on their meeting. It'll be no use clinging to the shadows. They'll see you for sure. No, you need a hiding place. Somewhere they'd never think to look. Like inside the Night Mother's coffin.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But that seems so...disrespectful.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Be that as it may, we have no other choice. You need to remain unseen! Now go, before they meet.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, the coffin. It's perfect.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They'll never think to check it. Who in their right mind would hide inside? Now go, before they meet.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (Remain silent)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No objections, then? Good. Go now. Before they meet. And report back to me with whatever you learn.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Any idea who would conspire with Cicero?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's the real question, isn't it? The jester enters, seals the door, and the conversation begins. So someone must be waiting for him inside. Any one of us could enter that chamber silently. Unnoticed. But who amongst us would dare conspire against the Sanctuary? The very thought breaks my heart.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do you think Cicero is planning?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Isn't it obvious? As the Night Mother's Keeper, he believes he's entitled to rule of this Sanctuary. Cicero will cite our independence as the need to rever to the Old Ways. He'll claim we're undisciplined, unruly. Heretical, even. Ironically, the Night Mother could prove to be just as much a victim. The queen in a fool's twisted game of chess.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is there anything else I should know?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't believe so. But I'll be able to instruct you further after you've returned from the chamber. It depends on what you learn. And make haste! You must be in place before Cicero and his...ally arrive! They could be planning another meeting any time! Go. Quickly! Hide in the coffin before Cicero and the traitor meet.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player can talk to the other DB members about Astrid's conspiracy theory. Cicero doesn't appear for questioning this time.
label: ACTION

dialogue: She said that? If I find anyone working against my wife, or this Sanctuary, I'll beat them to death with their own severed head. Of course, they'd probably already be dead... But you know what I meant!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh! Well, I hope she doesn't suspect me. I mean, I've spoken with Cicero a bit, and he's quite charming. But I'd never go against Astrid. Never.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ha! And would that surprise anyone? This Sanctuary's a mess. Wouldn't surprise me if somebody's talking to the fool on the sly. Making deals. And no, before you ask, it's not me. I know which side my bread is buttered on.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: To what end? Usurping Astrid's authority as leader of the Sanctuary? Hmmm... Yes, I can see her concern. Thank you for bringing this to my attention.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're joking. While I can understand if some Family members wish to honor the Old Ways once more, surely no one would oppose Astrid's rule.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Does she? Listen, brother... Astrid is my mistress, and I worship the ground she walks on. But this Cicero business has her a bit...paranoid.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: At Astrid's behest, the player hides in the coffin. As the door shuts, one the other door.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Are we alone? Yes...yes...alone. Sweet solitude. No one will hear us, disturb us. Everything is going according to plan. The others...I've spoken to them. And they're coming around, I know it. The wizard, Festus Krex...perhaps even the Argonian, and the un-child... What about you? Have you...have you spoken to anyone? No... No, of course not. I do the talking, the stalking, the seeing and the saying! And what do you do? Nothing! Not...not that I'm angry! No, never! Cicero understands. Heh. Cicero always understands! And obeys! You will talk when you're ready, won't you? Won't you... ...sweet Night Mother.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: At that moment, the corpse the player's facing glows slightly, and one hears the Night Mother's voice speaking directly into the mind.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Poor Cicero. Dear Cicero. Such a humble servant. But he will never hear my voice. For he is not the Listener.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Meanwhile, Cicero continues to talk outside, unaware of Mom's conversation.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Oh, but how can I defend you? How can I exert your will? If you will not speak? To anyone!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, but I will speak. I will speak to you. For you are the one. Yes, you. You who shares my iron tomb, who warms my ancient bones. I give you this task -- journey to Volunruud. Speak with Amaund Motierre.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Poor Cicero has failed you. Poor Cicero is sorry, sweet mother. I've tried, so very hard. But I just can't find the Listener.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell Cicero the time has come. Tell him the words he has been waiting for, all these years: "Darkness rises when silence dies."
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: At that moment, Cicero opens the coffin, taken aback at the player.
label: ACTION

dialogue: What? What treachery! Defiler! Debaser and defiler! You have violated the sanctity of the Night Mother's coffin! Explain yourself! Speak, worm!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Night Mother spoke to me! She said "I am the one."
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She...spoke to you? More treachery! More trickery and deceit! You lie! The Night Mother speaks only to the Listener! And there is...no... Listener!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wait! She said to tell you, "Darkness rises when silence dies."
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She...she said that? She said those words...to you? "Darkness rises when silence dies"? But those are the words. The Binding Words. Written in the Keeping Tomes. The signal so I would know. Mother's only way of talking to sweet Cicero... Then...it is true! She is back! Our Lady is back! She has chosen a Listener! She has chosen you! Ha ha ha! All hail the Listener!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Astrid enters the hall, having heard the jester's happy shrieks.
label: ACTION

dialogue: By Sithis, this ends now! Back away, fool! Whatever you've been planning is over! Are you alright? I heard the commotion. Who was Cicero talking to? Where's the accomplice? Reveal yourself, traitor!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I spoke only to the Night Mother! I spoke to the Night Mother, but she didn't speak to me! Oh, no. She spoke only to him! To the Listener!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What? The Listener? What are you going on about? What is this lunacy?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's true, it's true! The Night Mother has spoken! The silence has been broken! The Listener has been chosen!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: When I heard Cicero screaming, I knew you'd been discovered. I feared the worst. Are you all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, I'm fine.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then what in Sithis' name is going on? Cicero said he spoke to the Night Mother, but she spoke to you? Is this just more of the fool's rambling?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I...I don't know. It happened so fast.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Okay, let's all take a deep breath. Cicero said he spoke to the Night Mother, but she spoke to you? Please tell me this is some kind of sick joke.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (Remain silent)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You look like you've just seen a ghost. Please tell me you haven't. Cicero said he spoke to the Night Mother...but she spoke to you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's true. The Night Mother spoke to me. She said I was "the one".
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What? So Cicero wasn't talking to anyone else. Just...the Night Mother's body? And the Night Mother, who, according to everything we know, will only speak to the person chosen as Listener...just spoke. Right now... ...to you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: By Sithis. And...what did she say?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I must speak to someone named Amaund Motierre, in Volunruud.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Amaund Motierre? I have no idea who that is. But Volunruud...that I have heard of. And I know where it is.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So I should go to Volunruud? I should talk to this man?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hmm? No. No! Listen, I don't know what's going on here, but you take your orders from me. Are we clear on that? The Night Mother may have spoken to you, but I am still the leader of this Family. I will not have my authority so easily dismissed. I...I need time to think about all this. Go see Nazir -- do some work for him. I'll find you when I'm ready to discuss the matter further.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One can pick Cicero's brain about Listener duties...
label: ACTION

dialogue: You are the Listener! You are the Listener! I have served mother well, I have!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What exactly does a Listener do?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, the Listener, well...listens. The Night Mother speaks to you. Guides you on your path. But when the Night Mother speaks, the Listener must obey. You must! For her word is the will of Sithis. And Sithis is the Dark Brotherhood incarnate.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Will the Night Mother speak to me again?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ha! Surely you're pulling Cicero's leg! Wait...the Listener is serious? Oh. Well of course the Night Mother will speak to you again! She might speak now, or later, or...I don't know! But speak she will! The Night Mother is part of you now! You get to hear voices inside your head! The rest of us should be so lucky.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Cicero, did you want to be the Listener?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh... Well...yes. I did. I did indeed. I tried to listen. Tried so hard. But the Night Mother never spoke to poor Cicero. The silence became almost...maddening. Oh, but that was then! This is now! You're the Listener, and the Night Mother chose you for a reason, I'm sure! Cicero will remain the happy Keeper. Are you excited? Oh, you should be. Things are finally looking up!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One goes to Nazir.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Astrid wanted me to see you about some more work.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well then, your timing couldn't be better. As it turns out, I've got two new contracts. One rather easy assignment, and another that should prove quite a challenge. Your first target is an orc bard named Lurbuk. The other is a vampire by the name of Hern. Happy hunting.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me about Hern.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He's a vampire, and has blended into human society for years. He's never far from his female companion, Hert. Also a vampire. The contract is for the male, Hern. But you'll probably have to contend with the female, too. So for Sithis' sake, watch yourself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me about Lurbuk.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He is, by all accounts, the worst bard in Skyrim. Apparently, so many people sought his death, Astrid had to hold a lottery to determine the client. You've got people to kill, my friend. Best get to it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player goes to Lurbuk at Morthal's inn.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Is the line for my next performance starting already? Come on, don't be shy. Plenty of room for everyone.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Someone hired the Dark Brotherhood to kill you, Lurbuk.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ha! Oh, that's a good one, friend. Killing Lurbuk...I mean, can you imagine something so ludicrous? Depriving the world of my unique talents?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sing me a song, bard. A song of fear, and death!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hmmm... All right... How about this? "Shadow creep and, and...phantoms leap! A man got...he got scared. And the demons dared! To um...visit upon him all which they feared!" Brilliant, I know. It's a gift.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (Remain silent)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's the matter, friend? Khajiit got your tongue? Maybe you need a little ditty to loosen your gob, hmm? "There once was a stranger, with eyes full of danger, he spoke not a word, but his meaning was heard... Sing on, sweet Lurbuk, sing on!"
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They find Hern at Anga's Mill in Falkreath.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Well now. What have we here? A lost little lamb?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know what you are, nightspawn.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well then, you won't be leaving here alive!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Assassin versus vampire. A fight for the ages.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, so the Brotherhood has come for old Hern, has it? Well then, let us meet as equals.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (Remain silent)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hmph. Don't say much, but there's a strange aura about you. You walk in the shadow of death... Leave here. Leave here and never return.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After the kills, one returns to the Sanctuary.
label: ACTION

dialogue: We need to talk. (Remain silent) Of course, Astrid. What is it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Has the time come? Will I now serve the Night Mother?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look. Something is happening here. I'm not entirely sure what that something is, but... Well, we need to find out. If the Night Mother really did give you an order to talk to a contact, we'd be mad to ignore it. And I think we both agree, Cicero's brought quite enough madness to this Sanctuary. So go. Go to Volunruud. It's a crypt, pretty far to the northeast. Talk to this Amaund Motierre. And let's see where all this leads, hmm?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nazir will comment on completed contracts at this point.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Hern is dead.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No sarcasm this time. You faced a vampire, and lived to tell the tale. Well done. And if you contracted Sanguinare Vampiris, be sure to get that taken care of. Else you'll end up like our own Babette. Unless, of course, that was your goal all along. Here's your payment.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lurbuk is dead.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wonderful. The only good bard is a dead one, as far as I'm concerned. All that singing and...mirth. Your payment, as per the usual.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player can also ask Family members about the current Volunruud contract. Cicero has no lines in this regard, though.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Oho! The Listener wants my counsel! I thought you were above the opinions of mere mortals, now that you commune with dead old women.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The man you need to speak with, his name is Motierre? That's a very old and powerful Breton family, firmly established in Cyrodiil. Most curious...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So you're the Listener, hmm? Well that hardly seems fair. You just got here. The Night Mother should have spoken to me. Any idiot could see that. But, I will serve gladly, as that is my lot in life. Now let's see. Ah yes, Volunruud. It's an old crypt, infested with Draugr. So plan accordingly.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If the Night Mother truly spoke to you, if you really are the Listener...your destiny was written in the Void. Astrid is right to fear your power.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You may be the Listener, or you may just be a lunatic who's started hearing voices. Either way, Astrid is still your mistress. Not the Night Mother.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just remember Astrid's commitment to her Sanctuary, to her Family. A Family that now counts you as one of its own. Honor Astrid above all others.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player goes to Volunruud, finding the client a short ways inside.
label: ACTION

dialogue: By the Almighty Divines. You've come. You've actually come. This dreadful Black Sacrament thing...it worked.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Night Mother heard your pleas, Motierre.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, um... So it would seem. Well, I won't waste your time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have opened the door to darkness, little man.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, I know. I know. But I'm so glad you're here. Please, allow me to state my business. Surely your time is as valuable as my own.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (Remain silent)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Right, then. You prefer to listen, is that it? Well, you must represent the Dark Brotherhood. I certainly wasn't expecting anyone else. So, I'll cut right to the chase. I would like to arrange a contract. Several, actually. I daresay, the work I'm offering has more significance than anything your organization has experience in, well, centuries.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Go on.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As I said, I want you to kill several people. You'll find the targets, as well as their manners of elimination, quite varied. I'm sure someone of your disposition will probably find it enjoyable. But you should know that these killings are but a means to an end. For they pave the way to the most important target. The real reason I'm speaking with a cutthroat in the bowels of this detestable crypt. For I seek the assassination of... ...the Emperor.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Leaders rise and fall. Business is business.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, wonderful. You don't know how happy I am to hear you say that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You want us to kill...the Emperor. Of Tamriel?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That is correct. What I ask is no small thing, of course. But you represent the Dark Brotherhood. This is...what you do? No? You must understand.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (Remain silent)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's a shocking request, I know. But it is within the purview of what you Dark Brotherhood types do. Isn't it? If history is to be believed? You must understand. So much has led to this day. So much planning, and maneuvering. It's as if the very stars have finally aligned. But I digress... Here, they need to be delivered to your, um...superior. Rexus. The items.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Rexus, the bodyguard, hands over the notes.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Here. Here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Rexus will now give you two items which must be passed along to your superior. The sealed letter will explain everything that needs to be done. The amulet is quite valuable -- you can use it to pay for any and all expenses.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player can question Amaund further.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Was there...something else you need?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who are you, Motierre? Who are you, really?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I performed the Black Sacrament, contacted you people, because I thought you guaranteed discretion. Is this no longer so?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why do this? Why have the Emperor assassinated?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In the year 3E 41, Emperor Pelagius Septim was murdered in the Temple of the One in the Imperial City. Cut down by a Dark Brotherhood assassin. His killing ushered in, shall we say, a necessary change in Imperial policy. There are those now who wish for a similar change. I am sorry, but that's all I'm at liberty to say.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We'll require...significant compensation. Can you pay the price?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, my furtive friend. When Emperor Titus Mede II lies dead, there will be gold...a fortune in gold. But so much more! It is said that the Dark Brotherhood, in recent times, has been in decline. That you lack the power, wealth, and respect of days past. Is it not so? If you do this, if you kill the Emperor... Oh, how the masses will fear and respect you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You can trust your servant to keep this secret?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, Rexus is no mere servant. He has been with the Motierre family since I was a child. I trust the man with my life. You must deliver those items to your superior. And I...I must get out of this foul place.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player returns to the Sanctuary.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You're back. Good. All right, so? Did you meet this Motierre? What did he want?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Motierre wants us...to kill the Emperor.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're joking.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (Show Astrid the amulet and sealed letter)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The letter explains it all. The amulet is for expenses.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: By Sithis, you're not joking. To kill the Emperor of Tamriel...the Dark Brotherhood hasn't done such a thing since the assassination of Pelagius. As a matter of fact, no one has dared assassinate an Emperor of Tamriel since the murder of Uriel Septim, and that was two hundred years ago...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Surely the Night Mother wouldn't misdirect us...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, she certainly wouldn't. And...for whatever reason, she chose to relay Motierre's information to you. I don't know exactly what's going on here, if you're the Listener, or this is some kind of fluke, or what. But what we now have before us...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So we'll accept the contract?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're damn right we'll accept it. If we pull this off, the Dark Brotherhood will know fear and respect we haven't seen in centuries. You think I'd abandon an opportunity to lead my Family to glory? But this is all so much to take in. I need time to read the letter, and figure out where we go from here. And this amulet. Hmmm...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What are you thinking?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm thinking we need that amulet appraised. I want to know where it came from, how much it's worth, and if we can actually get away with selling it. And, there's only one man who can give us what we need -- Delvin Mallory. He's a fence, a private operator. Works out of the Ratway, in Riften. Give me the letter. Bring Mallory the amulet. Find out everything you can, and sell it if he's willing. He'll offer a letter of credit -- that's fine. Delvin Mallory and the Dark Brotherhood have...history. He can be trusted.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player finds Delvin in Riften's subterranean bar, the Ragged Flagon. He responds differently if the player's unaffiliated with the Guild.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Somethin' you need? Anything for the Guild.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, now you must be lost. Best ya scurry off while you're able. The Ratway, well, it has a habit of swallowin' up the uninvited.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Actually, I'm here on Dark Brotherhood business.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Dark Brotherhood requires your services.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh. Oh I see. • Well now, how is Astrid doin' these days, uh? Tell her to stop by some time. We can have a drink. Catch up. Ah, but we can discuss that later, yeah? What does the Brotherhood need? • Well, you're makin' friends, ain't ya? So, uh...how is Astrid doin' these days? Tell her to stop by some time. We can have a drink. Catch up. Ah, but business! Of course. What kind of business?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What can you tell me about this? (Give Delvin the amulet)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's see... Where oh where did you get this? Don't answer -- I don't want to know. This is an amulet of the Emperor's Elder Council. Specially crafted for each member. Worth a small fortune. Ain't somethin' you'd give up lightly. Look, it ain't my business ta tell the Dark Brotherhood its business, but if you killed a member of the Elder Council, you'd better belie--
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Will you buy it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Buy it? This? An Elder Council amulet? Oh yes. Oh yes, indeed. Wait just a moment... Here. It's a letter of credit. Usable, by Astrid only, for any service or item I can provide. As per our standard arrangement. You bring that back to your lovely mistress. With my regards.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player returns to the Sanctuary.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Good, you're back. Well, what did Mallory have to say? Is the amulet authentic?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, and specially made for members of the Elder Council.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Elder Council... Oh, now that explains quite a bit. Motierre, you naughty, naughty boy. Hiring the Dark Brotherhood to help you rise beyond your station. Delicious. Was Mallory willing to buy the amulet?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He was. Here's a letter of credit.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Splendid. Then we're ready to begin. Or, specifically, you're ready to begin. After all, you're the one the Night Mother spoke to. Now then. I hope you have something nice to wear. Because you're going to a wedding.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A wedding?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, more like the public reception. It should be a lovely affair. You'll mingle with the guests, eat some cake...stab the bride. Oh yes. You've got to kill the bride. At her wedding. And they say romance is dead.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who's the target?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Her name is Vittoria Vici. She oversees the East Empire Company's business holdings in Solitude. The wedding is being held in that city, at the Temple of the Divines. Her death will cause an uproar, which is exactly what we want. Vici is likely to address her guests frequently, as is the wedding custom. Kill her when she does that, and I promise you a significant bonus. Now go. And give my best to the bride.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Enough talk. Just tell me who to kill.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Very well. The target's name is Vittoria Vici. She oversees the East Empire Company's business holdings in Solitude. The wedding is being held in that city, at the Temple of the Divines. Remember, we want people to notice. Kill Vici while she's addressing her guests, as is the custom, and I can promise a bonus. Now go. And give the bride a special kiss, from me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (Remain silent)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your target's name is Vittoria Vici. She oversees the East Empire Company's business holdings in Solitude. The wedding is being held in that city, at the Temple of the Divines. Her death will cause an uproar, which is exactly what we want. Vici is likely to address her guests frequently, as is the wedding custom. Kill her when she does that, and I promise you a significant bonus. Now go. And give the city of Solitude a celebration they're not likely to forget.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Can you provide any more details on the contract?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This is a public kill. How you do it is entirely up to you. Arrow to the throat? Knife in the belly? Your choice, so long as it's loud and messy. Because of the current political climate, people are going to assume the murder is related to the bad blood between the Legion and Stormcloaks. In any event, when Vici dies, it's going to be complete pandemonium. Best have your escape route planned out in advance.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's Vici's connection to the Emperor?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: An excellent question. Vittoria Vici is the first cousin to our dear Emperor, Titus Mede II. Vici has obvious Imperial connections. Her husband has ties to the Stormcloaks. Their union is a step toward reconciliation. So if there's a murder at the wedding... Not only will it stall the peace process -- it will send shockwaves throughout the entire Empire. The Emperor's hand will be forced. He'll have to travel to Skyrim to deal with the aftermath...and he'll find the Dark Brotherhood waiting.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why isn't the Emperor attending the wedding?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hmph. He had a trip to Skyrim planned for months, and canceled at the last minute. Much to his cousin's dismay. Seems the Emperor realized his presence would necessitate a more direct role in the ongoing hostilities. A role he was, obviously, unwilling to take. All that will change with his cousin's murder. Everyone will think it was motivated by the conflict between the Imperial Legion and Stormcloaks. And the Emperor will be forced to come clean up the mess. Off to Solitude with you. Time to give the Emperor some real motivation to visit Skyrim.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As usual, the other Family members can comment on the current contract.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You got to kill a soft little woman on her wedding day? What's next? Murdering a crippled orphan in his sleep?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's no fair. I love weddings. Astrid should have given this contract to me. Instead, she's got me visiting cities, assessing security. How boring. But listen, I think I can help you. The wedding reception is outside the Temple of the Divines, right? In Solitude? If so, the bride will probably address the crowd from the balcony. It overlooks the courtyard. Well, there's an old statue there. I've seen it. Hanging right over where she'll be standing. Old means weak. Weak means it could fall. Hmmm?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, killing her will be easy. She'll be so happy, she'll never see it coming. I should know, I killed a bride once. It was our honeymoon. Tepid, I said! The bathwater should be tepid! Lukewarm is not tepid! Close, maybe, but there is a difference! Stupid cow.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I hope you don't mind, but I took the liberty of surveying the site of the reception. There's a small parapet, just opposite the balcony, that would prove an excellent spot for a long-range kill. I left something there for you. If you're inclined to take that approach.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Slaughtering the Emperor's cousin? At her wedding? Those guards will be out for blood. Wouldn't surprise me if the crowd jumped in too.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your contract sound simple, which means it certainly will not be. Getting into that reception will be easy, but have you thought about getting out?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player goes to the wedding. If Vici is approached formally...
label: ACTION

dialogue: What an amazing day this has been. I hope you've been enjoying the festivities. I'm...I'm just so overwhelmed. Such kindness...for me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Stormcloaks say hello!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh! Well, you tell your Stormcloak friends "hello" right back at them! This is a day of healing! Legion, Stormcloaks -- all are welcome here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hail the Imperial Legion!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ha ha ha ha! Yes, yes indeed! Hail the Imperial Legion! Hail the Stormcloaks! Hail Solitude and the Eight Divines! On this glorious day, we honor everyone! Ha ha ha ha!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (Remain silent)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, no need to be shy! My day is your day! Please -- eat, drink, make merry! We're all friends here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Vittoria will also make a speech from the balcony. For posterity:
label: ACTION

dialogue: Good people of Solitude. I just wanted to thank you all for being here. To thank you for sharing this wonderfully happy day with myself, and my new husband. Today, the problems of Skyrim are not my problems. Nor are they yours. Today we are joined in peace and happiness. So please, enjoy yourselves. I thank you all again for making this the best wedding a woman could ask for.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After the kill goes down, panic erupts.
label: ACTION

dialogue: What in the...? Vittoria! No!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Aiiiieeeeeeee!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No! Noooooo!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The bride has been murdered! Somebody help!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If the player is detected, Veezara may appear.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Astrid ordered me to keep an eye on you. Figured you could use a hand when the chaos erupted. I'll try to hold them off as best I can. You get back to the Sanctuary.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Either way, the player returns to Sanctuary.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Ha ha! The news is everywhere! Vittoria Vici, the Emperor's cousin, butchered at her own wedding! Well done! Let's see his eminence try to ignore this. (Remain silent) She bled like a stuck pig.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, the blushing bride now serves Sithis in the Void.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: With Vici's murder, you've started us down a path the Dark Brotherhood hasn't traveled in centuries. The assassination of an Emperor. And now, your reward. A unique spell to summon a legend of the Dark Brotherhood. His soul serves us now in death, as his body once did in life.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, and of course, the bonus, for killing Vici while she addressed her guests, as instructed. Gold...simple and pure. Spend it as you will.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Unfortunately, in your zeal, you failed to eliminate Vici while she addressed her guests, as directed. I'm sorry, but your bonus is forfeit.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now then, time to proceed to the next stage of the plan. Go and speak with Gabriella. She's been helping me arrange your next contract.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If Veezara appeared in Solitude, he'll comment on it back at the Sanctuary.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Ah, you're back. It was good to fight alongside you. I'm sure people won't be forgetting that wedding anytime soon, hmm?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player locates Gabriella.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Dear brother. I've been waiting for you. Your next contract awaits, as I'm sure Astrid indicated.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She did. What are the details?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: With the Emperor's arrival in Skyrim now a certainty, his security service, the Penitus Oculatus, will need to begin its preparations immediately. Security is being handled by a Commander Maro. Astrid and I have devised a plan to break the man, and in doing so, cripple the Emperor's protection. You are to slay the commander's son, Gaius Maro, and once he is dead, plant false evidence on him, implicating him in a plot to kill the Emperor.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I understand. Gaius Maro will die.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Gaius Maro will die! Hail Sithis!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (Remain silent)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He is set to leave the Penitus Oculatus outpost at Dragon Bridge, and inspect the security of each city in Skyrim. Go there now. Observe Gaius Maro's departure, and follow him. Waylay him in one of the cities, and send his soul to Sithis. Once he's dead, plant the incriminating letter on his body, and let fate take care of the rest. Oh, and one final thing...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: To earn your bonus, do not kill Gaius Maro in Dragon Bridge, or on the road. Kill him in one of the other major cities he'll be visiting. There, the body will be discovered quickly, as will the letter implicating Gaius Maro in the plot to assassinate the Emperor. Do that, and Astrid has authorized me to grant you a rather unique bonus. It is a special token, to be given to Olava the Feeble, in Whiterun. Olava is an old and dear friend, and a powerful seer. The token entitles you to a reading of your future. It's an opportunity one should not pass up.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What will killing Gaius Maro accomplish?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Killing Commander Maro would do no good. Someone would merely replace him. No, we need him to remain in charge. But...distracted. Weakened. Implicate and kill his son Gaius, and the commander will be grief-stricken and humiliated, his family name ruined. The security plan will then fail. Best yet, the Emperor will be lulled into a false sense of security, thinking an assassination plot had already been discovered and foiled.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me about Dragon Bridge.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's a small town, with one rather unique feature -- it houses Skyrim's only Penitus Oculatus outpost. It was established by Commander Maro when he first arrived in Skyrim, several months ago. When he began preparing for the Emperor's initial visit.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do you know Gaius Maro's schedule?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, so your best plan is to follow him after he leaves Dragon Bridge. However, there is one other option... We know there's an actual written travel schedule, somewhere in the Penitus Oculatus outpost. Securing that would, obviously, be most beneficial... Walk in Gaius Maro's shadow, and deliver to him the judgment of Sithis.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All uninvolved Family members can give their two cents, except Cicero.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I've taken the liberty of visiting the cities, and spreading some nasty rumors about Gaius Maro. To make his treachery that much more believable.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's the matter, Listener? The Night Mother not feeling very chatty these days? You need help from your flesh and blood lessers? You've got to track a man, kill him, and then frame him for a crime. This contract's perfect...for me. Clearly, my lovely wife made a mistake.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Normally I talk to a victim before I end his life, but I wouldn't recommend it this time. Maro will be alert to danger. Talking may spook him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Remember, your target is Gaius Maro, the son. Not Commander Maro, the father! We need him alive. But the son... Ha! Scorch his face off!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Killing Gaius Maro in a city will be challenging because of all the guards, but fights, even murder, are fairly common. Killing him secretly will certainly make things easier on you, but if there are witnesses, so be it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Astrid had me investigate the Penitus Oculatus. Their members are highly trained, effective warriors. Be on your guard, brother.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player goes to Dragon Bridge. Gaius is talking with his pops.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Father, you worry too much. I'll be fine.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know you will. But all the same, remember everything I said. Stay alert, and when you get to the cities, make your observations and move on.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I understand. But you're being paranoid. I'm inspecting security, not charging off into battle. There's not a lot that can go wrong.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Son, when the Emperor's safety is concerned, anything could go wrong. Off with you, now. And good travels.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Farewell, father. I'll return as soon as I'm able.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, this is it, then. Look after yourself, Gaius. You're doing your duty, and I'm proud of you. But you'd better come back to me. You hear?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, Faida. I may travel alone, but you know I carry you always in my heart. I'll see you soon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If Gaius is ever approached for conversation...
label: ACTION

dialogue: Keep back, citizen. I have important business I must attend to.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After I kill you, I'm going to kill the Emperor.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What? Filthy assassin! We'll see who lies dead!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Traveling alone can be so dangerous...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is that a threat? Back off, or by the Eight I'll cleave that arrogant head off its shoulders.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (Remain silent)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm sorry, but I really don't have time for this. Move along.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After the kill, one returns to Gabriella.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Ah, at last. I've been anxiously awaiting your return.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Gaius Maro is dead.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, I know. As does Astrid. • You have done well, and have earned both your reward, and a bonus, as I may have mentioned. • And you've earned your payment, though the bonus is forfeit, as I'm sure you're aware. But you should know that we have a more pressing matter to deal with. It's...Cicero. There's been an incident. You should proceed into the Sanctuary. I'll let Astrid explain.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player enters the main hall to find Babette tending to a wounded Veezara.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Just try to relax, Veezara. Let the elixir do its work. You'll feel better, shortly.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Achh... Thank you, dear. You are most kind. The jester's cut feels as bad as it looks, I'm afraid.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Damn it, this never should have happened! We knew better. We knew better, and still we let our guards down. Agh!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll admit, even I'm having a hard time disagreeing with you...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player walks over.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Maro is dead, I know. But we've got bigger problems right now!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Gabriella mentioned something about Cicero...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The fool went absolutely berserk! He wounded Veezara, he tried to kill me, and then he fled. I knew that lunatic couldn't be trusted.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's true, I'm afraid. Cicero was a little whirlwind, slashing this way and that. It would have been funny, if he weren't trying to murder us all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't forget the ranting and raving. About the Night Mother, how she was the true leader of the Dark Brotherhood and Astrid was just a "pretender."
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look, we've got to deal with this situation. You've got to deal with this situation.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do you want me to do?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I want you to find that miserable little fool and end his life! But first...find my husband. Make sure he's all right. After the attack, Arnbjorn flew into a rage. When Cicero left...Arnbjorn went after him. They disappeared into the wild. Search Cicero's room. Maybe there's something in there that sheds some light on where he might have gone. Let me know the minute you find something. I've got to see to Veezara, and calm everyone down.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Bested by a fool. Who's the fool now, hmm?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hush, Veezara. You were very brave. Astrid may well be dead if not for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She's right. I'll be forever in your debt, dearest brother. Now be quiet. Just...just rest.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Everyone present can comment on Cicero's latest annoyance, both when starting dialogue and when asked directly. Astrid has additional replies.
label: ACTION

dialogue: That twisted jester will pay for what he's done...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Isn't there any way to work this out?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look, the Dark Brotherhood is a family. This Sanctuary is a family. And, we've always welcome those...shunned by society. Werewolves, wizards, eternal ten-year-old vampires...what does it matter? In truth, I've rarely met a lunatic I haven't liked. Cicero's problem isn't his madness. It's an adherence to an ancient, outmoded way of life. The Night Mother's ways...simply are not our ways. He just couldn't accept that. And now he'll have to pay the price.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Did something set Cicero off?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, nothing. At least nothing I'm aware of. Well... If I'm being honest, I haven't exactly been discreet lately in expressing my frustration with this whole situation. Obeying the Night Mother. You being the Listener. It's ridiculous. No offense. Cicero may have heard me talking to one of the others about the Night Mother. It's possible I was...not entirely respectful. But to go this far. To attempt to murder the leader of the Sanctuary. Cicero must pay with his life. There is no other option. Damnable jester...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I believed in Cicero. But he's betrayed us all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Cicero destroyed any sympathy I may have had for him when he wounded Veezara. Kill the fool and be done with it. Go. Do what has to be done.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Boy, did you miss all the excitement.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right, so maybe I was wrong. Maybe Cicero coming here wasn't the best thing that could have happened. But even I didn't anticipate this. Well, you know the old saying. When life gives you lemons... ...go murder a clown. Burn that little jester alive.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It was a truly terrifying scene. Beautiful, in some respects.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I feel only pity for Cicero. He must die, of course, but can any of us truly blame him for his actions? We mocked him, disrespected the Old Ways. Our actions were shameful. Surely the Night Mother weeps this day.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Should have figured the little lunatic would completely snap.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Going after Cicero now would be a fool's errand. That little jester is currently being digested in Arnbjorn's stomach, mark my words.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It only hurts when I laugh. He he he. Oww...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, do not underestimate Cicero. A man like that, small and foolish, is easy to mock. To underestimate. Don't make the same mistake I did.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player finds writings in Cicero's quarters. Astrid is notified.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Have you found something?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, Cicero's journal.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good, good. Does it say where he may be headed?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, an abandoned Sanctuary in Dawnstar. I have the passphrase.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Dawnstar Sanctuary? Whatever for? Never mind, it doesn't matter. You need to leave. Now. Every moment counts, so I want you to take my horse. His name is Shadowmere. You'll find him outside, by the pool. Let's just say he's...one of us. Find Arnbjorn. Make sure my husband's all right. And then send that jester's twisted little soul to the Void, in as many pieces as possible.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do we know of the Dawnstar Sanctuary?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, it's ancient. Apparently one of the first Sanctuaries in Skyrim. It hasn't been used by the Brotherhood in close to a hundred years. If you say Cicero has gone there, then it stands to reason that he's familiar with the place. That means you'll be fighting him on his own ground. Tread carefully.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player finds the target Sanctuary carved into a hill near Dawnstar. A wounded Arnbjorn sits outside in a pool of his own blood.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Should have figured Astrid would send you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're hurt.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What gave it away? Ha ha ha ha ha. Yeah, got to admit that little jester's good with that butter knife. But don't worry, I gave as good as I got.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Where's Cicero now?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In there! Through the door. Some old Sanctuary, by the looks of it. I would have followed him, but I don't know the phrase.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know the phrase. I'll get Cicero -- you go home.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right, you convinced me. Doubt I'll be much good to you, anyway. The little fop cut me pretty deep. But I slashed him good. Pretty sure I severed an artery. Don't know what you're going to find in there...but you can probably just follow the blood. Do me a favor and kill that little jester twice. Just to make sure.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player gains entry with the "Innocence, dear Brother" passphrase. The glacial lair.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Listener! Is that you? Oh, I knew you'd come. Send the best to defeat the best. Astrid knew her stupid wolf couldn't slay sly Cicero.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, but this isn't at all what mother would want. You kill the Keeper or I kill the Listener? Now that's madness.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ouch! Pointy pointy! My home is well defended. I always have been a stickler for details. Get it? "Stick-ler." Ha ha ha ha ha ha! Oh, I slay me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're...still alive. Cicero respects the listener's abilities, of course, but could you at least slow down a bit? I'm not what I used to be. Heh.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Brrr! Chilly! You'll enjoy this. Not an original part of the Sanctuary, per se. Let's call it a "forced addition." Forced by what? Oh, come and see!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right, so Cicero attacked that harlot, Astrid! But what's a fool to do, when his mother is slandered and mocked? Surely the Listener understands!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Cicero admits, he thought the Listener would be dead by now. Heh. Maybe we can just forget all this? Hmm? Let bygones be bygones? What do you say?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If it's any comfort, I do feel slightly bad about Veezara. Stupid lizard got in my way! But please tell me that hulking sheepdog has bled to death.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And now we come to the end of our play. The grand finale.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player finally confronts Cicero as he's bleeding out by a fireplace.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You caught me! I surrender! Ha ha ha ha.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There is only one cure for your madness, Cicero. Me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, I like that! Very good, very good! Creative! But killing me would be a mistake! Oh yes. You would displease our mother, hmm? For she's your mother too, isn't she...Listener? Walk away! Let poor Cicero live! Tell the pretender Astrid you did the job! Stabbed, strangled, drowned poor Cicero! One little itty bitty lie!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Time to die, traitor!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Traitor? Me? Silly assassin. So confused, so confused...and they say I'm mad! If I'm a traitor, so are you! Have you not heard the maiden's voice? Are you not the Listener? So walk away! Let poor Cicero live! Tell Astrid you did the job! Stabbed, strangled, drowned poor Cicero! A tiny white lie for a dark assassin!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (Remain silent)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, you prefer to listen, eh? Of course, of course! The Listener listens! A joke! A funny joke! I get it. Then listen to this -- don't kill me. Let poor Cicero live! I attacked the strumpet Astrid, I did! And I'd do it again! Anything for our mother! Return to the pretender, tell her I'm dead! Tell her you strangled me with my own intestines! Ha ha! But lie! Yes, lie! Lie, and let me live! Do what you will. Cicero has no fight left. In the end, Sithis will judge us both.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If one kills him:
label: ACTION

dialogue: Coming...Mother...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One returns to Astrid afterward.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Arnbjorn is safe, and for that you have my thanks. But what of the fool? Is Cicero dead?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, Cicero is dead. / Yes, Cicero is dead. (Lie)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Excellent. Once again, you've proven yourself a born assassin. Tell you what. Why don't you hold onto Shadowmere a while longer? He's a fine steed, and hasn't been ridden as nearly as much as he should lately. And now that this Cicero mess has been mopped up, we can get back to the matter at hand, hmm?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Right. So what's my next task?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's just one more target before we strike out at the Emperor. Have you by chance heard of the "Gourmet"? Read his cookbook? It's become quite a phenomenon. The Gourmet is scheduled to cook for the Emperor at a special dinner. You'll kill him, steal his Writ of Passage, and assume the roll of master chef. Festus has been spearheading this part of the assassination plan. He's close to discovering the identity of the Gourmet. You should report to him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Arnbjorn has additional dialogue at this time.
label: ACTION

dialogue: There you are. Look, I...I just wanted to say thanks for coming to find me. Back in Dawnstar. Crazy jester finally met his match, am I right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One visits Festus for more info.
label: ACTION

dialogue: There you are. Took your sweet time dealing with Cicero, hmph? Now let's get down to business. Astrid told you about the Gourmet, I hope?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That I need to kill him and take on his identity?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Quite so. But first you'll need to learn who he is. Assuming, of course, that the Gourmet actually is a "he." Could be a woman for all we know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So you don't even know who the Gourmet is? Wonderful.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't be so petulant!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do you have any idea how I might find out?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, indeed I do! Indeed I do!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (Remain silent)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know, maybe I was wrong about you after all. Anyone who's smart enough to shut up and listen can't be all bad. In my, um, investigations, I came upon this. It's a copy of the Gourmet's cookbook. Ah, but not just any copy. It's signed you see! Seems to be a message from the Gourmet to one Anton Virane. I've tracked Virane to the keep in Markarth. It would seem he's the cook.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And this Anton Virane knows the Gourmet's true identity?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I believe so. Therefore, you need to obtain that information from Virane -- who the Gourmet is, and where he can be found. Oh, and when you're done with Virane, kill him. Loose ends and all that. Next, you'll have to... Are you still paying attention? (Remain silent) Of course, Festus. Please continue.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, I'm waiting with bated breath...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hmph. As I was saying... You'll need to kill the Gourmet, of course. But what's more, you'll need to get his Writ of Passage, so you can take his place. Oh, and if you can, hide his body. The longer it takes for anyone else to determine his real identity, the better. Now off with you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What else can you tell me about the Gourmet?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nobody knows his true identity. Well, nobody except Gaius Maro, and you've already taken care of him. I do know the Gourmet was classically trained in traditional Breton cuisine in High Rock. So that's where he must have met Anton Virane. In any event, our anonymous chef shares a passion for food with all of Tamriel. And that anonymity will prove the Emperor's undoing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me about this cookbook.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: "Uncommon Taste." It was published a few years ago, and became a sensation throughout the Empire almost overnight. The recipes were hailed as both practical and decadent. I've made a few of the Gourmet's dishes myself, actually. His roast mutton with Redguard berry sauce is to die for. But his chocolate pate gives me the runs.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So the Gourmet is in Skyrim?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. Gaius Maro, on orders from his father, arranged for the Gourmet to come to Skyrim months ago. To serve as the Emperor's personal chef. But the Emperor cancelled his journey at the last minute. Maro was smart, kept the Gourmet around, in case things changed. And so, the Gourmet has remained in seclusion, somewhere in Skyrim...on indefinite hold. Probably feels like a prisoner. But you'll fix that. Remember, the Markarth Keep. That's where you'll find Anton Virane. Probably cooking up all of the Gourmet's recipes, passing them off as his own.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Those unrelated will chime in if asked about the job.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Believe it or not, Festus likes you. He senses your power, your potential. Follow his instructions to the letter, and you may even earn his respect.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The last thing you need is my help. Listener or not, you have proven yourself time and again. To Astrid, to the Family...and to me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes -- don't kill the Gourmet! Oh, I know you have to, but it makes me sad all the same. I love the Gourmet's recipes. The world will soon be a blander, last flavorful place.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've been directed to dispose of the Gourmet's body, is that correct? I often find water to be a suitable hiding place. A lake, a pool...the sea.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hmph. I wouldn't worry too much about this Virane giving you the information you need. Give him a good scare, and he'll squawk like a Hagraven. That said... If your attack on Virane is witnessed, those Markarth guards are going to be none too happy...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hmmm... Well, assuming this Gourmet is just a cook, it will probably be an easy kill. Just be discreet -- alerting others will be the real threat.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player visits the cook in Markarth's Understone Keep.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Yes, yes, for the hundredth time, I am a Breton. I was born in High Rock. And then I came here. I am not a Reachman! (Remain silent) Ah yes, High Rock. Home of exquisite Breton cuisine...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know who you are, Anton Virane. And where you're from.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who are you? What do you want?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Gourmet. Who is he? Where is he?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The...the Gourmet? Never! I don't know what led you here, but nothing will betray my trust. I'll take the secret of the Gourmet's identity to my grave.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: For the Dark Brotherhood, that can be easily arranged. (Intimidate)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Dark Brotherhood? Now...now wait a minute. Let's not be hasty. I mean, surely my friend wouldn't want me to endanger my own life. Right? Look, his name is Balagog gro-Nolob. He's an Orc! The Gourmet's an Orc! He's staying at the Nightgate Inn! That's all I know! Now...now you'll let me go. Right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course, Anton. Thank you. (Lie)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Okay. All right. Wonderful. You're welcome! I'll just be on my way, then...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm afraid not. Loose ends, and all that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. Oh, please no...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (Remain silent)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So...we're done?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player visits the Gourmet after disposing of Anton.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Whatever it is, I'm sure I can't be of help. I'm just here on... holiday.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You served your last meal...Gourmet.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Gourmet? Why I... Um... Oh dear. You're going to kill me now, aren't you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Soon, the Emperor will die. Murdered, by the Gourmet.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What? The Emperor? But I... Oh. Oh, by the gods, no. No, you can't do this. You can't!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (Remain silent)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, well. Perhaps someone else in the village can assist you. Please, you're starting to...frighten me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player returns to the Sanctuary after stealing the Gourmet's writ.
label: ACTION

dialogue: So, the prodigal murderer returns. And the Gourmet?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Dead.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If the job was done to the letter:
label: ACTION

dialogue: So I gathered. It seems a certain Orc has disappeared. Which means you not only killed the Gourmet, but disposed of the body as well. You've got the Writ of Passage too, I see. Splendid, splendid... Ah, and word has come in from Markarth that the keep's cook has met an untimely demise. You performed your duties to the letter. (Remain silent) You would expect any less from the Listener?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All I've ever wanted to do is serve this Sanctuary.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hmph. I was wrong about you. I see that now. Maybe we all were. Here's your payment. And...a little something extra, as well. From me. Consider it my way of apologizing. For being so damned curmudgeonly! It's called the Nightweaver's Band. I wore this for years. I want you to have it now. It'll give your magic and sneakiness some much needed "oomph." Now, you better get a move on and see Astrid. It's time! Time for the final stage of this grand and glorious operation!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If the job was done, but the body wasn't hidden:
label: ACTION

dialogue: Good, good. And you've got the Writ of Passage, too, I see. So there's that. I also received word from Markarth. It would seem Anton Virane has suffered an untimely fate, as well. Good. But unfortunately, that inn is abuzz with the news of somebody killing one of their guests! What, hiding the body was too much for you to handle? Bah! Useless. Here's your gold. Now go see Astrid. The time to move against the Emperor has finally come. Sithis help us all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player reports to Astrid.
label: ACTION

dialogue: So it's done. You've killed the Gourmet. And now Titus Mede II is as good as dead.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So it's time? We're ready to assassinate the Emperor?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh yes. And I've decided you will have the honor.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I won't disappoint you, Astrid. Or the Dark Brotherhood.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, I have the utmost faith in your success, believe me. So let's begin.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Emperor will die! For Sithis and the Night Mother!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. For Sithis...and the Night Mother. You are the Listener after all, hmm? So let's not waste any more time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (Remain silent)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hmph. Look at you. So calm. So confident. I do believe you were born for this task. So let's begin. Go now to Castle Dour in Solitude. Present the Gourmet's Writ of Passage to the officer in charge, Commander Maro. I'm sure you remember him. You'll gain unrestricted access to the kitchens, and then the Emperor. You're posing as a chef, so you'll be able to poison his meal rather easily.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Which poison I should use?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Here, take this -- it's called Jarrin Root. All it takes is one taste, and the effects are quite immediate. The Emperor will be serving Sithis before he even knows he's dead. Once Mede has been killed, escape through the upper door, and across the bridge. I've "arranged" for it to be unguarded once the alarm is sounded. Now go, my friend. Go, and fulfill your destiny as Listener.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What else can you tell me about Jarrin Root?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's a rare plant, found only on the island of Stros M'Kai. It can be served like any vegetable -- cut up, put in a salad, perhaps boiled in a stew. One taste will lead to nearly instant death, so don't even think about it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Anything else before I set off?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It took all the favors, bribes, and blackmails I could muster, but I've secured your exit out of the keep. Just follow my instructions, and the Dark Brotherhood will be back on top. All thanks to you... Listener.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If one inquires to the other Family members before leaving...
label: ACTION

dialogue: You get to kill the Emperor. The bloody Emperor. You'd better enjoy this one. You owe us all that much. So make it bloody, painful, and spectacular.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't take any chances with this one. Use the Jarrin Root to poison the Emperor's food. You're disguising yourself as a chef -- it only makes sense.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, good to see you, brother. Gearing up to kill the Emperor? Exciting times. Exciting times, indeed. Well... While it's true I prefer sorcery's more destructive nuances, we mustn't forget the many spells with simpler, more practical applications. Sure, you poison the Emperor, but what then? Why not summon an atronach and cause some chaos? Or turn invisible and slip away? Use your imagination!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What an honor, the assassination of an Emperor. And all because you are the Listener, favored by the Night Mother, anointed by Sithis. I am so very happy for you. If not a bit...envious.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. You're killing the Emperor himself. The Dark Brotherhood will get one shot at this, and you've been given the honors. So don't screw up.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Astrid has arranged for your escape, no? Then you have nothing to worry about. Get in, kill the Emperor, and get out. Then, we celebrate.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player heads for Castle Dour to see the commander. Penitus Oculatus agents are chatting outside.
label: ACTION

dialogue: This city is crawling with Imperial Legion, and you know what? I'm still nervous. Lazy and useless, the lot of them. They can't even keep the Stormcloaks in line. No way I trust them with the Emperor's life.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You worry too much. The Emperor's never been safer. You think assassination attempts are planned overnight? We discovered the plot. End of threat.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I suppose. But what about the old man? Son killed, family name ruined...and he acts as if nothing even happened. Think he's even fit for duty?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm going to pretend I didn't hear that. Commander Maro is the best the Penitus Oculatus has ever produced. You should be half the man he is.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You misunderstand. It's just...I feel for him, is all. To carry a weight like that. It's got to take its toll. That happened to me, I'd be a wreck.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Maro is nearby.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Stop right there. The tower is off limits until further notice.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (Show Maro the Gourmet's Writ of Passage)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's this now? ...order of his eminence... ...possessor of these papers...the "Gourmet"... By Azura. The Gourmet! I...I'm sorry! I didn't realize! We...we had no idea when to expect you, you understand.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're not dressed as I would have expected...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your clothes... of course... I should have realized...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But please, don't let me keep you. Proceed to the kitchens straight away. Gianna, the castle chef, has been eagerly awaiting your arrival.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player tracks down Gianna.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Not another delivery. I told you people, our stocks are fine. Now put whatever you have over there, then get out!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You misunderstand. For I am...the Gourmet!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The...Gourmet? Oh! Finally! When I heard the Gourmet was being brought in to cook for the Emperor, I could hardly believe it. It's just...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: • You're a Nord! I never would have guessed it! But where in the world did you learn to cook like that? Here in Skyrim? Or maybe somewhere less... • I guessed right! I...I always imagined the great Gourmet was a Wood Elf. You see, only someone with a knowledge of woodland herbs could combine... • Well, I just never expected the Gourmet to be a Breton. It almost seems too obvious. Some of the greatest cooks have been Bretons, and... • You...you're an Argonian! Where did you learn to cook like that? Surely not in Black Marsh. Why even the... • You're a High Elf! I...I never would have guessed it. So many of your recipes are clearly aimed at the commonfolk. It just seems... • I... Well, I just can't believe the Gourmet is a Dark Elf. How difficult it must have been for you in Morrowind. The food there is... • Well, I don't mean to seem disappointed, but...I just never figured the Gourmet was an Imperial. I had dreamed of something more exotic, maybe... • It's just... Well...you're an Orc! Ha ha ha! If the people of the Empire only knew! I mean, now I understand your need for secrecy. Most would... • Oh, well, it's just...I never imagined the Gourmet was a Khajiit. You know, because of all the fur, and the potential for getting hair in the... • Well, I'm just surprised the Gourmet is a Redguard. I had you pegged for a Wood Elf, honestly. You know, because of your use of...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Silence! I am ready to prepare the grand feast!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh. Well, um, actually...you're not. Wearing a chef's hat, I mean. There's one right over there on the shelf. You can't very well cook without it. Oh, just look at you. Absolutely brilliant. Now...now you're just as I imagined.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If the player already has the hat on, the delay is skipped.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Enough! The Gourmet is here to cook, not talk! Let us begin.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh! Yes, but of course. Ahem. The Emperor has requested your signature dish -- the Potage le Magnifique. I've taken the liberty of getting it started. But the cookbook only says so much, and everyone makes the Potage differently. I would be honored if we could make it...the Gourmet's special way. The base broth is already boiled. We can get started right now. So... Which ingredient should I add next?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Carrots.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Carrots? Really? Okay... What next?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A sweetroll.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ooooh...how decadent. I never would have guessed it. What next?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (Remain silent)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, I get it. This is a test, right? You want to see how well I know the Potage le Magnifique. Well then, I think a pinch of frost salts should do the trick, right? Now what?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The next ingredient is...vampire dust.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Vampire dust? Seriously? Hmm... Yes, I guess I can see how that would add a more...earthy texture. And, oddly enough, we do have some on hand... All right, what next then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You must now add a splash of mead.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, of course. I suspected as much.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (Remain silent)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My choice, then? Very well. I think we should add some Chaurus eggs. For additional flavor.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We shall now add...a giant's toe!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A...giant's toe? You're...sure about that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I said a giant's toe! Do not question the Gourmet!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course! I...I'm sorry. One giant's toe... There. What, um... What next?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One nirnroot.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Really? Oh, I use Nirnroot as a special seasoning all the time as well. What a wonderful idea. Okay, now what?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (Remain silent)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ooookay... Um... Let me see. Thistle? Yes, let's try that. Just a sprig or two...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You must now add...a septim.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A Septim? As in...a gold coin? Really? Ah, I see now. The would give the Potage le Magnifique a slightly metallic -- but delicious -- aftertaste. Simply Brilliant. I have to say, the stew seems done.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Diced horker meat.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hmmm...horker. So delicious. I swear, is there a soul alive who doesn't enjoy the taste of... Sorry, I didn't mean to get carried away. There we go, one cup of diced horker meat. I have to say, the stew seems done.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (Remain silent)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My choice, hmm? All right, then -- tomatoes. Simple, yet infinitely flavorful. Don't you agree? Well, I have to say the stew seems done. Add anything else, and we may dilute the distinct flavors. So...is that it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We're done. Let us serve...the Potage le Magnifique!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Excellent. They should be ready for us now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There is one final ingredient. Here, add this. (Give jarrin root)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh? What is this, some kind of herb? Are you sure? The Potage tastes perfect as it is. Any other ingredient might...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now, now, Gianna. Who's the Gourmet here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Heh, I'm sorry. Of course. It's your most famous recipe, after all. All right then, your secret ingredient's been added. And I may say so...it has been an honor, getting a chance to prepare a meal with, well...the best chef in the entire Empire.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They finish the dish.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I'll carry the stew pot, and lead the way up to the dining room. I'm sure the Emperor and his guests are dying to meet you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A conversation from above can be heard en route.
label: ACTION

dialogue: But aren't you the least bit nervous? After everything that's happened?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You mean the wedding? My cousin's apparent murder? An unfortunate misunderstanding, no more. Cold mead, hot tempers... these things happen.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Quite. Yet that recent business with the young officer. Maro, was it? The son of your commander, plotting your assassination.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, an unfortunate turn of events, that. But an isolated incident. And I have been assured that the fault was with the man's son alone. Truth is, we are in no danger whatsoever. Killing an Emperor can be useful, but befriending one? Now that's beneficial -- as I'm sure you'd all agree.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The two head upstairs.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Here we are. Gods, I'm nervous. We'll go in in just a moment. Please, I'll serve. You just stand there and...be amazing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They enter the Emperor's dining room.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Aha! Here we are. Honored guests, I present to you -- the Gourmet! Ah, the Potage le Magnifique. So delicious. My friends, as Emperor, I of course reserve the right of first taste.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (laughs)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (laughs)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If the player poisoned the meal:
label: ACTION

dialogue: Oh... Oh now marvelous. Just delicious. It is everything I had hoped it would be. It...I... I think something's...wrong... I... Ugh...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: By the gods! The Gourmet and the chef have poisoned the Emperor! Get them!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Help! What? No. No, you don't understand! There's been some kind of mistake! I... Agghhhhh!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If the player didn't poison the meal, things go as normal. The people in room will give praise meant for the real Gourmet.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Oh... Oh now marvelous. Just delicious. It is everything I had hoped it would be. Please, everyone. Enjoy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Gourmet. Leave it to Titus to spare no expense.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I prefer a good roast duck. But your soup will do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Maybe when this is all over, you could sign one of your cookbooks for me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The missus and I love your strawberry tarts.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hmmm, the Potage le Magnifique. Smells delicious.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If the player kills the Emperor in a non-stew-related fashion.
