label: ACTION

dialogue: What in blazes!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Gourmet has killed the Emperor!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Either way, the player flees to the tower skybridge after the death plays window, clapping.
label: ACTION

dialogue: That man was, by far, the most insufferable decoy the Emperor has ever employed. I'm glad he's dead. Ah, but I'm even happier that you killed him. You, an assassin for the Dark Brotherhood, have just made an attempt on the Emperor's life. Would have succeeded, had it been the real man. Surprised? So was I, when a member of your "Family" came to me with the plan. We worked out a deal, you see. An exchange. I get you, and the Dark Brotherhood gets to continue its existence. But you know what? I've changed my mind. How about this? I kill you, and butcher each and every one of your miserable little friends? Your Sanctuary's being put to the sword right now. That's what I think of this "deal." You killed my son! All of you! And now you'll pay the price. Kill him. And make sure there's nothing left to bury.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player evades capture and frantically returns to the Sanctuary.
label: ACTION

dialogue: On arrival, Maro's words are shown to be true -- the Penitus Oculatus have the hall.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Which one was the rat?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Dunno. One of these corpses. Does it matter?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Suppose not. But what's taking the others so long? The sooner we get out of here, the better. Smoke's getting bad. This place'll be raging soon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Arcturus took some men deeper in, wanted to be sure. We should maybe...assist them.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You assist all you like. And get roasted for your trouble. I'll guard the exit.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Veezara's body is found near the entrance; Arnbjorn's is in the main hall, hall.
label: ACTION

dialogue: If I am to die today, so bet it. But you'll not soon forget the Dark Brotherhood. Yeargh!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player slays Arcturus, saving Nazir.
label: ACTION

dialogue: So you are alive. I was starting to wonder.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Emperor...it was all a trap. Someone set us up.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Considering most of us are now dead, I assumed as much. And before you ask, no -- I don't think it was you. Well, maybe I did, but you saving my sorry hide just now sort of erased any doubts. So thanks.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We need to get out of here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've got that right. Only a matter of time before we're roasted alive. Come on!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They turn to flee, but...
label: ACTION

dialogue: Listener. I am your only salvation. Come. Embrace me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Damn it! There's got to be a way out of here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player enters the Night Mother's coffin. The sound of Nazir pushing it through the stained glass window and into the pond can be heard.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Sleep.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A short while later, in the pitch blackness, Babette can be heard.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Hurry, Nazir! I'm telling you, he's in there!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm going...as fast...as I can, you stupid she-devil. I don't see you...helping...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not exactly built for manual labor. Now come on, you've almost got it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One more...pull... Yeaahhhh! There.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Can you get it open?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think so. Just hold on a moment.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You must speak with Astrid. Here, in the Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The coffin opens, Nazir having dragged it out of the pond. The fires have all stopped, but the Sanctuary is in ruins, most of it closed off or caved-in.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Whoa, whoa, whoa. Slow down. It's all right. You've been through a lot. Maybe you should just sit down for a bit...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have to speak with Astrid! She's here, in the Sanctuary. Follow me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She's here? By Sithis, I thought we'd lost her. Let's go!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm fine. But the Night Mother has another task for me. Let's go.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh! Well in that case, lead on. I'm right behind you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (Remain silent)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't know, Babette. Looks like he may have suffered a head wound. Best not let him out of our sight...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In Astrid's room, in an alcove previously blocked by a cabinet, the three third-degree burns from top to bottom.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Alive... You're alive... Thank Sithis...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Astrid...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ssshhh... Please. There is much...I have to say. And...not much time... I'm sorry. So very sorry. The Penitus Oculatus... Maro... He said that by giving you to them, he would leave the Dark Brotherhood alone. Forever. By Sithis, I was such a fool. All of this...it's all my fault. You are the best of us, and I nearly killed you...as I've killed everyone else...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You...sent me to die? Traitor!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. I set you up. I wanted you dead. I betrayed you, the Night Mother, and everything I hold dear. And now Maro has betrayed me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You will be judged by Sithis in the Void. I pity you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No! Don't pity me. I deserve whatever fate the Dread Lord has in store. I betrayed you...and now Maro has betrayed me. Fitting...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (Remain silent)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't you see? It was me. I set you up, wanted you dead. I betrayed you, the Night Mother...everything I hold dear. And now Maro has betrayed me. I just wanted things...to stay the way they were. Before Cicero, before the Night Mother. Before...you. I thought I could save us. I was wrong. But you're alive! So there's still a chance. A chance to start over, rebuild. That's why I did...this. Don't you see? I prayed to the Night Mother! I am the Black Sacrament.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What are you saying?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm saying you were right. The Night Mother was right. The old ways... they guided the Dark Brotherhood for centuries. I was a fool to oppose them. And to prove my...sincerity, I have prayed for a contract. You lead this Family now. I give you the Blade of Woe, so that you can see it through. You must kill... Me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, Astrid...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Astrid did the right thing, and now it's your turn. End her suffering.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player stabs Astrid to complete the Sacrament.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Uhh...thank you...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Astrid... By the sands, I still can't wrap my head around it...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If I hadn't heard it with my own ears I wouldn't have believed it. How could Astrid have done this to us? Strangely, I feel only pity for her...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Listener returns to the Night Mother.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Astrid is dead. It is as it should be. May she find redemption in the Void. But while you live, the Dark Brotherhood lives. We must fulfill our contract. Emperor Titus Mede II must be eliminated. Speak with Amaund Motierre at the Bannered Mare in Whiterun. He will know the true Emperor's location. But first, inform Nazir of your plans. For you are the Listener, and must bind this Family together.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player finds Nazir.
label: ACTION

dialogue: By Sithis, what a mess. I guess this is the end.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not exactly. The Night Mother has spoken to me again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What? Well -- what did she say?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I must speak with Amaund Motierre once more.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Amaund Motierre? But that would mean...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The contract is still on. The true Emperor must be assassinated.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You mean...there's still a chance? But how? Our plan has gone to ruin, everyone is dead, the Family...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Our Family lives on, Nazir. You have to trust me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hmph. All right, then. Go. Go, my Listener. Find out what that slimy bastard Motierre has to say, then send the Emperor to Sithis. Ah, but when you're done, there's no use returning here, is there? I was thinking...the Dawnstar Sanctuary. We could make a proper home there. Listen, when you're finished with this Emperor business, meet Babette and me there. I'll find some way to move the Night Mother. Don't worry! Now go! And come back with a barrel full of gold, hmm? Babette, my girl -- pack your things. We're moving.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I was hoping you'd say that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Amaund is found at the Whiterun inn.
label: ACTION

dialogue: What is it? I said I didn't wish to...be disturbed. (Remain silent) We have unfinished business, Motierre.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sithis is due a soul. Wouldn't you agree?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: By the gods. You...you're alive! But I had heard...your Sanctuary... Please! You mustn't think I had anything to do with that! I wanted the Emperor dead! The true Emperor! I still do! It was Maro. He...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Emperor. The real Emperor. Where is he?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You mean, after all that's transpired, the Dark Brotherhood will still...honor the contract? Why, this is astounding news! Wonderful news! The Emperor is still in Skyrim, but not for long. He's onboard his ship, the Katariah, moored offshore in the Solitude Inlet. But you must hurry! If you can get onboard that ship. Kill Titus Mede II, as contracted...I will reveal the location of the dead drop that holds your payment.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Commander Maro. Where is he?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, yes, I can imagine you'd want to settle that score. Last I heard, he was at the Solitude docks, conducting the Emperor's departure.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What kind of security should I expect?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Surely you're joking? This is the true Emperor, not some half-Septim lookalike. He'll be surrounded by elite bodyguards, I'm sure. You'll have your work cut out for you. Still...everyone assumes the Dark Brotherhood has been completely destroyed. They may be a bit more lax than usual.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This ship, the Katariah. How will I get onboard?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, I don't know. It's in the Solitude Inlet -- that's the channel just north of the docks. I suppose you should go to the docks and... swim? Please, make haste. The Emperor's ship won't stay moored forever. We won't get a chance like this again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player makes a detour to find Maro at the Solitude docks.
label: ACTION

dialogue: By the gods...you! But it can't be. You're dead. You... Yeaaaahhhh!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player dispatches an enraged Maro before swimming toward the Katariah, the inner cargo hold.
label: ACTION

dialogue: *sigh* ...and that's the last one. All right, enough of this. Come on, let's get something to eat.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Gods, I'll be glad to see the last of Skyrim. Dragons, murder, rebellion...and we sail right into the middle of it with the Emperor on board.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think we'll all feel better once we're back out at sea. Won't be long now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The bloodletting doesn't stop until the Emperor himself is cornered.
label: ACTION

dialogue: And, once more, I prove Commander Maro the fool. I told him you can't stop the Dark Brotherhood. Never could. Come now, don't be shy. You haven't come this far just to stand there gawking.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You were...expecting me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But of course. You and I have a date with destiny. But so it is with assassins and emperors, hmm?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your rule is at an end! Sithis commands it!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, you can save your sinister bravado. I'll not go to my grave whimpering like an infant. I know why you are here. I must die. And you must deliver the blow. It is simply the way it is.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (Remain silent)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You and I have a date with destiny, it seems. But so it is with assassins and emperors, hmm? Yes, I must die. And you must deliver the blow. It is simply the way it is. But I wonder...would you suffer an old man a few more words before the deed is done?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm listening.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I thank you for your courtesy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've heard enough. Your life ends now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tsk. How unfortunate. I had hoped you would honor an old man's dying wish. Well, let's be done with it then.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (Remain silent)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You will hear me out, then? Good. You will kill me and I have accepted that fate. But regardless of your path through life, I sense in you a certain...ambition. So I ask of you a favor. An old man's dying wish. While there are many who would see me dead, there is one who set the machine in motion. This person, whomever he or she may be, must be punished for their treachery. Once you have been rewarded for my assassination, I want you to kill the very person who ordered it. Would you do me this kindness?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll...consider your request.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you. Now, onto the business at hand I suppose, hmm?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A Dark Brotherhood assassin doesn't do..."favors."
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hmph. Pity. I had hoped to attain even a modicum of justice. Well, onto the business at hand then, hmm?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (Remain silent)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well. Perhaps you'll at least consider it, hmm? Now, on to the business at hand... Well? I won't fight you, so we may as well get this over with.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After the Emperor is slain, one returns to Amaund Motierre.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Aha! You're back!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Titus Mede II lies dead.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know! I know! I received the news not moments ago! Ha ha! This is glorious! My friend, you may not realize it, but you have served the Empire, indeed all of Tamriel, in ways you cannot possibly imagine. Ah, but you care little for politics, am I right? You want money! And money you shall have! Your payment waits for you at a dead drop. It is inside an urn, in the very chamber where we first met, in Volunruud. Now please, go. Collect your money, and let us never look upon one another again. Our business, thank the gods, is concluded.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If one talks to Amaund again...
label: ACTION

dialogue: Actually, Motierre, there is one more thing...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And what might that be?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just a favor...for an honorable man.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You assassins and your riddles. It really does get very annoying, you know. Now if you'll excuse me...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Today is the luckiest day of your life.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ha! Well, I certainly do feel that way. Now, if, um...you'll get going?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (Remain silent)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes? No? Nothing? Very well, then. If you'll just...get going now...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If one kills Amaund:
label: ACTION

dialogue: But...we had a deal...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After picking up the dead drop, the player returns to the Dawnstar Sanctuary. It's already been cleaned up a bit since one chased Cicero.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Well? What word of the Emperor?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Titus Mede II is dead...by my hand.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Truly? Could you have brought us more wondrous news? Recent events nonwithstanding, this is a happy day for us, my friend. Despite your misfortunes, you stayed true to the Dark Brotherhood. You've saved us all, and for this you have my eternal thanks. Now, of course I must ask... Killing the Emperor...how much did Motierre pay for such a thing?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ha! Remarkable! Well, the old bastard certainly made it worth your while, didn't he? Now, might I offer some advice? You should go to Riften and find Delvin Mallory. I believe Astrid had you visit him once before?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: 10,000 Gold. (Lie)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ha! Clearly, we should have killed that old bastard years ago! Now, might I offer some advice? You should go to Riften and find Delvin Mallory. I believe Astrid had you visit him once before?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: 5,000 Gold. (Lie)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh. Is that all? Really? Come now! You're joking with old Nazir! Surely the Emperor's life was worth more than that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Gotcha! It was 20,000 gold.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ha! I knew it, you rascal! By Sithis, the old man was worth the trouble. Now, might I offer some advice? You should go to Riften and find Delvin Mallory. I believe Astrid had you visit him once before?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sorry, no joke. 5,000 gold. (Lie)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Pfft. You'd think an Emperor would fetch at least twice that. Damn that motherless cheapskate, Motierre. In any event, here's my advice. Go to Riften's Ratway, find Delvin Mallory. I believe Astrid had you visit him once before, no? Mallory is an expert "obtainer of goods." We can use this money to repair and refit this Sanctuary. Make a true home for us, eh? You do that and I'll see what I can do about recruiting some new additions to our Family...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This ends the storyline, as all that's left is renovations and doing radiant put 'em here anyway. NM speaks to the player on the way out.
label: ACTION

dialogue: It is done. Emperor Titus Mede II lies dead, and the Dark Brotherhood yet lives. But our work is just beginning. Approach me, Listener, and hear my words.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If Cicero is alive, he'll approach the player after exiting the Sanctuary.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Listener! (Remain silent) What in the name of Sithis...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Cicero! Good to see you again, old friend.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh yes, it is Cicero! You were a fool to spare me. What, did you think I would be grateful? Cicero should be Listener! Not you! Now you will die! ... Ahhh...gotcha! Oh, Listener, you should see the look on your face! Ha ha ha ha ha ha ha! Oh, Cicero has returned! Not to kill the kind Listener, but to serve, until one of us dies horribly, in service to our Mother! Best friends forever! In the meantime, I'll make myself at home in the Sanctuary. I'm sure Mother needs...tending.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The others will comment on Cicero's surprising reappearance.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Why am I not surprised to learn Cicero is alive? I still can't stomach the little clown, but if you've welcomed him here, I won't question it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So wait, Cicero is alive? And we're all friends again? I swear, I can hardly keep up...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If the player goes to Delvin:
label: ACTION

dialogue: Can you repair and refit the Dawnstar Sanctuary?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Dawnstar Sanctuary? Is that where you lot are holing up in now? Hmm... Tell you what. It'll cost you -- a lot -- but I can help you out. What exactly are we talking about here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: New banners. (1,000 gold)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Banners, huh? Trying to pretty up the place? All right, you got it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Poisoner's nook. (5,000 gold)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That'll come in handy, eh? An alchemy station, maybe a little garden with some choice plants. All right, consider it done.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Torture chamber. (5,000 gold)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh ho. Now that's the Dark Brotherhood I know and love. This for business or pleasure? Ah, what's it matter, right? I'll see that it gets done.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Secret entrance (5,000 gold)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yeah, we can do that. I'm thinking a sewer grate on the outskirts of Dawnstar. Leads to a tunnel, then inside. You'll be in or out, quick as a coney.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Master bedroom (3,000 gold)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Heh. Chamber fit for a king and all that, right? No problem. Give ya a big bed, decorate the room real nice, maybe even throw in a few extra baubles.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nothing. Never mind.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Suit yourself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: When asked to supply things and all options are exhausted:
label: ACTION

dialogue: I'm afraid that's it, my friend. I've done all I can. I hope the place is at least livable, now. Good luck with your, um...murders.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If Astrid is slain during "With Friends Like These..." that quest fails and Which guard in which hold is irrelevant.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I killed the leader of the Dark Brotherhood.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You did what? By the gods, you're serious. You'd better report this to Commander Maro right away. He's at the Penitus Oculatus outpost, up in Dragon Bridge.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player goes to meet with the Commander.
label: ACTION

dialogue: A guard sent me. I killed the leader of the Dark Brotherhood.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The leader of the Dark Brotherhood? You mean Astrid? Dead? And this is no jest? Ha! This is a stroke of good fortune. Long have I watched the Dark Brotherhood's movements...waiting for the time to strike. That time is now! My agents have recently acquired the passphrase to their Sanctuary. It is, "Silence, my brother." Every assassin in that hole must be put down! You, my friend. You've slain their leader. This honor should be yours. Do this, and you will be rewarded most handsomely!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player goes to the Sanctuary to begin the slaughter. After, s/he reports back to the commander.
label: ACTION

dialogue: By all I hold holy... Can it be true? Have you actually done it? This is a great day, my friend. You have struck a blow against darkness that will not soon be forgotten! Here, as promised -- a most generous reward! I'll make sure the Emperor himself hears of all you've accomplished. You've made Skyrim a better place.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After overhearing how the Legion was recruiting, the player follows clues to strategy room, arguing about Whiterun.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I'm telling you, Ulfric's planning an attack on Whiterun.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He'd be insane to try. He doesn't have the men.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's not what my scouts report, sir. Every day more join his cause. Riften, Dawnstar, and Winterhold support him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's not a cause. It's a rebellion.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Call it whatever you like, General. The man's going to try to take Whiterun.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Jarl Balgruuf...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Jarl Balgruuf refuses the Legion's right to garrison troops in his city. On the other hand, he also refuses to acknowledge Ulfric's claim.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, if he wants to stand outside the protection of the Empire, fine. Let Ulfric pillage his city.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: General.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You people and your damn Jarls.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sir? You can't force a Nord to accept help he hasn't asked for.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If Ulfric's making a move for Whiterun, then we need to be there to stop him. Draft another letter with the usual platitudes, but this time share some of your intelligence regarding Ulfric's plans. Embellish if you have to. We'll let it seem like it's his idea.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, sir.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You Nords and your bloody sense of honor.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sir.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player goes over to Tullius.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Are my men now giving free reign to anyone who wanders into the castle? Do you have some reason to be here, citizen?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I believe we've already met.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Have we? Oh. Of course... You were at Helgen!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I was at Helgen.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Right... Helgen... One of the prisoners, if I recall correctly.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I was set free. I could've gone anywhere. I came here to fight for the Empire.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I suppose that's true. Fine. Why don't you have a chat with Legate Rikke? I suspect we might have use for someone resourceful like you. Not many survived Helgen. Besides, I'm sure your being imprisoned was all a terrible misunderstanding.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player finds Rikke.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You survived Helgen? General Tullius told me what happened. Not many made it out alive... I've got a good feeling about you. And I don't often get good feelings about anything. A warrior knows to trust her gut... I'm not going to go through the normal process with you. I've got a little test lined up. Pass that, and we'll talk about you joining the Legion.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can handle anything you throw at me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is that confidence, or bravado? Confidence I can use. Bravado gets soldiers killed. We'll soon find out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What kind of test?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The kind that evaluates your usefulness during...duress. I'm sending you to clear out Fort Hraagstad. If you survive, you'll pass. If you die, then I'll have no further use for your corpse.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's at Fort Hraagstad?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The ancients built many of the fortresses that dot the landscape of Skyrim. Sadly, most have fallen into disrepair. And nearly all have been overrun by bandits or other vagabonds. Fort Hraagstad is one of the few that remains mostly intact. We're going to install a garrison there, but first, your going to clean out the bandits that have moved in.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm going alone?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, not so confident now, are we?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. This is a test. I don't think you're regular militia material. I want to see what you're capable of.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not sure about this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, if you change your mind, you know what to do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Consider that fort already yours.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good. That's what I want to hear. Now go make it happen, soldier.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player reaches the fort along Skyrim's NW coast and eliminates all the with Tullius.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Tell me again why I'm wasting men chasing after a fairy tale.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If Ulfric gets his hands on that crown, it won't be a fairy tale. It'll be a problem.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't you Nords put any stock in your own traditions? I thought the Moot chose the king. We're backing Elisif. When the Moot meets, they'll do the sensible thing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not everyone's agreed to the Moot. You've been here long enough to know that Nords aren't always sensible. We follow our hearts.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So what -- Ulfric gets this crown and then suddenly he's High King?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, it's not as simple as that, but the Jagged Crown would be a potent symbol for his cause to rally around. But, if we found it first...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And we gave it to Elisif?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In the absence of the Moot, it would further legitimize her claim.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Perhaps... I'm entrusting you with what resources I can spare. But I'm warning you, if this turns out to be a waste of time and men...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It won't be a waste.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Make sure you take the Auxiliary here. You can send him back when you get there and find nothing but old bones and cobwebs.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Stonefist's no fool. He's found the Crown. But we'll get to it first.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Rikke notices the player's waiting.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Welcome back, soldier. I'm glad you made it in one piece. I'll send men to garrison the fort right away. You did well. I'm impressed. But before we go any further, it's time for you to officially join the Legion. Speak with General Tullius. He'll administer the oath.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In joining the Legion, you'll be taking an oath binding you to the service of the Emperor and thus to every citizen of the Empire. Are you prepared to make that commitment?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Actually, I'm not sure. I need to think about it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I see... Well, the Legion will still be here when you change your mind. Rikke believes in you. And I'm starting to see why. Consider this. What greater glory than to serve the Emperor and his citizens here in Skyrim, in these days of greatest need?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm ready to take the Oath.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, then. Repeat after me. "Upon my honor I do swear undying loyalty to the Emperor..."
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: "Upon my honor I do swear undying loyalty to the Emperor..."
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: "...and unwavering obedience to the officers of his great Empire."
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: "...and unwavering obedience to the officers of his great Empire."
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: "May those above judge me, and those below take me, if I fail in my duty."
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: "May those above judge me, and those below take me, if I fail in my duty."
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: "Long live the Emperor! Long live the Empire!"
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: "Long live the Emperor! Long live the Empire!"
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Welcome to the Imperial Legion, soldier. Just remember, we take care of our own. Once you're in the Legion, you're in it for life. Speak to Beirand, he's normally out by the forge. He'll get you outfitted. Now, if I'm not mistaken, Legate Rikke has a special assignment for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Rikke is sought out.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Welcome to the Legion, auxiliary. Listen up. Ulfric's right-hand man, Galmar Stonefist, has located what he believes is the final resting place of the Jagged Crown. We're going to make sure he doesn't get his hands on it. The rest of my men are already assembling outside Korvanjund. I'll meet you there as soon as as I finish up here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One can question the Legate further.
label: ACTION

dialogue: What's the Jagged Crown?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A legendary crown, dating back to King Harald's time, or before. A powerful relic of a golden age, long since passed. Legend has it that the crown is made from the bones and teeth of ancient dragons, and is said to increase the power of the wielder. Whatever the truth, if Ulfric get's his hands on it, it would be a powerful symbol around which to rally support for his cause.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How do we know the crown is in Korvanjund?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, to be frank, we don't. Its location was lost with King Borgas, when the Great Hunt killed him while off on his Alessian campaigns. Supposedly, his body was brought back to Skyrim and secretly buried with the crown. Knowledge of that location was lost, in the Wars of Succession. But my agents report that Galmar is pretty damned convinced Korvanjund is the tomb of King Borgas. I know Galmar. We fought in many wars together. He's not a sentimental man taken to fancy. If he believes the crown is there...he's likely found it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why do you fight for the Empire?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am a loyal citizen to the Empire. My parents were Legionnaires, and I've followed in their footsteps. But more importantly, I am a daughter of Skyrim and wish to see her made whole again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't Stormcloaks call themselves "sons and daughters of Skyrim"?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've been a daughter of Skyrim all my life. I love this land and her people. So do all the Nords that serve the Empire. Ulfric, too, once. He wasn't always a self-serving ego-maniac. He fought in the Imperial army in the War against the Dominion. But Ulfric and his "Stormcloaks" are deluding themselves. If there's any hope of a long term victory against the Dominion, it's in the Empire. The rebels are only inflaming the tension and weakening the Empire by distracting it from its ultimate aim.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do you consider the Thalmor enemies?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I consider this conversation over.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So you have no problem with the treaty that bans the worship of Talos?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm a soldier, not a politician. And my personal beliefs are not yours to question.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What will it take to end the war?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I hope Ulfric will come to his senses. But I fear he's in too far to stop now. Likely only Ulfric's death, or the overthrow of the Jarls supporting him will end this. Either way, much blood will be spilt.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player finds the ruin of Korvanjund near Windhelm. Rikke's team waits.
label: ACTION

dialogue: What's the situation?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Stormcloaks were already camped around the entrance when we got here. They don't know we're here yet, though.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, that's something at least.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She notices the player.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Looks like the damned rebels got here first. No matter, we have the element of surprise. Prepare to move out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hold on, I need a minute.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This isn't a damn summer picnic! Hurry up. We need to hit them before they know we're here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm ready, ma'am.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Follow me. Listen up, legionnaires. Those Stormcloaks are here for the same reason we are. Ulfric the Pretender wants that crown, but we're not going to let him have it. I realize some of you may know men on the other side. But remember this. They are the enemy now and will not hesitate to end your lives either. General Tullius is counting on us to bring back the Jagged Crown, and that's exactly what we're going to do. Let's show these rebels what real soldiers look like.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They slay the Stormcloak vanguard and enter the ancient tomb.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Everybody ready? We charge on my signal. Time to show what you're really made of. For the Empire!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The nearest Stormcloaks are defeated.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You two, stay and guard the entrance. We don't want any Stormcloak reinforcements taking us by surprise. Everyone else, with me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A ways in is a long, thin stairway.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I don't like the look of this. Perfect spot for an ambush. Ten to one they're just waiting for us on the other side.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But there isn't any other way through, Legate.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's not jump to conclusions, soldier. The Legion always finds a way. I'd rather take a moment and look around than walk blindly into an ambush. Auxiliary, see if you can find another way through. We'll charge in to help as soon as we hear fighting. There may be some way to get through on the level above. Hurry!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player sneaks ahead, overhearing Stormcloaks.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You hear anything?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, but I know they're out there. No other way they can come. Now shut it or you'll ruin our ambush.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't like it. What are they waiting for?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Maybe they're so scared of you they ran away.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hardly likely.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just shut up and keep out of sight.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player kills them before they can ambush the Legate's men. Later, the group encounters a draugr's corpse.
label: ACTION

dialogue: What in the nine holds is that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is this what killed that Stormcloak over there? Can't be. It looks like it's been dead for a hundred years.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Steady now. The Legion has faced down worse than a few dusty old bonewalkers. We're not leaving here until we get what we came for. Now let's keep moving.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Further on, they find a tunnel full of reliefs and murals.
label: ACTION

dialogue: And this must be the Hall of Stories.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh...I've heard of this. The walls are supposed to show the history of the ancients who built this place.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Too bad we can't read these carvings. Who knows what secrets we'd uncover?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One thing at a time soldier. Focus on our primary mission. We're searching for the crown.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They find dead Stormcloaks near the puzzle-locked door.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Looks like we weren't the first ones here, either. Even if these carvings tell us where the crown is, I'm sure we're going to have to find a way through this door. See what you can figure out auxiliary, I'm going to check out these carvings over here. Let me know if you find something.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player finds an Ebony Claw laying near a corpse.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Hmm...what is that? Some kind of stone claw? I wonder what it's used for?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Using the claw's clues, one removes the puzzle impediment.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Good job! Alright everyone! Keep your guard up. Let's move out!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They reach a large chamber.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Alright legionnaires! Spread out and see what we've got. Auxiliary, do what you do best. See if you can find some way to get that gate open. This may sound obvious, but do you see a lever anywhere?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player finds a handle on the floor above.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Alright, let's move, men! We've got more...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The gate opening summons all the draugr from their coffins.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Steady, legionnaires! We've been through worse. Just keep your guard up!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Once the draugr are relaid to rest...
label: ACTION

dialogue: Follow me! Let's see where this leads.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The squadron continues further into the crypt.
label: ACTION

dialogue: The crown should be around here somewhere. Spread out, and keep your eyes open.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She notices the crown on a skeleton nearby.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Well, King... If you don't mind, we'll just take that crown of yours and be on our way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The undead King raises his axe.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Have it your way. Let's get that crown, men!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They defeat three powerful draugr.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Alright, get that crown off that draugr!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The crown's reclaimed.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Take that crown back to Solitude, soldier. We'll stay here and see if we can find anything ele that could be of use.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The item is handed back to Tullius at Castle Dour.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Here's the Jagged Crown. Legate Rikke sent me to deliver it to you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Excellent work, soldier. I have to admit, I had my doubts it even existed. Did you run into any trouble?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nothing I couldn't handle.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's what I like to hear. I'll get the full report from Legate Rikke.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We lost a lot of good men. I hope it was worth it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's not for you to decide. Soldier. I wouldn't have sent you in the first place if it wasn't going to be worth it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Stormcloaks were there ahead of us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. Well, I didn't respond as quickly to the Legate's suggestion as perhaps I should have. But at least we ended up with the damn crown. Now then... I need someone I can trust to deliver a message of great import to Jarl Balgruuf of Whiterun. We have it on good authority that Ulfric has raised enough men to attack the city of Whiterun. The Jarl, however, refuses the Legion's support. This missive should convince him. Be aware soldier, these documents contain sensitive intelligence for the Jarl's eyes only.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player travels to Dragonsreach, the large hilltop castle overlooking the city of Whiterun. The Jarl, as usual, is in the throne room.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I have an important message from General Tullius.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No doubt requesting to garrison his men in my castle. How many times must I deny him? Well? Out with it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ulfric plans to attack Whiterun. The General wants to lend Legion troops.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: • Until that dragon's dealt with, I don't care what Tullius wants. For now, give the papers to my steward. • I see... Give the papers to my steward.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I was given strict instructions. For the Jarl's eyes only.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't be daft. Proventus is my eyes. Just give me the letter. I presume once I have it, I can do as I please with it? Good. • Now, I believe you have some business to conclude with my court wizard? • Hmm...these are interesting reports...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Once the nearby dragon problem is dealt with, the Jarl will look Tullius' note over with a bit more interest.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Proventus, what do you make of all this? If Ulfric were to attack Whiterun...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As in all things, my lord, caution...I urge us to wait and see.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Prey awaits.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am of a mind with Irileth. It's time to act.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You plan to march on Windhelm?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not a fool, Proventus. I mean it's time to challenge Ulfric to face me as a man, or to declare his intentions.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He'll do no such thing!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He was rather straight forward with Torygg.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Torygg? He simply walked up to the boy and murdered him!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That "boy" was High King of Skyrim.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not the High King, but neither am I a boy. If Ulfric wants to challenge my rule in the old way, let him. Though I suspect he'll prefer to send his "Stormcloaks" to do it for him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: True. He's already proven his personal strength. Now he seeks to prove his army's.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then might I urge you to consider General Tullius's request? I mean, if you are bent on offending Jarl Ulfric...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ulfric is the one who has offended. But, Proventus has a point. Ulfric has made it clear. In his mind, to refuse his claim is to side with the Empire.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And what harm is there in letting a few Legionnaires die in place of your own men?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It seems cowardly.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Was it cowardly then to accept the White-Gold Concordat?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This again?! That was different. Was I given a chance to object to the terms of the treaty? No. The Jarls weren't asked. We were told. And we had to like it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The chests of gold didn't hurt.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Dammit! This isn't about gold!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's time to decide.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lord, wait. Let us see if Ulfric is serious.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, he's serious. But so am I.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Finally.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: • You there. I have a message for you to deliver to our friend, the esteemed Jarl of Windhelm. Deliver this axe to Ulfric Stormcloak. • I've made up my mind, even if my advisors are still squabbling. I'm sending you to Windhelm. Deliver this axe to Ulfric Stormcloak.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: An axe?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How long have you been in Skyrim? Yes. Give the man my axe. If he returns it to you it means we have business to settle. If he keeps it, then we are at peace.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And you think Ulfric will let me just walk in there, no trouble?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: True, he's a dangerous and blood thirsty man, but he's also a Nord that honors our traditions. Keep your wits about you and you won't be harmed. And then get back here. Because if Ulfric isn't bluffing, I'll need every able body to defend Whiterun.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Should I say anything to him?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Men who understand one another need not waste words. There are but a few simple truths behind one warrior giving another his axe. Ulfric will know my meaning.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Understood.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good. Good...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player accepts.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Proventus. Bring me my pen. And the good parchment.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Are we writing a letter, my lord?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, to General Tullius. I need to make a few things clear before I accept these Legionnaires of his.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One goes to Windhelm's Palace of the Kings, the seat of Ulfric's power.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Yes? Make it quick, I'm a busy man.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: i've brought a message from the Jarl of Whiterun.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is that so? I've been wondering when he'd come around. Oh. What's this? Ahhh... You're quite brave to carry such a message. It's a pity you've chosen the wrong side... You can return this axe to the man who sent it. And tell him he should prepare to entertain...visitors. I expect a great deal of excitement in the city of Whiterun in the near future...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've killed the High King. Why make war on your own people?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have shown the people that when our Jarls drink the Empire's milk, it makes us weak. I must now show them the path that will lead us back to our strength. There is no progress without sacrifice. No wheat without threshing the chaff. The Empire and the Jarls who back them must be swept away. The people demand it. I demand it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You will be stopped.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh? True, I may meet my end in a dark alley with a dagger in my back. But the people have seen the truth, and they will not back down.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We'll be seeing you soon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sooner than you think.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The message delivered, it's time to report to Balgruuf. Him, Irileth and the Imperial Legate are pouring over strategy as a guard arrives.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Sir! I...I have...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Take a moment to breathe, soldier.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But...sir...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Breathe!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The outer walls are strong. If we can hold them there...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They have catapults.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Damnit. Where did they get catapults? The city walls are already falling apart as it is.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My scouts tell me they're loading them with fire.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, he wants to take my city, walls intact.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The men will be fighting in flames.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My men are fearless. It's the Imperial milk drinkers I'm worried about.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you prefer I took my men and left...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. Of course not. Just -- don't let me down Cipius. We'll need to set up water brigades to combat the flames.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Already taken care of.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You Imperials are efficient, I'll give you that. How long until they arrive?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sir.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not long. They're hiding in the country side.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Damnit. What's he waiting for?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sir!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sir, they're on the move. They'll be at the gates at any moment!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why didn't you say so immediately?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sir, I tried.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This is it! Time to see what these Stormcloaks are made of.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The men are already gathering at the gates. Move it soldier. Spread the word. Go. Go. Go.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oblivion take them. Every miserable last one of them.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Balgruuf notices the player's returned.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You've returned with my axe. I knew that would be his response. As soon as you left, I sent word to General Tullius, who's been kind enough to lend us some of his troops and Legate Cipius here. Let Ulfric try to make it past our combined forces. I'll turn you back over to your Legion. Legate Cipius will have use for you. Gods be with us all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why side with the Empire?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mutual advantage! Any fool can see that. For centuries, we have benefited from the Empire's protection, and prosperous trade with the south. In exchange, the people of Cyrodiil sleep peacefully, knowing their northern borders are guarded by the fiercest warriors in all Tamriel.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One seeks out the legate.
label: ACTION

dialogue: The Stormcloaks are here. In force. Get down to the front line. This is it. We must hold the city. Now move it!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As catapult projectiles start bombarding the city, the player reaches the front gate, just as Whiterun troops start showing their ugly mugs.
label: ACTION

dialogue: This is it men! This is an important day for the Empire and for the Legion. And for all of Skyrim. This is the day we send a message to Ulfric Stormcloak and the rebel Jarls who support him. But make no mistake. What we do here today, we do for Skyrim and her people. By cutting out the disease of this rebellion, we will make this country whole again! Ready now! Everyone, with me! For the Empire! For the Legion!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Rrraaaaaggghhhh!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Rrraaaaa!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The squadron prepares to make a stand at the front and only entrance to the
label: ACTION

dialogue: After a successful rebuff, which decimates Ulfric's boys, the Jarl himself goes down to the battle site to congratulate everyone.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Revel in your victory here today, even as the gods revel in your honor! They already sing of your valor and skill! The halls of Sovngarde are no doubt ringing with your praises! In defeating those Stormcloak traitors, you have proven the hollowness of their cause and the fullness of your hearts. The citizens of Whiterun are forever in your debt! But Ulfric will not stop here. No, he will continue to strike out against any true Nord who remains faithful to the Empire. He will continue to sow discord and chaos wherever he can. And so, we must each one of us, continue to fight this insurrection, lest our fallen brothers have died for naught! Lest our honor be lessened should we allow these bloodthirsty beasts to prowl our lands! Carry on men, my gratitude and blessings go with you! For Whiterun! For the Empire!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The soldiers whoop and holler at the praise before dashing back into town.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Thank you for your role in all of this. It would be my honor should you decide to make Whiterun your home. Speak with Proventus. He'll make the necessary arrangements.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Following the success at Whiterun, one reports back to the general.
label: ACTION

dialogue: By defeating Ulfric at Whiterun we have solidified the allegiance of the Jarl. Perhaps the Stormcloaks will soon lose heart for this little rebellion of theirs once and for all. I'm promoting you to Quaestor. Take this blade, a symbol of your new station and responsibility. I'll keep an eye on your progress. The Empire rewards excellence, and so do I.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What are my new orders, sir?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'd be wasted as a regular soldier. I have special plans for you. You'll be of greater use to me with greater flexibility. Make your way to our hidden military camp in the Pale. Rikke will have important tasks for you, and will need you when we reclaim the capital.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What exactly will I be doing in the field?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'll be doing whatever Rikke tells you to do. And, I expect you to find creative ways to disrupt the Stormcloaks along the way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes sir.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: For the Emperor!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Gods be with you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player finds the target destination in the snowy northern wilds, finding the Imperial bivouac.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Reporting for duty.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I need you to deliver some false orders to the Stormcloak commander in Dawnstar. But first we need to get our hands on some rebel orders to make the forgeries. The Nightgate and Candlehearth Inns are frequent stops for Stormcloak runners. See if you can't "convince" one of those innkeepers to help you. One way or another, get me those documents. But don't do anything rash if you go to Windhelm. Well, soldier? Can you do this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not sure. I need to think about it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't take too long figuring it out. I've got a war to run here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Consider it done.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good luck out there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good. Make it happen, soldier.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If one goes to the Nightgate Inn, info is squeezed from the innkeep. Note responses and dialogue here.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Ah, hello there, traveler. Come to the Nightgate for food or lodging?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Seen any Stormcloak couriers lately?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I tend to keep my patrons' privacy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: His life is in danger. (Persuade)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It is? Well that's different.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yeah, sure it is. You don't fool me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Maybe some gold will help ( gold)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, if you insist...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Seems your purse is lighter than you thought.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't have time for this. I can get rough with you if I have to. (Intimidate)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now, now! That won't be necessary.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Never mind.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hmph. He was here, but he left. If you leave now, you can probably catch him. Or, you can just wait here. He'll be back soon enough.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player tracks down the Stormcloak Courier.
label: ACTION

dialogue: No time to talk. Out of my way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not here to talk. I'm here for those documents.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We'll see about that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Never mind.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hmph.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: With the documents reclaimed, it's back to Rikke.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Very good... Let's see what you have here. Interesting... They know more of our plans than I expected... It would seem Fort Dunstad is in need of reinforcements... We'll make sure they won't be getting those... One moment while I "correct" some of these documents... That should do it. Make sure those forged documents get to the Stormcloak commander in Dawnstar. It'll throw him off our trail, allowing us to maneuver more freely.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Remind me -- what am I supposed to do?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (repeats "Make sure those...")
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player visits Cmdr. Frorkmar Banner-Torn at the barracks.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I have some important documents for you, sir.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: • Is that so? I don't recognize you. Why aren't you wearing your Stormcloak colors? Dragonborn: Ditched it for this. Easier to sneak past the enemy. I suppose it would be. Good thinking. All right. Let's take a look... Ah, good. Looks like the reinforcements for the fort are on their way. And we have some information about enemy troop movements as well. Excellent. It's not easy running messages, what with Imperial scouts crawling over the place. Well done. Why don't you grab yourself a drink at the Windpeak before heading back?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One returns to Legate Rikke afterwards.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Good job! I knew I gave the mission to the right person.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Reporting for duty.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your objective is Fort Dunstad. Meet the soldiers preparing for the attack. Then join them in wiping out the rebels. Once you prevail we will garrison the fort. Well, soldier? Are you up to the task?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not sure. I need to think about it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't take too long figuring it out. I've got a war to run here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That fort is as good as ours.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I knew I could count on you, soldier.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One goes to meet the small band of raiders outside the fort. Together, they stealing the fort. With good tidings, it's time to report to the general.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Taking the Pale gives us another port in Dawnstar, and puts us within striking distance of Windhelm. That should make Ulfric a bit more cautious, eh? Battles are won by trained and disciplined men. Wars are won by talented and exceptional individuals. I'm raising you to Praefect. Take this blade, as a gift and symbol of your new rank. You've earned it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What are my new orders, sir?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Make your way to our camp in the Rift. We have a few surprises for the Stormcloaks lined up.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What exactly will I be doing in the field?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'll be doing whatever Rikke tells you to do. And, I expect you to find creative ways to disrupt the Stormcloaks along the way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes sir.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: For the Empire!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player next reaches the camp, south of Ivarstead and the Throat of the World. Rikke has once again spearheaded the operation here.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Reporting for duty.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're going to Riften. My spies report the Jarl's steward, Anuriel, has arrangements with the Thieves Guild that would be rather embarrassing if made public. I need you to find evidence of her corrupt activities, and use it to gain a measure of her "cooperation." This will require stealth and discretion. The Jarl's guards won't take kindly to anyone rummaging through her Steward's private quarters.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not sure. I need to think about it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't take too long figuring it out. I've got a war to run here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll get proof...and Anuriel's cooperation.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good. I can always count on you, can't I?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One visits Riften's Mistveil Keep and finds an incriminating letter in the steward's bureau. Then it's time to threaten her.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Recognize this? (Show her incriminating letter)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not here. Come with me. Stay close and the guards will leave you alone.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She leads the player to her chambers.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I suppose you're here to extort something from me? Is that it? Well, what is it you want?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You rebels are doing a fine job destroying yourselves. Soldiers running errands?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So. You're an Imperial spy... Interesting... I have no strong love for the Stormcloaks but I can't say I'm all that fond of the Empire, either. This war of yours makes it different for a resourceful woman to advance her interests. Perhaps we can find a way for both of us to prosper from this unfortunate discovery?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What if this letter were made public?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It would ruin me. I have a good thing going here. The Jarl benefits from my more creative arrangements as well, though it'd be impossible for her to admit that. Laila is a simple and traditional woman. Which makes it easy to manipulate her, but impossible to regain her graces once offended. Look. Perhaps we could come to some kind of arrangement?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What kind of agreement did you have in mind?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What if I told you about a large shipment of gold and weapons?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Go on. I'm listening.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, no. I'm no fool. You'll learn what you need to know once we've come to an agreement.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And what about something for me, right now? (Persuade)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well I...I suppose I'm not left much choice in the matter, am I? Very well. I trust a hefty purse of septims will suffice?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How much are we talking about?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Enough to make a significant difference in the war.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right, it's a deal. Where can I find this shipment?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They're taking it by wagon to Windhelm. If you hurry, you'll catch them before they get far. It'll be a fairly slow moving caravan. The shipment is quite heavy, and guarded by many men. Now, let's pretend we never had this discussion.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player delivers the news to the legate.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Something to report?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Anuriel says there's a shipment of coin traveling to Windhelm...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Excellent work. I knew you'd bring back something useful. It just so happens, I've got some scouts along the road. Meet up with them, and together see if you can't overpower the caravan.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The troops are near Shor's Watchtower. Hadvar is helping them.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I remember you...you were with us at Helgen, and Whiterun. Glad to have you with us. How are you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm all right, I guess. How are you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good to hear.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've been better. And you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: These are dark days. But at least we know we're doing our part to make things better, eh? I guess I'm doing all right. I need this to go well. This is my first real command since they promoted me after Whiterun. You know, some nights when I close my eyes, I see the battle stretched out before me, like I'm still there... Do the men you've killed haunt you? Mine do...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Only a beast kills without feeling.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I suppose you're right...they say it gets easier... I'm not sure if that's a good thing...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you hadn't killed them, they would have killed you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's what I keep telling myself. But, never mind all that. What brings you out this way?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's an enemy wagon loaded with coin and weapons. We need to capture it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Really? It just so happens we've been tracking a wagon! For about a day now. So that's what's in there? Coins and weapons? How do you know that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I blackmailed Anuriel for the information.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That was crafty. I'm sure having a steward in the pocket will come in handy. Lucky for us, that wagon recently had a little accident.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It doesn't matter.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, fine. Keep your secrets. I see how it is. That wagon recently had a little accident. They're stranded now. Just up the road! We're outnumbered, but I have a plan. You got here just in time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's the plan?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: First, we're going to take out their sentry, then we'll situate ourselves overlooking their camp. Next, you'll infiltrate their position and get their attention while we hit them with a barrage of arrows. With a bit of luck, we'll catch them completely off guard and even the odds a little.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have a better plan. You wait here, and I'll take care of it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right, if you insist. But we'll come running if it sounds like things have gotten out of hand.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's wait a little longer.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let me know when you're ready.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ready. Let's go.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If they agree to fight as a team...
label: ACTION

dialogue: There's a sentry patrolling the hill. We'll go in quiet and drop him a combined arrow barrage. Keep low, fire on my word. Fire!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player kills the sentry quietly.
label: ACTION

dialogue: All right. You infiltrate their camp, we'll cover you from the ridge.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Either way, after slaying the Stormcloaks:
label: ACTION

dialogue: We make quite a team, eh? I'll stay here and guard the shipment. You get back to camp with news. Have them send some men -- with a new wagon. This one isn't going anywhere.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One goes back to Rikke.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Good work. I'll send some men with a wagon to collect the prize. We can use the weapons here, and I'll pass on the coin to Solitude.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Reporting for duty.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your objective is Fort Greenwall. Meet the soldiers preparing for the attack. Then join them in wiping out the rebels. Once you prevail we will garrison the fort. Well, soldier? Are you up to the task?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not sure. I need to think about it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't take too long figuring it out. I've got a war to run here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That fort is as good as ours.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I knew I could count on you, soldier.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As before, one goes visits the fort and slays its Stormcloak inhabitants. As they lie bleeding, it's time to revisit the general for due accolades.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Taking control of the Rift was a great victory. Ulfric must be rather nervous with us so close to his door step.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What are my new orders, sir?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're needed in Winterhold. Report to our hidden camp there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What exactly will I be doing in the field?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'll be doing whatever Rikke tells you to do. And, I expect you to find creative ways to disrupt the Stormcloaks along the way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes sir.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Gods be with you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: For the Empire!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player can inquire about the hostilies' state.
label: ACTION

dialogue: How goes the war?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's not much up there, but if we can regain Winterhold, our proximity to Windhelm should keep Ulfric wary and wasting troops garrisoned at home. By holding onto Falkreath, we control access to the Reach, Whiterun, and the Rift. Ulfric will try for it soon. We'll be there to stop him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What will it take to end the war?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ulfric Stormcloak's head rolling away from his lifeless body.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As usual, one meets Rikke at the designated camp.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Reporting for duty.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your objective is Fort Kastav. The rebels are keeping some of our men prisoner there. I aim to turn that into an advantage. I've sent men to scout the area. You are to meet them, find a way to slip in, free our men, and take over the fort. They won't be expecting an attack from the inside. This won't be easy, but that's why I'm sending you. Think you can handle it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not sure. I need to think about it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't take too long figuring it out. I've got a war to run here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That fort is as good as ours.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I knew I could count on you, soldier.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Show the rebels the futility of their cause.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Upon arrival, the player finds the scouting party is lead by Hadvar.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Hey there! Can you believe this place? So cold my breath turns to icicles! What are we even doing up here? Guess Tullius wants to make sure everything's locked down before launching a serious campaign for Eastmarch. Anyway, I'm glad you're here. We're outnumbered again, more so than when we took that wagon. But if we work together, we can pull this off.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's the plan?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's a grate outside the wall. Looks like it used to be buried in snow. I don't think they know it's there. From the look of it, I'd bet it leads straight into the prison. I need you to sneak in there, and free our men, killing anyone inside as you go. Once you've rescued the prisoners, head out to the courtyard. We'll stand guard out here and rush in as soon as we hear fighting.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm on it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Talos preserve you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not much for sneaking.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have faith in you. But, if you find more trouble than you can handle, run out to the courtyard. We'll come as soon as we hear fighting.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player finds the grate, infiltrating the prison as expected. No guards are around, but the prisoners are all up and at 'em.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Hey!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hurry!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player frees them and they reclaim their confiscated gear, killing any Stormcloaks en route to the courtyard. The rest soon fall as well.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Great work! Get back and report our success. I'll stay here and clean up the mess. Glad you were here. Couldn't have done it without you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One reports back to Solitude.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Now that we have Winterhold, I can garrison some troops there until I'm ready to march on Windhelm. I have come to rely heavily on you. It is only fitting that you join the upper eschelon. I am hereby elevating you to the rank of Legate. On behalf of the Empire, and myself, please accept this gift along with your new rank. Congratulations.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's next?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've little time to glory in your accomplishments. We're gathering for our final assault on Windhelm. Report to our camp in Eastmarch.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Rikke is found in the mountainside camp near Mzulft.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Reporting for duty.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your objective is the enemy held fort. Meet the soldiers preparing for the attack. Then join them in wiping out the rebels. Once you prevail we will garrison the fort. Well, soldier? Are you up to the task?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not sure. I need to think about it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't take too long figuring it out. I've got a war to run here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That fort is as good as ours.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I knew I could count on you, soldier.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player visits Fort Amol, a riverside holding in the Eastmarch hills. The orchestrated assault works perfectly, as usual. One reports back to Rikke.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Good job! I knew I gave the mission to the right person.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Reporting in.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We're taking the city. Meet the soldiers gathering for the attack. Move it!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player meets the men and Tullius at Windhelm's bridge entrance. He takes no time in rousing his men to glory.
label: ACTION

dialogue: All right! It's time to deliver the final blow to the Stormcloak rebellion! You have all fought bravely, and sacrificed much to bring us to this point. Ulfric thinks he can hide behind the walls of his castle. But we will fight our way in and drag him out through the rubble to face justice. Because this is the end for them, the Stormcloaks will fight like cornered rats. They will be fierce and crafty. But they are no match for Legionnaires. You are the best and the brightest warriors in Tamriel. Professional soldiers, fearless and devastating. The Emperor will be paying close attention to what happens here today. Men who distinguish themelves will be well rewarded. Ready now! Everyone, with me! For the Empire! For the Legion! Rrrrrraaaaaaaaaaaaaahhhhhhh!!!!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: With the attack orders given, the stone town of Windhelm quickly becomes a sits leisurely at his throne. Tullius and Rikke follow the player.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Secure the door.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Already done, sir.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ulfric Stormcloak! You are guilty of insurrection, murder of Imperial citizens, the assassination of King Torygg, and high treason against the Empire. It's over.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not while I'm still standing, it's not.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Step aside, Galmar. We're here to accept Ulfric's surrender.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll never surrender Skyrim to the hands of a corrupt and dying Empire.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Skyrim doesn't belong to you, Ulfric.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No... But I belong to her.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Enough! You are traitors and will die traitors' deaths. Stand down and face public execution, or advance and face summary execution by my hands. It matters little to me. Either way I'll be sending your heads back to Cyrodiil.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well? What are we waiting for?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They brandish their weapons, starting the final battle.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Die villain!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Talos smite you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Galmar is slain, and Ulfric terribly wounded.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Well Ulfric, you can't escape from me this time. Any last requests before I send you to...to wherever you people go when you die.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sovngarde...sir.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Right. Well?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let the Dragonborn be the one to do it. It'll make for a better song.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Song or not, I just want it done.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've had my fair share of killing today.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, I'm not quite done myself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I won't give him the satisfaction.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fine by me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll gladly kill him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Here, use my sword to do it. I made sure to sharpen it for the occasion.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ulfric's death sentence is carried out by the player or Tullius.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Aggh..
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Talos be with you...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What was that, Legate?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nothing. Just saying goodbye.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, the men will be expecting some kind of speech. And we'll need to hand the city over to that Free-Winter fellow.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Brunwulf. Yes, I've sent men to protect him and bring him here. Windhelm will need a government quickly if we are to prevent more violence.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Legion will be staying here for quite some time. I don't expect there to be any further violence.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He turns to the player.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Oh, and Legate. It's been an honor to have you at my side. As a token of my appreciation, I want you to keep my sword. And now, to deliver a speech.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Everyone goes outside to the waiting Imperial throng.
label: ACTION

dialogue: His head will be sent to Cyrodiil where it will adorn a spike on the walls of the Imperial City. Let this day be a final warning to all who would still call themselves Stormcloaks. We are turning the city over to Brunwulf Free-Winter, an honorable and faithful man. Many of you will be staying in Windhelm to aid the Jarl in restoring order and stamping out any embers of rebellion that may still smolder here. In appreciation for your exemplary service, I am doubling your pay and compensation to the widows of your fallen comrades.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Rrrraaaaaaggghhh!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am proud of all of you. All hail the Emperor! All hail his Legionnaires!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Rrrraaaaaaggghhh!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I hate giving speeches.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It wasn't so bad.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I hope we haven't just created a martyr.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's bound to be resistance. There are many Stormcloak camps tucked away in the hills. They'll no doubt strike whenever and wherever they can. But without Ulfric to inflame their passions, they'll settle down and return to their homes eventually.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I pray you're right, Legate. In the meantime, we'll continue to root them out and put them to the sword.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He turns to the player.
label: ACTION

dialogue: We couldn't have done this without you. The Empire glories in your accomplishments... Come, Rikke. There's still much to be done.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tullius can be asked about the aftermath.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Now that Ulfric is dead, will there be peace?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The fiercest of the remaining rebels will continue to harass us, but by in large, the people here desire peace. What I'm not so sure about is the peace we've made with the Thalmor. But we'll kee that between the two of us, alright?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Will you return to Cyrodiil now?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, I suspect Skyrim to be my home for many years. Can't say I'll ever get used to the damn cold, or understand these Nords...but, I've come to respect them. The harshness of Skyrim has a way of carving a man down to his true self.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is there anything further I can do for the Legion?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ulfric is dead and his army destroyed. There's not much more I could ask of you. The gods, however, I suspect, may have plans for you elsewhere. That said, Stormcloak true believers are still operating out of hidden military camps in the hills. If you encounter any on you travels, kill them. With luck, they'll soon lose heart and return to their homes and families. If not, we'll be forced to put them all to the sword.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Rikke can be asked about the aftermath.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Now that Ulfric is dead, will there be peace?
label: CHARACTER
