dialogue: There are those who still call themselves Stormcloaks, who continue to fight us, and bring misery to the people...but they are few in number. The ordinary citizen will be happy to get back to life as normal, to have their families return home. And they should enjoy it while they can...I suspect all of Tamriel will againb e called to arms in the not too distant future.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's next for the accomplished Legate Rikke?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The General's put me in charge of assisting the new governments. I may understand things here in Skyrim better than the General, but I'm a soldier at heart, not a politician. But I'll do my best. This is the land of my birth, the land that shaped me. I'm proud to have any part in making it strong again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is there anything further I can do for the Legion?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Legion's work is far from finished, but you are free to roam. I suspect you'll be of greater good to Skyrim out there, in the world. If while you're out there, you stumble into any Stormcloak military camps, I expect you to destroy them. I've reports they are hiding in the hills.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Like the Imperial side, one overhears talk of joining the Stormcloaks, based Stone-Fist, will be talking.
label: ACTION

dialogue: If he's not with us, he's against us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He knows that. They all know that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How long are you going to wait?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You think I need to send Balgruuf a stronger message.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If by message you mean shoving a sword through his gullet.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Taking his city and leaving him in disgrace would make a more powerful statement, don't you think?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So we're ready to start this war in earnest then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Soon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I still say you should take them all out like you did Deadking Torygg.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Torygg was merely a message to the other Jarls. Whoever we replace them with will need the support of our armies.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We're ready when you are.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Things hinge on Whiterun. If we can take the city without bloodshed all the better. But if not...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The people are behind you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Many I fear still need convincing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then let them die with their false kings.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We've been soldiers a long time. We know the price of freedom. The people are still weighing things in their hearts.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's left of Skyrim to wager?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They have families to think of.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How many of their sons and daughters follow your banner? We are their families.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well put, friend. Tell me, Galmar, why do you fight for me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'd follow you into the depths of Oblivion, you know that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, but why do you fight? If not for me, what then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll die before elves dictate the fates of men. Are we not one in this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I fight for the men I've held in my arms, dying on foreign soil. I fight for their wives and children, who's names I heard whispered in their last breaths. I fight for we few who did come home, only to find our country full of strangers wearing familiar faces. I fight for my people impoverished to pay the debts of an Empire too weak to rule them, yet brands them criminals for wanting to rule themselves! I fight so that all the fighting I've already done hasn't been for nothing. I fight...because I must.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your words give voice to what we all feel, Ulfric. And that's why you will be High King. But the day words are enough, will be the day soldiers like us are no longer needed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I would gladly retire from the world were such a day to dawn.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Aye. But in the meantime, we have a war to plan.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player walks over.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Only the foolish or the courageous approach the Jarl without summons... Do I know you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I believe we've already met.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is that so...? Ah yes, you were with us at Helgen.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I was at Helgen.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ahhh. Yes... Destined for the chopping block if I'm not mistaken.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I helped Ralof escape. He said he'd vouch for me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ralof's alive? I hope that's true. He's a damn good man. But he hasn't returned yet, so I'll need to wait for his account. For now, speak with Galmar.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I was set free. I could've gone anywhere. I came here to fight the Empire.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A fair point... Well, you've come to the right place, then. Speak with Galmar. I'm always looking for able fighters. Not everyone can say they made it out of Helgen. Seems we're all branded villains these days... So long as your criminal past stays in the past, and you fight for me with honor and integrity, we'll welcome you into our ranks.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If one is far enough in the main quest, Ulfric may instead say this, before giving the usual chatty options:
label: ACTION

dialogue: I remember you... You were at Helgen with us! Come to join the war? Speak with Galmar. He handles the new recruits.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, sir.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's not why I'm here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm sorry to hear that. If you change your mind, speak with Galmar. What does bring you to me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One finds Galmar nearby.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Hmm. Helgen, eh? Ulfric told us quite the story. If you made it through that, you're likely worth something to me. But first, tell me. Why's a foreigner want to fight or Skyrim?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Skyrim is my home.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fair enough. But are you willing to die for your home?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I want to fight the Empire. I'll bleed for the chance to do so.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Can't fault anyone for that! As long as you hate the Empire as much as I do, that I can work with.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's why I'm here. I want to join.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right. But before I can put you to use, I need to know how much you can take. I have a little test for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can handle anything you throw at me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's what I like to hear. So long as you can back up those words with steel.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What kind of test?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The kind men use to measure themselves. I'm sending you to Serpentstone Island. If you survive, you pass. If you die, well, you weren't going to be much use to me anyway.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's at Serpentstone Island?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's where men have tested their mettle for ages. There's a strange rock formation there, built by the ancients. Something about that place attracts the Ice Wraiths. You kill an Ice Wraith out there, and I'll have the proof I need about you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Does every recruit have to do this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Only the ones I'm not sure about. This will prove your abilities, but more importantly, it will prove your commitment.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm going alone?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not so sure of yourself after all?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: At the end of the day, every warrior is alone. Before you can stand next to your shield brother, you need to be able to stand on your own.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not sure about this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: When you kill that Ice Wraith, then we'll talk about you becoming a Stormcloak.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm off to kill that Ice Wraith. I'll be back soon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We'll see about that, won't we?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The glacial island is found off the northeast coast of Skyrim. Sure enough, Him and the Jarl are discussing another matter fervently.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Tell me again why we're wasting time and resources chasing a legend. We don't even know it exists!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Jarls are upset. They don't all support you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Damn the Jarls.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They demand the Moot.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And damn the Moot! We should risk letting those milkdrinkers put Torygg's woman on the throne? She'll hand Skyrim over to the elves on a silver plate.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All the more reason then. The crown would legitimize your claim.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A crown doesn't make a king.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, but this one...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If it even exists.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It exists. And it'll be the symbol of the righteousness of our cause. Think about it. The Jagged Crown! It heralds back to a time before jarls and moots. Back to a time when a king was a king because his enemies fell before him, and his people rose because they loved him. Skyrim needs that king. You will be that king, Ulfric. You must be.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're certain you've found it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: When have I ever been false with you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fine. I'll send the Unblooded here with you. Fancy a crawl through a moldering dungeon to see if you can't stir up Galmar's Jagged Crown?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It'll be there. You'll see.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They finish talking. Galmar walks over.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You're alive. I owe Ulfric a drink. I have to admit, I didn't think we'd be seeing you again. I misjudged you. You're definitely Stormcloak material. It's time we made this official. You ready to take the Oath?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Are you saying you sent me out there to die?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not at all. That was as much a test of your abilities as it was your resolve. I wasn't sure your heart was in it. But you've proven me wrong. And I respect that. Now, if were done being sentimental, it's time for you to take the Oath.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oath?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Before you're one of us, you must swear fealty to Jarl Ulfric Stormcloak, future High King of Skyrim. You must also pledge unswerving loyalty to your fellow Stormcloaks, to Skyrim and to her people.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Isn't it enough that I want to fight Imperials?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You can stick a sword through an Imperial any day you want. But that doesn't make you a Stormcloak. We're not just fighting Imperials. We're fighting to restore Skyrim to her glory and give her the king she deserves.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I need to think it over.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't take too long figuring it out. Might mistake your hesitation for Imperial sympathies. Come back when you're committed to the cause, or go join the Legion. They're taking anyone with a pulse these days.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm ready to take the Oath.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's the spirit.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player agrees to take the oath.
label: ACTION

dialogue: By swearing this oath, you become one of us. A hero of the people. A true son of Skyrim. A Stormcloak. Repeat after me. "I do swear my blood and honor to the service of Ulfric Stormcloak..."
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: "I do swear my blood and honor to the service of Ulfric Stormcloak..."
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: "...Jarl of Windhelm and true High King of Skyrim."
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: "...Jarl of Windhelm and true High King of Skyrim."
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: "As Talos is my witness, may this oath bind me to death and beyond..."
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: "As Talos is my witness, may this oath bind me to death and beyond..."
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: "...even to my lord as to my fellow brothers and sisters in arms."
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: "...even to my lord as to my fellow brothers and sisters in arms."
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: "All hail the Stormcloaks, the true sons and daughters of Skyrim!"
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: "All hail the Stormcloaks, the true sons and daughters of Skyrim!"
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now you're one of us. Which means you get to tag along on a little trip with me. Oh, and here. You're a Stormcloak now, you ought to look the part.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player can inquire further.
label: ACTION

dialogue: What's the Jagged Crown?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Have you not heard that ancient verse? "Maw unleashing razor snow, Of dragons from the blue brought down, Births the walking winter's woe, The High King in his Jagged Crown." Going way back to King Harald's time or even before, the High King always wore the Jagged Crown. It was the symbol of his might and power. The crown is made from the bones and teeth of ancient dragons, and it is said to contain a portion of the power of every king who has worn it. True or not, who would dare deny Ulfric's claim, when the legendary Jagged Crown sits upon his brow?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How do you know the crown is in Korvanjund?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's true, the location of the crown was lost with King Borgas. After the Great Hunt killed him, while he was off on his damned Alessian campaigns. But legend holds, his body was secretly returned to Skyrim and buried with the crown. Its exact whereabouts lost in the following Wars of Succession. Through sources that shall remain nameless, I've tracked down what I believe to be the final resting place of King Borgas -- Korvanjund. If the crown exists, it will be there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You anticipate danger?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Aye. The Great Hunt killed old King Borgas. Gods only know with what profane arts those elves cursed his remains. Curses nonwithstanding, the tombs of kings are always full of traps to ward off grave robbers, are they not? But nothing a band of Stormcloaks can't handle, I assure you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They arrive at the snowy tomb, about halfway between Whiterun and Windhelm. chapter, will run over at this point.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Ha, I knew you'd join up! Great news. We'll take back Skyrim together, eh? I'm glad I'll have you beside me in there. This place chills my blood, and I don't care who knows it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What are you talking about?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: These old ruins... My father always told me to stay away from them. Good advice, I'd say. But never mind all that. We've got a job to do, and nothing's going to stand in our way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They walk to the main group together.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Hail, Ilfhild.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hail, Galmar.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's the situation?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Cold as the inside of an ice wraith. That and some Imperials are camped out around the entrance, staying nice and warm around their fires.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Imperials? Well, if they're keeping themselves comfortable, let's slip in and send them to their graves that way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Galmar sees the player's arrived.
label: ACTION

dialogue: What's the Legion doing here? Damn Imperial spies... Well, should be fun for us, at least. They don't seem to know we're here yet. Ready to spill some Imperial blood for Skyrim?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hold on. I need a minute.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Even the Imperials might eventually decide to patrol their perimeter. Get yourself ready!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm ready. Let's go get them.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's what I like to hear. Listen up. Those Imperials aren't here by coincidence. Their spies must have found out we know about the Crown, and they don't want us to have it. But they won't stand in our way. I know some of you are ex-legion and may know men on the other side. But remember this. They are the enemy now and they will not hesitate to kill you. Keep your wits about you and watch your shield brother's back. Ulfric Stormcloak is counting on us to bring him back that crown, and that's exactly what we are going to do. Follow me. Quickly and quietly now. I want their guts on the ground before they even know we're here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They slaughter the gate guards and slip inside undetected.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Pick a man and put him down. We attack on my signal. Time to show what you're really made of. For Skyrim!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They slay the nearby patrolmen.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Gretta, Engar, stay and guard the entrance. We don't want any Imperial reinforcements taking us by surprise. The rest of you lot are with me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They soon reach a long, thin stairway.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I don't like the look of this. Perfect spot for an ambush. Ten to one they're just waiting for us on the other side.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But there isn't any other way through.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You sure about that? Then please, be my guest and go strolling on in there. We'll stay here and watch your back... Not so sure? Oh, then perhaps we should take a moment to look around a little, eh? You there, Unblooded, see if you can find another way through. We'll charge in to help as soon as we hear fighting. There may be some way to get through on the level above. Hurry!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Using the upper route, the player reconnoiters, overhearing two sentries.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You hear anything?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, but I know they're out there. No other way they can come. Now shut up or you'll blow our ambush.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't like it. What are they waiting for?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Maybe they're so scared of you they ran away.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hardly likely.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just shut up and keep out of sight.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player attacks.
label: ACTION

dialogue: It must be the Stormcloaks! Attack!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They slay 'em.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Careful, boys. There's bound to be more up ahead.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They pick off a straggler. Nearby is a draugr and a fresh corpse.
label: ACTION

dialogue: What in the nine holds is that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Draugr. Ain't you ever seen one before?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. And I'm not sure I'm better off for it now neither.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Steady. A few dusty bonewalkers aren't going to stop us anymore than the Imperials could. We're not leaving until we get what we came for. Now let's keep moving.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They progress deeper into the crypt, coming upon the tunnel and puzzle lock.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Ah! The Hall of Stories...we must be getting close now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh...I've heard of this. They say these walls show the history of the ancients who built this place.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Too bad we can't read these carvings. Who knows what secrets we'd uncover?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One thing at a time. We're here for the Crown. Any of these carvings show a crown?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: An Imperial corpse is nearby.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Hmm, looks like this is as far as the Imperials got. Even if one of these pictures tells us where the Crown is, I'm betting we're going to have to find a way through that door. See what you can figure out, Unblooded. I'm going to check out these carvings over here. Let me know if you find something.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The corpse has a claw nearby.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Hmm...that looks like some kind of claw from a statue. I wonder what it's used for.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Using the claw, the puzzle door's opened.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Good job! Alright everyone! Keep your guard up. No telling what we'll find down here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They reach a larger chamber.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Come on, boys. Let's spread out and see what we've got. Unblooded, do what you do best. See if you can find some way to get that gate open.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A lever up top opens the gate.
label: ACTION

dialogue: That's done it! Alright, boys, let's get moving. We've got more...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Draugr pop out of the coffins.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Look out! Draugr!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Steady now! They may be uglier than Imperials but they'll go down just the same.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The undead are laid to rest.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Let's hope that's the last of them. Come on, let's see what's down this way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Finally, the team comes across the deepest tomb.
label: ACTION

dialogue: The crown must be around here somewhere. Spread out, and keep your eyes open.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, I found a crown over here on this corpse. Is this the one we're looking for?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ralof...get away from there, fool!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: High-level draugr reanimate nearby. Afterwards, the player finds the Crown.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Get to Windhelm with the crown as quick as you can. Tell Ulfric he owes me a drink. We'll stick around here for a while and see if we can find anything else useful.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The headgear is delivered to Ulfric personally.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Here's the Jagged Crown. I believe you owe Galmar a drink?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Damn him -- the old bear was right! Did you run into any trouble?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nothing I couldn't handle.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's the spirit. I'll get all the details from Galmar when he gets back.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We lost a lot of good men. I hope it was worth it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The blood of our fallen heroes will make Skyrim free, never doubt it. Also, never doubt me or Galmar.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Imperials were there ahead of us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Damn it. What were they doing there? Imperial spies are everywhere. Never forget that... I trust you gave them a thrashing? Now then... I'm glad you're here. I have a message I need delivered to the Jarl of Whiterun. Deliver this axe to Balgruuf the Greater.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: An axe?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. An axe. How long have you been in Skyrim. Give the man my axe. If he keeps it, I will bide my time. If he returns it to you, it means war.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Should I say anything to him?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Men who understand each other often have no need for words. There are but a few simple truths behind one warrior giving another his axe. Balgruuf will know my meaning.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Understood.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Keep your wits about you. The Jarl of Whiterun is known for his temper.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Jarl's sought out at Dragonsreach, the hilltop castle overlooking his fair city.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Jarl Ulfric Stormcloak asked me to deliver this axe to you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Did he now? The man is persistent, I'll give him that. • But until that dragon's dealt with, Ulfric's just going to have to wait. For now, I'll hold onto this axe. But it's a tenuous peace at best. Now I believe you have some business to conclude with my court wizard? • I suppose it's time I give him an answer... Proventus, what do you make of all this? If Ulfric were to attack Whiterun...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As in all things, Lord, caution...I urge us to wait and see.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Prey waits.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm of a mind with Irileth. It's time to act.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You plan to march on Windhelm?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not a fool, Proventus. I mean it's time to challenge Ulfric to face me as a man, or march his Stormcloaks up to the gates.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He'll do no such thing! A dagger in the back is all you could expect!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He was rather straight forward with Torygg.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Torygg? He simply walked up to the boy and murdered him!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That "boy" was the High King of Skyrim.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not the High King, but neither am I a boy. If Ulfric wants to challenge my rule in the old way, let him. Though I suspect he'll prefer to send his "Stormcloaks" to do it for him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: True. He's already proven his personal strength. Now he seeks to prove his army's.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then might I urge you to consider General Tullius's request? I mean, if you are bent on offending Jarl Ulfric...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ulfric is the one who has offended. But, Proventus has a point. Ulfric has made it clear. In his mind, to refuse his claim is to side with the Empire.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And what harm is there in letting a few Legionnaires die in place of your own men?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It seems cowardly.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Was it cowardly then to accept the White-Gold Concordat?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This again?! That was different. Was I given a chance to object to the terms of the treaty? No. The Jarls weren't asked. We were told. And we had to like it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The chests of gold didn't hurt.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Dammit! This isn't about gold!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's time to decide.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lord, wait. Let us see if Ulfric is serious.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, he's serious. But so am I.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Finally.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So about this axe... You can return this axe to our friend. The esteemed Jarl of Windhelm has my answer. Make sure he gets it. Proventus. Bring me my pen. And the good parchment.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Are we writing a letter, Lord?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, to General Tullius. I need to make a few things clear before I accept these Legionnaires of his.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One returns to Ulfric with the grim tidings.
label: ACTION

dialogue: The Jarl of Whiterun returns your axe.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then I was wrong about him. You were right Galmar.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Again?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm in no mood to joke.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Give the word, my lord, and Whiterun is yours.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whiterun is only a means to an end.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've toured our camps. We're ready, Ulfric... Whenever you are.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is a man ever ready to give the orders that will mean the deaths of many.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. But neither is every man able to give that order when he must. But you are that man, Ulfric. You've been that man before, and you'll be him again. And these men and women -- they call themselves Stormcloaks because they believe in you... They are the meanest, toughest sons of bitches Skyrim has to offer. And they want this. They want this as much as you do. Perhaps they want it more.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're certain we're ready? Whiterun's army will no doubt be bolstered by Legionnaires. And those walls around Whiterun are old, but they still stand.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We're ready. And I might be old myself, but I'll kick those damn walls down with my bare feet! -- if you would only ask me to do it!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And I'm sure you could do it, too. Alright. This is it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Send the word. "A new day is dawning and the sun rises over Whiterun."
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Aye, and the sons of Skyrim will greet that dawn teeth and swords flashing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So it begins. Make haste to our camp in Whiterun. I want you on the front lines. I have a feeling about you. Your place is on that battlefield. I need you there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, sir!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fight well, or die well.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Many will die by my hand.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then I commit them to whatever gods they still believe in. Talos be with you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We're taking the city. Meet the brothers gathering for the attack. Fight well or die well. Talos be with you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player travels to the Stormcloaks' catapult-filled camp in Whiterun's countryside.
label: ACTION

dialogue: This is it, men!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, do you get that weird taste in your mouth before battle, too? What is that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They storm the gates, destroying the chevaux-de-frise and approaching the Dragonsreach.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Halt in the name of the Jarl, Balgruuf the Greater!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll be damned if I let this rabble take my city without raising my own sword.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Stay back, lord!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Soon, the jarl is brought to heel.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Enough! That's enough. I surrender...I surrender. Peace! Everyone stand down. That's an order. Stand down!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hostilities over, a prominent Whiterun citizen enters the castle.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Balgruuf!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Vignar Gray-Mane! Your family was noticeably absent from the walls... Now I know why. Wouldn't a dagger in the back have sufficed?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You think this is personal? The Empire has no place in Skyrim... Not any more. And you? You have no place in Whiterun anymore.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A convenient position to hold now. But mark my words, old man, in the days to come, Ulfric will spread his rebellion thin. And what then? We need the Empire, as much as it needs us. We Nords are the Empire! Our blood built it. Our blood sustains it! You of all people should know that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If this was my Empire, I'd be able to worship whoever I damned well pleased. You wish to see an Empire without Talos? Without its soul? We should be fighting those witch-elves, not bending knee to them. The Emperor is nothing more than a puppet of the Thalmor. Skyrim needs a High King who will fight for her, and Whiterun needs a Jarl who will do the same.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me, Vignar. Was all this worth it? How many of those corpses lining our streets wear the faces of men who once called you friend? What about their families?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Enough! Both of you! There is a burning city out there that needs a government.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He's right. Galmar, come, let us restore order.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This isn't over. You hear me you old fool! This isn't over!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He turns to the player.
label: ACTION

dialogue: And you. A Stormcloak? I'd thought better of you. You'll all come to regret this day.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Get over to Windhelm. Tell Ulfric of our victory here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm pretty sure I killed more than you. I was counting.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The victory is soon reported to Ulfric.
label: ACTION

dialogue: We've driven the Imperials out of Whiterun. This is good. Very good. We now control the center. It's a powerful position. One I aim to keep. We'll call you Ice-Veins now, for the thick blood of our land has seeped into your heart. Here, take this. It's an Imperial officer's sword. A fitting weapon to use against our enemy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's our next move against the Empire?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I suspect you'll be of greater use to us with greater freedom, so you're free to engage the Imperials as you see fit. But I also want you to find our hidden camp in Falkreath. Galmar will have special tasks for you, and will need you when we liberate the capital.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What exactly will I be doing out there?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'll be doing whatever Galmar tells you to do, and causing as much mayhem as possible for the Empire and any Jarl who supports them.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Understood.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Talos guide you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Go with the gods.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player journeys to Falkreath's camp, set on the Throat of the World's southern slope, near the mountain pass.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Reporting in.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're going to Fort Neugrad. They have some of our boys locked up there. But with a little luck, we can turn that to our advantage. I've sent some men to scout the area. Meet them, see if you can't find a way to slip in, free our men, and take over the fort. They'll never suspect an attack from the inside. This won't be easy. But that's why I'm sending you. You got the grit to get this done?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not sure. I need to think about it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I see. Well, make it quick, or do you have better things to do than fight for the people of Skyrim?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nothing I can't handle.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We all have faith in you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good. You've got real fire in you. I like that... Talos guide you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Near the fort, the player finds the ambush party. Ralof is there, too.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Well, well. Look who it is! How have you been?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm all right, I guess. How are you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good to hear.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've been better. And you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: These are dark days. But at least we know we're doing our part to make things better, eh? I guess I'm doing all right. I need this to go well. This is my first real command since they promoted me after Whiterun. You know, some nights when I close my eyes, I see the battle stretched out before me, like I'm still there... Do the men you killed still haunt you? Mine do...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Only a beast kills without feeling.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I suppose you're right...they say it gets easier... I'm not sure if that's a good thing...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you hadn't killed them, they would have killed you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's what I keep telling myself. But, never mind all that. We've got a job to do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So what's the plan? / What's the plan?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Straight to business with you, huh? Well, it just so happens I have the perfect mission for you. We found a cave under the lake. With luck, it'll lead into the prison. I need you to sneak in there, free our men, killing anyone inside as you go. Once you've rescued the prisoners, head out to the courtyard. We'll stand guard out here and rush in as soon as we hear fighting. Should be fun.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm on it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You should wait until night fall before trying to sneak in.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Talos preserve you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not much for sneaking.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have faith in you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Using Ralof's advice, the player uses a sunken cave to infiltrate the prison. The four prisoners are being watched by a guard, who's quickly disposed of.
label: ACTION

dialogue: The guard has the key.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The captives are freed. They collect their confiscated gear, then make for gutted and the fort overtaken.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Great work! Get back and report our success. I'll stay here and clean up the mess. Glad you were here. Couldn't have done it without you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: News is brought to Ulfric.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I'm proud we liberated Falkreath from the Empire. In many ways it's the heart and soul of Skyrim. Not to mention its rather strategic position. Some brothers have taken to calling you Bone-Breaker, evidence of your ferocity and determination. A fitting name. So we shall all call you thus. The war demands so much from us, and we give all we have to it and the people...but I've kept a little something to offer you in appreciation. Please take this on behalf of all the brothers and sisters. And I need capable and loyal warriors close at hand. So I'd like to offer you a home in Windhelm. Speak with my steward who'll make the arrangements.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's our next move against the Empire?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Get over to our camp in the Reach. They need every able body they can muster.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What exactly will I be doing out there?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'll be doing whatever Galmar tells you to do, and causing as much mayhem as possible for the Empire and any Jarl who supports them.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Understood.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Talos guide you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: For Skyrim!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One ventures to the hilly Reach camp, northeast of Karthwasten.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Reporting in.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Get over to Markarth. Rumor has it the Jarl's steward, Raerek, is a faithful Talos worshipper, if not a true son of Skyrim -- he still supports the Empire, after all. But, if confronted with proof of his belief, you might be able to "persuade" him to aid our cause, indirectly of course. Wouldn't want to sully his reputation, would we? You'll need to be careful with this one. The Jarl's men won't look kindly on you rummaging through the steward's quarters.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not sure. I need to think about it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I see. Well, make it quick, or do you have better things to do than fight for the people of Skyrim?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll get proof...and Raerek's cooperation.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can always count on you, can't I?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One ventures to Understone Keep in Markarth, and finds Raerek's inscribed Amulet of Talos in his nightstand. He's immediately confronted with it.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Recognize this? (Show him Raerek's Inscribed Amulet of Talos)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not here. Come with me. Stay close and the guards will leave you alone.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He leads the player into his chambers.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I suppose you're here to extort something from me? Is that it? Well, what is it you want?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you believe in Talos, why don't you join our cause?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So. You're one of Ulfric's spies... I can't deny the man is right about a few things... But I've seen first hand what Ulfric is capable of, given the chance. Suffice it to say, he is no friend of Markarth, and no friend of mine. My first and only loyalties are to my nephew, and to this city.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What if this were made public?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Thalmor would need to make an example of me...I'd be thrown into prison, but our family's honor would be stained for generations. I'm the Jarl's uncle. He, his father, and I, swore oaths to the Empire to abandon Talos, as conditions of our return to the city.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Perhaps we could come to some kind of agreement?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What if I told you about a large shipment of silver and weapons?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Go on. I'm listening.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, no. I won't tell you anything more until we have an agreement.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And what about something for me, right now? (Persuade)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well I...I suppose I'm not left much choice in the matter, am I? Very well. I trust a hefty purse of septims will suffice?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How much are we talking about?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Enough to make a significant difference in the war.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right, it's a deal. Where can I find this shipment?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They're taking it by wagon to Solitude. If you hurry, you'll catch them before they get far. It'll be a fairly slow moving caravan. The shipment is quite heavy, and guarded by many men. Now, let's pretend we never had this discussion.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The news is delivered to one's superior.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Raerek says there's a shipment of coin traveling to Solitude...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good job. I knew you'd come back with something for me. It just so happens, I've got some scouts along the road. Meet up with them, and together see if you can't overpower the caravan.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ralof is found once again at the meeting spot.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Hey there! I was wondering when I'd run into you out here. The Reach is a beautiful but dangerous place, eh? One false step and you'll fall to your death, that is if those Forsworn don't get you first. Have you seen those Briarheart men? That's some evil magic right there. What brings you? You have the look of purpose in your eyes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's an enemy wagon loaded with coin and weapons. We need to capture it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Really? It just so happens we've been tracking a wagon! For about a day now. So that's what's in there? Coins and weapons? How do you know that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I blackmailed Raerek for the information.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That was crafty. I'm sure having a steward in the pocket will come in handy. Lucky for us, that the wagon recently had a little accident. They're stranded now. Just up the road!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It doesn't matter.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, fine. Keep your secrets. I see how it is. That wagon recently had a little accident. They're stranded now, just up the road. We're outnumbered, but I have a plan. You got here just in time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's the plan?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: First, we're going to take out their sentry, then we'll situate ourselves overlooking the camp. Next, you'll infiltrate their position and get their attention while we hit them with a barrage of arrows. With a bit of luck, we'll catch them completely off guard and even the odds a little.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have a better plan. You wait here, and I'll take care of it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right, if you insist. But we'll come running if it sounds like things have gotten out of hand.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's wait a little longer.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let me know when you're ready.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ready. Let's go.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They sneak forward toward the sentry.
label: ACTION

dialogue: There's a sentry patrolling the hill. We'll go in quiet and drop him with a combined arrow barrage. Keep low, fire on my word. Fire!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They silently slay the watchman.
label: ACTION

dialogue: All right. You infiltrate their camp, we'll cover you from the ridge. Good luck!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Imperial stooges are mopped up.
label: ACTION

dialogue: We make quite a team, eh? I'll stay here and guard the shipment. You get back to camp with news. Have them send some men -- and a new wagon. This one isn't going anywhere.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Galmar is notified.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Well done! I'll send men with a wagon to collect our prize. We'll put the weapons to use here, and I'll send the coin back to Windhelm.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's off to the fort, set atop a ridge and heavily fortified. Despite the The player reports to Ulfric.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Now that the Empire has been driven from the Reach we can put a stop to the raping of her silver mines. That silver belongs to Skyrim. Multitudes of our enemies are buried in an avalanche of pain and retribution delivered by your hands. I shall call you Snow-Hammer now. You show great passion for battle, and compassion for those we fight for. You are becoming indispensable to our cause. We do what we do out of love for our brothers and sisters. Here, take this as a token of such love reciprocated.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's next?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're needed in Hjaalmarch. There's much to be done.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What exactly will I be doing out there?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'll be doing whatever Galmar tells you to do, and causing as much mayhem as possible for the Empire and any Jarl who supports them.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Understood.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: For Skyrim!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Talos guide you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One visits the Hjaalmarch camp, in the marshes near Solitude Inlet. Galmar, as usual, is there to dole out missions.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Reporting for duty.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Need you to deliver some false orders to the Imperial Legate in Morthal. But first we need to get our hands on some Imperial orders to make the forgeries. The inns at Dragonbridge and Rorikstead are frequent stops for Imperial runners. See if you can't "convince" one of those innkeepers to help you. One way or another, get me those documents. What do you say?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not sure. I need to think about it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I see. Well, make it quick, or do you have better things to do than fight for the people of Skyrim?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That fort is as good as ours.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't screw this up.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Excellent. Put the fear of the Nine into those motherless dogs.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If one goes to Dragon Bridge or Rorikstead, the innkeeper is Faida or Mralki, responses seen in the Imperials' version of the quest.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I tend to keep my patrons' privacy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: His life is in danger. (Persuade)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It is? Well that's different.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yeah, sure it is. You don't fool me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Maybe some gold will help ( gold)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, if you insist...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Seems your purse is lighter than you thought.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't have time for this. I can get rough with you if I have to. (Intimidate)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now, now! That won't be necessary.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Never mind.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hmph. He was here, but he left. If you leave now, you can probably catch him. Or, you can just wait here. He'll be back soon enough.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Eventually, one tracks down the Imperial deliveryman.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Can't stop to chat, citizen.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not here to talk. I'm here for those documents.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is that so?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Never mind.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hmph.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The parcel is taken, one way or another, to Galmar.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Good work! Let's see what you got. Hmm... They know more of our plans than I thought... Not good... Oh, what's this? Fort Snowhawk is in need of reinforcements... We'll make sure they won't be getting those... Give me a moment while I make a few, um, "corrections" to these reports... There we go. Make sure those forged documents get to the Legate in Morthal. That should give them the wrong idea...and us the advantage.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One seeks out Taurinus Duilis in the swampy village.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I have important documents for you, sir.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: • Is that so? Lost your uniform along the way did you, soldier? Dragonborn: Ditched it for this. Easier to sneak past the enemy. I suppose it would be. Good thinking. Thank you, soldier. Let's take a look at these reports... I'm waiting on word about reinforcements for the fort... Good, they're on the way. And we have some information on enemy troop movements. Excellent. Stormcloak scouts are making it difficult to move around. It's good you made it here in one piece. Why don't you have yourself a drink at the Moorside before you head back?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Galmar is notified of the subterfuge.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Good job! Ulfric was right about you. I'm glad to have you with us!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Reporting in.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're going to Fort Snowhawk. Meet the brothers preparing for the attack. Then join them in wiping out the Imperials. Once you prevail we will garrison the fort. What do you say? Can you do this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not sure. I need to think about it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I see. Well, make it quick, or do you have better things to do than fight for the people of Skyrim?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That fort is as good as ours.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good. You've got real fire in you. I like that... Talos guide you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One visits Snowhawk, set in the mountain west of Morthal. It's a wonder who through before victory's at hand. Afterward, it's time to notify Ulfric.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Tullius must be getting nervous. Taking Hjaalmarch we're practically in his backyard now. As soon as we're able, we'll march on Solitude. You've become a true hero of Skyrim. I number you among my kin. You shall now be known as Stormblade. The love of the land and her people flows from your heart, even as death to her enemies flows from your hands. On behalf of the sons and daughters of Skyrim, on behalf of all that is righteous and true, take this token of our appreciation for your service.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's next?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've no time to glory in your accomplishments. We're gathering for our final assault on Solitude. I need you there. Report to our camp in Haafingar.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One goes to the base, situated between Solitude and Dragon Bridge.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Reporting in.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're going to the fort. Meet the brothers preparing for the attack. Then join them in wiping out the Imperials. Once you prevail we will garrison the fort. What do you say? Can you do this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not sure. I need to think about it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I see. Well, make it quick, or do you have better things to do than fight for the people of Skyrim?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That fort is as good as ours.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good. You've got real fire in you. I like that... Talos guide you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One visits the snowy fort, nestled on the northern face of the mountains to Galmar.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Good job! Ulfric was right about you. I'm glad to have you with us!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How can I help?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We're taking the city. Meet the brothers gathering for the attack. Fight well or die well. Talos be with you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: At long last, it's time to fight at the seat of Tullius' leadership. Ulfric himself is leading the charge at the city's gates.
label: ACTION

dialogue: This is it men! Time to make this city ours! We come to this moment carried by the sacrifice and courage of our fellows! Those who have fallen. And those still bearing shields to our right. On this day, our enemy will know the fullness of our determination, the true depth of our anger, and the exalted righteousness of our cause. The gods are watching. The spirits of our ancestors are stirring. And men under suns yet to dawn will be transformed by what we do here today. Fear neither pain, nor darkness. For Sovngarde awaits those who die with weapons in their hands, and courage in their hearts. We now fight our way to Castle Dour to cut the head off the Legion itself! And in that moment, the gods will look down and see Skyrim as she was meant to be. Full of Nords who are mighty, powerful, and free! Ready now! Everyone, with me! For the sons and daughters of Skyrim! Rrrrrraaaaaaaaaggggghhhhhhh!!!!!!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Stormcloak army filters into the city, bringing the bloodletting to the the jarl and Galmar in tow. Rikke and Tullius are in the strategy room.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Secure the door.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Already done.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player can speak to Rikke before anything else happens.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Dragonborn... Perhaps this is the fate of Skyrim after all. To be destroyed from the inside.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We'll kill you if we must.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A true Nord never fears death. It's the how and why of it one needs consider.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Rikke, leave. They'll kill you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If that must be, then it will. And why should I be any different? So many lives have already been lost. What's one more?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Jarl will soon approach Tullius and his aide-de-camp.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Ulfric. Stop.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Stop what? Taking Skyrim back from those who'd leave her to rot?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're wrong. Ulfric. We need the Empire. Without it Skyrim will assuredly fall to the Dominion.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You were there with us. You saw it. The day the Empire signed that damn treaty was the day the Empire died.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're a damn fool.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Stand aside woman. We've come for the General.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He has given up. But I have not.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Rikke. Go. You're free to leave.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm also free to stay and fight for what I believe in.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're also free to die for it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This is what you wanted? Shield brothers and sisters killing each other? Families torn apart? This is the Skyrim you want?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Damnit woman, stand aside!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's not the Skyrim I want to live in.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Rikke. You don't have to do this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've left me no choice... Talos preserve us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The fighting is brief, but ends with Rikke dead and Tullius gravely wounded.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Enough...enough...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This is it for you. Any last words before I send you to Oblivion?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You realize this is exactly what they wanted.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What who wanted?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Thalmor. They stirred up trouble here. Forced us to divert needed resources and throw away good soldiers quelling this rebellion.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's a little more than a rebellion, don't you think?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Heh.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We aren't the bad guys you know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Maybe not, but you certainly aren't the good guys.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Perhaps you're right. But then what does that make you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You said it yourself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It makes us right.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And if I surrender?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Empire I remember never surrendered.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That Empire is dead. And so are you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So be it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just kill him and let's be done with it already.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come, Galmar. Where's your sense of the dramatic moment?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: By the gods! If it's a good ending to some damn story you're after -- perhaps the Dragonborn should be the one to do it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good point. Well, Dragonborn. What do you say? Do you want the honor?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've had my fair share of killing today.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As you wish.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That honor belongs to you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As you wish. This moment, we three, will be immortalized in song.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll gladly kill him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Dragonborn. Here, use my sword to do it. This moment will be immortalized in song. Make it a good kill.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One way or another, Tullius is put to the sword.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Aghh..
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good. It's done.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, I suppose some kind of speech is in order.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll go gather the men in the courtyard.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And Elisif?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't you worry about her. I've sent my best men to round her up.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Stormblade. I want you to have my sword, a token of my appreciation. Now then. The men will expect a speech. Will you stand by my side? I wish to honor you, Dragonborn and the truest of Stormcloaks.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course, my Lord.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Very good. Come, the people await us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Maybe you should leave me out of your speech.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, why is that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Many have fought and died. I'm no different than they are.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: On the contrary, you exceed the rest. But, I will honor your request. The gods will know of your victories, and they themselves will glory in your deeds. Come, at the very least walk out with me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not sure this was all worth it, after all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's no shame in such thoughts. A man without doubts is a man without a conscience. But rest assured. We've won Skyrim's right to determine her own future. And for that, every Nord praises us. But I will heed your wishes. Come, at the very least, walk out with me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My reasons are my own.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A man's heart is his own burden to bear, so I will honor your request, though it casts a bit of gloom on an otherwise glorious day. Come, at the very least walk out with me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Outside, the Stormcloak throngs are massing for the speech. Elisif the Fair, the region's jarl, is in attendance with Galmar's bodyguards.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I am indeed Ulfric Stormcloak, and at my side the man we know as Stormblade, and the world knows as the Dragonborn. And indeed, there are many that call us heroes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: • I am indeed Ulfric Stormcloak... And indeed, there are many that call me hero. • I am indeed Ulfric Stormcloak, and at my side the man we know as Stormblade, and the world knows as the Dragonborn. And indeed, there are many that call us heroes. But it is all of you who are the true heroes! It was you who fought a dying Empire who sunk its claws into our land, trying to drag us down with it. It was you who fought the Thalmor and their puppets who would have us deny our gods and our heritage. It was you who fought your kin who didn't understand our cause, who weren't willing to pay the price of our freedom. But more than that, it was you who fought for Skyrim, for our right to fight our own battles... To return to our glory and our traditions, to determine our own future! And it is for these reasons that I cannot accept the mantle of "High King." Not until the Moot declares that title should adorn my shoulders will I accept it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What about Jarl Elisif?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, what about the Lady Elisif? Will she put aside her personal hatred for me, and her misplaced love for the Emperor and his coin, so that the suffering of our people will end? Will she acknowledge that it is we Nord's who will determine Skyrim's future? Will she swear fealty to me, so all may know we are at peace, and a new day has dawned?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I do!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then it is settled. The Jarl will continue to rule in Solitude, I will garrison armies here to ward off Imperial attempts to reclaim the city. And in due time, the Moot will meet, and settle the claim to High King once and for all. There is much to do, and I need every able bodied man and woman committed to rebuilding Skyrim. A great darkness is growing, and soon we will be called to fight it, on these shores or abroad. The Aldmeri Dominion may have defeated the Empire, but it has not defeated Skyrim!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yyyyyyyaaaaaahhhhhh!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How'd I do?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Eh, not so bad. Nice touch about the High King.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you, I thought so, too.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's a foregone conclusion, you know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, I know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Imperials aren't going to leave us alone. They still have camps in the hills. They'll continue to strike out at us, whenever and wherever they are.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not afraid of the remnants of the Legion, in time they'll all give up and go home. What I fear, is the Thalmor will see our victory here and turn greater attention to our shores. We must be prepared to face them.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Aye.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He turns to the player.
label: ACTION

dialogue: And, of course, we couldn't have done it without you. May the gods preserve you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: May the gods preserve us all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come, Galmar. We've still much work to do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ulfric can be asked about the future, now that the questline's over.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Is there anything further I can do to help the cause?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: True sons and daughters of Skyrim reign in every city, we've crippled the Imperial Legion, and cut off its head by killing General Tullius himself. What more could I ask of you? No, you're free to roam. I suspect the gods have needs for you elsewhere. That said, some of the Legion's staunchest men have organized themselves, and are operating out of hidden military camps in the wilderness. If you come across any Imperials in your travels, I expect you'll know what to do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, do I call you High King now?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, not yet. We'll wait for the Moot to name me High King. It'll be better for all that way. But, that doesn't mean I won't start acting like it. There's much to do. The new Jarls need help building armies, and enforcing their right to rule. The Empire may try to reclaim Skyrim, and I need everyone ready for that. Though the biggest threat, of course, is the elves.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now that we've defeated the Imperials, will there be peace?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There will be peace for a time, during which we must rebuild Skyrim into the land it once was. Strong. Self-reliant. The center of mankind. Because getting rid of the Empire was only half the problem. Soon, the elves will again seek to rule the world. We must ready ourselves to fight them. For it will be Skyrim that shall lead Tamriel in those dark days, when the fate of the world is finally determined.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Galmar can also be spoken to.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Is there anything further I can do for the cause?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. I trust you'll do more good out there in the world, wherever you damn well please to go. You're a true son of Skyrim. You'll know what to do. To begin with, killing any Legionnaire you find out in the wilderness. I've reports they've hidden military camps out there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's next for the mighty Galmar Stone-Fist?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Heh. Ulfric's put me in charge of keeping an eye on the new Jarls. You know, make sure they're generally following orders. Can't say I'm looking forward to that. But, I'll also be training men and women for their new armies. The Empire might send over a few Legionnaires to make sure we're serious, and of course, we'll be taking the fight to the elves soon enough. We'll need trained, disciplined and creative warriors ready for all that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Elisif can be spoken to as well.
label: ACTION

dialogue: What do you think about Ulfric, now that he has won?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ulfric coveted the High King's throne. He thought he deserved it more than Torygg. Now it would seem Ulfric has his wish. And there truly is no justice in the world.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, do you still claim to be High Queen of Skyrim?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. Although it's true my husband Torygg was the High King and I am his widow, I am in no position to claim such a title. Ulfric Stormcloak is victorious, and the Jarls have fallen in line. It seems I will never take my rightful place as High Queen.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Never done an honest day's work in your life for all that coin you're carrying, eh, lad?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm sorry, what?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm saying you've got the coin, but you didn't earn a septim of it honestly. I can tell.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How could you possibly know that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's all about sizing up your mark, lad. The way they walk, what they're wearing. It's a dead giveaway.7
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My wealth is none of your business.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, but that's where you're wrong, lad. Wealth is my business. Maybe you'd like a taste?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do you have in mind?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've got a bit of an errand to perform, but I need an extra pair of hands. And in my line of work, extra hands are well-paid.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do I have to do?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Simple...I'm going to cause a distraction, and you're going to steal Madesi's silver ring from a strongbox under his stand. Once you have it, I want you to place it in Brand-Shei's pocket without him noticing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why plant the ring on Brand-Shei?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's someone that wants to see him put out of business permanently. That's all you need to know. Now, you tell me when you're ready and we'll get started.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm ready. Let's get this started.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good. Wait until I start the distraction, then show me what you're made of.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why are we doing this to Brand-Shei?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We've been contracted to make Brand-Shei remembers not to meddle in affairs that are not his own. Now, since we're not the Dark Brotherhood, we're not going to kill him; we're just going to make sure he sits in the prisons for a few days.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How am I supposed to do all of this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do you want me to hold your hand as well? You're going to have to sneak over to Madesi's stall and use your lockpick on the strongbox. Then, when you have the ring, you pickpocket Brand-Shei and leave it behind.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Break the law? Are you kidding?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sorry...I usually have a nose for this kind of thing. Never mind then, lad. If you change your mind, come find me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: With help recruited, Brynjolf begins his scam, getting other vendors to come see what he's hawking.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Everyone! Everyone! Gather 'round! I have something amazing to show you that demands your attention! This way, everyone! Over here! No pushing, no shoving. Plenty of room!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come on, Brynjolf...what is it this time?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Patience, Brand-Shei. This is a rare opportunity, and I wouldn't want you to get left out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's what you said about the Wisp Essence and it turned out to be crushed Nirnroot mixed with water!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, that was a simple misunderstanding, but this item is the real thing. Lads and lasses, I give you, Falmerblood Elixir!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, come on, are you talking about the Snow Elves?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The one and only. Mystical beings who live in legends and were masters of great magic. Imagine the power that coursed through their veins!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How did you get that then? No one's seen them in years!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My sources must remain a secret for their own protection, but I can promise you that the contents are genuine. One sip of the elixir and your wishes will be granted. Great wealth, everlasting life or perhaps limitless power could be yours!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How much does it cost?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Only twenty gold septims. Hurry before my supply is gone!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why would you even listen to him?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Only twenty septims a bottle!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can't afford to get one, but can I afford not to?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player steals Madesi's ring and reverse-pickpockets it without a hitch.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Well, I see that my time is up. Come back tomorrow if you wish to buy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What a waste of time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Damn. I knew I shouldn't have waited.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As the crowd disperses, Brynjolf seeks the player out.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Looks like I chose the right person for the job. And here you go... your payment, as promised. The way things have been going around here, it's a relief that our plan went off without a hitch.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's been going on?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Bah. My organization's been having a run of bad luck, but I suppose that's just how it goes. But never mind that, you did the job and you did it well. Best of all, there's more where that came from...if you think you can handle it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can handle it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Alright, then. Let's put that to the test. The group I represent has its home in the Ratway beneath Riften...a tavern called the Ragged Flagon. Get there in one piece and we'll see if you really have what it takes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The money's nice, but I don't know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look, I'll make this simple for you. The group I represent has its home in the Ratway beneath Riften...a tavern called the Ragged Flagon. When you make up your mind, come find me there and we can talk about your future.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No way. It was wrong to do those things.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Arrogant, eh? Play it however you want, but listen up. The group I represent has its home in the Ratway beneath Riften...a tavern called the Ragged Flagon. When you come to your senses, find me there and we'll discuss your future.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Defeating the foes in the Ratway, the player reaches the hidden tavern 'neath the city. Brynjolf and some of his cohorts are discussing the player.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Give it up, Brynjolf...those days are over.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm telling you, this one is different...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We've all hear that one before, Bryn! Quit kidding yourself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's time to face the truth, old friend. You, Vex, Mercer... you're all part of a dying breed. Things are changing!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Dying breed, eh? Well what do you call that then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, well...color me impressed, lad. I wasn't sure I'd ever see you again!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Getting here was easy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Reliable and headstrong? You're turning out to be quite the prize! So...now that I've whetted your appetite with our little scheme at the market, how about handling a few deadbeats for me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I almost got killed!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No risk, no reward. That's the way it goes, so you better get used to it. Now, if you're done bellyaching like a child, how about handling a few deadbeats for me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't know why I bothered. This place is a mess.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you were expecting a palace, then maybe you're not cut out for this line of work. Our methods require secrecy and discretion. Now, if you're done bellyaching like a child, how about handling a few deadbeats for me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Deadbeats? What'd they do?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They owe our organization some serious coin and they've decided not to pay. I want you to explain to them the error of their ways.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sounds good. Who are they?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Keerava, Bersi Honey-Hand and Haelga. Do this right and I can promise you a permanent place in our organization.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How do you want me to handle it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Honestly, the debt is secondary here. What's more important is you get the message across that we aren't to be ignored. A word of warning, though...I don't want any of them killed. Bad for business.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Consider it done.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good. If you need any details on your marks, I'll be here. Get
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Will I get a cut?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course you'll get a cut. We take care of our own. Now, if you need any details on your marks, I'll be here. Get going.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's Haelga's story?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Haelga is a devout follower of Dibella and dotes over the statue to the Divine which she keeps at the Bunkhouse. Use it as leverage and she'll cave.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Any tips about Keerava?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Keerava's stubborn, but she's got a soft spot for her family. Talk to Talen-Jei at the Bee and Barb and see if you can get something out of him. They're...well-acquainted, if you catch my meaning.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Any help with Bersi?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He's as pig-headed a man as you'll ever find. The key is that ugly dwarven urn in his shop. Smash that thing to bits and he'll change his attitude.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player goes to see Bersi Honey-Hand at his pawn shop.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I have a message from Brynjolf.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wha...what? Oh, it's one of you people. So, Brynjolf doesn't even bother to show up himself anymore, eh? What's this message?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Simple. You don't pay, bad things happen.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Petty threats and fist-waving are not going to sway me. You people are all talk and everyone knows it!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We can protect ourselves. Trust me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't fool yourself. It's only a matter of time before you people are run out of Riften.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think you know what it is.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're gouging me for what little coin I make and you can't even protect yourselves? Ridiculous!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We can protect ourselves. Trust me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (same as above)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've had enough of this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Likewise. Now, I have a lot to do, so I'm afraid you'll just have to leave!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think you need to shut your mouth. (Brawl)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm going to make you sorry for this!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If Bersi is beaten up:
label: ACTION

dialogue: Please, no more! I'll pay, I'll pay! Here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If the urn is destroyed.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Stop! That's priceless!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh my word!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No! That urn was priceless!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You want me to break anything else?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right! I get it. I'll pay on time from now on. Just don't smash anything else. Here! Take your gold and leave me in peace.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If the urn is destroyed before speaking to Bersi:
label: ACTION

dialogue: I can't believe you're doing this! Stop! No! That urn was priceless!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That was from Brynjolf. Get the message?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can't believe you did that! You people are monsters! You demand payment for protection and you can't even protect yourselves! Here, take your coin and tell Brynjolf to leave us alone.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If Bersi is the last of the three left, he'll already be intimidated:
label: ACTION

dialogue: Oh no! You're the one from Brynjolf's outfit, aren't you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have a message from Brynjolf.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh! There's no need for that. I know why you're here. Tell Brynjolf not to worry about it anymore. Oh! And look, I even have the payment I owed. Here, take it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player goes to Haelga's bunkhouse.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I have a message for Brynjolf.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What does he want now? I already explained to him that you can't get blood from a stone.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This isn't about the money anymore.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look, I can't make the coin appear out of thin air. Please, be reasonable. I'll...I'll pay next month.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We've run out of patience.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And so have I. What's the point of paying anyway? Your outfit can't even fend for itself. I could do better tossing the gold into the sewer. You can't scare me with your tough talk. I'm not paying you a single coin.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then you'll pay in more than just coin. (Brawl)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ha! We'll see about that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If Haelga is beaten up:
label: ACTION

dialogue: Here...take your damn coin and get out of here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If her Dibella statue is taken.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Please! Don't take the statue! It's the only thing of value I have left!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have a message from Brynjolf.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You...you have my statue! What are you going to do with it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, should I drop this statue down a well?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not Lady Dibella! No, please! I can't lose her! I get the message. Here, take your gold. I hope you choke on it!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If Haelga is the last of the three, she'll already be intimidated.
label: ACTION

dialogue: It's you! Please, don't hurt me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have a message from Brynjolf.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know who you are. You've been terrorizing the entire city. Please, there's no need for that here. Message understood. Here, I even have the payment!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player goes to shakedown Keerava, an Argonian at the bar.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I have a message from Brynjolf.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've already told that buffoon I'm not paying you people a single coin!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It was never a request.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look around you, I'm barely keeping this rathole together. The war's seen to that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm finished wasting my time talking to you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good, and take this little message back to your bosses: I'm not paying any of you a single septim...ever! Now get out of my inn!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't say I didn't warn you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come on, give it your best shot!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If Keerava is beaten up:
label: ACTION

dialogue: Please, stop! I'll pay up! Take it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If one learns about Keerava's family from Talen-Jei, another Argonian:
label: ACTION

dialogue: Are you ready to pay Brynjolf what you owe?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, and I never will. Now get out of my inn.
