label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Maybe I should visit that farm in Morrowind...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How could you possibly know about... Please. My family means too much to me. Don't hurt them.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then pay up and I'll forget about it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Very well. Here. Take this back to Brynjolf and tell him he'll have no more trouble from me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If Keerava is the last of the three, she'll already be intimidated.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I have a message from Brynjolf.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look, everything was all just a misunderstanding. I didn't mean to tell Brynjolf to go jump off the pier. You'll tell him I'm sorry, yes? Take this. Every single coin I owe is there, I swear.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: With all three merchants shaken down, the player returns to Ragged Flagon.
label: ACTION

dialogue: So, job's done and you even brought the gold. Best of all, you did it clean. I like that. Dumping bodies and keeping the guards quiet can be expensive.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Here's what they owed us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well done. And it would seem I owe you something in return. Here you go, I think you'll find these quite useful.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He gives some potions as recompense.
label: ACTION

dialogue: What's next, then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Judging from how well you've handled those shopkeepers, I'd say you've done more than simply prove yourself. We need people like you in our outfit.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If there's more gold where that came from, I'm in.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's the spirit! Larceny's in your blood...the telltale sign of a practiced thief. I think you'll do more than just fit in around here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Before we go, I have to ask...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's on your mind?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Word is your outfit isn't doing well. True?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We've run into a rough patch lately, but it's nothing to be concerned about. Tell you what: you keep making us coin and I'll worry about everything else. Fair enough?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fair enough.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now if there are no more questions, how about following me and I'll show you what you're all about.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Brynjolf leads the player through a hidden door into the Thieves Guild's real domain, a cistern beyond the Ragged Flagon. The guildmaster is waiting.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Mercer? This is the one I was talking about...our new recruit.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This better not be another waste of the Guild's resources, Brynjolf. Before we continue, I want to make one thing perfectly clear. If you play by the rules, you walk away rich. You break the rules and you lose your share. No debates, no discussions... you do what we say, when we say. Do I make myself clear?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, I understand.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good. Then I think it's time we put your expertise to the test.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not sure.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you're not sure maybe you don't belong here. I'll ask again, are we clear on all of this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Rules? We're thieves. What's the point of rules?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll let that comment go because you're new here. Ask things out of turn again, and we have a problem. Now, are we clear on all of this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wait a moment... You're not talking about Goldenglow, are you? Even our little Vex couldn't get in.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You claim this recruit possesses an aptitude for our line of work. If so, let him prove it. Goldenglow Estate is critically important to one of our largest clients. However, the owner has suddenly decided to take matters into his own hands, and shut us out. He needs to be taught a lesson. Brynjolf will provide you with the details.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mercer, aren't you forgetting something?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hmm? Oh, yes... Since Brynjolf assures me you'll be nothing but a benefit to us, then you're in. Welcome to the Thieves Guild.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mercer walks off.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Welcome to the family, lad. I'm expecting you to make us a lot of coin, so don't disappoint me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So how do I get my cut of the spoils?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Simple. Do as you're told and keep your blade clean. We can't turn a profit by killing. You should talk with Delvin Mallory and Vex. They know their way around this place and they'll be able to kick some extra jobs your way. Oh, and talk to Tonilia in the Flagon...she'll set you up with your new armor.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me about the Goldenglow job.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Goldenglow Estate is a bee farm; they raise the wretched little things for honey. It's run by some smart-mouth wood elf named Aringoth. We need you to teach him a lesson by burning down three of his estate's hives
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's the catch?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The catch is that you can't burn the whole place to the ground. That important client Mercer mentioned would be furious if you did.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who cares, we're the Thieves Guild.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's not how things work around here. The Guild depends on an arrangement of influential people to keep things running smoothly. Without them at our backs, we'd be in serious trouble.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Makes sense.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Aye, the last thing we want to be doing is crossing our clients.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's so important about these clients?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The guild depends on an arrangement of influential people to keep things running smoothly. Without them at our backs, we'd be in serious trouble.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What should I do about Aringoth?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Maven prefers that Aringoth remains alive, but if he tries to stop you from getting the job done, kill him. The Guild has a lot riding on this. Don't make me look foolish by mucking it up.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I need more details about Goldenglow.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Goldenglow Estate brought in a mountain of gold for the Guild. You could almost call it our sweetest deal. Then out of the clear blue, Aringoth stops sending us our cut. Mercer was...well, angry, to put it kindly. So we send in Vex to find out he's hired a bunch of mercenaries to guard the place.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mercenaries? Not Riften guards?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Aye. Aringoth sent the city guard packing and fortified the entire island. In fact, Vex barely made it out of there alive. You should talk to her about it before you go.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How do I destroy the bee hives?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They're built like small fortresses to resist the weather, but their one weakness is flame. Besides, nothing tells the people of Riften we mean business than a huge column of smoke.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why not level the entire estate?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll give you one good reason: Maven Black-Briar. Burn all the hives and she'd have to import for Black-Briar Meadery, which would cut into her profits.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Maven Black-Briar is the influential client?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We had an arrangement with Maven. We kept an eye on Goldenglow Estate to make sure the honey kept flowing. If the workers had a dispute, we rough them up. If competitors tried to buy honey from Aringoth, we'd steal the shipments. In return, Maven allowed us to extort Aringoth and bring in a huge payout.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, how dangerous is it to cross her?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let me put it to you this way: nothing happens in Riften without Maven's consent. One word from her and you could spend the rest of the fourth era in prison.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player prepares to leave.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You watch yourself on that island. Those mercenaries don't take prisoners.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Optionally, one can ask Vex about her encounter.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I heard you ran into trouble at Goldenglow.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hmph, yeah, I did. That wood elf s'wit...he's a lot smarter than I expected. Can you believe that fetcher had more than tripled the guard? There must have been eight of them in there. It was like he was daring us to come and get him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Any tips to get me in there?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, there's an old sewer tunnel that dumps into the lake on the northwest side of the island. That's how I slipped in there. Should still be unguarded.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If the player finds Aringoth upstairs:
label: ACTION

dialogue: Worthless mercenaries. I didn't think Maven or Mercer would allow me to get away with this, but I had little choice.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I just want the key to your safe.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can't. If I do, I may as well cut my own throat.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What makes you think I won't? (Persuade)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't believe you. That's not your way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then I'll take it off your corpse!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Give it your best shot!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Forget it. I'll just open it myself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No! I'm not about to let you ruin everything I've worked so hard for!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If the player returns to Brynjolf after destroying too many hives:
label: ACTION

dialogue: You've made a mess and Maven is furious. I told you not to burn more than three of the hives! I've smoothed things over with her for now, but you can forget your cut.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sorry. Here's what was in the safe.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: At least you remembered one of the things I asked. Let me see that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If the player returns to Brynjolf after doing a satisfactory job:
label: ACTION

dialogue: Word on the street is Goldenglow's been hit. Good job.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, and here's what was in the safe.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let me take a look at what you found. Aringoth sold Goldenglow? What's that idiot thinking? He has no idea the extent of Maven's fury when she's been cut out of a deal, but I'm certain he'll find out. If only the parchment had the buyer's name instead of this odd symbol. Any idea what that may be?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No idea.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Blast. Well, I'll check my sources and ask Mercer. But for now, you're off to speak with Maven Black-Briar. She asked for you by name.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good, it's about time I met her.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't sound so eager, it's not a social visit. It's business.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I thought I did the job like you asked...?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, no. Nothing like that. You're calling on her for business.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sure, but will I come out of there alive?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ha ha. If it was like that she wouldn't be asking for you, she'd be calling the Dark Brotherhood. It's just business.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What does Maven want from me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's between you and Maven and I prefer to keep it that way. • Just keep your ears open and your mouth shut and you'll do fine. • Don't worry about it. Maven's business dealings usually involve quite a bit of gold for her people.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Speaking of which...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course...your pay. Haha! You're smart as a whip, lad. Keep doing right by us and there'll be plenty more where that came from.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Dragonborn tracks down Maven in Riften. If the player fouled things up:
label: ACTION

dialogue: So you're the one who burned down Goldenglow Estate. Do you have any idea what that little stunt you pulled is going to cost me? I'm amazed you even bothered to show your face here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My apologies, Lady Maven.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The only reason we're having this conversation is due to Brynjolf's assurance you won't botch another assignment. He claims you possess some sort of uncanny aptitude for your line of work. Quite frankly I find that hard to believe.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If the player did the Goldenglow job right:
label: ACTION

dialogue: So, you're the one. Hmm. You don't look so impressive.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm the best at what I do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is that confidence I hear...or arrogance? Strange how often they're confused.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sorry you're disappointed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This is exactly what I'm talking about. Once again Brynjolf sends me someone with no backbone, no determination.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How about we skip the conversation?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have to understand, it's been a long time since Brynjolf's sent me anyone I can rely on.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have no faith in the guild?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Faith? I don't have faith in anyone. All I care about is cause and effect. Did the job get done and was it done correctly. There's no gray area.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You won't have that problem with me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I hope not. This is an important job. I have a competitor called Honningbrew Meadery that I want to put out of business. I also want to know how they got the place up and running so quickly.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Where do I begin?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Head to the Bannered Mare in Whiterun and ask for Mallus Maccius. He'll fill you in on all the details.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who runs the Honningbrew Meadery?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Some layabout named Sabjorn. Been a thorn in my side for the last few years now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sabjorn seems like more than just friendly competition.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not a day goes by that I don't regret letting Sabjorn get as far as he did. In only a few short years, he's taken that bile he calls mead to market and a chunk of my profits with it! I can't imagine where he found the gold to take it to market so quickly.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So get rid of him and he's no longer a threat.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Exactly. With Sabjorn in prison, his meadery will be forced to close. Then I swoop in and take over the place. No more competition.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why strike now?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Goldenglow Estate job has undoubtedly interrupted the supply of honey that I need to make my mead. Sabjorn could use this interruption to his advantage and take a larger share of the market. I can't have that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How did you become Allied with the Thieves Guild?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Black-Briar family has always been allied with the Guild. Our connections with the Empire and within Skyrim make for a perfect fit. I dare say the Guild owes its survival as much to my family as it does to its own people.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One more time in case I wasn't clear. You butcher this job and you'll be sorry.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player travels to Whiterun's inn.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Can't a man drink in peace?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Maven said you're expecting me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm going to keep this short 'cause we've got a lot to do. Honningbrew's owner, Sabjorn, is about to hold a tasting for Whiterun's Captain of the Guard, and we're going to poison the mead.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have the poison?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, no. That's the beauty of the whole plan. We're going to get Sabjorn to give it to us. The meadery has quite a pest problem and the whole city knows about it. Pest poison and mead don't mix well, you know what I mean?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How do I fit in?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're going to happen by and lend poor old Sabjorn a helping hand. He's going to give you the poison to use on the pests, but you're also going to dum it into the brewing vat.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Clever.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Maven and I spent weeks planning this. All we need is someone like you to get in there and get it done. Now get going before Sabjorn grows a brain and hires someone else to do the dirty work.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How do I get to the brewing vats?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Both of the buildings are connected by tunnels made by the pests infesting the meadery. There's an entrance to it in the basement storeroom of the warehouse that used to be boarded over. I've already removed the boards so the meadery would be infested. That's where you should start.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What about just going in through the brewery?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sabjorn keeps that locked up tight. If you can get through that way, go right ahead.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why are you doing all this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I made the mistake of borrowing coin from Sabjorn. He's allowing me to pay it back, but he's working my fingers to the bone! He treats me like a slave...I have to do every nasty, dirty job in the meadery.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's more to this than a debt, isn't there?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If this plan works, not only is my debt gone, but I'll be set up for life. Maven and I worked out a little deal. If Sabjorn ends up in jail, she's going to take over his meadery. And guess who gets to run the Black-Briar Meadery in Whiterun? You're looking at him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why bother poisoning the nest for Sabjorn?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Once Sabjorn is out of the way, Maven has plans for this place. One way or another, we don't want the pests coming back. Consider it just more of the dirty work. I did my part getting them in there, now you need to clear them out. Remember, Sabjorn will be needing a helping hand. Make it look good.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Dragonborn goes to the meadery. Dead rats lie near the serving counter.
label: ACTION

dialogue: What are you gawking at? Can't you see I have problems here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is something wrong?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Are you kidding me? Look at this place. I'm supposed to be holding a tasting of the new Honningbrew Reserve for the Captain of the Guard. If he sees the meadery in this state, I'll be ruined.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I might be able to help.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh really? And I don't suppose you'd just do it out of the kindness of your heart, would you? I hope you're not expecting to be paid until the job's done.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's the only way I operate. (Persuade)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well that's not how I operate, so forget it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You better, or I yell "skeever." (Intimidate)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Okay, okay. No need to make rash decisions. Here's half. You get the rest when the job's done. My only demand is that these vermin are permanently eliminated before my reputation is completely destroyed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just pay me when the job's done.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My only demand is that these vermin are permanently eliminated before my reputation is completely destroyed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How do I "permanently" clear the vermin?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I bought some poison. I was going to have my lazy, good-for-nothing assistant Mallus handle it, but he seems to have vanished. If you plant this in the vermin's nest, it should stop them from ever coming back.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've got a deal.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't come back until every one of those things are dead.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I haven't finished the job yet.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why are you standing here then? I've told the Captain of the Guard we'll have the meadery cleared for the tasting and he could be here any minute.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You mentioned someone named Mallus?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mallus is the best deal I've ever made. Lent him a bit of gold some time ago I knew he'd never be able to pay back. Nothing like free labor to make operating costs cheaper. Now I've got to clean up this mess.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After killing the rats and the human living with them, the mead is poisoned. The Dragonborn returns for his payment.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Job's finished.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well it's about time! I had to stall the captain until you were finished.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What about my pay?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'll just have to wait until after the captain's finished. I suppose you can wait around if you must.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, Sabjorn, now that you've taken care of your little pest problem, how about I get a taste of some of your mead?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Help yourself, milord. It's my finest brew yet...I call it Honningbrew Reserve. I think you'll find it quite pleasing to your palate.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, come now. This is mead, not some wine meant to be sipped and savored. By the Eight?! What...what's in this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I...I don't know. What's wrong?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You assured me this place was clean! I'll see...see to it that you remain in irons for the rest of your days!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, please! I don't understand...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Silence, idiot! I should have known better...to trust this place after it's been riddled with filth.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I beg you...please! This is not what it seems!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You...you're in charge until I can sort this all out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It will be my pleasure.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And you...you're coming with me to Dragonsreach. We'll see how quickly your memory cleans in the city's prisons. Now move.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look, I assure you, this is all just a huge misunderstanding!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I said move!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Farewell, Sabjorn.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Caius and his prisoner leave.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I don't think that could have gone any better. Anything else you need before you head back to Riften?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I need to get a look at Sabjorn's books.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, Maven wants to hunt down Sabjorn's private partner, huh? You're welcome to take a look around Sabjorn's office. He keeps most of his papers stashed in his desk. Here, this should help.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What are you going to do with this place?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Start changing it over to the Black-Briar Meadery as soon as possible. That was Maven's part of the deal. She's put me in charge of keeping the mead flowing, so that's exactly what I'm going to do. If you're in the area and you ever need anything fenced, you just let me know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You never mentioned that lunatic living in the tunnels.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I thought it would be better to leave some of the details out of our previous discussion. Didn't want to risk you walking away from the job. Besides, you've done Maven a favor getting rid of him and saved me from wasting coin hiring someone else to do it later. Remember to put in a good word with Maven for me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After finding a promissory note, it's time to report back to the Guild.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I trust you have good news for me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Job's finished. Here's the information you requested.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This doesn't tell me much. The only thing that can identify Sabjorn's partner is this odd little symbol.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. I've seen that symbol before.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, whoever this mysterious marking represents, they'll regret starting a war with me. You should bring this information to the Thieves Guild immediately. There's also the matter of your payment. I believe you'll find this more than adequate for your services.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Back at Brynjolf's...
label: ACTION

dialogue: Word on the street is that poor Sabjorn has found himself in Whiterun's prison. How unfortunate for him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yet very fortunate for Maven.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Exactly! Now you're beginning to see how our little system works. Maven sent word that you'd discovered something else while you were out there. Something important to the Guild?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The same symbol from Goldenglow was involved.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then this is beyond coincidence. First Aringoth and now Sabjorn. Someone's trying to take us down by driving a wedge between Maven and the Guild.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is there anything we can do?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mercer thinks he knows a way to identify this new thorn in our side. He wants to meet with you right away. And if I were you, I'd hurry. I've never seen him this angry before.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player finds Mercer at his usual desk in the cistern.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Ah, there you are. I've consulted my contacts regarding the information you recovered from Goldenglow Estate, but no one can identify that symbol.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I found the same marking at Honningbrew Meadery.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It would see our adversary is attempting to take us apart indirectly by angering Maven Black-Briar. Very clever.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You admire them?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They're well-funded and they've been able to avoid identification for years. I'm surprised it reached this point. Just don't mistake my admiration for complacency; our nemesis is going to pay dearly.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Maybe we should recruit them.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You just, but they've been able to avoid detection for years. They're obviously well-funded, driven and patient. Just don't mistake my admiration for complacency; our nemesis is going to pay dearly.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Clever or not, they need to die.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't dismiss our adversary so easily. They're well-funded, patient and have been able to avoid identification for years. However, don't mistake my admiration for complacency; our nemesis is going to pay dearly.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How can we make them pay?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Because, even after all their posturing and planning, they've made a mistake. The parchment you recovered mentions a "Gajul-Lei". According to my sources, that's an old alias used by one of our contacts. His real name is Gulum-Ei. Slimy bastard.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Where do I begin?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Gulum-Ei is our inside man at the East Empire Company in Solitude. I'm betting he acted as a go-between for the sale of Goldenglow Estate and that he can finger our buyer. Get out there, shake him down and see what you come up with. Talk to Brynjolf before you leave if you have any questions. Aringoth was a fool to think he could get away with this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If one goes to get extra info:
label: ACTION

dialogue: I can't believe Gulum-Ei's mixed up in all this; that Argonian couldn't find his tail with both hands. Don't get me wrong. He could scam a beggar out of his last septim...but he's no mastermind.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Think he'll give me trouble?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Trouble? He's one of the most stubborn lizards I've ever met! You have your work cut out for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So how do I get him to talk?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're going to have to buy him off; it's the only way to get his attention. If that fails, follow him and see what he's up to. If I know Gulum-Ei, he's in way over his head and you'll be able to use it as leverage.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Betrayal or not, I'll let him live.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm glad to see you're embracing our methods. It would be a waste to lose a contact at the East Empire Company before we had the entire story. Just keep on Gulum-Ei's tail and he's bound to step in something he can't scrape off his boot.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He's going to owe us for this betrayal.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Aye, he does indeed...and with his fingers in the East Empire Company's pie, we'll make good use of that debt. If I'm not being clear enough, that means we don't want him killed. For now, just keep on his tail and he's bound to step in something he can't scrape off his boot.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If he's betrayed us, I'll kill him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, no, Mercer wants him alive. For now. Stubborn or not, he's the only contact we have at the East Empire Company. Just keep on his tail and he's bound to step in something he can't scrape off his boot.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: East Empire Company? Who are they?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A mercantile group that has established ports all over Tamriel. They pretty much dominate the whole shipping industry. The Emperor himself supposedly backs them, which means they have fairly unlimited resources...so don't get their feathers in a ruffle.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If I get information from Gulum-Ei, what then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just head right back to the Guild and get the information to Mercer. Nothing else is more important. If you discover Gulum-Ei's holding out on us and hs more loot stashed away than he claims, we'd find that information quite valuable as well.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You think Gulum-Ei will give me trouble?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There are thieves and there is Gulum-Ei. No honor, no code at all. He'd shake your hand and stab you in the back at the same time. The cut he's supposed to provide the Guild has dwindled as of late. He says pickings in the warehouse are slim, but I'm certain he's lying. Keep your eyes on him; he's quite crafty.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How is Gulum-Ei an asset to the Guild?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Gulum-Ei works in the East Empire Company warehouse. He helps maintain all of the shipments of goods that goes in and out of Solitude. That means he has the pick of the litter from some of the finest goods to grace Skyrim's shores. He isn't exactly in the Guild, but he pays us a cut of all the stuff he lifts from the warehouse. Good luck in Solitude. Keep Gulum-Ei alive, but remind him who we are.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Argonian is found at Solitude's Winking Skeever tavern.
label: ACTION

dialogue: So, what do we have here? Hmm...let me guess. By your scent, I'd say you were from the Guild. But that can't be true, because I told Mercer I wouldn't deal with them anymore.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm here about Goldenglow Estate.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't deal in land or property. Now, if you're looking for goods, you've come to the right person.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You can drop the act now...Gajul-Lei.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, wait...did you say Goldenglow Estate? My apologies. I'm sorry to say I know very little about that...bee farm, was it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You acted as a broker for its new owner.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Maybe I did, maybe I didn't. I can't be expected to remember every deal I handle.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Identify the buyer and we'll forget what we know. (Persuade)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't care what you promise. If I tell you the buyer's name and word gets around, it could ruin me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What would it take to identify the buyer? (Bribe)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, now that you mention it, there is something I've been trying to get my hands on. I have a buyer looking for a case of Firebrand Wine. There just so happens to be a single case in the Blue Palace. Bring it to me, and we'll talk about Goldenglow Estate.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Give me the buyer's name or I'll kill you. (Intimidate)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hasn't Mercer Frey taught you people anything? You kill me and your only contact with the East Empire Company vanishes. That's not smart for business.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Dragonborn steals a case of wine from the jarl's palace, then returns.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I have the Firebrand Wine.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, I see you have the wine. Hand it over and we'll talk. Good. Can't have the buyer getting impatient and looking elsewhere for this, can we? Here, take this. I certainly can't use it, but I suppose I need to pay you something for the goods.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're trying to bribe me now?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not at all. I consider it an investment in prolonging my life. As far as Goldenglow Estate goes, I'll tell you what I know. I was approached by a woman who wanted me to act as the broker for something big. She flashed a bag of gold in my face and said all I had to do was pay Aringoth for the estate. I brought him the coin and walked away with her copy of the deed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Did she say why she was doing this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not at all. I tend not to ask too many questions when I'm on the job. I'm sure you understand. However, I did notice she was quite angry and it was being directed at Mercer Frey.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's it? No name or anything?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In this business we rarely deal in names; our identity comes from how much coin we carry.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think you're lying to me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look, that's all I know. I never promised you I'd have all the answers. Now, since our transaction is done, I'll be on my way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The broker leaves and gets tailed into the East Empire Warehouse. Gulum-Ei fact he's soon confronts him over.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Now, there's no need to do anything rash... This isn't as bad as it seems. I was going to tell Mercer about everything, honestly! Please...he'll have me killed!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mercer doesn't have to know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I see you wish to be reasonable. Perhaps I misjudged you. The name of the person you want is Karliah.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me first, and then I'll decide.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Alright, alright... It's Karliah...her name is Karliah.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me now or I'll kill you where you stand!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, please! There's no need for that! I'll tell you everything. It's Karliah...her name is Karliah.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You say that name like I should know it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mercer never told you about her? Karliah is the thief responsible for murdering the previous Guild Master, Gallus. Now she's after Mercer.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And you're helping her?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Help...? No, no! Look, I didn't even know it was her until after she contacted me. Please, you have to believe me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Where is Karliah now?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't know. When I asked her where she was going, she just muttered "where the end began". Here, take the Goldenglow Estate deed as proof. And when you speak to Mercer, tell him I'm worth more to him alive.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll keep quiet about your scam, but you owe me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now you're speaking my language. Tell you what, if you need any stolen goods fenced, you bring them to me and I'll pay you good money for them. Consider me your new friend in the north.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm keeping the deed. Any objections?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Consider it a gift to ensure your silence. That thing seems to be bringing me nothing but trouble anyway. Karliah didn't even want it, she wanted to keep the sale a secret. I can see how well that went.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why did Karliah purchase Goldenglow Estate?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I asked her the same thing and she wouldn't come out and tell me. But now that I know who she is, I'd say she's trying to hit the Thieves Guild where it hurts.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How would that hurt the guild?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Maven Black-Briar needs Goldenglow's honey for her mead. She's been using the Guild to keep the Estate under her thumb. If the owner cuts the Guild out of the picture, he's cutting Maven out of the picture...which she can't afford. If I was Maven, I'd blame the Guild for weakening and not being able to handle the place.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Which makes Maven lose faith in us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Exactly. For the Guild to survive, they need Maven's support. This Karliah must have spent a lot of time and resources planning this. Now, you won't forget to tell Mercer I cooperated, will you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player returns to the Guild.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Did Gulum-Ei give up any information on our buyer?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He said Goldenglow was purchased by a "Karliah".
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, it...it can't be. I haven't heard that name in decades. This is grave news indeed, she's someone I hoped to never cross paths with again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Gulum-Ei also told me she was a murderer.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Karliah destroyed everything this guild stood for. She murdered my predecessor in cold blood and betrayed the Guild. After we discovered what she'd done, we spent months trying to track her down, but she just vanished.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why has she returned?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Karliah and I were like partners. I went with her on every heist. We watched each other's backs. I know her techniques, her skills. If she kills me, there'll be no one left that could possibly catch her. If only we knew where she was...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Gulum-Ei told me she said, "Where the end began."
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's only one place that could be. The place where she murdered Gallus...a ruin called Snow Veil Sanctum. We have to go out there before she disappears again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, I'm going with you and together we're going to kill her. Here's your payment for Solitude. Prepare yourself and meet me at the ruins as soon as you can. We can't let her slip through our fingers.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player goes to Snow Veil Sanctum in Winterhold.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Good, you're finally here. I've scouted the ruins and I'm certain Karliah is still inside.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You saw her?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, I found her horse. Don't worry, I've taken care of it...she won't be using it to escape. Let's get moving, I want to catch her inside while she's distracted. Take the lead.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You want me to lead?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm sorry, I was under the impression I was in charge. You're leading and I'm following. Does that seem clear to you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Understood.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just make certain you keep your eyes open. Karliah is as sharp as a blade. The last thing I need is you blundering into a trap and warning her that we're here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How did Gallus die?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Twenty-five years ago, I was standing outside these very same ruins. Gallus told me to meet here but he wouldn't say why. When I arrived, Gallus stepped from the shadows. Before he uttered a sound, an arrow pierced his throat. Before I could even draw my blade, her second arrow found its mark in my chest.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So Karliah took on both of you alone?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Karliah was a master marksman and her greatest weapon was the element of surprise. I was lucky...she missed my heart by mere inches. I staggered away from the ruins and my vision began to blur. It's then that I realized the bitch had poisoned her arrows.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And Gallus?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The last thing I saw was Karliah dumping his body into an opening atop the ruins; an unceremonious end for a remarkable man. To this day, I've regretted letting her escape, even if it had meant I died trying. I owed Gallus that much.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What happened after Gallus died?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Guild was thrown into disarray. Several stepped up and tried to claim Gallus' former position as Guild Master. Sides quickly formed behind these men and the Ratway became a bloodbath.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And you were a part of this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I saw what they did to Gallus. I wanted to use the Guild's resources to hunt down Karliah. The others didn't even care he was gone. Fortunately, I perservered and the other groups were either killed or they left Skyrim.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And what of Karliah?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The in-fighting had taken months to subside, which gave her time to go into hiding and carefully cover her tracks. I spent thousands of septims and used every contact at my disposal, but it was as if she had simply vanished...like I said before, she was the best.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me about Karliah.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She was a stubborn Dunmer...always had to do everything her way. But she was also the best...bringing in more coin a month than some thieves heist in a year. Gallus trusted her too much and let her get too close.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, they had a relationship.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you want to call it that, yes. Me? I think she was softening him for the kill. Gallus would call her his "little nightingale". He was absolutely smitten by her.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why did she kill him?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Greed? Jealousy? Spite? Who can say what drove her to such an iniquitous act. One thing's certain: I intend to find out before she draws her last breath.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Isn't murder Dark Brotherhood territory?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have a long-standing arrangement with the Dark Brotherhood. If I need someone in the Guild taken care of, we do it ourselves. We both agree it's best to keep these matters in-house. Let's get going. I want her head on my mantle.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They arrive at the ruins' locked entrance.
label: ACTION

dialogue: They say that these ancient Nordic burial mounds are sometimes impenetrable. This one doesn't look too difficult. Quite simple, really. I don't know what all the fuss is about these locks. All it takes is a bit of know-how and a lot of skill. That should do it. After you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The two head inside.
label: ACTION

dialogue: The stench in here...this place smells of death. Be on your guard. Pull the chain over there and watch out for the spikes. Looks like Karliah reset all the traps.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They fight off boatloads of awakened draugr.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Karliah always was a nimble minx...slipping past these draugr must be child's play for her. We're on the right track. She's been through here as well.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After more fighting, a long passage is revealed.
label: ACTION

dialogue: That door up ahead...looks perfect for hiding an ambush. Be ready.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They come to a door requiring a specific claw object.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Ah, it's one of the infamous Nordic puzzle doors. How quaint. Without the matching claw, they're normally impossible to open. And since I'm sure Karliah already did away with it, we're on our own. Fortunately, these doors have a weakness if you know how to exploit it. Quite simple, really.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He opens the door easily.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Karliah's close, I'm certain of it. Now let's get moving.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As they enter the next room, the player is dropped to the floor by a hidden Mercer and Karliah play out.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Do you honestly think your arrow will reach me before my blade finds your heart?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Give me a reason to try.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're a clever girl, Karliah. Buying Goldenglow Estate and funding Honningbrew Meadery was inspired.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: "To ensure an enemy's defeat, you must first undermine his allies." It was the first lesson Gallus taught us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You always were a quick study.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not quick enough, otherwise Gallus would still be alive.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Gallus had his wealth and he had you. All he had to do was look the other way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Did you forget the oath we took as Nightingales? Did you expect him to simply ignore your methods?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Enough of this mindless banter! Come, Karliah! It's time for you and Gallus to become reunited!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Instead, she drinks an invisibility potion.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I'm no fool, Mercer. Crossing blades with you would be a death sentence. But I can promise the next time we meet, it will be your undoing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She slips away. Mercer goes and stands over the player.
label: ACTION

dialogue: How interesting. It appears Gallus's history has repeated itself. Karliah has provided me the means to be rid of you, and this ancient tomb becomes your final resting place. But do you know what intrigues me the most? The fact that this was all possible because of you. Farewell. I'll be certain to give Brynjolf your regards.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He stabs the player, walking away as they bleed out. Later, the player wakes up in front of the Sanctum. Karliah is there.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Easy, easy. Don't get up so quickly. How are you feeling?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hold on...you shot me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, I saved your life. My arrow was tipped with a unique paralytic poison. It slowed your heart and kept you from bleeding out. Had I intended to kill you, we wouldn't be having this conversation.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why save me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My original intention was to use that arrow on Mercer, but I never had a clear shot. I made a split-second decision to get you out of the way and it prevented your death.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then I'm in your debt.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: More than you'll ever realize.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why should I believe you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Without the antidote I administered, you'd be as still as a statue. I treated your wounds and didn't leave you defenseless.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You should have shot Mercer instead.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I promise you, the thought crossed my mind. The poison on that arrow took me a year to perfect; I only had enough for a single shot. All I had hoped was to capture Mercer alive.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why capture Mercer alive?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mercer must be brought before the Guild to answer for what he's done. He needs to pay for Gallus' murder.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How will you prove it now?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My purpose in using Snow Veil Sanctum to ambush Mercer wasn't simply for irony's sake. Before both of you arrived, I recovered a journal from Gallus' remains. I suspect the information we need is written inside.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, what's it say?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I wish I knew. The journal is written in some sort of language I've never seen before.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Perhaps it could be translated.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Enthir...Gallus' friend at the College of Winterhold. Of course... It's the only outside Gallus trusted with the knowledge of his Nightingale identity.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's that word again, "Nightingale".
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There were three of us: Myself, Gallus and Mercer. We were an anonymous splinter of the Thieves Guild in Riften. Perhaps I'll tell you more about it later. Right now, you need to head for Winterhold with the journal and get the translation. Here, take these as well, they may prove useful for your journey.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Can't you come with me to Winterhold?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm afraid not. There are preparations to make and Gallus' remains to lay to rest. I promise to join you there as soon as I can.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me about Gallus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He was a scholar, a master thief and a natural leader. Everyone respected him and followed him without question. It was Gallus who inducted me into the Nightingales and honed my skills to a razor-sharp point. I owe everything to him. We were...very close.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You were lovers?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Gallus once said he felt comfortable around me; able to let his guard down. I can't help but think that I'm responsible for what happened to him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why didn't you kill Mercer?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mercer lied to the Guild, branded me a murderer and slandered my name across his network of contacts. For twenty-five years I ran, never sleeping in the same place twice and carefully covering my tracks. Mercer doesn't need to die...he needs to feel the cold sting of fate as his life crumbles in front of him and he's hunted by the Guild.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Might not have a choice next time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can promise you if it comes to that, and my back's to the wall, I won't hesitate. Remember, speak only to Enthir. Trust no one else.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Enthir is found at Winterhold's inn.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Yes, yes, what is it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've been sent by Karliah.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Karliah? Then she's finally found it. Do you have Gallus' journal?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, but there's a problem.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A problem? Let me see it. This is just like Gallus. A dear friend, but always too clever for his own good. He's written all of the text in the Falmer language.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Can you translate it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. However, I know someone who might. The court wizard of Markarth, Calcelmo, may have the materials you need to get this journal translated. A word of warning: Calcelmo is a fierce guardian of his research. Getting the information won't be easy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What exactly is a Falmer?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In the time before man, they were known as the snow elves. They lived in the sunlight and had a very prosperous society.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So they were like your kind?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Like the Altmer? Yes, I would say their culture quite possibly rivaled our own.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What drove them underground?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Nords went to war with the Falmer in the First Era. Killed them by the thousands to drive them from their snowy homeland. The Falmer retreated underground and forged an uneasy alliance with the dwarves, who ended up betraying them. This betrayal made them what they are now...horrible, blind monstrosities with a burning hatred of any but their own kind.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They sound more like victims to me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, I suppose you're right. Forgive me. I've lost several close friends to the Falmer and it tends to distort my view.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You appear to despise them.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why shouldn't I? The Falmer have killed more than a fair share of my acquaintances. They're animals...they show absolutely no pity or remorse.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then I'll make it a point to hunt them down.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good. I lost more than a few acquaintances to the Falmer and I wish to see them avenged. If you wish to learn more about them, you're welcome to my tome on the subject. Should be on my table.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What can you tell me about Gallus?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He was a dear friend of mine and a surprisingly astute pupil of academia...I was devastated when he was killed. I suppose that risk always coexisted with his line of work; I just never thought his luck would run out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He was an academic yet he chose a different path. Why?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, for the thrill, of course. He was quite clear that he felt more in his element climbing through a window than hunched over a dusty tome.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How did you meet him?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, yes, quite an amusing anecdote actually. I caught him trying to break into my laboratory. I was about to show him the error of his ways when he made a curiously astute comment about my research notes. I was astounded and it in turn lead to a conversation. Who'd have imagined it would lead to such a strong friendship?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why did Gallus scribe his journal in Falmer?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Besides the fact that there are only a handful of people in Tamriel that even recognize the language? I'm fairly certain he was planning some sort of a heist that involved a deep understanding of the Falmer language. Sadly, we never had the opportunity to speak about the details.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Where did he acquire the knowledge to use it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ironically, I pointed him in the same direction I pointed you, to Markarth and Calcelmo. I'm only hoping whatever means he used to learn the language will still be available to you. Calcelmo is stubborn as a mule. Be careful when you speak to him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player finds Markath's court wizard.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Look, I'm very busy, so this better be important. What are you doing here? The excavation site is closed. I don't need any more workers or guards.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I was looking for you, actually.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I told you I'm not hiring any more guards. Why do you people always bother me when I'm trying to finish my research? You idiot. Do you even know who I am? The most recognized scholar on the Dwemer in all of Tamriel, and you people keep bothering me! I...I'm sorry, I...I got too excited. I'm in the middle of some very...stressful work, and I shouldn't have yelled. How can I help you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I hear you're the authority on ancient Falmer.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then you were well informed. I am at this very moment on the cusp of completing my magnum opus on the subject. I'm calling it "Calcelmo's Guide to the Falmer Tongue". It will revolutionize the way we understand those ancient beings.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Perhaps I could view your work?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Preposterous! That research represents years of personal toil in some of the most dangerous Dwemer ruins in Skyrim! You must be mad to think I'd allow anyone to see it before it's completed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Even after everything I did for you and Faleen?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, I'm not blind to the fact that you've been instrumental in improving my affairs of the heart. If you wish, you may enter my tower to view the museum section, but I'm afraid the laboratories are still off-limits. That's the best I can offer.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But I'm a great admirer of your work. (Persuade)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: While I appreciate the sentiment, I still have to decline. Being an admirer, I'm sure you can appreciate the need to keep my research a secret.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What will it cost to change your mind? (Bribe)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not certain how many scholars you're accustomed to dealing with, but I can assure you personal wealth is our lowest priority.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Grant me access or you'll regret it. (Intimidate)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do you realize that at the snap of my finger, I can bring the entire Markarth city guard to my defense? You best rethink this course of action or you may find yourself on the executioner's block.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Forget it. Maybe I'll come back later.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Very well. Perhaps when my research is complete, I'll feel more comfortable discussing my findings with you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Dragonborn enters the museum, then slips into the laboratories. He can overhear Aicantar, Calcelmo's nephew, in the distance.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You heard me, captain -- our work must not be disturbed. Kill any intruders on sight. Call for backup if you need it. But let no one through.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...As you say, sir.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After some slipping through the guard detail, the player sneaks into the coming in.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Yes, I'm positive I heard something!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I...oh, alright. If there is a thief, he won't leave this tower alive. But shouldn't we inform Master Calcelmo?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll deal with my uncle. Just...go! Scour this place from top to bottom!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Dragonborn escapes and returns to Enthir in Winterhold. Karliah's there.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Back, eh? And how was our friend Calcelmo?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This should help translate Gallus' journal.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I suppose it would be inappropriate of me to ask how you obtained this, so I simply won't. A rubbing, eh? Odd. I expected notes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's quite the tale.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I undertstand. Now, let me take a good look at this. Over here, please. Hmm... This is intriguing, but highly disturbing. It appears Gallus had suspicions about Mercer Frey's allegiance to the Guild for months. Gallus had begun to uncover what he calls an "...unduly lavish lifestyle replete with spending vast amounts of gold on personal pleasures."
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Does the journal say where this wealth came from?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. Gallus seems certain that Mercer had been removing funds from the Guild's treasury without anyone's knowledge.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Anything else, Enthir? Anything about...the Nightingales?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hmm. Yes, here it is. The last few pages seem to describe "the failure of the Nightingales," although it doesn't go into great detail. Gallus also repeatedly mentions his strong belief that Mercer desecrated something known as the Twilight Sepulcher.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Shadows preserve us. So it's true...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not familiar with the Twilight Sepulcher. What is it? What's Mercer Frey done?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm sorry, Enthir. I can't say. All that matters is we deliver your translation to the Guild immediately. Farewell, Enthir...words can't express...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's alright, Karliah. You don't have to say a word. Listen, all I want is the truth to be revealed to the Guild. They respected Karliah, and she deserves better. Do whatever you can and I'll consider it a personal favor.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you, Enthir.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you ever manage to gain entry to the College, and you find trying to rid yourself of stolen goods becoming a burden, come visit me. I've been known to handle items of questionable interest from time to time and I'll see what I can do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You must hasten to Riften before Mercer can do any more damage to the Guild.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Gallus' journal mentioned the "Twilight Sepulcher".
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've come this far, so I see no harm in concealing it any longer. The Twilight Sepulcher is the temple to Nocturnal. It's what the Nightingales are sworn to protect at all costs.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why does it require that type of protection?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Everything that represents Nocturnal's influence is contained within the walls of the Sepulcher. Now it seems Mercer's broken his oath with Nocturnal and defiled the very thing he swore to protect.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thieves and temples. It just doesn't add up.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I felt the same way when Gallus first revealed these things to me. I think given time, you'll understand what I mean.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'd understand better if less mystery was involved.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As a Nightingale, I've been sworn to secrecy regarding the Sepulcher. I know the Guild doesn't do much to foster faith, but I'm going to have to ask that you continue to trust me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Very well, we do it your way for now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll make for Riften and scout the situation; see if I can discover what Mercer's up to. When you're ready, meet me at the Ragged Flagon. In the meantime, I wanted you to have this. It belonged to Gallus, but given the circumstances I think he'd approve.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll put it to good use.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If the Guild isn't willing to listen to reason, you might have to.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He takes Gallus' Nightingale Blade and makes for the Flagon.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Karliah waits at the Flagon's entrance, far away from the sitting area.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I'm glad you're here. I think some of these people are beginning to suspect who I am. Are you ready to face the Guild?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm ready. Let's go.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Keep your eyes open. I'm not sure what to expect when we enter the cistern.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What if Mercer's there?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then we'll show them Gallus' journal and hope for the best. Remember, we've got proof and all he's got is his word.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, I'm not.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Time is of the essence here, please hurry back.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A thief is waiting behind the false cabinet.
label: ACTION

dialogue: They're waiting for you in the cistern. No tricks.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The cistern is filled with the guildmembers, all readying their sword arms.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You better have a damn good reason to be here with that murderer.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Please, lower your weapons so we can speak. I have proof that you've all bee misled!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No tricks, Karliah, or I'll cut you down where you stand. Now what's this so-called proof you speak of?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have Gallus' journal. I think you'll find its contents disturbing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let me see. No, it...it can't be. This can't be true. I've known Mercer too long...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's true, Brynjolf. Every word. Mercer's been stealing from the Guild for years, right under your noses.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's only one way to find out if what the lass says is true. Delvin, I'll need you to open the Vault.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wait just a blessed moment, Bryn. What's in that book? What did it say?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It says Mercer's been stealing from our vault for years. Gallus was looking into it before he was murdered.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How could Mercer open up a vault that needs two keys? It's impossible. Could he pick his way in?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That door has the best puzzle locks money can buy. There's no way it can be picked open.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He didn't need to pick the lock.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's she on about?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Use your key on the vault, Delvin. We'll open it up and find out the truth.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Delvin fulfills his role.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I've used my key, but the vault's still locked up tighter than a drum. Now use yours.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Brynjolf uses his. The vault's contents are laid bare.
label: ACTION

dialogue: By the Eight! It's gone, everything's gone! Get in here, all of you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The gold, the jewels...it's all gone.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That son of a bitch! I'll kill him!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Vex! Put it away...right now. We can't afford to lose our heads...we need to calm down and focus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do what he says, Vex. This ain't helpin' right now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fine. We do it your way. For now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Delvin, Vex...watch the Flagon. If you see Mercer, come tell me right away.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Other guild members can comment on the recent heist or situation. This is optional, but still worth noting somewhere.
label: ACTION

dialogue: This is gettin' dangerous. Don't let anythin' get the jump on you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Stabbed in the back. It's like the Dark Brotherhood all over again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If I see Frey, I'll pluck his eyes from his skull with my bare hands!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Need to stay focused in case Frey comes back, make it fast.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How can Karliah remain so calm when Mercer had her on the run for that long? Amazing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I never saw this coming. I thought we were just having a run of bad luck.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Vex is ready to tear you apart. I hope you have a good excuse for bringing Karliah here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Vex better leave a piece of Mercer for us. It's payback time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If I find Mercer first, I'm going to crush his skull with my bare hands!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I won't rest until Mercer's dead. How could he murder Gallus and betray all of us like that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I dare Mercer to come back here! He takes one step in the cistern and I'll cut it off!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can't believe he emptied the vault. Right from under our noses.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's no doubt Mercer will make for the borders of Skyrim. I hope you find him before he escapes our grasp. If you find Mercer, give no quarter...kill him and be done with it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Word is Mercer Frey is a dead man. The Guild wants his blood. I can't say I blame them. Murder is not our way. Gallus was before my time, but I still can't believe it. You need to teach him a lesson...show him the penalty for betrayal around here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Back to the mandatory stuff...
label: ACTION

dialogue: Look, before I help you track Mercer down, I need to know what you learned from Karliah. I mean everything.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mercer killed Gallus, not Karliah.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Aye, I feared that was the case. From that last entry in Gallus's diary, it looks like he was getting close to exposing Mercer to the Guild. Anything else?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Gallus, Karliah and Mercer were Nightingales.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What? Nightingales? But, I always just assumed they were a tale... a way to keep the young footpads in line. Was there anything else she told you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Karliah was behind Goldenglow and Honningbrew.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Trying to make Mercer look bad in front of Maven, eh? Clever lass. Was there anything else?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, that's it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then, I have an important task for you. I need you to break into Mercer's home and search for anything that tells us where he could have gone.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He has a house in Riften?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Aye, a gift from the Black-Briars when the kicked the previous family out...place called Riftweald Manor. He never stays there, just pays for the upkeep on it. Hired some lout by the name of Vald to guard the place.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll take care of it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Be careful, lad. This is the last place in Skyrim I'd ever want to send you. Just find a way in, get the information and leave. And you have permission to kill anyone who stands in your way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's the best way to get into Riftweald Manor?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good question. I've only set foot inside a few times myself and that was in Mercer's company. If you can get past his trained watchdog, I think your best bet might be the ramp to the second floor balcony in his backyard.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't suppose the ramp is easy to access.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. It's some sort of crazy contraption commissioned for quick escapes. I'd wager a well-placed shot at the ramp's mechanism would lower it in a hurry.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's missing from the vault?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Better question would be "what did he leave." Mercer took everything. Even all of our plans are gone.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Plans for what?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Before Mercer took over, Gallus started collecting every bit of material on locations the Guild could heist. Museums, keeps, estates...you name it. By the time Mercer took over the Guild we must have had a few dozen.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How could he have opened the vault door alone?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't have a clue. That door is impenetrable. Without two keys, it's impossible to open. I have a key, Delvin has a key, and Mercer has a key. That's it. There are no other copies.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You mentioned a watchdog?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That'd be Vald. A real piece of work, that one. Mercer's holding something over his head, keeping him loyal. Talk to Vex. She used to know him very well...if you catch my meaning. Careful at Mercer's place, I don't want to lose anyone else to that madman.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If the player speaks to Vex on the matter...
label: ACTION

dialogue: Brynjolf said you have info on Vald.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That pig? Oh, I have info on him. More than you care to know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I want to get on his good side.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Vald? Good side? I think you have the wrong person. The only thing Vald understands is gold. A man after my own heart.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, buy him off?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sure, but he'll ask for a whole lot. I mean, you are asking him to betray Mercer Frey. Your best bet would be to erase his debt with Maven Black-Briar. If you talk to her, she might be able to give you the details. Of course, you could just run him through and take what you need off his corpse...I could care less. While you're in there, help yourself to anything in Frey's manor. I would.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If the player speaks to Vald:
label: ACTION

dialogue: This is Mercer Frey's place and he don't like visitors. Now go away.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I need to get inside Mercer's house.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No visitors. No way. Now piss off before ya make me mad.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mercer needs you in Markarth right away! (Persuade)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, come on, I ain't that dumb.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll make it worth your while. (Bribe)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You ain't got enough coin to make my problems go away, unless ya can talk to Maven Black-Briar into lettin' me outta my debt. You try and set one foot in this yard and I'll cut it off.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let me in or I'll kill you. (Intimidate)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hahaha! That's funny. Ya think you can take me on? Try it anytime. I've been itching for a fight.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If one then speaks to Maven:
label: ACTION

dialogue: I'd like to erase Vald's debt.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Vald? Why would you want to help that idiot? He owes me a steep debt. In fact, he's lucky all I did was force him to work for Mercer.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What did he do?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A few years back, I commissioned a unique quill from a good friend of mine in Winterhold. Vald was tasked with getting it here safely and it ended up at the bottom of Lake Honrich.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He's in debt because of a quill?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The wizards call it the Quill of Gemination and demanded a tremendous amount of gold to have it made. If you can locate the quill and return it to me, something Vald was too stupid to do himself, I'll consider the debt satisfied.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is the Quill of Gemination?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The quill was supposed to allow me to duplicate any writing I'm viewing in exacting detail. I'm sure you understand how useful that would prove in a business situation, especially where signatures were involved.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What if someone else got their hands on it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fortunately, the quill required an ink with a unique formula known only to myself. So if you're getting any ideas abou selling it to someone else or keeping it, you'll find it would hold little value.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How did it end up in Lake Honrich?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I had Vald meet the caravan from Winterhold on the western end of the lake so he could avoid the roads. The idiot got lost in the mist and ran his boat right over some rocks, sending it straight to the bottom. He's too stupid to remember where he was, and any attempt I've made to find it in the past has been unsuccessful.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Any ideas where I can look?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Vald said his rowboat struck some rocks...I'd check under the water near one of the small islands in the lake. Perhaps you should start at the docks and work your way out towards Goldenglow Estate. I believe we're done.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If the player recovers the Quill:
label: ACTION

dialogue: I found the Quill of Gemination.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Really? I wrote that off a long time ago. Well, I suppose I need to fulfill my end of the bargain. Give this document to Vald. It frees him from the debt, but I never want to see him in Riften again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If the player brings the note to Vald:
label: ACTION

dialogue: I have something of yours.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of mine? What is it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Here, it's your debt with Maven. You're free.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can't believe it! How'd ya talk her into this? Never mind, I don't care. I'm just glad I don't gotta work for Maven anymore. Here, ya did me a favor, I guess I owe you one.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He gives over the key and walks off. Either way, the player will enter the Brynjolf...
label: ACTION

dialogue: I've scoured the town and I've spoken to every contact we have left. No sign of Mercer. Any luck on your end?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He wasn't here, but I found these plans.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Shor's beard! He's going after the Eyes of the Falmer? That was Gallus's pet project. If he gets his hands on them, you can be certain he'll be gone for good and set up for life.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then we have to stop him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Agreed. He's taken everything the Guild has left, and to go after one of the last greatest heists is just an insult. I've spoken to Karliah, and made amends for how the Guild's treated her. Now she wishes to speak with both of us. Quickly, we have no time to lose.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Karliah walks over.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Brynjolf, the time has come to decide Mercer's fate. Until a new Guild Master is chosen, the decision falls to you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Aye, lass...and I've come to a decision. Mercer Frey tried to kill both of you, he betrayed the Guild, murdered Gallus and made us question our future. He needs to die.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We have to be very careful, Brynjolf. Mercer is a Nightingale, an Agent of Nocturnal.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then it's all true...everything I heard in the stories. The Nightingales, their allegiance to Nocturnal and the Twilight Sepulcher.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. That is why we need to prepare ourselves and meet Mercer on equal footing. Just outside of Riften, beyond the Southeast Gate, is a small path cut up the mountainside. At the end of that path is a clearing and an old standing stone. I'd ask you both to meet me there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player goes to the designated location, a dead end where the path has vanished. A gigantic stone is off to one side. The other two are waiting.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I'm glad you're here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's the significance of this place?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This is the headquarters of the Nightingales, cut into the mountainside by the first of our kind. We've come to seek the edge we need to defeat Mercer Frey.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What kind of an edge?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you'll follow me, I'll try to explain on the way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me about the Nightingales.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Gallus, Mercer Frey and I were once members of what is known as the Nightingale Trinity. The Trinity disbanded twenty-five years ago when Mercer Frey betrayed us by slaying Gallus and dumping his body in the ruins of Snow Veil Sanctum.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Were they a part of the Thieves Guild?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Indirectly. The Trinity is usually selected from the ranks of the Guild, although its existence is a closely-guarded secret.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is their purpose?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Nightingales protect the Temple of Nocturnal, a place known as the Twilight Sepulcher.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who is Nocturnal?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She's the mistress of night and darkness and the patron of every thief in Tamriel.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've never met a thief that worshipped anything.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nocturnal isn't one for worship and reverence. There are no priests and no sermons, no services and no alms. She influences our luck and in return demands payment.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sounds like a Guild contract.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're closer to understanding than you realize. The only difference is she doesn't demand payment in the traditional sense, and sometimes the cost can be quite high. Whether you know it or not, Nocturnal dictates how well we perform as rogues.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have my skill, not powers or magic.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Again, you have to think differently. Haven't you ever noticed how our luck behaves? Like a novice picking an impossible lock or a blind man suddenly turning to face you as you reach for his pocket? It's through these subtle means that Nocturnal influences us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sounds like she just likes us to suffer.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nocturnal's whim is the greatest mystery to everyone. There have been volumes written on the subject. Does she exact payment when we die? When we suffer does she revel in our misery? No one knows. The return certainly seems worth the risk though.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Am I to become a Nightingale?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's my hope that you will, yes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What happened to capturing Mercer alive?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: From the moment you were struck with my poisoned arrow at Snow Veil Sanctum, my path changed its course. Perhaps I couldn't bring Mercer back alive, but together, we were able to clear my name and to put Gallus's remains to rest.
