I'd always intended Mercer's fate to ultimately be decided by the Guild, and it seems they've spoken. This way, please.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A rock slides back in the cliffs, revealing the hidden Nightingale Hall.
label: ACTION

dialogue: So, this is Nightingale Hall. I heard about this place when I joined the Guild, but I never believed it existed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The assumption that the Nightingales were just a myth was seeded within the Guild on purpose. It helped avert attention from our true nature. What's wrong, Brynjolf? I can almost hear your brow furrowing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm trying to understand why I'm here, lass. I'm no priest, and I'm certainly not religious. Why pick me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This isn't about religion, Brynjolf...it's business. This is Nightingale Hall. You're the first of the uninitiated to set foot inside in over a century. Now, if you'll both proceed to the armory to don your Nightingale Armor, we can begin the Oath.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think we should trust the lass and take the deal.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Each goes to one of the emblem-emblazoned stones and receives armor.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You appear ready for the Oath.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Okay, lass. We've got these getups on...now what?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Beyond this gate is the first step to becoming a Nightingale.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whoa there, lass. I appreciate the armor, but becoming a Nightingale? That was never discussed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: To hold any hope of defeating Mercer, we must have Nocturnal at our backs. If she is to accept you as one of her own, an arrangement must be struck.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What sort of arrangement? I need to know the terms.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The terms are quite simple, Brynjolf. Nocturnal will allow you to become a Nightingale and use your abilities for whatever you wish. And in return, both in life and death, you must serve as a guardian of the Twilight Sepulcher.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Aye, there's always a catch. But at this point, I suppose there isn't much to lose. If it means the end of Mercer Frey, you can count me in.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What about you? Are you ready to transact the Oath with Nocturnal?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, I'm ready.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good. After I open the gate, please stand on the western circle.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not sure I understand the terms.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: By transacting the Oath with Nocturnal, you're entering into a business deal. You'll be provided all the power and knowledge befitting a Nightingale. You're free to use those powers as you see fit, to further your own goals or the goals of the Thieves Guild.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And in return?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In return, you'll be required to defend the Twilight Sepulcher and everything within when the need arises. More importantly, upon your death, your spirit will be bound to the Twilight Sepulcher as one of its guardians.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's no going back?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Once the Oath has been struck, the terms are binding. Knowing this, are you ready to undergo the ceremony?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In the deepest chamber, each person stands on a floor glyph.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I call upon you, Lady Nocturnal, Queen of Murk and Empress of Shadow. Hear my voice!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nocturnal manifests as a giant ball of energy.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Ah, Karliah. I was wondering when I'd hear from you again. Lose something, did we?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My lady, I come before you to throw myself at your mercy and to accept responsibility for my failure.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're already mine, Karliah. Your terms were struck long ago. What could you possibly offer me now?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have two others that wish to transact the Oath; to serve you both in life and in death.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You surprise me, Karliah. This offer is definitely weighted in my favor.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My appetite for Mercer's demise exceeds my craving for wealth, Your Grace.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Revenge? How interesting... Very well, your conditions are acceptable. You may proceed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lady Nocturnal, we accept your terms. We dedicate ourselves to you as both your avengers and your sentinels. We will honor our agreement in this life and in the next until your conditions have been met.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Very well. I name your initiates Nightingale and I restore your status to the same, Karliah. And in the future, I'd suggest you refrain from disappointing me again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All three people glow with blue energy, then Nocturnal disappears.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Now that you've transacted the Oath, it's time to reveal the final piece of the puzzle to you; Mercer's true crime.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He's done more?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mercer was unable to unlock the Guild's vault without two keys because of what he stole from the Twilight Sepulcher...the Skeleton Key. By doing this, he's compromised our ties to Nocturnal, and in essence, caused our luck to run dry.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So the key unlocks any door?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, yes. But the key isn't only restricted to physical barriers. All of us possess untapped abilities; the potential to wield greater power, securely sealed within our minds. Once you realize the key can access these traits, the potential becomes limitless.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Guild should possess this item.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Although it would benefit the Guild more than you could imagine, in the end, it would do more harm than good.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The three of us could keep it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm afraid that's impossible.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sounds like no one should possess it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good, then you understand why this is about more than Mercer's lust for power. If the Key isn't returned to its lock in the Twilight Sepulcher, things will never be the same for the Guild. As time passed on, our luck would diminish to the point of non-existence. And whether you know it or not, our uncanny luck defines our trade.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: First time I ever set out to return something...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Very true. In our line of work, it's quite rare we set out to return a stolen item to its rightful owner.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's go.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Before we depart, Brynjolf has some business to discuss. I suggest you listen to him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Listen, lad. There's one last piece of business we need to settle before we go after Mercer...the leadership of the Guild.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why tell this to me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Karliah and I had a long discussion before you arrived here. Thanks to your efforts, Mercer's treachery has been exposed. After we deal with him, all that remains is restoring the Guild to its full strength. As a result, we both feel that you have the potential of replacing Mercer as leader of the Thieves Guild.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Me? What about you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've been at this game a long time, my friend. A long time. I've stolen trinkets from nobles and framed priests for murder. I'm good at what I do, maybe even one of the best. But it's all I know. I've never been one to lead. Never desired it, never cared for it. Don't want it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't know what to say.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, we have a bit of an errand to run before your coronation, so don't get sentimental on me now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's about time you asked.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ha! Spoken like the leader of the Thieves Guild. Just don't lose yourself in the role. We have a bit of an errand to run before your coronation.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, it's not right.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look. Everyone in the Guild admires what you've done. Maybe they won't come out and simply tell you, but I promise you it's true. And now they know Mercer never genuinely cared about the Guild. He lacked the loyalty you obviously possess. I can't think of anyone better.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I accept.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then it's decided. When this is all over and Delvin's contacts assure me we've regained our footing in Skyrim, we'll handle the details. Until then, we have quite the task ahead.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then lets get to it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've been pouring over the plans you brought us, and I'm convinced the Eyes of the Falmer are in the dwarven ruins at Irkngthand. Karliah and I will meet you there. Prepare yourself, lad. This will be a fight to remember!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do you think we stand a chance against Mercer?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you would have asked me that yesterday, I'd have said no. But now I think our chances have improved. Look, call me crazy if you like, but I trust Karliah. I don't think she'd lead us down a suicidal path. Besides, I'd rather die with some of Mercers blood on my blade than spend my life regretting that I ran the other way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I guess we're Nightingales now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Aye, and some of what Karliah said is starting to make sense. Mercer may have damaged our reputation and raided our coffers, but this goes well beyond even his twisted form of larceny. Old Delvin kept calling it a curse and we all laughed at him. Looks like the joke's on us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If one talks to Karliah, 2 new options comes up.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I don't feel stronger.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: With the Skeleton Key missing from the Twilight Sepulcher, I'm afraid afraid Mercer's seen to it that none of us can benefit from Nocturnal's gifts.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But she spoke to us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You merely transacted the Oath; signed the unwritten contract with Nocturnal. In order for us to receive our abilities...our end of the bargain, I'm afraid the Key must be returned.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then Nocturnal's angry at us?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If Nocturnal was truly displeased with me...with any of us, she wouldn't have answered my call. I have no doubt that we still hold her favor and I believe it gives us enough of an edge to defeat Mercer Frey.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: May I ever return to Nightingale Hall?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. Now that you're a Nightingale, you may consider this your new home. You'll find that this place offers many things that will help you in your endeavors as well as a wealth of information for you to learn. Once the Skeleton Key has been restored to the Twilight Sepulcher, I'll make this place my home as well.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player reunites with the Nightingales in Irkngthand's Grand Cavern area.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Mercer's been here...I hope we're not too late.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Those bandits back there...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Brynjolf and I found them like that. Mercer's doing. We have to catch up to him before it's too late.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm ready. Let's go.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We should tread carefully. I wouldn't be surprised if he's left behind a few surprises for us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player can have optional convos with the other 'Gales at this point.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Crime is one thing, murder is another. Mercer will answer for this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do you think Mercer knows we're here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The lass seems to think old Mercer is pulling a fast one on us... leading us here and letting the dwarven constructs wear us down. I've learned to trust her lead at this point. After all, we Nightingales need to stick together, eh?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What are the Eyes of the Falmer?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A few years before Mercer murdered Gallus, the Guild took in a thief who specialized in dwarven antiquities. The thief had broken into a nobleman's home somewhere in Windhelm and made off with a small figurine of a snow elf with crystalline eyes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A snow elf?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Aye, that's what the Falmer were known as long ago...before they became the blind monstrositie they are today. When Gallus took one look at this statue, he knew it was something special. He took it right up to Enthir at the College of Winterhold. Didn't take long for Enthir to find a book in the college's library that told of Irkngthand and a great statue with gemmed eyes within.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So the Eyes of the Falmer are gems?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not just ordinary gems. They're said to be flawlessly cut and as big as a man's head. Can you imagine how much they're worth? Gallus and Mercer spent the better part of a month infiltrating Irkngthand, but the dwarves had protected the place far too well. There were just too many obstacles blocking the way. The plans were shelved and the rest is history.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If Mercer leaves here with the Eyes, we'll never see him again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do you think Mercer knows we're here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mercer's been careful so far. I don't think he'd just leave those plans behind unless he had his reasons. For someone in possession of the Skeleton Key, stealing the Eyes of the Falmer would be child's play. No, he means to ambush us down here, I'm almost certain of it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Both of you wait here a moment.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Alright, but don't wander ahead too far or else we'll be forced to come find you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's go.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lead on, we're ready. Keep as quiet as you can. The Falmer are blind but they can still hear us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A ways ahead, through a massive barricade, they spy something creeping behind Falmer, killing them. It soon runs out of sight.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Wait a moment...what's that? It's Mercer! Look...down there!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm on it, lass. Damn it! There's no way through.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He's toying with us. He wants us to follow.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Aye, lass...and we'll be ready for him. Let's keep moving.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They continue a tour of the massive caverns.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Look at the size of this place. Have you ever seen anything like it in your life, lass?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Can't say that I have. Imagine the riches hidden within these walls.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Nightingales find a debris-strewn room.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Looks like we can take the low road or the high road across this chamber. Your choice.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They reach the other side after hearing a rumbling.
label: ACTION

dialogue: So this is what we heard. The entire tower collapsed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The only reason to do that would be to block pursuit. It must be Mercer. We'll have to find another way around.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They find a chamber with Falmer and a large dwarven construct.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Shor' bones! Look at that monstrosity.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's a Dwarven Centurion. Very tough and very deadly.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We can take the beast on or sneak around. It's your call, lad. We're right behind you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Further on...
label: ACTION

dialogue: This is where we saw Mercer. We must be getting close.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Everyone heads into the next section, killing more Falmer by torture devices.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Even the Falmer don't deserve the pain these implements must have inflicted. The dwarves were a cruel race.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In the next cavern:
label: ACTION

dialogue: There's a mass of the Falmer in this chamber. We can sneak through or take them down...I don't care. As long as we get to Mercer.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In the shoddy tunnel beyond:
label: ACTION

dialogue: I can hear water rushing through these pipes. We must be beneath a lake.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: At the final door...
label: ACTION

dialogue: He's close. I'm certain of it. We must prepare ourselves.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then this is it. We do this for Gallus and for the Guild.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They all enter the deepest chamber, where Mercer is trying to pry the gemmed eyes out of a massive Falmer statue.
label: ACTION

dialogue: He's here and he hasn't seen us yet. Brynjolf, watch the door.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Aye, lass. Nothing's getting by me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Climb down that ledge and see if you can--
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Karliah, when will you learn you can't get the drop on me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He activates something, crumbling the ledge they're standing on.
label: ACTION

dialogue: When Brynjolf brought you before me, I could feel a sudden shift in the wind. And at that moment, I knew it would end with one of us at the end of a blade.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Give me the Key, Mercer.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's Karliah been filling your head with? Tales of thieves with honor? Oaths rife with falsehoods and broken promises? Nocturnal doesn't care about you, the Key or anything having to do with the Guild.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't believe you. Nocturnal guides me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then it appears the shadows shroud more than your presence...they blind your wisdom as well. Our actions have always been one and the same; both of us lie, cheat and steal to further our own end.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's not about Nocturnal. This is personal.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Revenge is it? Have you learned nothing from your time with us? When will you open your eyes and realize how little my actions differ from yours? Both of us life, cheat and steal to further our own end.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: To blazes with Nocturnal. I'm here for the Eyes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wait a moment...do I detect a hint of genuine avarice from this noble thief? Perhaps Karliah and Brynjolf misjudged you and your true nature is no different than my own.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The difference is I still have honor.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's clear you'll never see the Skeleton Key as I do...as an instrument of limitless wealth. Instead you've chosen to fall over your own foolish code.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If anyone falls, it will be you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then the die is cast, and once again my blade will taste Nightingale blood! Karliah, I'll deal with you after I deal with your irksome companions. In the meantime, perhaps you and Brynjolf should get better acquainted.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mercer uses his powers to control Brynjolf, making him fight Karliah. They both start parrying each others attacks.
label: ACTION

dialogue: What...what's happening... I can't stop myself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fight it, Brynjolf...he's taken control of you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm sorry, lass, I...I can't...!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Damn you, Mercer!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Enough of this! Fight me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player is left to fight Mercer alone, eventually dealing a coup de grace.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Shadows take me...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: With his spell over, the other Nightingales quit fighting and try the door.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Damn! This place is coming down! Quick, get the Skeleton Key and the Eye and lets get out of here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No luck there, lass. Something must have fallen on the other side of the door because it isn't moving!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We have to find another way out of here before the place fills with water!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The water rapidly rises. At the last moment, part of the ceiling collapses, take a breather in Bronze Water Cave
label: ACTION

dialogue: I can't believe it's over. After twenty-five years in exile and just like that, it's done. All that remains is to ensure the safe return of the Skeleton Key.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sounds like it will be a simple task.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm afraid it's not that simple. When the Skeleton Key was stolen from the Twilight Sepulcher, our access to the inner sanctum was removed. The only way to bring it back will be through the Pilgrim's Path.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I take it you never used the Pilgrim's Path.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It wasn't created for the Nightingales. It was created to test those who wished to serve Nocturnal in other ways. As a consequence, I have no knowledge of what you'll be facing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then we'd best get started.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Brynjolf is needed back at the Thieves Guild to keep order while you're away. And I...I can't bear to face Nocturnal after my failure to protect the Key. I'm afraid you'll have to face the end of your journey alone.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't worry. I'll return the Key.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Take this with you. I'm not certain if it will help within the walls of the Sepulcher, but I certainly don't need it as much as you. I've had this bow almost my entire life, and it's never let me down. I hope it brings you the same luck.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't understand why you won't come with me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've been a Nightingale for a very long time. I sold my allegiance to Nocturnal in exchange for many profitable years of thieving. Falling in love with Gallus was wrong. It was a distraction that allowed the Sepulcher to be desecrated and it likely cost him his life. Until the Key is returned, I will never set foot inside that place again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's the story with the Pilgrim's Path?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Even though Nocturnal doesn't desire worship in the traditional sense, the Twilight Sepulcher propagated a small group of priests. Of course, they'd never come into direct contact with Nocturnal but they insisted they had her favor. As part of their "duties," the priests created all sorts of baseless rituals and ceremonies, all on Nocturnal's behalf.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This didn't interfere with the Nightingales?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: These priests weren't threat to the Skeleton Key or the conduit to Nocturnal's realm, so they were tolerated. One of the ceremonies involved the Pilgrim's Path, a so-called "test of worthiness". If a pilgrim was able to complete the path, it was said they would live forever in twilight. What that means is anyone's guess.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me about the conduit inside the Sepulcher.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The conduit to Nocturnal's realm, the realm of Evergloam, has been in Skyrim...well, longer than recorded history. The Twilight Sepulcher was constructed around it by man and mer in order to shield it from those who would exploit its power. It's through this conduit that we're given Nocturnal's greatest gift, our luck. What she gains in return is a complete mystery.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player journeys to the Sepulcher, tucked away in a corner of Falkreath. A single ghostly sentinel guards the temple steps.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I didn't recognize you, but I sense you are one of us. Who are you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'd ask the same question of you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The last of the Nightingale Sentinels, I'm afraid. I've defended the Sepulcher alone for what seems like an eternity.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The last? What happened to the rest?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We were betrayed by one of our own kind. In fact, I'm to blame for what's happened here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How are you to blame?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I was blinded. Blinded by dark treachery masquerading as friendship. Perhaps if I had been more vigilant, then Mercer Frey wouldn't have lured me to my fate and stolen the Skeleton Key.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wait a moment... You're Gallus!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I haven't heard that name in a long time. How do you know of me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have the Key.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Key! You have the Skeleton Key! I never thought I'd see it again. And Mercer Frey?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Dead.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then...it's over and my death wasn't in vain. I owe you a great deal, Nightingale.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I did this for Nocturnal.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's quite a noble sentiment for someone in our...well, in your line of work.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I did this to honor the Guild.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've done the Guild a great deed. And although they may not show it, I'm certain they appreciate your sacrifices.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I did this to get rich.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Were I able to provide it, I'd shower you in wealth for what you've done. My only regret is that you had to undertake this task alone.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Karliah helped me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Karliah...she's still alive? I feared she'd befallen the same fate, ending up a victim of Mercer's betrayal.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then take the Key and right all the wrongs.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nothing would bring me more pride than to return the Key, but I'm afraid it's impossible. From the moment I arrived here, I've felt myself...well...dying.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How can a spirit die?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Sepulcher isn't merely a temple or a vault to house the Key. Within these walls is the Ebonmere...a conduit to Nocturnal's realm of Evergloam. When Mercer stole the key, that conduit closed, severely limiting our ties to her.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then I'll have to proceed alone.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm afraid so. I'm weakening, and I can feel myself slipping away. The years without restoration of my power have taken their toll. Whatever damage has been caused can only be corrected by following the Pilgrim's Path to the Ebonmere and replacing the Key.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How does the Ebonmere affect all of us?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Ebonmere is a conduit through which Nocturnal influences our world. Not through magic or blessings, but purely through luck.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Luck is meaningless. What we do involves skill.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, absolutely. Your skill is your own...don't let anyone ever tell you otherwise. But Nocturnal, she influences our luck; nearly imperceptible assistance we get when we ply our trade.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How's that changing the way things are?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Think about the Guild...about the state it was in when you began. Think about all the little things you might have heard. A pick breaking when it shouldn't have, the clouds in the nighttime sky clearing at the wrong moment... Our access to those bits of luck are what separates us from common bandits.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So with the Ebonmere closed, our luck's run dry?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Precisely. There are still a few who call Nocturnal "Lady Luck" and for good reason.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What will I face in the Pilgrim's Path?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I wish I could help you, but I've been a prisoner in this very chamber for the last quarter century. The only possible help I've come across are the remains of some poor fellow who was trying to follow in your footsteps. Perhaps his journal can help?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's wrong with the other Nightingale Sentinels?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: With the Ebonmere closed, and the sudden severance from the realm of Evergloam, I fear they've undergone a drastic change. They're shadows of their former selves. They no longer remember their true purpose or their original identities.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why aren't you like them?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My spirit didn't manifest itself in the Sepulcher immediately, so fortunately I wasn't present when the Ebonmere was sealed. However, ever since that day, I've felt my power waning...slowly draining away.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Can't you just take the Key?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whatever is affecting the Nightingale Sentinels is starting to affect me too. As I get closer to the Ebonmere I begin to feel myself slipping away. Even right this moment, I feel strange...when I don't think I should be feeling anything at all. Good luck, Nightingale.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player proceeds down the Pilgrim's Path, eventually ending up in a pit. opens it, summoning Nocturnal to the realm.
label: ACTION

dialogue: My, my. What do we have here? It's been a number of years since I've stepped foot on your world. Or perhaps it's been moments. One tends to lose track. So...once again the Key has been stolen and a "champion" returns it to the Sepulcher. Now that Ebonmere has been restored, you stand before me awaiting your accolades; a pat on the head...a kiss on your cheek. What you fail to realize is your actions were expected and represent nothing more than the fulfillment of your agreement. Don't mistake my tone for displeasure, after all, you've obediently performed your duties to the letter. But we both know this has little to do with honor and oaths and loyalty. It's about the reward; the prize. Fear not. You'll have your trinkets, your desire for power, your hunger for wealth. I bid you to drink deeply from the Ebonmere, mortal. For this is where the Agent of Nocturnal is born. The Oath has been struck, the die has been cast and your fate awaits you in the Evergloam. Farewell, Nightingale. See to it the Key stays this time, won't you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nocturnal disappears. The player goes over to Karliah.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I'm glad you were able to bring the Key back safely. Nocturnal seemed quite pleased with your efforts.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Pleased? She sounded indifferent.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I wouldn't take that to heart. It's her way. Think of her as a scolding mother continually pushing you harder to be successful; outwardly sounding angry but silently content. I assure you, had she been displeased with you, we wouldn't be having this conversation.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's thi about becoming an Agent of Nocturnal?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The circles at the base of the Ebonmere imbue you with powers befitting a Nightingale Agent. The crescent moon represents the Agent of Shadow, the half moon for the Agent of Subterfuge and the full moon for the Agent of Strife.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why can't I be all three?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This is Nocturnal's way of maintaining balance. If you ever feel the need to change your abilities, you can return to the Sepulcher and step onto a different circle. Be warned that once you've chosen, you can't reselect for at least a day.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So what now?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now, your life as a Nightingale begins. Should the need arise, you'll be summoned to the Sepulcher in order to defend it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Guild has welcomed me back with open arms. I feel like a void in my life has finally been filled. I only hope this isn't an ending to things, but actually the beginning.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The beginning of what?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why, perhaps the greatest crime spree Skyrim's ever known. There are pockets brimming with coin and coffers overflowing with riches ripe for the picking. We may be Nightingales, but in our hearts we're still thieves and we're damn good at what we do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me about the Agent of Stealth.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Agent of Stealth is the master of remaining unseen. They are able to manipulate the darkness and use it to their advantage. On moonlit nights or in darkneed rooms, this agent literally becomes invisible.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me about the Agent of Strife.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This Agent of Strife can send forth a tendril of pure darkness into the heart of another, causing great injury to them. At the same time, this tether will bolster the agent's own life force, making him stronger.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me about the Agent of Subterfuge.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Agent of Subterfuge utilizes shadow to cloud the judgment of those around him. By weaving the darkness to their will, this Agent can manipulate others into fighting for the Nightingale for a limited time. Choose your path and your journey will be complete.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player picks a power. At that moment, Gallus returns to the Ebonmere.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Karliah?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Gallus! I feared I would never see you again. I was afraid you'd become like the others.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If it were not for the actions of this Nightingale, your fears would have come true. He honors us all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What will you do now, my love?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nocturnal calls me to the Evergloam. My contract has been fulfilled.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Will I ever see you again?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: When your debt to Nocturnal has been paid, we'll embrace once again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Farewell, Gallus. Eyes open...walk with the shadows.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Goodbye, Karliah.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Optionally, the player can ask more questions of Karliah now.
label: ACTION

dialogue: How will I know if I'm needed here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If this place is in danger ever again, the shadows will call. Should the need arise, a portal connects the Sepulcher and Nightingale Hall. Use it whenever you wish.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Where will you be from now on?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've decided to make my home at Nightingale Hall. Since it's your home as well, I hope to see you and Brynjolf there. Of course, I may visit some of Skyrim's cities to "acquire" things from time to time. Can't afford to get rusty now, can we?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Where did Gallus go?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Gallus's oath has been paid. His actions have satisfied the terms. Now his spirit becomes one with the Evergloam...the realm of perpetual twilight and the cradle of shadow.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, he's gone?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, not gone...he's become one with the shadows. This is the greatest honor a Nightingale can hope to achieve. In death, he's become part of that which we use to live.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They're a part of the darkness around us?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Absolutely. When we say "walk with the shadows," we are asking those Nightingales who have passed on to protect us. It's believed that they are literally what guides our uncanny luck...by placing their hands in ours. That's why the Ebonmere needed to be reopened. Without it, there's no way Nocturnal was able to allow them through.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player returns to the Guild.
label: ACTION

dialogue: It's good to see you in one piece, lad! I just wanted to give you a proper thank you for everything you've done. The Guild is back on its feet again and on its way to a prosperous future. What's become of the Skeleton Key?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's been returned to the Sepulcher.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's it then. After all of those years helplessly watching the Guild decline. But enough of that...I'm confident that with you in charge, we'll soon have more gold than we could possibly spend.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, where will you be now?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll be down here, trying to coordinate everything with Delvin and Vex; to make sure the coin keeps flowing...and no one skims! If you still feel like doing some jobs, I'm sure Delvin and Vex have more than their fair share to give out. Either way, it's been a pleasure, my friend. Here's to the future of the Guild. May it last another thousand years!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After the speech, if the Guild is reestablished in all major cities, one is directed to talk to Bryn about becoming the outfit's new leader.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Well, my friend...the time's come to make it official. It's time to become our Guild Master. Don't worry, I promise this will be short and sweet. If you'll just meet us in the center of the cistern room, we can begin.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Karliah, Delvin, Vex and the others gather round for the "coronation".
label: ACTION

dialogue: Look, I've never been good at these things, so I'm just going to keep it short. Being Guild Master means more than just getting a cut of all the loot, it's about being a leader and keeping this rabble in order. With that in mind, I propose that the position of Guild Master should be yours. Delvin?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Agreed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Vex?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sure, why not...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Karliah?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Absolutely.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Everyone is in agreement, so all I can do now is name you Guild Master and wish you good fortune and long life. Now everyone, get back to work.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This officially ends the questline. Most guildies will remark on the player's given a line relating to it afterwards.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You need anything, anything at all...don't hesitate to ask.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So now the pupil is the master, eh? Good show!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I suppose you deserve it. Couldn't do any worse than Mercer anyway.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can't think of a better person for the job, Nightingale.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I suppose congratulations are in order. Now don't screw it up.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Here's to a long and prosperous future...may the Guild last another hundred years.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am at your service.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As long as you continue to make us all rich, I'm behind you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, now that you're Guild Master, how about drinks for all of us!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, looks like you're running the show now. Good luck.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We're all rich thanks to you. Cheers!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Glad to see they picked the right person for the job.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I promise to live up to your expectations.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I haven't seen so much celebrating in years. Mercer's dead, we have a new Guild Master and things are finally looking up. Business is booming, coin is flowing and everyone seems content as things keep going our way. A new chapter in the Thieves Guild is being written this day and we all owe it to you. Many thanks.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If the player asks Karliah about her new dialogue options...
label: ACTION

dialogue: About the secrecy of the Nightingales...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think by now, most within the Guild are well aware of what transpired between Mercer Frey and ourselves. The notion that the Nightingales are a fictive group has long since passed. If you wish to wear your Nightingale Armor within the Guild, I'm certain that no one would give it a second thought.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How have things been now that Mercer's gone?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm feeling a sense of inner peace...something I haven't felt in a very long time. Instead of being clouded with thoughts of revenge and retribution, I feel only serenity and fulfillment. Of course, I've been also dabbling in my old pastimes as well. Take a look around, and feel free to share the fruits of my labor.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If the player asks Brynjolf about his new dialogue options...
label: ACTION

dialogue: So that's it? There's nothing else to it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, that's it. Sorry if it isn't the ceremony you were hoping for, but we're not exactly known for throwing our coin around. After we're done here, head over to Tonilia and she'll set you up with your Guild Master Armor. Oh, and one last thing. Here, I want you to take this. It's sort of a tradition around here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How's the Guild doing?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Take a good look around you! Have you ever seen the Guild in such a prosperous state? With Mercer Frey gone and our influence spreading across Skyrim, the Guild's earned a new level of respect it hasn't seen in decades. I couldn't be more proud to be part of the Thieves Guild, or its new Guild Master.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: On one's travels, the player finds an orc slaying a vampire.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You there. The Dawnguard is looking for anyone willing to fight against the growing vampire menace. What do you say?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's the Dawnguard?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We're vampire hunters. We search out and destroy those bloodsucking scum wherever we find them.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I haven't noticed any vampire menace.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're not paying attention then. Like most everyone else around here. Haven't you heard that the Hall of the Vigilants was destroyed by vampires? They never took the threat seriously, and now they've paid the price.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Vigilants? Dawnguard? What are you talking about?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Vigilants mostly hunt down daedra worshippers, which is why they got torn to pieces when they went up against vampires. That's why our leader Isran is reestablishing the Dawnguard. Real, serious vampire hunters.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Killing vampires? Where do I sign up?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ha. Isran's going to like you. He's up the hill in the fort. He'll decide if you're Dawnguard material.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sorry, I'm not interested.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's what everybody says, right up until they find their throat being ripped out by a pack of hungry vampires. If you change your mind and decide to join fight before it's too late, go talk to Isran up at the fort.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player seeks out Fort Dawnguard via a canyon passage east of Riften. A scrawny man is alongside the road nearby.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Oh, hey there! You here to join the Dawnguard, too? Truth is, I'm a little nervous. I've never done anything like this before. I hope you don't mind if I walk up with you. Hey, uh, don't tell Isran I was afraid to meet him by himself. Not the best first impression for a new vampire hunter, I guess. You've probably killed lots of vampires, huh? I'm sure Isran will sign you right up. Not sure he'll take me. I hope so. That must be it. Fort Dawnguard... Wow. Bigger than I expected.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They come upon a mammoth fortification, bigger than the Palace of the Kings or even Dragonsreach.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Where is everybody? This place looks almost deserted.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They come up to the main gate's steps.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I guess this is it. Wish me luck.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: New recruits? Hmm. Isran will decide if you've got what it takes. Go on, he's right inside.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They enter the vestibule to find Isran arguing with Vigilant Tolan.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Why are you here, Tolan? The Vigilants and I were finished with each other a long time ago.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know why I'm here. The Vigilants are under attack everywhere. The vampires are much more dangerous than we believed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And now you want to come running to safety with the Dawnguard, is that it? I remember Keeper Carcette telling me repeatedly that Fort Dawnguard is a crumbling ruin, not worth the expense and manpower to repair. And now that you've stirred up the vampires against you, you come begging for my protection?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Isran, Carcette is dead. The Hall of the Vigilants...everyone...they're all dead. You were right, we were wrong. Isn't that enough for you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, well...I never wanted any of this to happen. I tried to warn all of you... I am sorry, you know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He notices the player's presence.
label: ACTION

dialogue: So who are you? What do you want?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm here to join the Dawnguard.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Got a fire in your belly to kill vampires, eh? Good for you. But look around -- there's really not much to join yet. I've only just started rebuilding the order.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I heard you were looking for vampire hunters.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You heard right. I'm glad word's finally starting to get around. But that means it won't be long before the vampires start to take notice as well.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I was just looking around. What is this place?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why do I even post guards? This is the headquarters of the Dawnguard. Well, it used to be, a long time ago. As you can see, we have some work to do to restore it to its former glory. But maybe you want to help me with that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What can I do to help?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I need someone out in the field, taking the fight to the damn vampires, while we're getting the fort back in shape... Tolan was telling me about some cave that the Vigilants were poking around in. Seemed to think it was more related to these recent vampire attacks.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's the Dawnguard?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We hunt down and kill vampires. Haven't you been paying attention? In the old days, the Dawnguard kept all of Skyrim safe from those bloodsucking scum. Then people stopped taking the threat seriously, the Dawnguard was disbanded, and the vampires came creeping back. Now I'm trying to reestablish the Dawnguard. Take the fight to the vampires for a change. I hope it isn't too late.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll have to think about it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: While you're thinking about it, the vampires will be gathering strength in the shadows, waiting to strike.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player joins up.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Tolan, tell him about, what was it, Dimhollow?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, that's it. Dimhollow Crypt. Brother Adalvald was sure it held some long-lost vampire artifact of some kind. We didn't listen to him any more than we did Isran. He was at the Hall when it was attacked...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's good enough for me. Go see what the vampires were looking for in this Dimhollow Crypt. With any luck, they'll still be there. Here, you should take a crossbow. Good for taking out those fiends before they get close. Feel free to poke around the fort and take what you need. There isn't much yet, but you're welcome to anything you can use.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll meet you at Dimhollow. It's the least I can do to avenge my fallen comrades.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tolan, I don't think that's a good idea. You Vigilants were never trained for...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know what you think of us. You think we're soft, that we're cowards. You think our deaths proved our weakness. Stendarr grant that you do not have to face the same test and be found wanting. I'm going to Dimhollow Crypt. Perhaps I can be of some small assistance to you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He notices Agmaer nearby.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You there, boy. Stop skulking in the shadows and step up here. What's your name?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm, uh...my name is Agmaer, sir.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do I look like a "sir" to you, boy? I'm not a soldier, and you're not joining the army.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, si...Isran.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Didn't I tell you to step forward? Hmm... Farm boy, eh? What's your weapon?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Uh, my weapon? I mostly just use my pa's axe, when wolves are attacking the goats or soemthing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: "My pa's axe," Stendarr preserve us. Don't worry, I think we can make a Dawnguard out of you. Here, take this crossbow and let's see how you shoot.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Uh, crossbow? I've never...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, a crossbow. Best thing for killing vampires. Just take a few shots at those crates over there. Take a deep breath and let it out as you fire. You need to concentrate, boy. Try it again. You'll get the hang of it. That's it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They exit the castle.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Isran found something for you to do, eh? I thought he'd like you. Good luck!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player travels to the crypt, cut into the mountain slope near Dawnstar. Inside, one can hear vampires discussing something.
label: ACTION

dialogue: These Vigilants never know when to give up. I thought we'd taught them enough of a lesson at their hall.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: To come in here alone...a fool like all the rest of them.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He fought well enough though. Jeron and Bresoth were no match for him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ha. Those two deserved what they got. Their arrogance had become insufferable.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All this talk is making me thirsty. Perhaps another Vigilant will wander in soon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I wish Lokil would hurry it up. I have half a mind to return to the castle and tell Harkon what a fool he's entrusted this mission to.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And I have half a mind to tell Lokil of your disloyalty.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You wouldn't dare. Now shut up and keep on watch.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After slaying the fiends, one finds that Tolan, who had arrived first, was watery chamber where a kidnapped Vigilant is being interrogated by Lokil.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I'll never tell you anything. My oath to Stendarr is stronger than any suffering you can inflict on me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I believe you, Vigilant. And I don't think you even know what you've found here. So go and meet your beloved Stendarr.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He cuts down the hostage.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Are you sure that was wise, Lokil? He still might have told us something. We haven't gotten anywhere ourselves with...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He knew nothing. He served his purpose by leading us to this place. Now it is up to us to bring Harkon the prize. And we will not return without it. Vingalmo and Orthjolf will make way for me after this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, of course Lokil. Do not forget who brought you news of the Vigilants' discovery.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I never forget who my friends are. Or my enemies.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He soon forgets everything, as the player kills all the evil vampires. Using solved, revealing...a cute girl inside a coffin-like chamber?!
label: ACTION

dialogue: Unh...where is...who sent you here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who were you expecting?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I was expecting someone...like me, at least.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I was expecting someone from my family. I don't recognize you. Are you one of my father's little acolytes?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who's your father?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He's a very powerful man. Or he was at one point. I'm surprised another vampire hasn't heard of him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, a group called the "Dawnguard" sent me here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's not a name I know. And it doesn't sound like a name a group of vampires would choose.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A man named Isran.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I...I don't know who that is. Is he...like me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's not your concern.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think it is, actually. Why would someone who isn't...like me...come all the way down here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do you mean, "like you"?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A...can't you tell just from looking at me? A vampire.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Are you a...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Vampire, yes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How did you know I was a vampire?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You think I can't tell my own kind? I smelled you almost before my eyes were open.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're a vampire?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Can't you tell your own kind? I smelled you almost before my eyes were open.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Dawnguard would want me to kill you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not fond of vampires, are they? Well look. Kill me, you've killed one vampire. But if people are after me, there's something bigger going on. I can help you find out what that is.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't think that'll keep them from turning on you eventually. They'll figure out what you are.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why were you locked away like this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's...complicated. And I'm not totally sure if I can trust you. But if you want to know the whole story, help me get back to my family's home.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Where do you need to go?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As long as you don't get in my way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I was going to say the same thing to you. My family used to live on an island to the west of Solitude. I would guess they still do. By the way...my name is Serana. Good to meet you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One can inquire further about her circumstances.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Any idea how to get out of here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your guess is as good as mine. This place looks pretty different from when I was locked away.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is that an Elder Scroll?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, it is, and it's mine.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why do you have an Elder Scroll?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's...complicated. I can't really talk about it. I'm sorry.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is it fragile? Do we need to be careful with it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ha. Nothing can destroy an Elder Scroll. Worry more about protecting your hide, and let me worry about my things.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How long were you in there?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good question. Hard to say. I...I can't really tell. I feel like it was a long time. Who is Skyrim's High King?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's actually a matter for debate.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, wonderful. A war of succession. Good to know the world didn't get boring while I was gone. Who are the contenders?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ulfric Stormcloak is the true High King.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've...never heard of him. Is he well supported?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Elisif of Solitude will be High Queen.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't know that name. You say she's Jarl of Solitude? Who supports her?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Empire supports Elisif, but there are many in Skyrim loyal to Ulfric.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Empire? What...what empire?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The...Empire. From Cyrodiil.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Cyrodiil is the seat of an empire? I must have been gone longer than I thought. Definitely longer than we planned. Please, let's hurry. I need to get home so I can figure out what's happened.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why were you locked away?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'd...rather not get into that with you. If that's all right. I'm sorry, it's not that...it's just that I don't know who I can trust just yet. Let's get to my home, and I'll have a better sense of where we all stand.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me about your home.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's on an island near Solitude. Hopefully we can find a boat to take us there. It's my family home. Not the most welcoming place, but depending on who's around, I'll be safe there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why wouldn't you be safe there?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's just say that my mother and father had a bit of a falling out. Don't worry, I'm not in any danger or anything like that. It'll just be more unpleasant to run into my father.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Someone you don't want to see?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My father and I don't really get along. Ugh, saying it out loud makes it sound so...common. "Little girl who doesn't get along with her father." Read that story a hundred times.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wait here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll hang back a bit, but you're not leaving me behind. This is too important.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sorry, I'm not that easy to get rid of. If you want to run ahead, I won't stop you, but I'll be following.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you think I'm going to let you have all the fun, you're crazy. I'll let you lead ahead, but I'll be keeping an eye on you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come with me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's go.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thought you'd never ask.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whenever you're ready.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I need to trade some things with you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hands to yourself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not going to happen.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why don't you keep your things, and I'll keep mine.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think we should part ways.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I disagree.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You can't get rid of me that easily.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And go where? You can't just leave me alone whenever you feel like it. I'm coming with you, like it or not.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Discussion over, it's time to find the exit.
label: ACTION

dialogue: This feels like the right way. I was starting to worry. Does the air feel...heavy down here? I'm a little woozy, but it might just be from waking up.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They finally escape the musty cavern.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Ah, it's so good to breathe again! Even in this weather, it's better than the cave.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If one travels to Fort Dawnguard before doing anything else...
label: ACTION

dialogue: I don't like the feel of this place. I'll wait for you back by the entrance.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If one talk with Isran before continuing on with Serana...
label: ACTION

dialogue: So, any luck? Was Tolan right about the vampires being interested in Dimhollow Crypt?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, the place was crawling with vampires.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good. I assume you took care of that little infestation. Did you figure out what they were looking for in there?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tolan was right. And he's dead. The vampires killed him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Damn fool. I told him not to go. The Vigilants always had more bravery than sense. Did you at least find out what the vampires were looking for in there?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It seems they were looking for a woman who was sealed in the crypt.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That doesn't make much sense. Where is this woman? Who is she?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't know who she is. She says she lives in a castle near Solitude.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (skip to "Well I don't know...")
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She didn't want to follow me here. But she wants me to take her home.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Home? Where's that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She says she lives in a castle near Solitude.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well I don't know what that means. But we need to find out. She must either have something the vampires want, or be someone important to them.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm pretty sure she's a vampire, actually.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That would fit with the rest of it... I don't like it, but you did right to play along. We need to find out what this is all about. I won't lie -- if this were any other situation, I'd put her down just on the chance she might be a vampire. But this is something different. I'd say do what she wants. Take her home, and see who else is in this castle.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: On the NW coast of Skyrim, they find a small dock. An island castle looms on the northern horizon.
label: ACTION

dialogue: That's it, out there to the north. We used to keep a boat around here to get there and back.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: With the boat in working order, they row to Castle Volkihar.
label: ACTION

dialogue: So this is your home?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This is it. Home sweet...castle.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why didn't you tell me it was so huge?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I didn't want you to think I was one of those...you know, the women who just sit in their castle all day? I don't know. Coming from a place like this, well...it's not really me. I hope you can believe that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's impressive.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's something all right.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They approach the locked front gate.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Hey, so...before we go in there...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I wanted to thank you for getting me this far. But after we get in there, I'm going to go my own way for a while. I think... I know your friends would probably want to kill everything in there. I'm hoping you can show some more control than that. Once we're inside, just keep quiet for a bit. Let me take the lead.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Are you all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think so. And thanks for asking. (repeats "I wanted to thank...")
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is it now?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fine, don't worry about it. When we get in, you won't have to babysit about me any more.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lady Serana's back! Open the gate!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They enter the vampire clan's keep. A gruesome feast is going on.
label: ACTION

dialogue: How dare you trespass here! Wait...Serana? Is that truly you? I cannot believe my eyes! My lord! Everyone! Serana has returned!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I guess I'm expected
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can't believe it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They go down to the dining room.
label: ACTION

dialogue: My long-lost daughter returns at last. I trust you have my Elder Scroll?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After all these years, that's the first thing you ask me? Yes, I have the scroll.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course I'm delighted to see you, my daughter. Must I really say the words aloud? Ah, if only your traitor mother were here, I would let her watch this reunion before putting her head on a spike. Now tell me, who is this stranger you have brought into our hall?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This is my savior, the one who freed me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: For my daughter's safe return, you have my gratitude. Tell me, what is your name?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm (name). Who are you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You first.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Very well. I am Harkon, lord of this court. By now, my daughter will have told you what we are.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're vampires.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not just vampires. We are among the oldest and most powerful vampires in Skyrim.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're a reclusive cannibal cult.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not quite, though I can see how an outsider might arrive at that conclusion. No, we are vampires, among the oldest and most powerful in Skyrim.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't really care what you are.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Perhaps you should. I count some of the oldest and most powerful vampires in Skyrim among the members of my court. For centuries we lived here, far from the cares of the world. All that ended when my wife betrayed me and stole away that which I valued most.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do I get a reward for finding your daughter?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I was about to suggest that very thing. Yes, you most certainly deserve a reward.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What happens now?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have done me a great service, and now you must be rewarded. There is but one gift I can give that is equal in value to the Elder Scroll and my daughter. I offer you my blood. Take it, and you will walk as a lion among sheep. Men will tremble at your approach, and you will never fear death again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And if I refuse your gift?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then you will be prey, like all mortals. I will spare your life this once, but you will be banished from this hall.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm already a vampire. What more can you offer me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You contracted a disease, perhaps, but you are no true vampire. Accept my gift and I promise that you will learn the difference. Refuse me, and I will banish you from this castle. I will spare your life this once, but after that, you are prey.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm a werewolf. What will happen if I accept your gift?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, I can smell it on you. The power of my blood will purge that filth and make you whole again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And if I want to remain a werewolf?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I will banish you from this castle. I will spare your life this once, but after that, you are prey. Perhaps you still need convincing? Behold the power!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He morphs into a demonic-looking vampire.
label: ACTION

dialogue: This is the power that I offer! Now, make your choice!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I will accept your gift and become a vampire.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Be still!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't want to become a vampire. I refuse your gift.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So be it! You are prey, like all mortals. I banish you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If the player accepts, Harkon bites the player's neck and is lead to a back room with a blood fountain in it.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Awake at last, good. The power is growing within you, and now you must learn to wield it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm ready to learn about my new powers.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: With my guidance you will become a deadly instrument, striking terror into the hearts of mortals wherever you tread. Now, listen to my words and do as I instruct. The true power of the ancient blood is found in the form of the Vampire Lord. Assume the mantle of the Vampire Lord, and we will continue.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What happened? How did I get here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My blood is potent. At first, the body is overwhelmed by it. After my bite, you collapsed and felt into a slumber. Now your flesh has acclimated to the new blood that courses through your veins. I assure you, no harm was done. In truth, your strength surprises me. Not all mortals can withstand my embrace.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is this place?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A shrine to Molag Bal, the mighty Daedra Prince who is father to all our kind. Our power is a blessing from him. It is he who first bestowed the power of the ancient blood upon me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You made a pact with Molag Bal?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In an age long forgotten to history, I ruled as a mighty king. My domain was vast, my riches endless and my power infinite. And yet, as my mortal life neared an end, I faced a seemingly invincible enemy -- my own mortality. I pledged myself to Molag Bal, and in his name I sacrificed a thousand innocents. In reward, he gave everlasting life to myself, my wife and my daughter. And so I have defeated mortality itself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player shapeshifts into the Vamp Lord.
label: ACTION

dialogue: In this form, you can drain the life from your foes with your right hand. With your left hand, you can wield the power of blood magic to raise the dead. You can also call upon the powers of night to turn into a swarm of bats and reappear some distance away. Should you run out of magicka, you can descend to the ground and fight as the beasts do. Do so now and we will continue.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player stops floating.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Good. You are weaker while on the ground, because you cannot access the blood magic. However, the night powers are still yours to command, and your claws are still formidable weapons. Over time, your powers will grow in strength and you will find new ways to use your gifts. There is much to learn, but if you master the powers of the Vampire Lord, few enemies will be able to stand against you. There is one last thing you must know. Slaying mortal men with your life drain grants you new night powers and blood magic. I keep a stable of thralls in the castle should you need to feed like the baser vampires to stave off the sun. That is all I have to teach you. If you wish to be reminded of these lessons, you need only ask. I have a task that will test your new powers, but first, do you have any questions?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm ready to carry out this task.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good. Go and speak to Garan Marethi. Tell him it is time. He will understand.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What must I know about being a vampire?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As a vampire, you will gain new powers, but also a weakness to sunlight. With each passing day that you do not feed, that weakness will become more deadly, but your powers will also become stronger. Feed upon those who are sleeping, and your vulnerability to sunlight will diminish along with your powers.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me again about being a Vampire Lord.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: When you first transform into a Vampire Lord, you will hover in the air. While you do, you will command the powers of Blood and Night. Descend to the ground, and you can attack with your claws and feed upon your prey to regain your strength. With experience, your powers will grow and you will discover new ways to use them.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If one refuses Harkon's gift, the come to outside. With nothing left to do, their doorstep.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Look at this. I should have known it was only a matter of time before they found us. It's the price we pay for openly recruiting. We'll have to step up our defenses. I don't suppose you have some good news for me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not exactly.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Damn. Well what do you know?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have news, but I wouldn't call it good.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course. Why did I suppose differently. Fine, tell me what you know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The woman was a vampire, and they wanted her back.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And so we delivered her right to them. I should've kept her here until we were certain...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The vampires were looking for a woman trapped in Dimhollow.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A woman? Trapped in there? That doesn't make any sense. Who is she? More importantly, where is she?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She wanted to go home, so I took her to her castle.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm waiting to hear what any of this means.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She's the daughter of a powerful vampire lord.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And so you delivered her to them.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They also have an Elder Scroll.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They what? And you didn't stop them? You didn't secure the scroll?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm lucky I made it out alive.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Right. So they have this woman, and an Elder Scroll.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There were too many of them, and only one of me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So they have everything they wanted, and we're left with nothing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I never got the chance.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I suppose you're lucky you're not dead. Or worse, one of them. By the Divines, this couldn't get much worse. This is more than you and I can handle.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So you're just going to give up?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: When did I say that? We just need...we need help.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We have to do something.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well of course we do. I'm old, not stupid. We're just going to need some help. If they're bold enough to attack us here, then this may be bigger than I thought. I have good men here, but... There are people I've met and worked with over the years. We need their skill, their talents, if we're going to survive this. If you can find them, we might have a chance.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Where can I find the people we need?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Right to the point, aren't you. I like that. Not like those fools in the order. We should keep it small. Too many people, and we'll draw unwanted attention to ourselves. I think we'll want Sorine Jurard. Breton girl, whip-smart and good with tinkering. Fascination with the Dwemer. Weapons in particular. Last I knew, she was out in the Reach, convinced she was about to find the biggest dwarven ruins yet.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She'll help us?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Might need a little convincing first, but she should. You'll also want to find Gunmar. Big brute of a Nord, hates vampires almost as much as I do. Got into his head years back that his experience with animals would help. Trolls in particular, from what I hear. Last I knew he was out scouring Skyrim for more beasts to tame. Bring the two of them back here, and we can get started on coming up with a plan. Watch your back.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Gunmar is located near Ivarstead, tracking his prey.
label: ACTION

dialogue: • You there, hold fast! I've tracked this damned bear for two weeks; I'll not let it have any more victims. • For two weeks I've tracked that bear, and now find that you've killed it on your own. I'm not sure whether that makes you brave or foolish. What brings you here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Isran needs your help.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Isran? Needing someone else's help? Never thought I'd hear that. I'm afraid he's a few years too late. I've moved on. I have more important business to attend to. Besides, he can handle anything alone! He assured me so himself. What could he possibly need my help with?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We're up against vampires.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Vampires? That...well, that might change things. Tell me more about what's going on.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We're not sure, but they have an Elder Scroll.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: By the Eight... • All right, look. I'll consider it, but I just can't leave this bear to prey on more innocent people. Once it's dealt with, then perhaps I'll see what Isran expects of me. • All right. I'll hear out Isran, see if there's anything I can do to help. Where do you expect me to go? Dragonborn: Isran's at Fort Dawnguard. He's been working on that place for years now. Never lets anyone in. His own little fortress. Well, I guess I'll get to see what he's been up to all this time. I'll meet you there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They slay the bear.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Don't know how well I'd have managed by myself. You have my thanks. You've helped me, so I suppose the least I can do is find out what Isran wants. He's still at that fort near Stendarr's Beacon, I assume?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, he said to meet him at Fort Dawnguard.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course he did.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How did you know?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If Isran is anything, he's stubborn. He's been working on that place for years now. Never lets anyone in. His own little fortress. Well, I guess I'll get to see what he's been up to all this time. I'll meet you there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sorine Jurard is found in the Reach's wilderness.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You haven't seen a sack of dwarven gyros lying around, have you? I'd swear I left it right here. Do you think mudcrabs might've taken it? I saw one the other day... Wouldn't be surprised if it followed me here. Just look around, will you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Isran asked me to find you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Isran? Wants me? No, you must be mistaken. He made it exceedingly clear the last time we spoke that he had no interest in my help. I find it hard to believe he changed his mind. He said some very hurtful things to me before I left. Anyway, I'm quite happy with my current pursuits. So if you'll excuse me...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You had a falling out?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, that was my point. I felt it was rather clear. Look, what is it you want from me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Vampires threaten all of Skyrim. We need your help.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Vampires? Really? Oh, and I suppose now he remembers that I proposed no less than three different scenarios that involved vampires overrunning the population. Well, what are they up to?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They have an Elder Scroll.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I... Well, that's actually something I never would've anticipated. Interesting. I'm not sure what they would want with one, but in this case Isran is probably correct in thinking it isn't good.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We're not sure, but Isran is concerned.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In case you haven't noticed, Isran is always concerned about something. That's what got us working together in the first place. Still, if he sent you to find me, it may actually be pretty bad. All right. If nothing else, I suppose it wouldn't hurt to learn more about what's going on so I can better defend myself. But I'm not just going to abandon what I've been working on here. It's too useful. I need at least one intact dwarven gyro. So either I need to find the satchel those mudcrabs stole, or I need another gyro from someplace. You wouldn't happen to have one, would you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's no time. You need to get moving now. (Persuade)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fine, fine! I can't afford to forget about this work, though. Some very interesting applications. Now where is it I'm supposed to be going?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm sorry, but I'm not about to do that without at least a single gyro to show for my efforts.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Here, I've got a dwarven gyro. Take it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you! It's not much, but this will help a great deal with some things I've been researching. Now where is it I'm supposed to be going?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't have any gyros on me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well then I'm very sorry, but I just can't walk away from this project yet.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We're meeting at Fort Dawnguard.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah. Been working more on his secret hideout, has he? It'll be interesting to see how much progress he's made. I'll finish up here and head in that direction soon as I can. See you there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: With the two helpers recruited, it's time to report to Isran. The player them to stand in the main entry.
label: ACTION

dialogue: All right Isran, you've got us all here. Now what do you want?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hold it right there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A bright light erupts from the center.
label: ACTION

dialogue: What are you doing?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Making sure you're not vampires. Can't be too careful.
label: CHARACTER
