dialogue: He shuts the magical light off.
label: ACTION

dialogue: So, welcome to Fort Dawnguard. I'm sure you've heard a bit of what we're up against. Powerful vampires, unlike anything we've seen before. And they have an Elder Scroll. If anyone is going to stand in their way, it's going to be us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This is all well and good, but do we actually know anything about what they're doing? What do we do now?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We'll get to that. For now, get acquainted with the space. Sorine, you'll find room to start your tinkering on that crossbow design you've been working on. Gunmar, there's an area large enough for you to pen up some trolls, get them armored up and ready to use.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He looks at the player.
label: ACTION

dialogue: In the meantime, we're going to get to the bottom of why a vampire showed up here looking for you. Let's go have a little chat with it, shall we?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One visits Merethi as Harkon instructed.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I have a message from Harkon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lord Harkon. Remember your place. Now, what is our Lord's wish?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He simply said "It is time."
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, well. He wants the Chalice, then. You've heard of the Bloodstone Chalice?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've never heard of it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It is a rather well-kept secret.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course. Hasn't everyone?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. Don't try and impress me. It only leaves you looking foolish. The Chalice has been in Lord Harkon's possession for quite some time now. It is, when used properly, able to increase the potency of our powers. He has neglected using it for ages. If he wants it filled now, then grander things are afoot. This is good. Follow me. I'll take you to it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They start walking to the dining room.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Lord Harkon has never cared to use the Chalice, relying on his more than adequate powers until now. This is an intriguing change.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They arrive.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Excuse us. I need to fetch the Bloodstone Chalice.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Chalice? Why?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What are you up to, Garan?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lord Harkon's orders, Orthjolf. Calm yourself. Our friend here has been ordered to fill the Chalice.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Really?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Indeed. He's off to Redwater Den.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, then... Best of luck to you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Vingalmo and Orthjolf are Harkon's primary advisors. I'm sure they're quite surprised to learn that you're taking the Chalice. And here we are.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They find a large chalice on a small pedestal.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Now, this Chalice needs to be filled directly from the bloodspring that is the source of Redwater Den. But that's not enough. Once that's done, the blood of a powerful vampire needs to be added to it. Keep in mind that Redwater Den has fallen into...well, let's just say less reputable members of society now dwell there. It's your choice whether to attempt to deal with them or force your way through. Hurry back. You don't want to keep Lord Harkon waiting.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player travels to Redwater Den, near Riften's Lake Honrich. The place is be preyed upon.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Hold it. If you're going downstairs, you keep your weapons to yourself or we'll be getting better acquainted. Head on in and behave yourself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One way or another, one enters the back caverns and finds Redwater's spring. The overhear vampires talking nearby.
label: ACTION

dialogue: So why don't you just drink the blood from the spring? I mean, that seems easier than running a skooma den...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The boss said it's some sort of profaned spring. It looks like blood, but it's not the real thing. Drinking it gives you strength, but it also gets you pretty messed up... That's why we thought of putting it in the skooma.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After cutting through an entire den, the spring's source is uncovered. One fills the chalice. Two Volkihar vampires show themselves.
label: ACTION

dialogue: It's really too bad, you know. The little accident you had here, completely unexpected...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yeah, too bad. Lord Harkon's new favorite, dead so soon after joining the family.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We're just lucky I was here to return the Chalice to Vingalmo, so he could make sure Harkon gets it back.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wait, what? That's not what we agreed. We take it back together.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Idiot. You didn't really think I'd let you walk out of here either, did you? Vingalmo wants you both dead.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, that's just fine. Orthjolf told me to finish off anyone who got in the way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Dragonborn slays both traitorous vampires, then returns to Marethi.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I see you have returned. Lord Harkon will be pleased. You met Stalf and Salonia, I assume? Lord Harkon and I suspected they might follow you there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They tried to kill me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well of course they did.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I killed them both.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As well you should have. Welcome to the politics of Lord Harkon's court. Vingalmo and Orthjolf both long for our Lord's throne, but cannot make overt moves against him. Each sought to gain power by using his underling to kill you and keep the Chalice for himself. By ensuring the Chalice reaches our Lord, you have increased his power over them, and at the same time deprived them of their little pets. You've done Lord Harkon two great services. Take what you've learned to heart, and be careful who you trust. Now, I believe Lord Harkon wishes to speak with you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player goes with Isran to the balcony rooms, finding Serana there.
label: ACTION

dialogue: This vampire showed up while you were away. I'm guessing it's the one you found in Dimhollow Crypt. Says it's got something really important to say to you. So let's hear it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You probably weren't expecting to see me again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What are you doing here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'd rather not be here either, but I needed to talk to you. It's important, so please just listen before your friend, here, loses his patience. It's...well, it's about me. And the Elder Scroll that was buried with me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What about the scroll?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The reason I had it...and why I was down there. It all comes back to my father.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What about you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The reason I was down there...and why I had the Elder Scroll. It all comes back to my father. I'm guessing you figured this part out already, but my father's not exactly a good person. Even by vampire standards. He wasn't always like that, though. There was...a turn. He stumbled onto this obscure prophecy and just kind of lost himself in it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What sort of prophecy?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's pointless and vague, like all prophecies. The part he latched onto said that vampires would no longer need to fear the sun. That's what he's after. He wants to control the sun, have vampires control the world.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do you mean..."lost himself"?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He just became absorbed...obsessed. It was kind of sick, actually. The prophecy said that vampires would no longer need to fear the sun. For someone who fancied himself as vampire royalty, that's pretty seductive. Anyway, my mother and I didn't feel like inviting a war with all of Tamriel, so we tried to stop him. That's why I was sealed away with the Scroll.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's all this have to do with the Dawnguard?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm sorry, I had heard there were vampire hunters here. I thought they might want to know about a vampire plot to enslave the rest of the world. Was I wrong?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You took a big risk coming here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I did. But something about you makes me think I can trust you. I hope I'm not wrong.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, you're right. We just have to convince the others you're on our side.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, let's move then. I'm nothing if not persuasive.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You want us to help you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That was the plan, yes. Assuming the rest of them can trust a vampire. Come on, I'll need you to help convince them.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right, you've heard what it has to say. Now tell me, is there any reason I shouldn't kill this bloodsucking fiend right now?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Because we're going to need her help.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why, because of that story about the prophecy? About some vampire trying to put the sun out? Do you actually believe any of that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why else would she risk her life to come here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who knows, maybe it has a death wish. Maybe it's just insane. I don't really care.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Set your hatred aside and try to see the larger picture, Isran.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Set my hatred aside? Not a chance. It's what keeps me strong.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You don't trust her, fine. Trust me. I believe here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'd better know what you're doing. It can stay for now, but if it so much as lays a finger on anyone here, I'll hold you responsible. Got it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He turns to Serana.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You hear me? Don't feel like a guest, because you're not. You're a resource. You're an asset. In the meantime, don't make me regret my sudden outburst of tolerance and generosity, because if you do, your friend here is going to pay for it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you for your kindness. I'll remember it the next time I'm feeling hungry. So, in case you didn't notice the giant thing I have on my back, I have the Elder Scroll with me. Whatever it says, it will have something that can help us. But of course, neither of us can read it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who can?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, the Moth Priests are the only ones I've heard who can do it. They spend years preparing before they start reading, though. Not that it helps us, anyway, because they're half a continent away in Cyrodiil.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Some Imperial scholar arrived in Skyrim a few days ago. I was staking out the road when I saw him pass by. Maybe that's your Moth Priest.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do you know where he's staying now?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, and I'm not going to waste men looking. We're fighting a war against your kind, and I intend to win it. You want to find him, try talking to anyone who'd meet a traveler. Innkeepers and carriage drivers in the big cities maybe. But you're on your own.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Any idea on how you're going to find a Moth Priest? Skyrim's a pretty big place. Do you have any ideas?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Where would a Moth Priest actually go?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, back before I...you know. The College of Winterhold was the first place I'd think to go for any kind of magic or historical thing. The wizards know about all kinds of things that people probably shouldn't know about.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Actually, now that I think of it...I'm going to come along with you. I've been really wanting to get out and explore a bit.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'd...well, I'd come with you, but I don't know if I can trust your friend. Let me know if you want me along.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There are many ways to find leads, such as those Harkon suggested. The most can ask the librarian.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I need to find a Moth Priest.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A Moth Priest? What in Oblivion do you want a Moth Priest for?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My business is my own. Just tell me what I need to know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fine, fine. No need to get your breeches in a twist. The obvious answer is to go to the Imperial City. The Moth Priests make their home in the White Gold Tower. Sometimes they go out looking for Elder Scrolls. Lucky for you, there's a Moth Priest in Skyrim right now, doing just that. He stopped in to do some research in the library, then left for Dragon Bridge. If you hurry, you might catch him there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If one asks a carriage driver instead, they will all give the same answer:
label: ACTION

dialogue: Have you seen a Moth Priest?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's one of them Imperial scholars, right? Old man with a gray robe?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's right. You've seen him?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Might be that I have, but I can't say for sure. I got enough troubles on my mind just tryin' to scrape by out here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Please, it's very important that I find him. (Persuade)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now that I think on it, I did see your priest. He tried to hire me for a trip to Dragon Bridge, but I told him that ain't one of my stops.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Can't help you, friend. I might remember better if my pockets weren't so light.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Maybe this will put your mind at ease. ( gold)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah yes, I remember your Moth Priest now. He wanted me to take him out to Dragon Bridge, but I told him it ain't one of my stops.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: An' maybe it won't.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Never mind, I'll look somewhere else.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Suits me just fine.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Some innkeepers may not be able to give information. Others, like Hulda in as below.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Heard anything about a moth priest passing through?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Have I heard anything? It was the talk of the city for three days straight. Ain't too often we get a visitor like that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Where is he now?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, he just left a short while ago. He said he'd finished up his work and it was time to move on. That's all I can tell you. He asked me not to let anyone know where he was going. I suppose he didn't want the attention.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's important that I find him right away. (Persuade)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, well, in that case, I'll tell you what I know. He took the road southwest out of town, and he said he was going to be crossing over the Dragon Bridge. That's all he told me. I hope it helps.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's like I said, I'm not going to talk about it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Finding that Moth Priest is worth a lot to me. ( gold)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can see that. He said he was heading for Dragon Bridge next. I hope that helps you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sorry, but that Moth Priest's comings and goings are none of my business, and none of yours either.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll try my luck elsewhere.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Never much cared for folks who can't mind their own business.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: With the info found, one heads to Dragon Bridge. Across the titular landmark, the priest, captured in an ancient barrier, and questioned by a vampire.
label: ACTION

dialogue: The more you fight me, the more you will suffer, mortal.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I will resist you, monster. I must!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How much longer can you keep this up, Moth Priest? Your mind was strong, but you're exhausted from the struggle.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Must... resist...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, I can feel your defenses crumbling. You want it to end. You want to give in to me. Now, acknowledge me as your master!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. master.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They kill the vampires, then release Dexion. However, the bewitched priest is hostile, attacking immediately.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I serve my master's will. But my master is dead, and his enemies will pay!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He's soon defeated, snapping out of it.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Wait, stop! I yield! That...that wasn't me you were fighting. I could see through my eyes, but I could not control my actions. Thank you for breaking that foul vampire's hold over me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Are you alright?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm quite alright, thanks to you. Dexion Evicus is my name. I'm a Moth Priest of the White Gold Tower. These vampires claimed they had some purpose in store for me, but they wouldn't say what. Probably holding me for ransom, the fools.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know why they needed you, because we need you for the same purpose.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You do? Alright then, enough mysteries.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We're called the Dawnguard, and we need you to read an Elder Scroll.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have an Elder Scroll? Remarkable! If my knowledge of history serves me, I recall that the Dawnguard was an ancient order of vampire hunters. I will be happy to assist you with your Elder Scroll. Just tell me where I need to go.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll explain later. Right now, we need your help and time is short.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, you saved me from those vampires. I suppose the least I can do is hear you out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You can find us at Fort Dawnguard, near Stendarr's Beacon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Very well. I'll hurry on my way there before more of those vampires turn up.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Everyone rendezvous at the Fort.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I'm impressed you could find a Moth Priest so quickly.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Does he have the Scroll? Is everything ready?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: For the reading? Yeah. Just let the old man know when you're ready.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, hello there!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Glad you made it here safely, Dexion.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, my rescuer! It's good to see you again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Have my companions made you feel welcome?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's not exactly the hospitality I'm used to, but your man Isran has seen to my needs well enough. And might I add, this is a remarkable fortress. I have colleagues back home that would love to study this place in detail.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Are you prepared to read the Elder Scroll?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, most certainly! Let's find out what secrets the scroll can tell. Now, if everyone will please be quiet, I must concentrate.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He opens the legendary scroll.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I see a vision before me, an image of a great bow. I know this weapon! It is Auriel's Bow! Now a voice whispers, saying "Among the night's children, a dread lord will rise. In an age of strife, when dragons return to the realm of men, darkness will mingle with light and the night and day will be as one." The voice fades and the words begin to shimmer and distort. But wait, there is more here. The secret of the bow's power is written elsewhere. I think there is more to the prophecy, recorded in other scrolls. Yes, I see them now... One contains the ancient secrets of the dragons, and the other speaks of the potency of ancient blood. My vision darkens, and I see no more. To know the complete prophecy, we must have the other two scrolls. I must rest now. The reading has made me weary.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come on, old man. You should get some rest.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After returning the Chalice to its proper place, one returns to Harkon.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Ah, you are here. Good.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You wanted to speak to me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, I did. When I told you that I was grateful for my daughter's safe return, I told the truth. But I did not tell you everything.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I suspected as much.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good. Strong instincts and a cunning mind will serve you as well as blade, spell or claw.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: When do you plan to start trusting me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do not presume to tell me who I can and cannot trust. I possess the wisdom of a dozen lifetimes, and I will make my own judgements. Now be silent, and hear what I have to say. As you know, vampires are powerful but we have limits. Our great enemy is the sun, and until recently it's an enemy we've had no way to fight. For centuries I searched for an answer to this problem. I found an old prophecy written by a Moth Priest, those scholars who read the Elder Scrolls. The prophecy tells of a time in which vampires will gain power over the sun, and will no longer fear its tyranny. I believe the secret to unraveling that prophecy is written in Serana's Elder Scroll. I have ordered the court to assemble. I have a new task for us all to carry out, and that includes you. Come now, and hear my proclamation.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Harkon stands to address the other Volikhar vampires.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Scions of the night! Hear my words! The prophesied time is at last upon us. Soon we will claim dominion over the sun itself, and forge a new realm of eternal darkness. Now that I have reclaimed one of my Elder Scrolls, we must find a Moth Priest to read it. I have spread false rumors about the discovery of an Elder Scroll in Skyrim to lure a Moth Priest here. Now it is time to see if those efforts have borne fruit. Go forth, and search the land for rumors of a Moth Priest within our borders. Look to the cities. Speak to the innkeepers, carriage drivers, anyone who would meet a traveler. Go now, and carry out this task. This is my command!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A Moth Priest?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It will be done my lord!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hm. Most intriguing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Feran Sedri and Hestla run out immediately.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Any idea on how you're going to find a Moth Priest? Skyrim's a pretty big place. Do you have any ideas?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Where would a Moth Priest actually go?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, back before I...you know. The College of Winterhold was the first place I'd think to go for any kind of magic or historical thing. The wizards know about all kinds of things that people probably shouldn't know about.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Actually, now that I think of it...I'm going to come along with you. I've been really wanting to get out and explore a bit.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'd...well, I'd come with you, but I don't know if I can trust your friend. Let me know if you want me along.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The methods of finding info are the same as in the Dawnguard version of this light barrier and overhear the Dawnguard talking.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Those vampires put up a hell of a fight."
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I just hope we weren't too late. I'm not sure what they did to this Moth Priest, but he doesn't look right.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You think they turned him?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't know, maybe. Won't know until we get him out of there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How do we do that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm working on it, now give me some silence so I can think.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player slaughters the former allies, takes the weystone focus from the and angry.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I serve my master's will. But my master is dead, and his enemies will pay!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One uses a vampiric seduction spell for calming, then feeds on him.
label: ACTION

dialogue: By the divines! It's as if my eyes have been opened! I am blinded by the light of your majesty. I...I must obey you. What would you have of me, master?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I command you to travel to Castle Volkihar.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Certainly. Where can I find this castle?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Off the northern coast of Skyrim, due west of Solitude.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll set out at once, then.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The good news is soon reported to Harkon.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Well done! Somehow I knew it would be you and Serana who found our moth priest.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have made the Moth Priest my thrall.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, I see that. I trust his capture was not too difficult a task?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Dawnguard tried to stop me, but they posed no threat.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I wish I could have been there to hear the sounds of their screams.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Dawnguard were there. They fought well, but not well enough.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They are determined and well-armed, but foolish if they think they can defy us. We will deal with them in time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Dawnguard were protecting him, and they nearly killed me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We both know that a band of fools with crossbows is no match for a scion of the ancient blood. I admit, I do not entirely understand your sense of humor. Well, your thrall awaits and we have given him the Elder Scroll. Command him to read it, and let us hear the words of prophecy together.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One finds Dexion nearby.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Master, I have done as you asked and traveled here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have a new task for you, thrall.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course. What is it that you need me to do?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You must read an Elder Scroll.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, yes, the Elder Scroll! I admit, I'm looking forward to this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then you may begin your reading.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course, master. Now, if everyone will please be quiet, I must concentrate.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He takes out the legendary scroll.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I see a vision before me, an image of a great bow. I know this weapon! It is Auriel's Bow! Now a voice whispers, saying "Among the night's children, a dread lord will rise. In an age of strife, when dragons return to the realm of men, darkness will mingle with light and the night and day will be as one. The voice fades and the words begin to shimmer and distort. But wait, there is more here. The secret of the bow's power is written elsewhere. I think there is more to the prophecy, recorded in other scrolls. Yes, I see them now... One contains the ancient secrets of the dragons, and the other speaks of the potency of ancient blood. My vision darkens, and I see no more. To know the complete prophecy, we must have the other two scrolls.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That was...not as useful as I would have liked. Even so, you did well.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do you know where these other scrolls are?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My traitor wife stole one of them away and then disappeared. As for the other, the last that I heard, it was lost in the bowels of a Dwemer ruin. It seems our work is not yet done. But I have waited this long, and we are so very close now. I can wait a bit longer.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After the crowd disperses following the Scroll's reading, Serana approaches. options may only make sense or appear based off that.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Do you have a moment to talk?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's on your mind?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That Moth Priest, Dexion. He said we needed two other Elder Scrolls. I think I know where we can start looking.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Can't it wait?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, you could waste a lot of time trying to figure out our next move, or you could let me help. Your choice.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why didn't you say something earlier?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Didn't want that lot getting wind of it. Especially my father.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Half the people in your little crew would just as soon kill me as talk to me. That doesn't exactly make me want to open up. I got a warmer welcome from my father, and that's saying something.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is it between the two of you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ever since he decided to make that prophecy his calling, we kind of drifted apart.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do you trust Harkon at all?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's not a question of trust...he's just obsessed with the prophecy. And from what I can tell, an thousand extra years of obsession haven't made him any better. We should have found him a hobby.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Does Harkon even care about you anymore?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know, I've asked myself the same thing. I thought...I hoped that if he saw me, he might feel something again. But I guess I don't really factor in at this point. I don't think he even sees me as his daughter anymore. I'm just...a means to an end.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So where is this Elder Scroll?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We need to find my mother, Valerica. She'll definitely know where it is, and if we're lucky, she actually has it herself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You said you didn't know where she went.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The last time I saw her, she said that she'd go somewhere safe... somewhere that my father would never search. Other than that, she wouldn't tell me anything. But the way she said it..."someplace he'd never search." It was cryptic, yet she called attention to it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sounds like she was being cautious.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Maybe. What I can't figure out is why she said it that way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We can't waste time on cryptic clues.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you have a better lead than this, I'm all ears.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Maybe your mother didn't trust you, either.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's always a possibility. She was almost as obsessed as my father by the time she shut me in. But I can't worry about that now. We need the scroll, and she's our only lead. Besides, I can't imagine a single place my father would avoid looking. And he's had all this time, too. Any ideas?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hiding with the Dawnguard?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I doubt my mother would waste her time with those fools. They probably would have tried to kill her, and that has a way of souring relationships. Any other ideas?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They'd be even less welcoming to her than they've been to me. It would have been a bloodbath. And since the Dawnguard are still around, that must not have happened. Any other ideas?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sealed away like you were?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't think so. She said she wanted to stay awake in case the situation was resolved. It had to be one of us, and, well, she's so much more powerful than I am. It just made sense for her to be out there. Anything else?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How about right here, in the castle? / In Castle Volkihar?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wait...that almost makes sense!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I used to help my mother tend a garden in the courtyard here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's a courtyard in the castle. I used to help her tend a garden there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All of the ingredients for our potions came from there. She used to say that my father couldn't stand the place. Too...peaceful.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Isn't that pretty risky, staying around the castle?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, absolutely. But my mother's not a coward. That is...I don't think we'll actually trip over her there. But it's worth a look.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How can we get in without your father noticing?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Trust me. I lived here for a very long time and I know every nook and cranny.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They aren't going to let us use the front door.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: True. But I know a way we can get to the courtyard without arousing suspicion. There's an unused inlet on the northern side of the island that was used by the previous owners to bring supplies into the castle. An old escape tunnel from the castle exits there. I think that's our way in.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's go to the castle's secret entrance.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come on. It's just around the side.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's around the side of the castle. Let's move.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, I don't take just anyone into the secret parts of the place I grew up. Get rid of this interloper and you and I can be on our way. I'll wait for you at the dock.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Actually, I have some things to do first.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't let me stand in your way, then. I'll be at the dock whenever you're ready.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The two walk the Volkihar shore clockwise toward the inlet.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Yeah, just around this bend. Castle looks so big from down here. I mean, it is big, but, well, even bigger.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Together, the player and Serana enter the deserted undercroft.
label: ACTION

dialogue: The old water cistern. One some days, this smell would just...be glad you weren't here then. Take a left up here. This is one of those weird double-barred security measures that my father put in when he got more paranoid. If we follow that path around, we can find the other switch. This leads out to the courtyard. Just head for the door.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They continue on, eventually reaching the old garden, now gone to seed.
label: ACTION

dialogue: We've made it to the courtyard. Oh no... What happened to this place? Everything's been torn down... The whole place looks...well, dead. It's like we're the first to set foot here in centuries. This used to lead into the castle's great hall. It looks like my father had it sealed up. I used to walk through here after evening meals. It was beautiful, once. This was my mother's garden. It...do you know how beautiful something can be when it's tended by a master for hundreds of years? She would have hated to see it like this. Wait... Something's wrong with the moondial here. Some of the crests are missing and the dial is askew. I didn't even know the crests could be removed. Maybe my mother's trying to tell us something? I'm telling you, there's something strange with the moondial.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player can inquire further.
label: ACTION

dialogue: What happened to the castle courtyard?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If I had to guess, I'd say the moment mother fled the castle, father went on a rampage. Knowing him, anything at all that reminded him of her was just destroyed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then he just walled it off.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It appears that way. I suppose he wanted to put the past behind him. Perhaps if he had spent more time with us, he would have recognized the beauty for himself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's so special about the moondial?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, as far as I'm aware it's the only one in existence. The previous owners of the castle had a sundial in the courtyard, and obviously that didn't appeal to my mother. She persuaded an elven artisan to make some improvements. You can see the plates that show the phases of the moons, Masser and Secunda.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Does it work?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's the thing...what's the point of a moondial? I always wondered why she didn't just have the whole thing ripped out. But she loved it. I don't know. I guess it's like having a piece of art, if you're into that sort of thing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So what exactly am I doing to it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hard to say. Maybe if we found the missing crests, we could figure it out. Look around for the missing crests. Even in this mess, they should stick out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player finds the crest, then places them correctly. The sundial reveals a hidden stairway below it.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Very clever, mother. Very clever. I've never been in those tunnels before, but I'd bet they run right under the courtyard and into the tower ruins. Well, at least we're getting closer. Let's go.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They pull a hidden wall back with a lever, revealing a bloody kitchen.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I've never even seen this part of the castle before. Be careful. I don't know what might be around.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They continue through the ancient halls, constantly ascending.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I don't think we've reached the top yet. I'd bet there's some kind of secret passage around here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They find a path behind the fireplace.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Leave it to my mother...always smarter than I gave her credit for.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They reach the tower's apex, Valerica's old laboratory.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Look at this place. This has to be it! I knew she was deep into necromancy. I mean, she taught me everything I know. But I had no idea she had a setup like this. Look at all this. She must have spent years collecting these components. And what's this thing?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She looks at a floor indentation with many concentric circles.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I'm not sure about this circle, but it's obviously...something. Let's take a look around. There has to be something here that tells us where she's gone.

dialogue: Do you think this would help? (Give journal)

dialogue: You've found her journal! Let me take a look at it. (jump to "What's this "Soul Cairn"...")
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What exactly are we looking for?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My mother was meticulous about her research. If we can find her notes, there might be some hints in there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Did your mother keep gargoyles here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not that I ever saw. My mother had a bit of a thing for magical constructs. Not...not what you're thinking. She just found them fascinating.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your mother maintained quite a laboratory.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I had no idea that her laboratory even existed. She had an alchemy setup in her drawing room, but nothing that even comes close to what's here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What did she research?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Looking at the equipment and materials, it looks like she was trying to advance her necromancy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: To what end?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't know. Certainly not longevity. Kind of a waste of time for a vampire. I remember she used to keep a small journal. See if you can dig it up.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A journal is found on a shelf.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I've found your mother's notes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You did? Let me see them.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's this "Soul Cairn" that she mentions?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I only know what she told me. She had a theory about soul gems. That the souls inside of them don't just vanish when they're used...they end up in the Soul Cairn.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why did she care where used souls went?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Soul Cairn is home to very powerful beings. Necromancers send them souls, and receive powers of their own in return. My mother spent a lot of time trying to contact them directly, to travel to the Soul Cairn itself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If she made it there, we'll find her.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That circle in the center of the room is definitely some type of portal. If I'm reading this right, there's a formula here that should give us safe passage into the Soul Cairn.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do we need?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A handful of soul gem shards, some finely-ground bone meal, a good bit of purified void salts... Oh...damn it...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's wrong?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We're also going to need a sample of her blood. Which...if we could get that, we wouldn't even be trying to do this in the first place.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You share her blood.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hmmm. Not bad. We'd better hope that's good enough. Mistakes with these kinds of portals can be...gruesome. Anyway, enough of that. Let's get started.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Are all of those ingredients here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, definitely. Mother would have plenty of those materials in her laboratory, you just need to find them.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I already found all of the ingredients.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, good. Well then...let's head over to the portal vessel and I'll do the rest.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player collects the items and puts them in the vessel.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Then the rest is up to me. Are you ready to go? I'm not entirely sure what this thing is going to do when I add my blood.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Can I ask you something first?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course. What is it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What will you do if we find your mother?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've been asking myself the same thing since we came back to the castle. She was so sure of what we did to my father, I couldn't help but go along with her. I never thought of the cost.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It sounds like she did everything for your sake.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Possibly. I guess even a vampire mother is still a mother. She worried about me. About all of us. But she wanted to get me as far away from my father as possible before he really went over the edge.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't know what she was thinking.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Neither do I. She always seemed happy, before we heard the prophecy. Then it all changed. She became a different person. They both did.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It sounds like she was pretty selfish.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She wasn't, always. But I think you're right. She was practically smirking as we left home. Almost like she was proud of herself. Like she didn't just want to stop my father...she wanted to stick it to him, too.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We won't know until we find her.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes...yes, you're right. I'm sorry. I just didn't expect anyone to care how I felt about her. Thank you. Are we ready then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's get that portal open.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right. Here goes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have some preparations to make, first.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll be here. Don't take too long, now!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm ready.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Okay, here goes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Putting the blood in the vessel opens an otherworldly portal.
label: ACTION

dialogue: By the blood of my ancestors... She actually did it...created a portal to the Soul Cairn. Incredible.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If one isn't a vampire, the Soul Cairn portal rejects the player.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Are you alright? That looked painful.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It was. What happened?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now that I think about it...I should have expected that. Sorry. It's hard to describe. The Soul Cairn is...well, hungry, for lack of a better word. It's trying to take your life essence as payment.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So there's no way in, then.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There might be, but I don't think you're going to like it. Vampires aren't counted among the living. I could probably go through there without a problem.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Are you saying that I need to become a vampire?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not your first choice, I'd guess.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There has to be another way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Maybe. We could just "pay the toll" another way. It wants a soul, so we give it a soul. Yours.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wouldn't that kill me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My mother taught me a trick or two. I could partially soul trap you, and offer that gem to the Ideal Masters. It might be enough to satisfy them. It would make you a bit weaker when we travel through the Soul Cairn, but we might be able to fix that once we're inside. Maybe.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Those are my only options?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm sorry. I wish I knew a better way, something that would be easier for you. Just know that...whatever path you choose, I won't think any less of you. Sometimes things just have to be done. I know that better than anybody.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If one decides to become a vampire to gain entry:
label: ACTION

dialogue: I don't see another way. I'll become a vampire.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Are you sure? I'm willing to turn you, but you need to think it through. You'd become the very thing you'd sworn to destroy. I don't know how the Dawnguard will react.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're right. Let me think about it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I understand. Take your time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm ready.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Turning someone is a very...personal thing for vampires. It's intimate. For us. I don't want you to feel like I'm forcing you into this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In that case, I'm glad you're the one doing it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's not waste too much time, then.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I understand.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's just get it over with.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As you wish. I promise to try and make this as painless as possible. Hold still.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If one decides to get soul trapped to gain entry:
label: ACTION

dialogue: Soul trap me. I won't feel right as a vampire.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Are you sure? I'm willing to do it, but you need to think it through. You'll remain mortal, but you'll find yourself weakened within the Soul Cairn.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're right. Let me think about it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I understand. Take your time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm ready.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know this is difficult for you. I hope you trust me. I'd never do anything that could hurt you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I trust you completely.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't worry about it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh. Good.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's just get this over with.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As you wish. I promise to make this as painless as possible. Hold still. Let's go. My mother must be waiting on the other side of that thing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Once one is soul-trapped or vampirized, the team can finally descend the steps into the magnificent new location.
label: ACTION

dialogue: With one Scroll in hand, and one apparently in Valerica's hands, it's time to as before. One seeks out the librarian.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I'm looking for an Elder Scroll.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And what do you plan to do with it? Do you even know what you're asking about?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me more about the Elder Scrolls.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I knew it. Everyone comes in here, expecting my help, but they don't even have the proper questions. An Elder Scroll is an instrument of immense knowledge and power. To read an Elder Scroll, a person must have the most rigorously trained mind, or else risk madness. Even so, the Divines usually take the reader's sight as a price.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A price for what?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The simplest way to put it is "knowledge," but there's nothing simple about an Elder Scroll. It's a reflection of all possible futures and all possible pasts. Each reader sees different reflections through different lenses, and may come away with a very different reading. But at the same time, all of it is true. Even the falsehoods. Especially the falsehoods.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who wrote the Elder Scrolls?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It would take a month to explain to you how that very question doesn't even make sense. The Scrolls exist here, with us, but are also beyond and beneath. Before and after. They are bits of Divine made substance so we could know them. Sorry. Talking about the Scrolls, you usually end up in irritating and vague metaphors like that. Some people who study them devoutly go mad.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right. So do you have one that I could use?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ha!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course I do. Do you have one here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You think even if I did have one here, I would let you see it? It would be kept under the highest security. The greatest thief in the world wouldn't be able to lay a finger on it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do you at least have any information on them?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I need to find one and was told you could help.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't know who told you that, but I'll do what I can. What we do have are plenty of books. I'll bring you everything we have on them, but it's not much. So don't get your hopes up. It's mostly lies, leavened with rumor and conjecture.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He gets out a book written by Septimus Signus.
label: ACTION

dialogue: This "Ruminations" book is incomprehensible.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Aye, that's the work of Septimus Signus. He's the world's master on the nature of Elder Scrolls, but...well. He's been gone for a long while. Too long.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Where did he go?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Somewhere up north, in the ice fields. Said he found some old Dwemer artifact, but...well, that was years ago. Haven't heard from him since.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He's dead?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh no. I hope not. But even I haven't seen him in years, and we were close. Became obsessed with the Dwemer. Took off north saying he had found some old artifact. Haven't seen him since. Somewhere in the ice fields, if you want to try and find him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: At this point, the quest ends, and "Discerning the Transmundane" begins. It's done to find the scroll. See that section for relevant details.
label: ACTION

dialogue: The player and Serana enter the Soul Cairn, a dark, twisted landscape with the fog-covered area.
label: ACTION

dialogue: • Let's keep moving. I feel like we're being watched. • I'd heard stories about the Soul Cairn, but never thought I'd see it myself. So far it's...about what I imagined.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They make for a far-off castle with twin energy spires. There, one finds a barrier preventing entrance. Valerica is trapped on the other side.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Mother!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Maker...it can't be. Serana?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is it really you? I can't believe it! How do we get inside? We have to talk.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Serana? What are you doing here? Where's your father?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He doesn't know we're here. I don't have time to explain.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I must have failed. Harkon's found a way to decipher the prophecy, hasn't he.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, you've got it all wrong. We're here to complete the prophecy our way, not his.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wait a moment...you've brought a stranger here? Have you lost your mind?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, you don't...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You. Come forward. I would speak with you. • So how has it come to pass that a vampire of mixed blood is in the company of my daughter? • So how has it come to pass that a vampire hunter is in the company of my daughter? It pains me to think you'd travel with Serana under the guise her protector in an effort to hunt me down.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've been keeping her safe.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Safe? You call bringing her here safe? Has she explained nothing to you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This is no ruse. I want to keep her safe.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Coming from one who murders vampires as a trade, I find it hard to believe your intentions are noble.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've saved her from your foolish plan.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I find your choice of words quite interesting considering that Serana is in far more danger now than she was following my "foolish plan."
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm just here for the Elder Scroll.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Glorious. Serana claims you're her guardian, yet your first instinct appears to be greed. I see that my daughter is still as naive as ever. Serana has sacrificed everything to prevent Harkon from completing the prophecy. I would have expected her to explain that to you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's why I'm here for the Elder Scroll.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You think I'd have the audacity to place my own daughter in that tomb for the protection of her Elder Scroll alone? The scrolls are merely a means to an end. The key to the Tyranny of the Sun is Serana herself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do you mean?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: When I fled Castle Volkihar, I fled with two Elder Scrolls. The scroll I presume you found with Serana speaks of Auriel and his arcane weapon, Auriel's Bow. The second scroll declares that "The Blood of Coldharbour's Daughter will blind the eye of the Dragon."
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How does Serana fit in?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Like myself, Serana was a human once. We were devout followers of Lord Molag Bal. Tradition dictates the females be offered to Molag Bal on his summoning day. Few survive the ordeal. Those that do emerge as a pure-blooded vampire. We call such confluences the "Daughters of Coldharbour."
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Tyranny of the Sun requires Serana's blood?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now you're beginning to see why I wanted to protect Serana, and why I've kept the other Elder Scroll as far from her as possible.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Serana underwent this ritual willingly?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It was expected of her, just as it was expected of me. Being selected as an offering to Molag Bal is an honor. She wouldn't have dared turn her back on that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Coldharbour?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's what some call the domain of Molag Bal. His place in Oblivion.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Are you saying Harkon means to kill her?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If Harkon obtained Auriel's Bow and Serana's blood was used to taint the weapon, the Tyranny of the Sun would be complete. In his eyes, she'd be dying for the good of all vampires.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I would never allow that to happen.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And how exactly do you plan on completing the prophecy without the death of my daughter?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll kill Harkon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you believe that, then you're a bigger fool than I originally suspected. Don't you think I weighed that option before I enacted my plans?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll need your help.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Have you been listening to me? Like Serana, I'm a pure-blooded vampire. My presence on Tamriel is as much of a danger as hers is.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Perhaps her death is destined.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No! I will not allow that to happen. The Elder Scrolls only tell of events that might be, not events that will be.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And Serana's opinion on this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You care nothing for Serana or our plight. • You see the Tyranny of the Sun as your chance at deification, and like Harkon you won't hesitate to destroy anything that stands in your path. • Whether or not you've become one of us in order to survive the Soul Cairn, you're still a vampire hunter at heart. You're here because we're abominations in your mind. Evil creatures that need to be destroyed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Serana believes in me, why won't you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Serana? This stranger may call himself vampire, but he knows nothing of our struggle. Why should I entrust you to him?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This stranger aligns himself with those who would hunt you down and slay you like an animal, yet I should entrust you to him?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm just here for the Elder Scroll.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I see. You're simply here to stop the Tyranny of the Sun, despite the cost to Serana. Nothing else matters.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This "stranger" has done more for me in the brief time I've known him than you've done in centuries!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How dare you! I gave up everything I cared about to protect you from that fanatic you call a father!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, he's a fanatic...he's changed. But he's still my father. Why can't you understand how that makes me feel?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, Serana. If you'd only open your eyes. The moment your father discovers your role in the prophecy, that he needs your blood, you'd be in terrible danger.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So to protect me, you decided to shut me away from everything I cared about? You never asked me if hiding in that tomb was the best course of action, you just expected me to follow you blindly. Both of you were obsessed with your own paths. Your motivations might have been different, but in the end, I'm still just a pawn to you, too. I want us to be a family again. But I don't know if we can ever have that. Maybe we don't deserve that kind of happiness. Maybe it isn't for us. But we have to stop him. Before he goes too far. And to do that, we need the Elder Scroll.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm sorry, Serana. I didn't know...I didn't see. I've allowed my hatred of your father to estrange us for too long. Forgive me. If you want the Elder Scroll, it's yours.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She turns to the player.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Your intentions are still somewhat unclear to me. But for Serana's sake, I'll assist you in any way that I can.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do you have the Elder Scroll with you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. I've kept it safely secured here ever since I was imprisoned. • Fortunately, you seem to have already killed the Keepers maintaining the barrier around these ruins.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Does that mean you can take us to it now?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. Please, follow me. One more word of warning. There's a dragon that calls itself Durnehviir roaming the Cairn. The Ideal Masters have charged him with overseeing the Keepers, and will undoubtedly investigate the fact that the barrier has fallen.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fortunately, you're in a position to breach the barrier that surrounds these ruins.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do we need to do?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You need to locate the tallest of the rocky spires that surround these ruins. At their bases, the barrier's energy is being drawn from unfortunate souls that have been exiled here. Destroy the Keepers that are tending them, and it should bring the barrier down.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We'll return soon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One more word of warning. There's a dragon that calls itself Durnehviir roaming the Cairn. Be wary of him. The Ideal Masters have charged him with overseeing the Keepers, and will undoubtedly intervene if you're perceived as a threat. Be careful, and keep my daughter safe.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's kill those...Keeper things and get back to the prison.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One can ask further questions.
label: ACTION

dialogue: How did you become imprisoned here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: When I entered the Soul Cairn, I had intended to strike a bargain with the Ideal Masters, the custodians of this place.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What was the bargain?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I requested refuge in the Soul Cairn, and in exchange, I would provide the Ideal Masters the souls that they craved. If I had foreseen the value they placed on my own soul, I would never have come here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They tricked you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Ideal Masters unleashed their Keepers and sent them to destroy me. Fortunately, I was able to hold them at bay and retreat into these ruins.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You became trapped.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Unfortunately, yes. Since the Keepers weren't able to claim my soul, they had their minions construct a barrier that I'd never be able to breach.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've been imprisoned here for all this time?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Time has very little meaning to me. Consequently, it has little meaning to the Ideal Masters as well. I suppose you could call this the ultimate waiting game, each watching the other to see which will give in.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If I leave the Soul Cairn, can I safely return?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As you've been traveling in the Soul Cairn, your body has become attuned to it. Let's just say a tiny part of you rubbed off on it, and in its place, a bit of the Soul Cairn filled the void. You should find no difficulty using the portal any longer.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why haven't you pursued the prophecy?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Harkon's vision is a world plunged in eternal darkness where the vampire can flourish and never again fear the "tyranny of the sun." What he fails to realize is how much attention would be called to our kind if the prophecy came to fruition.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What sort of attention?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If eternal night fell, there are many who wouldn't stand for it. They would raise armies in attempts to return things to normal. The order of the day would be our destruction until every last vampire was hunted down and eliminated.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So you prefer living in the shadows.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I do. It's how the vampire has survived for millennia, and the only way we can continue to survive in the future.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who are the Ideal Masters?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know very little about them. They're mystic entities that lord over the Soul Cairn, controlling every aspect from its fabric to its appearance.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do they resemble?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, some necromancers believe they are the crystalline structures dotting the Soul Cairn. I believe there's more to it than that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How so?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think they transcend what we perceive as a physical form. Perhaps they were once corporeal beings, but they've obviously reached a point where they no longer require a tangible presence.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And the crystals?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Conduits through which the Ideal Masters speak to their underlings and feed on their victims.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why would they require sustenance?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Ideal Masters's weakness is their insatiable hunger for pure souls. It's the reason for the Soul Cairn's existence, and the only leverage a necromancer has when bargaining with them.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do the Masters provide in return?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The ability to summon powerful undead guardians as one would conjure an atronach or daedra. However, the majority of necromancers that are foolish enough to enter into a bargain with the Ideal Masters wind up here...as harvested souls.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player slays three Keepers, dispelling the barrier.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You managed to destroy all three Keepers? Very impressive.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Are you able to give us the scroll now?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. Please, follow me. Keep watch for Durnehviir. With the prison's barrier down, he's almost certain to investigate.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They enter the prison's large courtyard.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Wait...I hear something!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's Durnehviir...he's here! Defend yourselves!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They fight the ancient dragon, fending off the skeletons his powers start to resurrect. Eventually, they stamp out his attacks.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Forgive my astonishment, but I never thought I'd witness the death of that dragon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What makes you say that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Volumes written on Durnehviir allege that he can't be slain by normal means. It appears they were mistaken. Unless...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Go on.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The soul of a dragon is as resilient as its owner's scaly hide. It's possible that your killing blow merely displaced Durnehviir's physical form while he reconstitutes himself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How long will that take?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Minutes? Hours? Years? I can't even begin to guess. I suggest we don't wait around to find out. Now, let's get your Elder Scroll and you can be on your way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come on, she's leading us to the scroll.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They find a sheltered alcove across the courtyard. One takes the scroll from an ornate box.
label: ACTION

dialogue: That's it. That's the last scroll. Come on, let's take it to Dexion.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now that you've retrieved the Elder Scroll, you should be on your way. If there's anything I can do before you depart, you must let me know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Can you help me get my soul back?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So my daughter applied some of the lessons I taught her about necromancy, did she? Don't worry, I think I can help you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good, I could use all the help I can get.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your soul essence was trapped inside a gem. When you and Serana entered the Soul Cairn, it was "given" to the Ideal Masters as payment. You simply need to retrieve the gem. The moment you touch it, your soul essence will be restored.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Any idea where it could be?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's an offering altar not terribly far from here. I'm willing to bet that the gem you're looking for is there. Is there anything else? Could be your last chance.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're staying here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have no choice. As I told you before, I'm a Daughter of Coldharbour. If I return to Tamriel, that increases Harkon's likelihood of bringing the Tyranny of the Sun to fruition.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We'll return for you when we can.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I appreciate your concern for me, but Serana is all I care about. You must keep her safe at all costs.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We could use your help in Tamriel.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As much as it pains me to send you and Serana back alone, I can't take the risk.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We may never return.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After what I've put Serana through, I would understand if she never wished to see me again. I leave that decision in your hands. Remember that Harkon is not to be trusted. No matter what he promises, he'll deceive you in order to get what he wants. And promise me you'll keep my daughter safe. She's the only thing of value I have left. Farewell. Remember that Harkon's not to be trusted.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm glad we found the scroll, but I...I wish she could come with us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Dragonborn can inquire further.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Why don't you come back with us?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Even if I could, it would only serve to hinder your efforts. Harkon would likely sense my return to Tamriel. The last thing you need right now is a trail for him to follow.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You said "even if I could." Why?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Like Serana, I am a Daughter of Coldharbour, an vampire offspring of Molag Bal. My presence in Tamriel would simply double the risk that Harkon could complete the prophecy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And if Harkon failed?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The only way I'd even consider returning to Tamriel was if Harkon were not only to fail, but to be destroyed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You hate him that much?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You must understand that he's no longer the man I married all that time ago. He's obsessed...insane. Everyone around him fears him as they would a rabid dog. For all of this to end, he must die.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They exit the boneyard, only to find Durnehviir's spectral form waiting.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Stay your weapons. I would speak with you, Qahnaarin.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I thought you were dead.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Cursed, not dead. Doomed to exist in this form for all eternity. Trapped between laas and dinok, between life and death.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why are we speaking?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I believe in civility among seasoned warriors, and I find your ear worthy of my words. My claws have rended flesh from innumerable foes, but I have never once been felled on the field of battle. I therefore honor-name you "Qahnaarin," or Vanquisher in your tongue.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I found you equally worthy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your words do me great honor. My desire to speak with you was born from the result of our battle, Qahnaarin. I merely wish to respectfully ask a favor of you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Didn't you try to kill me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The hostility was necessary. I was bound to an oath.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have more pressing matters at the moment.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Forgive me, Qahnaarin. We will continue this when time releases you from its relentless grasp.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What kind of favor?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: For countless years I've roamed the Soul Cairn, in unintended service to the Ideal Masters. Before this, I roamed the skies above Tamriel. I desire to return there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's stopping you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I fear that my time here has taken its toll on me. I share a bond with this dreaded place. If I ventured far from the Soul Cairn, my strength would begin to wane until I was no more.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How could I help?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I will place my name with you and grant you the right to call my name from Tamriel. Do me this simple honor and I will fight at your side as your Grah-Zeymahzin, your Ally, and teach you my Thu'um.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just call your name in Tamriel? That's it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Trivial in your mind, perhaps. For me, it would mean a great deal. I don't require an answer, Qahnaarin. Simply speak my name to the heavens when you feel the time is right.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He teaches his thu'um. One can inquire further.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Why do you call me "Qahnaarin"?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In my language, the Qahnaarin is the Vanquisher, the one who has bested a fellow dovah in battle.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fellow dovah? I am not a dragon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Forgive me, my instinct was to grant you this title. I am uncertain why. Perhaps one day it will become clear to both of us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How did you end up in the Soul Cairn?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There was a time when I called Tamriel my home, but those days have long since passed. The dovah roamed the skies, vying for their small slices of territory that resulted in immense and ultimately fatal battles.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Were you a part of all that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I was. But unlike some of my brethren, I sought solutions outside the norm in order to maintain my superiority. I began to explore what the dovah call "Alok-Dilon," the ancient forbidden art that you call necromancy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So you sought the Soul Cairn for answers.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Ideal Masters assured me that my powers would be unmatched, that I could raise legions of the undead. In return, I was to serve them as a Keeper until the death of the one who calls herself Valerica.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They didn't tell you she was immortal.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I discovered too late that the Ideal Masters favor deception over honor and had no intention of releasing me from my binding. They had control of my mind, but fortunately they couldn't possess my soul.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is that why you're free now?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Free? No. I've been here too long, Qahnaarin. The Soul Cairn has become a part of what I am. I can never fully call Tamriel my home again, or I would surely perish. I only hope that you will allow me the precious moments of time there through your call.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After hearing the necrodragon's words, it's back to Castle Volkihar...
label: ACTION

dialogue: The team emerges from the Cairn.
label: ACTION

dialogue: The sooner we get the scroll home, the sooner we can deal with my father.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: IF ON D'GUARD SIDE IF ON D'GUARD SIDE
label: ACTION

dialogue: I trust your journey was successful?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've brought the Elder Scrolls.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm sorry, my friend. I can no longer be of use in this matter.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why? What's happened?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's my fault. In my haste to read the first scroll, I neglected the careful preparation required. I thought I'd be able to allay the after effects, but I was wrong. Now I'm paying for it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That covering on your eyes. Are you--
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Blind? Yes. I'm afraid so.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Can anything be done to help you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. It'll have to run its course, and there's always the chance I may never recover.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then we're finished.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, there's another way. The question is, how much are you willing to risk to find Auriel's Bow?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do I need to do?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can't guarantee you'll be free from harm. Becoming blind could be the least of your worries.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't worry about that. Just tell me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: IF ON VAMPIRE SIDE IF ON VAMPIRE SIDE
label: ACTION

dialogue: They return to Dexion, who now appears with a blindfold.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Yes, how may I serve you, milord?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've brought the Elder Scrolls.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm afraid I won't be able to help you with the scrolls any longer, milord. Please, do not be angry with me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What are you talking about?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm afraid in my haste to read the first scroll, I neglected the time I needed to prepare. The failure is purely mine to bear. As you can see from my bandages, it's not that I'm unwilling, it is that I'm physically unable.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're blind!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh please, milord! Please...forgive me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't suppose there's a cure.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If only such a miracle existed, I'd overcome the impossible in order to secure it if it meant pleasing you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then we have no further need of you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Although I would gladly die by your hand, perhaps I could offer an alternative way to read the scrolls?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Go on.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh thank you, milord. Thank you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just get to it!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: PATHS REJOIN AT THIS POINT PATHS REJOIN AT THIS POINT
label: ACTION

dialogue: Scattered across Tamriel are secluded locations known only as Ancestor Glades. There's one in Skyrim, in the Pine Forest. Performing the Ritual of the Ancestor Moth within the glade should provide the answers you seek.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Explain this "ritual."
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It involves carefully removing the bark from the Canticle Tree which will in turn attract Ancestor Moths to you. Once enough of the moths are following, they'll provide you with the second sight needed to decipher the scrolls.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Carefully gather the bark? How?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In keeping with tradition, you must use a specific tool in the Ancestor Glade, an implement known as a Draw Knife. Every Moth Priest is taught this ritual, but few ever get the chance to perform it...you should consider yourself fortunate if it works for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do I need to read the scrolls in any particular order?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: From what I saw in the vision, the Elder Scroll which foreshadows the defiance of the gods with the blood of mortals is the key to the prophecy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One can talk to Dexion about new options at this point.
label: ACTION

dialogue: How's a moth related to the Elder Scrolls?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, as I am sure you've figured out by now, it's no mere coincidence we are named "Moth Priests." The voice of the Ancestor Moth has always been an integral part of reading the Elder Scrolls.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Moths barely make a sound, let alone speak.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, the moths don't literally read the scrolls...but they maintain a connection to ancient magic that allows the Moth Priests to decipher them. If you listen closely when you find the glade, you should be able to hear their song...a soft, harmonious trilling. It's through this ancestral chorus that the moths tap into a form of primal augur and become a conduit for deciphering the scrolls.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How does that help the Moth Priest?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: By having the Ancestor Moths close to the Moth Priest, they can utilize the conduit and share the moth's augury. Only the most resilient of priests can do it this way...it takes years of practice to interpret the harmony.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then how do I even stand a chance?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've come this far, and you've found several Elder Scrolls. Whether you believe it or not, the scrolls have a mind of their own. If they didn't want you to find them, they wouldn't allow it. Because of this, I strongly believe you were meant to hear the ancestral chorus. Only one way to find out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What went wrong?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Deciphering one of the Elder Scrolls is nothing like reading a simple book. There is quite a bit of ritual and concentration required. It can take months or even years to complete a single scroll and even then, months to recover.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is it normal for Moth Priests to go blind?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sadly, yes. It is the inevitable fate we agree to pursue when reading the Elder Scrolls. It generally does not occur until a Moth Priest is in his latter years, but in my case I simply was not preparing myself properly.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player and Serana visit the glade, high in Falkreath's mountains. Inside is a bunch of loose foliage and crags.
label: ACTION
