dialogue: This must be the place. Hmph...not very impressive, is it? If this ends up being a wasted trip, your friend Dexion and I are going to have some words when we get back.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They head further in, finding a massive cavern, replete with a freshwater waterfall and spring, plus trees everywhere.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Wow. Look at this place. No one's been here in centuries. I doubt there's any other place like it in Skyrim. It's beautiful.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They find a draw knife in a ceremonial holder below.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Well, we got the knife...now all we need to do is track down one of those Canticle Trees.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's a blossoming Canticle on a higher ledge.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Hope those moths like that bark as much as Dexion said they would. Dexion didn't really give us a lot to go on, did he?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One moves around the area, finding swarms of moths and getting them to follow with the others.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Look at them...they've definitely taken a liking to you. And unless I'm seeing things, you're starting to...glimmer.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Soon, a sphere of ancient light is enveloping the player.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Woah! I think that might have been what we were waiting for. Let's head back up there and see if we can read the scrolls.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They go to the spring and stand in a column of sunlight. The player begins reading the the Blood scroll.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Nervous?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player reads the scrolls, and sees some kind of cryptic map.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Are you okay? Almost thought I lost you there...you went as white as the snow.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't worry, I'm fine.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I never trusted those damn scrolls. Who knows what those things could have done to you...just look at Dexion.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That felt strange.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I could see it in your eyes. You looked about a thousand leagues away.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Never mind that...it worked!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After everything we've been through, it had damn well better work. What about Auriel's Bow? Do you know where we can find it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's in a place called Darkfall Cave.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then it's almost over. • We can finally rewrite the prophecy as we see fit. • We can finally put an end to this ridiculous prophecy. Where is this "Darkfall Cave?"
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The scrolls gave me its exact location.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then let's get going. I want to get there before my father has a chance to track us down.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They leave, just in time to slay intruders from the faction opposite the one they're currently aligned with.
label: ACTION

dialogue: The cave is located in the NW mountains, not far from Mor Khazgur. There's they come across a small campsite with corpses stewn around.
label: ACTION

dialogue: These people were...why would anyone want to set up camp here? I wonder what happened to them.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After slaying some trolls, they see a man at a deep shrine.
label: ACTION

dialogue: What's that? I can feel some kind of power from it...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come forward. You have nothing to fear here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They approach Gelebor at his humble campsite.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I am Knight-Paladin Gelebor. Welcome to the Great Chantry of Auri-El.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This cave is a temple to Auriel?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Auriel, Auri-El, Alkosh, Akatosh...so many different names for the sovereign of the snow elves.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Snow elves? You're a Falmer?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I prefer snow elf. The name "Falmer" usually holds a negative meaning to most travelers. Those twisted creatures you call Falmer, I call the Betrayed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I imagine you know why we're here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course. You're here for Auriel's Bow. Why else would you be here? I can help you get it, but first I must have your assistance.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What type of assistance do you need?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I need you to kill Arch-Curate Vyrthur...my brother.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do I have a choice?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Absolutely. You could turn around and travel back from wherever you started empty handed, or you could assist me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How did you know?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: For the thousands of years I've served as the Chantry's sentinel, there hasn't been a single visitor here for any other reason. They request Auriel's Bow, and I request their assistance. It's been repeated so many times, I can't imagine it any other way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Kill your brother, why?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The kinship between us is gone. I don't understand what he's become, but he's no longer the brother I once knew. It was the Betrayed... they did something to him, I just don't know why Auri-El would allow this to happen.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What exactly did the Betrayed do?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They swept into the Chantry without warning and began killing everyone without pause.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Didn't you fight back?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Chantry was a place of peaceful worship. I led a small group of paladins, but we were no match for the Betrayed's sheer numbers. They slaughtered everyone and stormed the Inner Sanctum where I believe they corrupted Vyrthur.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You don't even know if he's alive.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He's alive. I've seen him. But something's wrong. He never looks as though he's in pain or under duress. He just...stands there and watches, as though waiting.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Have you tried getting into the Inner Sanctum?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Leaving the wayshrines unguarded would be violating my sacred duty as a Knight-Paladin of Auriel. And an assault on the Betrayed guarding the Inner Sanctum would only end with my death.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wayshrine?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, let me show you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The strange monument nearby rises, revealing it was actually a small, shrunken pavilion with only a ceremonial basin inside.
label: ACTION

dialogue: So, this is snow elf magic. Incredible.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This structure is known as a wayshrine. They were used for meditation and for transport when the Chantry was a place of enlightenment. Prelates of these shrines were charged with teaching the mantras of Auri-El to our Initiates.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's that basin in the center signify?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Once the Initiate completed his mantras, he'd dip a ceremonial ewer in the basin of the wayshrine's center and proceed to the next wayshrine.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So these Initiates had to lug around a heavy pitcher of water. Marvelous. How long would they have to do that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, once the Initiate's enlightenment was complete, he'd bring the ewer to the Chantry's Inner Sanctum. Pouring the contents of the ewer into the sacred basin of the Sanctum would allow him to enter for an audience with the Arch-Curate himself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All that just to end up dumping it out? Makes no sense to me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's symbolic. I don't expect you to understand.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, let's get this straight. We need to do all that nonsense to get into the temple, so we can kill your brother and claim Auriel's Bow?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know how it all sounds, but if there was another way I'd have done it long ago. The only way to get to my brother is by following in the Initiates' footsteps and traveling from wayshrine to wayshrine just as they did. The first lay at the end of Darkfall Passage, a cavern that represents the absence of enlightenment.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How many more wayshrines are there?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There are five in total, spread far across the Chantry.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: These caves must be massive.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Caves? Oh, no. The Chantry encompasses far more than a few caves, as you'll soon discover. But before I send you on your way, you'll need the Initiate's Ewer.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So I need to fill this at each wayshrine?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Once you've located a wayshrine, there will be spectral Prelate tending to it. They will allow you to draw the waters from the shrine's basin as if you've been enlightened.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll be off then.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This may be the last time we're able to converse. If you have any questions before you leave, I suggest you ask them. Otherwise, all I can do now is grant you my hopes for a safe journey.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If one inquires further to Gelebor...
label: ACTION

dialogue: Questions? I expected as much.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who are the spectral Prelates you mentioned?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They're ghosts of the snow elf priests that tended the wayshrines before being slaughtered by the Betrayed. Through the grace of Auri-El, they were restored to their spectral form to enable them to continue their duties.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good, they should be able to help us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm afraid in their current form, they still believe the Chantry to be an active center of worship. They won't respond to you in any way other than believing that you're an Initiate and you're undertaking the journey to the Inner Sanctum.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is the Chantry of Auri-El?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This is, or was, the epicenter for our religion. Most of the snow elf people worshipped Auri-El. The Chantry was constructed near the beginning of the First Era to provide a retreat to those that wished to become enlightened.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Most snow elves?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Our empire had temples to some of the other deities: Trinimac, Syrabane, Jephre and Phynaster rounded out the rest. But those temples paled in comparison to the glory of the Chantry and its wayshrines.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The wayshrines are part of the Chantry then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh yes. They were an important part of the process here. They represented the steps the Initiates took on the path to total enlightenment. Sadly, the magic used to construct these wonders were lost long before I arrived here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who were your people?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We were once a wealthy and prosperous society that occupied a portion of Skyrim. Unfortunately, we were constantly at war with the Nords who claimed the land as their ancestral home.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It appears the Nords won.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In a manner of speaking. We had always maintained an uneasy alliance with the underground-dwelling dwarves, and when faced with extinction we turned to them for help. Surprisingly, they agreed to protect us but demanded a terrible price...the blinding of our race.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Everyone couldn't have possibly agreed to that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There were splinter groups that resisted the agreement, and even some that sought alternate alliances. But when it was all said and done, those elves were either slaughtered, vanished or gave up and took the dwarves' bargain.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What turned your people into the Betrayed?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've often asked myself the same question. The blinding of my race was supposedly accomplished with a toxin. Certainly not enough to devolve them into the sad and twisted beings they've become.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why weren't the snow elves here afflicted?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Chantry is quite isolated, so it took some time for word of the dwarves' offer to reach us here. By the time the compact had been completed, it was too late for us to even attempt to intervene.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is that why you had retained your sight?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Correct. We only numbered perhaps a hundred at the time, so our presence remained a secret to the dwarves and the Nords. Ironically, our undoing came at the hands of our own people.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You mean the Betrayed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. They swarmed the Chantry in vast numbers until we were completely overrun. We never really stood a chance. I assume that the Arch-Curate was corrupted by them when they found a way to breach the Inner Sanctum.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There were others here like you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Vyrthur and myself are the only two snow elves that remain.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The snow elf magic opens a wayshrine portal to Darkfall Passage.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Well...that wasn't as unpleasant as I thought it would be. Kind of soothing, actually. I feel a little warmer, now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They start slaying the Falmer inhabitants.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Looks like these Falmer are here to stay. They must be who that priest was calling "the Betrayed."
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They come to a pull-chain door with a warrior's skeleton beside it.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Hmmm. Pull chains and traps. Be careful here. Whatever's on the other side of this, the Falmer wanted to keep there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They find a Vale Sabre Cat beyond, one of the first new Chantry monsters. The caverns filled with strange animals.
label: ACTION

dialogue: This is the kind of thing I've been wanting to see. Makes everything worth it. I think that's another wayshrine up there. Here we go.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They come upon a shrine and its ghostly prelate.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Welcome, Initiate. This is the Wayshrine of Illumination. Are you prepared to honor the mantras of Auri-El and fill your vessel with His enlightenment?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then behold Auri-El's gift, my child. May it light your path as you seek tranquility within the Inner Sanctum. May Auri-El's brilliance illuminate your path.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They fill the ewer and reach the Forgotten Vale. Unlike the rest of Skyrim, this mountain-tucked landscape has the remnants of snow elf architecture.
label: ACTION

dialogue: This is incredible. It's like a whole other world. Come on, the bow has to be in this valley somewhere. Is that another one of those wayshrines up there? I wonder where this one goes...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They reach the nearby shrine.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Welcome, Initiate. This is the Wayshrine of Sight. Are you prepared to honor the mantras of Auri-El and fill your vessel with His enlightenment?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then behold Auri-El's gift, my child. May it speed your journey to the Inner Sanctum. May Auri-El's light guide you in your darkest hours.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They continue on.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Is that another one of those wayshrines up there? I wonder where this one goes...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They reach the next shrine.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You've reached the Wayshrine of Learning, Initiate. Are you prepared to honor the mantras of Auri-El and fill your vessel with His enlightenment?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Auri-El bless you, child. For you are a step closer to the Inner Sanctum and everlasting wisdom. May Auri-El's warmth imbue your body with strength.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: From the riverbank, they spot the next 'shrine on a far-off cliff.
label: ACTION

dialogue: If we open that one, we'll be able to move around this valley a lot faster.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They reach it.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You've arrived at the Wayshrine of Resolution. Are you prepared to honor the mantras of Auri-El and fill your vessel with His enlightenment?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then go forth, child. May the enrichment of Auri-El strengthen your resolve as you undertake your journey to the Inner Sanctum. May Auri-El's glow shield you from your enemy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: To reach the final shrine, Serana and her helper must travel the Falmer-choked a troll, and must put them down one and all.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Poor thing. I know it would have tried to kill us, but still...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's a rickety bridge nearby.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Not the most solid construction. About what I'd expect from...creatures like this. Looks like they're better at making traps than they are at making bridges. A strange race, these Falmer.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Through a glacial crevice, the final wayshrine is finally in sight.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You've found the Wayshrine of Radiance, Initiate. Are you prepared to honor the mantras of Auri-El and fill your vessel with His enlightenment?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: May the blessings of Auri-El protect you as you climb the road to the Inner Sanctum and final enlightenment. May Auri-El's radiance fill your heart with joy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Inner Sanctum, a marvel of snow elf design, is right nearby.
label: ACTION

dialogue: That...that has to be the place. I've never seen a building like that before. It looks like some kind of temple. Never saw anything like this back on the island.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They enter the courtyard.
label: ACTION

dialogue: That is a statue of Auriel, but it's using the older signs of his power. This temple must be ancient. The bow has to be in here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As the water is placed in the final basin, it opens the destination's door. Inside, the long-frozen corpses of snow elves can be seen.
label: ACTION

dialogue: These Falmer are...they're frozen in the ice. I wonder how long they've been like this. And I thought the Soul Cairn was creepy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They reach the chapel, cut right into the glacier. The Arch-Curate's there.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Did you really come here expecting to claim Auriel's Bow? You've done exactly as I predicted and brought your fetching companion to me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wait, is he talking about me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Which, I'm sorry to say, means your usefulness is at an end!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They destroy the frozen Falmer he unleashes.
label: ACTION

dialogue: An impressive display, but a wasted effort. You delay nothing but your own deaths!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Watch out! He's pulling down the ceiling!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Finish them!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: More of his icy acolytes are smashed.
label: ACTION

dialogue: This has gone on long enough. Child, my life ended long before you were born!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They kill all his companions.
label: ACTION

dialogue: No...I won't let you ruin centuries of preparations...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Surrender and give us the bow!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Death first!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The snow elf magic destroys the Sanctum's walls and ceiling.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Are you alright? Come on, we can do this. I know we can. He's up there, on the balcony. Come on!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They corner him.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Enough, Vyrthur. Give us the bow!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How dare you. I was the Arch-Curate of Auri-El, girl. I had the ears of a god!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Until the "Betrayed" corrupted you. Yes, yes. We've heard this sad story.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Gelebor and his kind are easily manipulated fools. Look into my eyes, Serana. You tell me what I am.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're...you're a vampire? But Auriel should have protected you...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The moment I was infected by one of my own Initiates, Auri-El turned his back on me. I swore I'd have my revenge, no matter what the cost.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You want to take revenge...on a god?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Auri-El himself may have been beyond my reach, but his influence on our world wasn't. All I needed was the blood of a vampire and his own weapon, Auriel's Bow.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The blood of a vampire...Auriel's Bow... It...it was you? You created that prophecy?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A prophecy that lacked a single, final ingredient...the blood of a pure vampire. The blood of a Daughter of Coldharbour.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You were waiting...all this time for someone with my blood to come along. Well, too bad for you...I intend on keeping it. Let's see if your blood has any power to it!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What trickery is this!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They kill him.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Farewell.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: His death activates the final wayshrine. Gelebor steps out.
label: ACTION

dialogue: So, the deed has been done. The restoration of this wayshrine means that Vyrthur must be dead and the Betrayed no longer have control over him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Betrayed weren't to blame.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What? What are you talking about?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He was a vampire. He controlled them.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A vampire? I see. That would explain much. Deep inside, it brings me joy that the Betrayed weren't to blame for what happened here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Because that means there's still hope that they might one day shed their hatred and learn to believe in Auri-El once again. It's been a long time since I felt that way and it's been long overdue. My thanks, to both of you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're welcome.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You risked everything to get Auri-El's Bow, and in return, you've restored the Chantry. I can't think of a more deserving champion to carry it than you. If you wish to learn more about the bow, or obtain Sunhallowed Arrows for it, I'd be more than happy to help. You've but to ask.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One can inquire further.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Please, take the bow...it's yours.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What will happen to you now?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Even with Vyrthur gone and the Inner Sanctum destroyed, my duty as a Knight-Paladin of Auri-El remains. I've been sworn to protect this vale and everything it represents until I die.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And the wayshrines?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: For the time being, they will remain open. If remnants of our kind who escaped the betrayal at the hands of the dwarves exist out there, perhaps they will find this place one day.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What can you tell me about Auriel's Bow?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The bow was said to be carried by Auri-El himself into battle against the forces of Lorkhan in ancient and mythic times. Its craftsmanship has no equal anywhere within Tamriel and possibly beyond.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What can it do?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The bow draws its power from Aetherius itself, channeling it through the sun. Therefore, when an arrow is loosed from the bow, it produces a magical effect very similar to being burned by fire.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sounds powerful.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's actually only a fraction of its potential. With Sunhallowed Arrows, you would be able to produce a much more spectacular effect... causing bursts of sunlight to envelop your foes. The sunbursts would certainly hurt anything, but is especially devastating to the undead.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Vyrthur said something about using blood?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, using an arrow with the bow that's been dipped in blood may cause it to function differently...corrupting its purpose. That's of course if you're foolish enough to try it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How do I obtain Sunhallowed Arrows?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can actually assist you in that regard. If you were to bring me some good quality elven arrows, I could imbue them with the proper incantations and rituals.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Can you make me some Sunhallowed Arrows? • Absolutely. I can only do twenty at a time, so if you want the rest of your arrows blessed, let me know. • Absolutely. I can only do twenty at a time, but I see that won't be a problem in this case. • I'm afraid I'll need elven arrows if you want me to produce Sunhallowed Arrows, and it seems you're all out of them at the moment.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Can the Betrayed ever be cured?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I feel nothing but sympathy for the Betrayed, despite my actions against them. But I'm afraid that they're well beyond a cure at this point.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The twisted forms you've seen didn't occur overnight. It isn't a plague or a disease that ravaged our species. The dwarves may have stolen their sight, but it took many generations for them to become what they are today.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then there's no hope for them.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Perhaps they'll never return to their former appearance, but over the centuries, I've noticed a rise in their intellect. If a line of communication could be established with them, maybe they can find peace. It's the only way they'll discover that they weren't always malignant...they were once a proud and prosperous race.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What will happen to the Chantry now?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: While it would fill me with joy to see the Chantry back to its former glory, that time has long since passed. Now that my brother's dead, it's quite possibly I'm the last of our kind.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then I've contributed to your kind's extinction.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's no need for that kind of talk. I said it was possible. It's also quite possible that there are some other isolated conclaves of snow elves nestled elsewhere on Nirn. I'll also assume Vyrthur didn't exactly give you the option to stay your hand.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What will you do then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: For the time being I will remain here, on the overlook and continue trying to keep the Sanctum free of the Betrayed. You're always welcome to return here at any time, of course.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player claims the hallowed bow from the shrine.
label: ACTION

dialogue: It's...not as shiny as I was expecting. Still, it's beautiful.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do we do now?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: • Well, before we spoke to my mother in the Soul Cairn, I would have said we bring the bow to my father. But after everything with her...I don't think we can trust him. • I think we both know...it's time to face my father. If we don't, he'll keep chasing us for the rest of our lives.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then we kill him, before he kills us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I keep thinking that there's got to be another way, but he'll turn on us the moment he gets the chance.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If we do, he'll have to die.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've been thinking about this for a long time. It's...it's not easy. But I don't think we have much of a choice.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We have the bow, he'll listen to us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Have you been paying attention to everything that's happened? He'll betray us the second our backs are turned.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Maybe we can reason with him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Have you been paying attention? It's obvious my father's well beyond reason.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We should honor our agreement with him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Are you out of your mind? The moment you hand over the bow your usefulness ends. He'll kill you and then he'll take my blood for the damn prophecy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's run as far from him as we can.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's nowhere to run. And I'm certainly not moving in with my mother, if that's what you're implying.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. He has to die. We have no choice.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. This has to end here and now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then let's face him, together.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: • Thank you. Somehow I knew you'd understand. • If we head back to the castle and kick the front door in, we're going to be knee-deep in his friends. Let's head back to Isran and let him see what we've got first. I'm betting he'll lend us a sword or two.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One can ask about Vyrthur's plan...
label: ACTION

dialogue: Vyrthur was saying something about vampire blood and the bow...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It sounds like...that's the last bit of the prophecy. The blood of a Daughter of Coldharbour can corrupt the bow.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Can I use your blood, then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sure...do you have any arrows, though? They would have to be of elven quality, I'd guess.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're a Daughter of Coldharbour.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So I am. I guess we could use my blood. Do you have any arrows? Elven arrows. I'm not going to just bleed on any old thing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'd like to treat some arrows with your blood.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's just get this over with.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think you'll need to find some arrows, first. Only elven ones will work for this, remember?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not going to take your blood right now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh. All right, then.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Are you ready to do this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't think you can ever be ready to kill your parent. I'm doing my best to not think of him as my father anymore.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's a good way to be thinking.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I hope so.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let me know if you need anything.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We've got enough to worry about right now. You stay focused, and I'll worry about me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just...leave me alone for now. I'll be fine.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ON THE DAWNGUARD SIDE ON THE DAWNGUARD SIDE
label: ACTION

dialogue: One returns to Isran after exploring the Vale.
label: ACTION

dialogue: The bow...you have Auriel's Bow! I've heard it described in tales, but I could never have imagined its beauty.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We need your help, Isran.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Indeed. The day hasn't been won while Harkon still walks Tamriel. But what of Serana? Can she be trusted to lift a blade against her own kind? Her own family?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I trust her to do the right thing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I suppose that's as much as I can hope for. Let me address the Dawnguard, and then we'll be off. The men deserve to know we've finally gained the upper hand. Everyone! Gather 'round! Come on then, we haven't got all day! For too long we've allowed these vampires to poison the night and kill our people! Now, we finally have the means to strike back! We now have Auriel's Bow. The gods themselves have favored us and we must answer with action. The time has come to finally put an end to Harkon and his unholy prophecy! We will march on their land and destroy those wretched abominations so they can no longer corrupt our world! This is our fight and this is our fate! This is the time of the Dawnguard!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Kill the abominations!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This is it!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Send them to Oblivion!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Give him a crossbow bolt right between the eyes for me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The prophecy is no more!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's time we take the fight to their door. Gather your things and rest well, my friend. We meet outside Castle Volkihar.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Dawnguard assembles outside the vampires' castle. The hunters slay Modhna, put to the sword. Finally, it's time to visit the chapel.
label: ACTION

dialogue: ON THE VAMPIRES' SIDE ON THE VAMPIRES' SIDE
label: ACTION

dialogue: Everyone returns to Volkihar to confront Harkon. Before finding him, some of the other vampires will comment on it. This is optional, but eh well.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Auriel's Bow. Well done, indeed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Find Lord Harkon. Let him know the time of the prophecy is at hand.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I knew you would be victorious.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Our lord will be most pleased, I'm sure. I knew you could do it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All of Skyrim will tremble before us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't keep our master waiting. Take him the bow immediately.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have the bow...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm sure your reward will be great for ensuring our Lord's success.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who'll need thralls when the very sun is at our mercy?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Go find Lord Harkon. Tell him of your success.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Auriel's power is ours!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm sure Lord Harkon will be most pleased with your efforts. Find him at once.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Present the bow to Lord Harkon at once!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've served us all well, friend.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Auriel's Bow is ours. Deliver it to Lord Harkon at once, so we can reap the benefits of this prophecy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ON BOTH PATHS ON BOTH PATHS
label: ACTION

dialogue: The player and Serana find Harkon in the cathedral, where Molag Bal's blood shrine is. The Lord is waiting in his Vampire Lord form.
label: ACTION

dialogue: • So, you've returned. Is your...pet keeping you entertained? • Serana, my darling. I see you still favor keeping a pet.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know why we're here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course I do. You disappoint me, Serana. You've taken everything I've provided for you and thrown it all away for this • ...pathetic half-breed vampire. • ...pathetic being.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Provided for me? Are you insane? You've destroyed our family. You've killed other vampires. All over some prophecy that we barely understand. No more. I'm done with you. You will not touch him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Harkon sees she's drawn her weapon.
label: ACTION

dialogue: So, I see this dragon has fangs. Your voice drips with the venom of your mother's influence. How alike you've become.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No... Because unlike her, I'm not afraid of you. Not anymore.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And you... It appears I have you to thank for turning my daughter against me. I knew it was only a matter of time before
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: • your ambition outgrew your loyalty. • she'd return with hatred in her heart.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: • Loyalty? You never intended to let me live. • Hatred born of your neglect.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A small price to pay for the betterment of our kind.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: • You're an insult to our kind. • Your kind is a blight on this world.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: • Oh, come now...spare me your notions of kinship. You've simply used Serana in an attempt to take away what should rightfully be mine. • Yes, yes. Always the noble vampire hunter. And what happens when you've slain me? Is Valerica next? Is Serana?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I would never use Serana like that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The vampire is eternal, and with immortality comes the revelation that these bonds never endure... It's fleeting, momentary at best.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I would never harm Serana. She's too important to me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then my daughter is truly lost. She died the moment she accepted a mortal into her life.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, I'm here to prevent our annihilation.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, I see you've been speaking to Valerica and she's convinced you that eternal night will plunge us into war with daytime dwellers. If only it were so. With the world in shadow, we would never tire, never weaken...more than a match for their pitiful armies.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm only here to kill you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I see. Interesting that you can set aside your morals when it suits you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This is about more than killing vampires.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, of course. The prophecy. You've come here to stop me from taking Auriel's Bow and shrouding the world in darkness.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The bow belongs to me now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Finally, a trace of honesty in our little conversation. How does it feel to hold the fate of the vampire in your grasp? Exhilarating, isn't it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Enough of this!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, quite. I'm growing weary of speaking to you and my traitorous daughter. I'll give you a single chance to turn over the bow to me. There will not be a second.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Never.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Very well then, you leave me no choice!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Very well. (Give Auriel's Bow)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Pitiful. Simply pitiful. I expected more from the defiant fool that beguiled my daughter. No matter. Serana will sacrifice her blood for the sake of the prophecy, and I will feast upon yours in Molag Bal's honor!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Little patience for talk? Good. Let's end this!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Auriel's Bow will be mine!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I will darken the skies!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Serana will give various lines during the ensuing fight.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Tough day for you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The bow! Use the bow!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You can't hide from us!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sorry it had to be this way!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This day was always coming!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I still remember how to fight!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They fight Harkon. When he retreats to the blood fountain to restore life, coup de grace is dealt. Harkon collapses and melts by the altar.
label: ACTION

dialogue: No...Serana...your own father...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, now that's done.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What will you do now?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not sure. • I'll probably stay here, for as long as they'll let me. I think we can rebuild here. Make my family's legacy something more respectable. • I'll probably stay with the Dawnguard, for as long as they let me. They're respectable fighters, and I think they see the benefits of having a vampire on their side, now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course, if you've got any more adventures planned...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'd love to have you along.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's what I wanted to hear.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't think they'll involve you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Suit yourself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ON VAMPIRE PATH ONLY ON VAMPIRE PATH ONLY
label: ACTION

dialogue: Garan Marethi enters and sees the carnage and Harkon's bloody remains.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Lord Harkon, defeated. I never imagined I'd see the day. My lady, you have my deepest sympathies. I am sure this was not easy for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He was out of control, Garan. It had to be done. I'm not happy about this. He...he was still my father. But I suppose my father really died a long time ago. This was just the end of something else.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course, my dear. All will be well now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The questline has ended by this point, though some vampires will comment on the startling outcome.
label: ACTION

dialogue: My congratulations on defeating Harkon. Clearly, you are the superior vampire.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: None can deny your power now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No one will soon forget that you were the one to defeat Harkon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My lord.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am at your service, as always.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Garan has extra dialogue.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Something on your mind, Garan?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, now that the Castle is yours, I was wondering. Would you be interested in having the passage to the Courtyard restored? Harkon clearly never cared much for it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: See to it at once.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It would be my pleasure.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't care. Do as you like.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then I think I shall see to the repairs. Thank you for your time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Stop wasting my time, Garan.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My apologies. I shall not trouble you with it again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ON DAWNGUARD PATH ONLY ON DAWNGUARD PATH ONLY
label: ACTION

dialogue: After Harkon's demise, Isran walks into the cathedral.
label: ACTION

dialogue: It's over. He's dead, and the prophecy dies with him. I...I suppose this is difficult for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think my father really died a long time ago. This was just...the end of something else. I did what needed to be done. Nothing more.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think perhaps...I think you did more than that. You have my thanks.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He turns to the player.
label: ACTION

dialogue: So, the beast is destroyed. Not only that, but Auriel's Bow is in safe hands. The Dawnguard will now be dedicated to safeguarding it, making sure that prophecy will never come to pass. You've served Skyrim well. Even with these vampires gone, the fight isn't completely over. Once we're settled back in at the fort, there will be more work to do. We'd be honored to have you join us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ON EITHER SIDE ON EITHER SIDE
label: ACTION

dialogue: If one revisits Valerica in the Soul Cairn, the good news can be conveyed.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Harkon is dead.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What? Are you certain?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He died by my hand.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then I see nothing preventing my return to Tamriel. Allow me to gather some of my things and I'll head back to Castle Volkihar. And from the bottom of my heart, I thank you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After exiting the Cairn:
label: ACTION

dialogue: What will you do now?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, I think it's time I got back to my work as an alchemist. The Soul Cairn will offer a unique opportunity to continue my studies, and I intend to complete my research. In the meantime, if there are any potions you might need, feel free to help yourself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Can you give me Bloodcursed Arrows?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm sorry, I don't feel comfortable giving them to you. I understand what you did for • my family, • Serana and for me, but the prophecy never sat well with me, and I don't want to be part of it. I'm sorry.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: When entering a city, the player is randomly accosted by masked weirdos.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You there! You're the one they call Dragonborn?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, I am Dragonborn.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your lies fall on deaf ears, Deceiver. The True Dragonborn comes... You are but his shadow.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Greybeards seem to think so...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then it is too late. The lie has already taken root in the hearts of men. So we shall expose to them the falseness in their hearts by tearing out yours, Deceiver!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't know what you're talking about.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your lies fall on deaf ears, Deceiver! We know you are the False Dragonborn! You shall not stand in the way of the true Dragonborn's return. He comes soon, and we shall offer him your heart! When Lord Miraak appears all shall bear witness. None shall stand to oppose him!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After killing the belligerent freaks, one finds a note on their person that Captain Gjalund Salt-Sage on his ship.
label: ACTION

dialogue: If you're looking for passage to Solstheim, too bad. I'm not going back there anymore.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Are you the captain of the Northern Maiden?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sure. Yeah. That's me. Why? Who sent you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I was attacked by some cultists who came here on your ship.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now hold on! That wasn't my fault...I didn't know they were going to attack anybody. I don't even know how I got here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How can you not know how you got here? You sailed here, right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: (same as "What happened? Why...")
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What happened? Why won't you go back?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's hard to explain. I remember those people with the masks coming on board, then... Next thing I remember, I was here and they were gone. That's not right, losing whole days like that. There's been something strange going on there for a while, but after this...I'm done. I'm not going back to Solstheim.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, you are. You're taking me to Solstheim.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Have you been listening to me? I'm not going back there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll pay you double your usual rate. (Give 500 gold)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well...a man's got to make a living, after all. Fine. We'll cast off immediately.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's a tempting offer...when you actually have the gold, I might be willing to consider it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You owe me. Those cultists you brought here tried to kill me. (Persuade)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Alright, you have a point. Taking you back to find them is the least I can do. Besides, maybe you can put a stop to whatever's going on over there. I owe them a bit of payback myself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look, I'm sorry about your troubles, but I've got to look out for myself. I'm not going to risk it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: People are trying to kill me. I'm not taking no for an answer. (Intimidate)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hold on, now. I'm just a simple sailor. I never wanted to get mixed up in any of this. Alright, I'll take you. But we leave immediately.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yeah, well, and I don't want them trying to kill me. So the answer is still no.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll be back.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whatever you want. The answer isn't going to be any different later though.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Solstheim? Where's that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Surprised you've never heard of it. It's an island northeast of here. Has a small dark elf town called Raven Rock and a handful of Nords living in Skaal Village. But I'm not going back there. There's something wrong with about that place.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player books passage and, after a few days, arrives at Raven Rock, the island's main port of call.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Well, here we are. This is Raven Rock. Can't say I'm all that glad to see it again. Good luck. Maybe you can figure out what's going on around here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A man, Adril Arano, approaches on the docks.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I don't recognize you, so I'll assume this is your first visit to Raven Rock, outlander. State your intentions.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm looking for Miraak. Do you know him?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Miraak...I...I'm not sure that I do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just looking for work.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've picked one of the worst places in Morrowind to do that, but suit yourself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: None of your business.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's the kind of attitude that's going to land you in prison, but I'll let it go for now. Just remember, Raven Rock is sovereign territory of House Redoran. This is Morrowind, not Skyrim. While you're here you will be expected to abide by our laws. Any questions?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know who Miraak is?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I...I'm unsure. I swear I know the name, but cannot place it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Can you tell me anything about him?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't think so. I'm not... The name has something to do with the Earth Stone, I think. But I'm not sure what.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why are you so suspicious of visitors?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have to be. As Second Councilor, the security of Raven Rock is my primary concern.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Has security been an issue?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This isn't exactly the city of Blacklight. We're on the frontier here, and we've had more than a fair share of troubles. After all we've been through together, I refuse to let Councilor Morvayn down.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do your titles mean?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Councilor Morvayn is House Redoran's representative on Solstheim. As second councilor, it's my job to support him and make certain his rule is enforced.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is the city of Blacklight?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your ignorance of our homeland doesn't surprise me. It's the capital of Morrowind...been that way ever since Mournhold was sacked by the Argonians. I don't visit there often anymore, but we still get the occasional supply ship and visitors from there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Argonians invaded Morrowind?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Quite a while ago, yes. They cut a bloody swath across most of the southern region of Morrowind. Nobody seems certain why it happened...an attempt at expansion, revenge for the enslavement of their people or perhaps both. Whatever the case may be, thousands of Dunmer needlessly lost their lives and many more were exiled from their homeland.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Raven Rock is purely a Dunmer settlement?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Raven Rock started out as an Imperial settlement, but the Empire chose to abandon it just as my people were first setting foot here. They left the town in shambles...but when House Redoran took over, we turned it around and it became ours. And even if it's been a struggle to make this island livable, we're proud to call it home. Remember, we're watching you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One visits the Earth Shrine nearby -- it's a large stone that people've been which would fit with the captain's talk of lost time. A wizard approaches.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You there... You don't seem to be in quite the same state as the others here. Very interesting. May I ask what it is you're doing here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm looking for someone named Miraak.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Miraak...Miraak... It sounds familiar, and yet I can't quite place... Oh. Wait, I recall. But that makes very little sense. Miraak's been dead for thousands of years.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What does that mean?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not sure, but it is fascinating, isn't it? Perhaps it has some relation to what's going on here. Quite unexpected. I'm afraid I can't give you any answers. But there are ruins of an ancient temple of Miraak's toward the center of the island. If I were you, I'd look there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What are these people doing?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Building something, clearly. And yet they don't seem to have much to say about it. I'm very interested to find out what happens when they finish.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Have you tried to stop this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Certainly not! Doing so would interfere with whatever is going on, and I would be unable to see how this all turns out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What can you tell me about Morrowind?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: When the city of Vivec was destroyed, it took decades for us to rebuild. We are still but a shadow of our glorious past, but some day we will rise again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You are too young to remember the Nerevarine. He defeated Dagoth Ur and saved us all from the blight.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The ignorant think it is only a place of ash and lava. It had rolling green plains and swamps and verdant hills too.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It is the only place where silt striders can be found. Although I managed to transplant a few here when I arrived.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There is the big island of Vvardenfell, and the coastal mainland. House Telvanni has its properties on Vvardenfell. I've never been to the mainland myself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's the home of the dunmer. The lesser races call us dark elves. We built great works there, like Vivec and Ald'ruhn. Many of them are destroyed now, either by Red Mountain or the argonian invasion.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Red Mountain dominates the island. Every now and then ash and debris from an eruption land on our shores.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: With the tip received, one visits the island's central temple. Like the stone temple.
label: ACTION

dialogue: In the middle of the arena-like courtyard, the player finds Frea, a Nord. She isn't laboring like the others.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You there. What brings you to this place? Why are you here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who are you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am Frea of the Skaal. I am here to either save my people, or avenge them.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Save them from what?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am unsure. Something has taken control of most of the people of Solstheim. It makes them forget themselves, and work on these horrible creations that corrupt the Stones, the very land itself. My father Storn, our shaman, says Miraak has returned to Solstheim, but that is impossible.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This Miraak tried to have me killed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then you and I both have reason to see what lies beneath us. Let us go. There is nothing more I can do here. The Tree Stone and my friends are beyond my help for now. We need to find a way into the temple below.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do you know about Miraak?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: His story is as old as Solstheim itself. He served the dragons before their fall from power, as most did. A priest in their order. But unlike most, he turned against them. He made his own path, and his actions cost him dearly. The stories say he sought to claim Solstheim for himself, and the dragons destroyed him for it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is the Tree Stone?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It is an ancient stone of power, a connection to the All-Maker. It represents one of the aspects of nature, a part of the All-Maker's creation. There are other stones around Solstheim. I fear for what has happened to them...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me of your people, the Skaal.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We have lived on Solstheim for many generations. Our people are tied to the land itself. We try to serve the All-Maker, to live in balance with nature, instead of exploiting it as others would.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're here by yourself?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There are few of us left unaffected by this curse. My father Storn, the shaman, protects them in the village. I fashioned an amulet to guard me against whatever has taken hold of the Skaal, but it is the only one of its kind. If I cannot find a way to save them, there is no hope for our people.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Together, they enter the lower temple.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Are you ready to help me now? We should not delay. We should check these rooms for supplies before heading further into the temple. We must be careful in these ruins. Traps can be anywhere, and there will likely be many. Miraak was trying to take power here, and protect himself in the process.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They enter an ancient chamber with skeletons in hanging cages.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I do not wish to imagine what kinds of things happened in this chamber. Who were the poor souls trapped in these cages? What tortures did they suffer at Miraak's hands? Was it in service to the dragons, or for his own purposes? Look up there. I think I see something. The stairs are knocked out. I have no doubt you can find your way up. You never know, you may find something of value up there. I shall look around. We can proceed when you are ready.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If one uses a support beam to reach the isolated ledge:
label: ACTION

dialogue: Impressive! Was it worth the effort?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The two head deeper into the crypt, setting of a guillotine trap.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I am not going down there. It would be foolish to attempt it. You have a much better chance to make it through these traps. I have no doubt that lever turns the blades off. I shall wait here for now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One shuts off the dangerous impediment.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Thank you. Miraak took great pains to make it difficult to reach him, it seems. Let us hope that is the last of these traps.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The continue toward the sanctum.
label: ACTION

dialogue: The evil of this place must be rooted out. I do not know what it is Miraak learned that gave him reason to turn on his masters. But his path seems to have been a cruel one. I wonder if we will find some answers to what happened so long ago.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After awhile...
label: ACTION

dialogue: How much deeper can this be? I had been told that Miraak's power was great, but to have built so large a temple... It cannot be much further now. I feel it in my bones.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After encountering a Word Wall, the chamber shakes.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Something feels wrong. Brace yourself!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They kill the escaping draugr and find a key, leading into a hidden section of the temple.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Dead end? Impossible. There must be something more! Look around. I will let you know if I find anything in the dining area.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player uses a weird lever.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I knew it! A secret passage in the dining area just opened up. This must be it. Let us move quickly.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The room they find has gated stairways and grotesque statues.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I wonder if there is something here that tells the story of Miraak... Nothing but ruined books. I do not recognize this statuary. We passed by a few of them earlier, but they are becoming more frequent as we get further in. I do not like this place. It almost looks as if these statues will come to life at any moment. It looks like there is only one way to proceed. I leave the honor of pulling that handle to you. I do not want to put my hand anywhere near the mouth of that statue.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They continue downward.
label: ACTION

dialogue: It is eerily quiet. I do not suspect that will be the case the further we go. Be on your guard.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Deep in the heart of the temple is a massive statue-adorned stairway. The large book.
label: ACTION

dialogue: There are dark magics at work here. Ready yourself. This book... It seems wrong, somehow. Here, yet...not. It may be what we seek.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As one begins to read the Black Book, a mass of tentacles drags one into a floating creatures. A subservient dragon seems to be nearby.
label: ACTION

dialogue: The time comes soon when... What?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He zaps the player, preventing them from attacking.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Who are you to dare set foot here? Ah... You are Dragonborn. I can feel it. And yet... You have done little beyond killing a few dragons. You have no idea of the true power a Dragonborn can wield! Mul...Qah Diiv! This realm is beyond you. You have no power here. And it is only a matter of time before Solstheim is also mine. I already control the minds of its people. Soon they will finish building my temple, and I can return home. She can await my arrival with the rest of Tamriel.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The creatures delay the player, letting Miraak fly away on the dragon. One is the forcefully ejected from the book.
label: ACTION

dialogue: What happened to you? You read the book and then... It seemed as though you were not really here. I could see you, but also see through you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not really sure. I saw Miraak on a dragon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Where? Where is he? Can we reach him? Can we kill him?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Somehow, reading this book took me to where he was.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This is a dangerous thing, then. We should return to my village, and show this to my father. Perhaps Storn can make sense of what is going on. Come, there looks to be a way out through here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Everyone escapes out into the fresh air. The Wind Stone's glow is nearby.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You see that green light? That comes from the Wind Stone, where my people work against their will. They must be freed soon. My village is just ahead. Storn has used his magic to raise a barrier around it, protecting the few of us left. That the barrier is still there is a good sign.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They reach the small village. In its center, a few people are meditating, and their energies are creating an overhead wind barrier.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Father! I have returned! There is yet hope!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Frea! What news do you bring? Is there a way to free our people?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, but I have brought someone who has seen things... He has confirmed that Miraak is the one behind the suffering of our people.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I feared that it would be so.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But how is that possible? After all this time...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I fear there is much we do not yet know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Please, tell Storn what has happened.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, you have seen things, yes? My magic grows weak, and so does the barrier around our village. Time is short. Tell me what you know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've seen Miraak.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Really? How?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Miraak is behind what's happening to your people.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How do you know this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I read a book in Miraak's temple, and went somewhere. Miraak was there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The legends speak of that place. Terrible battles fought at the temple. The dragons burning it to the ground in rage. They speak also of something worse than dragons buried within. Difficult to imagine, but if true... It means what I feared has come to pass. Miraak was never truly gone, and now has returned. If you could go to this place and see him... Are you like Miraak? Are you Dragonborn?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am indeed Dragonborn.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then perhaps you are connected with him. The old tales say that he, too, was Dragonborn.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Miraak did claim to be Dragonborn.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That is what the stories say. You are Dragonborn as well, then. Perhaps you are connected.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What does it mean if we're both Dragonborn?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am unsure. It may mean that you could save us, or it may mean that you could bring about our destruction. But our time is running out. The few of us left free of control cannot protect ourselves for much longer. You must go to Saering's Watch. Learn there the Word Miraak learned long ago, and use that knowledge on the Wind Stone. You may be able to break the hold on our people there, and free them from control.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do you know about Miraak?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Much of what was known has been lost to the ages. He was Dragonborn, and yet he served the dragons. A priest in their order, highly esteemed and very powerful. Then he turned against them, becoming something they feared. He was defeated long ago, but it seems he was never destroyed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do you mean, "free your people from control?"
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Some dark influence wields power over them, forces them to forget themselves and act against their nature. At first it was only during the night, but now every moment is spent building some strange shrine around the Wind Stone. I believe if the shrine can be destroyed, the Skaal will be free once more.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why do I need to learn a Word of Power?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Miraak is behind what's happening to our village, and so the knowledge he has gained as Dragonborn is at the heart of it. You are Dragonborn as well. You too can wield this power, perhaps to a better end. All-Maker shelter you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After getting part of the Bend Will Shout at the destination, one returns to appears for everyone to neutralize. Everyone returns to the village.
label: ACTION

dialogue: The air is different. We are safe, which means you have succeeded.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your people are free.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So it is. You have proven yourself an ally to the Skaal, and so the Skaal shall be allies to you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do we do now?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you have released the Wind Stone and broken the hold on my people, perhaps you can do the same for the rest of Solstheim. I doubt it will fully stop whatever Miraak is doing, but it may slow his progress.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's not enough. I need to stop Miraak now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I cannot help with that. None here can. You will need the knowledge Miraak himself learned. You will need to learn more about this Black Book.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me more about this book, then.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Miraak had this? This does not look like something of the Dragon cult. It is a dark thing, unnatural. I would have nothing to do with it. But the Dark Elf Wizard, Neloth... He came to us sometime ago, asking about the Black Books. I believe he knows a great deal about them. Perhaps too much. Seek him to the south. Be cautious, Dragonborn. There is something else at work here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: To the south is a gigantic house made from a Morrowind mushroom -- Neloth's spellcasting.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Why are you out here? Aren't you supposed to be in the tower assisting Master Neloth?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why won't this summoning work? If you must know, I'm trying to get this Ash Guardian spell to work. Now let me concentrate. Besides, shouldn't you be worrying about the damage to the tower?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Master Neloth has tasked Elynea with repairing the tower. Why aren't you doing this in the lab, where it would be safer for all of us?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The, uh...the lab is too small. Also, I need the ashy soil. Master Neloth knows what I'm doing. No need to bother him about it though. He's quite busy at the moment
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's on your head if something goes wrong. Just let me get back inside first.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No Ash Guardian. Maybe the book has something.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She notices the player is approaching.
label: ACTION

dialogue: We don't get many visitors. Is there something you need?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is this place?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tel Mithryn. It's the home of Master Neloth. You may have heard of him. He's a famous Telvanni wizard.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He lives in a giant mushroom?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In Morrowind, the Telvanni grow buildings from special fungus spores. Master Neloth grew one here to be his home. Don't ask me how.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Are you one of Neloth's apprentices?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. Talvas is his apprentice. I'm his steward. I manage the day to day affairs of Tel Mithryn.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who else lives here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Talvas is Master Neloth's apprentice. If you are interested in spells, he might be willing to sell you some. Elynea is our alchemist. She specializes in mushrooms and other types of fungus. Ulves runs the kitchens.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One goes up to visit the famous wizard in the largest mushroom tower.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You again? Didn't I see you in Raven Rock?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I hear you know where to find Black Books.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You refer to the tomes of esoteric knowledge that old Hermaeus Mora has scattered throughout the world? Is this somehow connected to your search for Miraak?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I found a Black Book. I need to find more.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Found one? Yes, and you read it, too, didn't you? Don't try to deny it, you've got the look. I can see it now. Dangerous knowledge is still knowledge and therefore useful. Usually turns out to be the most useful, in my experience.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Black Books have something to do with Hermaeus Mora?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You didn't know? Hmm, I thought it was obvious. Hermaeus Mora has always tried to seduce mortals into his service with the lure of forbidden knowledge. Where the Black Books actually came from...no one really knows. Some appear to have been written far in the past, others might be from the future. Apparently time is more malleable if you're the Daedric Prince of fate and destiny.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who is Hermaeus Mora?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you have to ask that, you'd probably be best leaving his books to wiser heads than yours. Like all Daedric Princes, he's not to be trifled with. But he is subtler than most of his ilk, appropriate for the prince of knowledge and fate. Many scholars and loremasters have been ensnared by the lure of learning secrets that only Hermaeus Mora possesses. But don't worry. I have no intention of joining them in their endless search though the infinite halls of Apocrypha.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have to know what Miraak knows if I want to stop him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now that is a dangerous path indeed. Hermaeus Mora gives nothing away for free. You may end up like Miraak, of course. Two power-mad Dragonborn. It could be very interesting.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do you know where I can find another Black Book?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh yes. They're not hard to locate once you know how to look for them. I have one here that I've been using to locate more.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have a Black Book?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. I haven't been idle while this fascinating madness engulfed Solstheim. But my book isn't what you're looking for. I'm quite sure it's unconnected with this Miraak. But I do know where to find a Black Book that can help you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So you know where to find this Black Book? The one connected with Miraak?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, I do. I haven't been able to get it, though. But maybe together we can unlock the secrets the Dwemer left behind.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Dwemer? What do they have to do with this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Forbidden knowledge was somewhat of a specialty of the dwarves, eh? You don't think they would just leave it alone, do you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just tell me where the book is and I'll go get it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm afraid it isn't that simple. If it was, I would have the book already. It seems the ancient Dwemer discovered this book and took it to study. I found their "reading room" in the ruins of Nchardak. The book is there, but it's sealed in a protective case which I wasn't able to open. But perhaps the two of us together will be able to get at the book. To Nchardak, then. Follow me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why won't the book you have here help me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, it is clearly not associated with the same power that has overtaken the island. And I'm not talking about Hermaeus Mora. These Black Books are all his, of course. No, what you're looking for is a specific book. Presumably because Miraak's power derives from it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Neloth takes the player to the seaside Dwemer ruins.
label: ACTION

dialogue: The Dwemer certainly know how to build for the ages. These towers have outlasted their creators by millenia. The book is housed inside that dome. I'll need to unlock the door for us. Let's get on with it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Reaver bandits attack.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I had to clean out the riff-raff last time I was here, too. Where do they come from?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They finally slay the outdoor assailants and approach the locked entrance.
label: ACTION

dialogue: The Dwemer of Nchardak appear to have been fond of these control pedestals. Luckily I found a cube to operate it inside on my last visit. I sealed the door when I left to keep out ignorant meddlers. Let me unlock it. The book is just inside.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The two visit inside. The target item is visible in the floor, under a thick protective cover.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You can see the book right there. So tantalizingly close...but trust me, no magic will open that. I'd have had the book already if it could. No, we'll have to do this the hard way. If we can restore the steam supply to this room, I'm certain I can open it. As you'll see, that's easier said than done. This way to the boilers. Follow me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The elevator takes them into the desolate, flooded boiler room.
label: ACTION

dialogue: The last time I was here, I only explored a small portion of the ruins. I was here alone then, and I find an assistant is absolutely essential for this kind of dirty, dangerous work. Nchardak. The "City of a Hundred Towers". In its day, it was the largest of the great Dwemer Archives, and perhaps the most advanced. In the old stories, when the Nords came to conquer it, it's said the Dwemer submerged the entire city beneath the sea until the invaders gave up. I have my doubts. But the city was a marvel of Dwemer engineering. Now...reduced to this. As you can see, most of the lower levels of the city are flooded. But it isn't hopeless -- the old Dwemer pumps still seem to work. Watch.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He uses a control pedestal, draining part of the room.
label: ACTION

dialogue: But the pumps only operate when a cube is in the pedestal. And unfortunately, I only have one cube. These four boilers provide steam to the room upstairs. They're shut down, but they still respond to the control cubes. So, if we can find four more cubes, we can turn these boilers back on and restore steam power to the room upstairs. Then I should be able to open the book's protective case. Bring that cube. We'll need it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One takes the cube and visits Neloth at an old Dwemer control panel.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Yes...here we are. This device shows the location of four more cubes in this section of the city. It looks like most of the cubes were moved to the lower levels; perhaps to try to control the flooding before the city was abandoned. Interesting. That would suggest that the city must have originally sunk during the first cataclysm of Red Mountain. Or that the Dwemer's servitors continued to try to preserve the city after their creators' disappearance.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He stops at a door.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Three of the cubes are through here. This seems like a sensible place to start. You should be able to unseal this door with the control cube I gave you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They enter the adjacent workshop. A cube is sitting a few steps away.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I hope the rest of the cubes arethis easy to find. Although knowing the Dwemer, I rather doubt it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A long, half-flooded chamber is nearby.
label: ACTION

dialogue: These must be the "Great Workshops of Nchardak". Impressive even in ruins. In the city's days of glory, it was reputed to be able to assemble a complete automaton in a single day. Much of the Dwemer army at the Battle of Red Mountain must have come from here. It looks like we'll need to lower the water level to make any more progress.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Using the cubes, the room is drained.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Ah, good. Now we can see if we can find a way to get that next cube.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Some Centurions come to life.
label: ACTION

dialogue: There seems to be an inexhaustible suply of these Dwemer contraptions.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They claim a third cube still in use.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Unfortunately, each cube we retrieve shuts down the corresponding pumps, raising the water level. We'll have to be careful.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They end up reflooding the room, gaining access to a broken passage.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Let's see where this leads. With the water level this high, we can swim right across the collapsed part of the passage and reach the other side.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Soon after, they find another cube.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Very good. By my count, we've found a total of four cubes. Assuming you haven't dropped any anywhere.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They return to the first area of the boilery.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You'll need to lower the water level before we can proceed any further.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Soon, it's time to visit the aqueduct.
label: ACTION

dialogue: The last cube is somewhere in here. I hope it won't require more swimming around in this filth. I'd guess that must be the pump activator up there. But how to reach it? We'll need to get all three of these bridges down in order to reach the pump control.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player fiddles with the cube controls.
label: ACTION

dialogue: That's it! Don't touch anything else. Quickly now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They kill some automatons.
label: ACTION

dialogue: What a mess. I'm getting tired of wading around in this muck. I have an idea. I'll wait here and retrieve this cube once you find the last one we need. Good luck!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nearby, one retrieves the last cube from its booby-trapped pedestal.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Do you have the cube? Good, good! Then I'll take this cube and we can be on our way. Watch out. The water's rising even higher with both pumps shut down. That was easier than I expected. I'm glad you were here to do all the hard work. With the cube I retrieved from the pumping pedestal, we should now have five cubes -- exactly what we need. Now we can finally see about getting those boilers started.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: For the last time, everyone returns to Nchardak's boilery.
label: ACTION

dialogue: You'll need the cube I picked up to start all the boilers. Here, I picked this up this cube for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All boilers are put back in action.
label: ACTION

dialogue: That seems to have done it. Good. It took longer than I'd hoped, but at least it's finally done. Look out, another Steam Centurion!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They kill the final foe.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I'm going to head back upstairs and see if the reading room has steam. If so, it should be a simple matter to release the book.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Everyone travels upstairs.
label: ACTION
