dialogue: Yes, it worked! The steam is flowing. Now it should be as simple as... That should do it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The case recedes and the book rises up into plain view.
label: ACTION

dialogue: At last. I hope it was worth it. Please...be my guest. You deserve the first look. Besides, it could be very dangerous. These books are known to drive many people insane.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player opens Nchardak's Black Book...
label: ACTION

dialogue: Oh good. Be sure to say hello to Hermaeus Mora for me, if you see him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...and is warped back to Hermaeus Mora's plane of Oblivion, filled with black previously completed his "Discerning the Transmundane" quest.
label: ACTION

dialogue: • So, another seeker after knowledge enters my realm. • I know you, champion. The Oghma Infinium was only the beginning.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This is Apocrypha, where all knowledge is hoarded.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: • Perhaps you will prove clever enough to uncover the secrets hidden here. If so, welcome. Perhaps you are a fool or a coward. If so, you are in peril. Read your book again and escape before Apocrypha claims you forever. • Sate your thirst for knowledge in the endless stacks of my library. If you tire of your search, read your book again to return to your mortal life. For a time. The lure of Apocrypha will call you back. It is your fate.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player navigates the book's chapters to reach the end.
label: ACTION

dialogue: • All seekers of knowledge come to me, sooner or later. • Well done, my champion. Your journey towards enlightenment has finally lead you here, to my realm, as I knew it would.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who are you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am Hermaeus Mora, the Gardener of Men, knower of the unknown, master of fates. You stand in my realm, mortal.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do you want of me? / What do you want of me this time?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have entered my realm. You have sought out the forbidden knowledge that only one other has obtained. You are Dragonborn, like Miraak before you. A seeker of knowledge and power.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do you want me of this time, my lord?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your progress since obtaining my Oghma Infinium has been rapid. And now, I find you here, following in my servant Miraak's footsteps. You also are Dragonborn. You also seek how to bend the world to your will.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't worry, I was just leaving.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. Not yet. I have watched your progress through my realm with growing interest. You are following in the footsteps of my servant, Miraak. Like him, you are Dragonborn, and seek the power that is your birthright.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, I came here to learn Miraak's secrets.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All that he knows he learned from me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I won't serve you, monster. I just want to defeat Miraak.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You will serve me, willing or not. All who seek after the secrets of the world are my servants.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't need your help. I'll learn Miraak's secrets on my own.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. Look around you. You have done nothing here on your own. You could spend a hundred lifetimes searching my library, and you will never find what you seek. I know what you want: to use your power as Dragonborn to bend the world to your will. Here then is the knowledge you need, although you did not know you needed it. The second Word of Power. Use it to bend the will of mortals to your purpose. But this is not enough. Miraak knows the final Word of Power. Without that, you cannot hope to surpass him. Miraak served me well, and was rewarded. I can grant you the same power as he wields, but all knowledge has its price.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So what's your price for the final Word of Power?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Knowledge for knowledge.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me what you want, my lord, and I will bring it to you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You please me, champion. Your loyalty will be richly rewarded. The Skaal have withheld their secrets from me for many long years. The time has come for this knowledge to be added to my library.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I will talk to the Skaal and bring you their secrets.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know you will. And then I will give you the knowledge that you seek.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I will do as you command, my lord.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, I know. And then Miraak's power will be yours as well.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What if the Skaal refuse to give up their secrets?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My servant Miraak would have found a way to bring me what I want. So will you, if you wish to surpass him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How do I know I can trust you, demon?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My word is as true as fate, as inevitable as destiny. Bring me what I want, and I will give you what you seek.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why do I need this Word of Power to defeat Miraak?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Even dragons submit to Miraak's Voice. Without that power, you cannot face him. So say I, Hermaeus Mora, master of the tides of Fate.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Isn't Miraak your ally? Why help me defeat him?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He has served me long and well. But he grows restless under my guidance. His desire to return to your world will spread my influence more widely. But it will also set him free from my direct control. It may be time to replace him with a more loyal servant. One who still appreciates the gifts that I have to offer. Send the Skaal shaman to me. He holds the secrets that will be mine.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player finally exits the book, being transported back to Nchardak.
label: ACTION

dialogue: What happened? What did you see? Different people have very different experiences when reading these books.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I talked to Hermaeus Mora.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're still surprisingly sane, too. What did he have to say? He must have wanted something from you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I learned the second Word of the Bend Will Shout.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No wonder the Dwemer were so interested in that book. It was indeed one that Miraak used to advance his power as Dragonborn. But I assume there's some bad news. It would be unlike Hermaeus Mora to allow anyone to gain such knowledge without exacting a price.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He wants the "secrets of the Skaal" in exchange for teaching me the third Word.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hmph. What secrets could they have worth keeping from old Mora? Sounds like a bargain to me. Hermaeus Mora learns some fascinating new ways to skin a horker, and you become the second most powerful Dragonborn that ever lived. Well, that gives me a lot to think about. I need to get back to Tel Mithryn. I have some ideas about how to locate more of these Black Books...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: With the sojourn over, the player exits outside, finding a dragon waiting.
label: ACTION

dialogue: When Miraak returns, all will bow before him!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They kill the dragon, but a projection of Miraak appears, taking the soul.
label: ACTION

dialogue: This dragon's soul belongs to me. One step closer to my return.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After, it's back to Skaal Village to find Storn.
label: ACTION

dialogue: I spoke to Hermaeus Mora. He asked for the "secrets of the Skaal."
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hermaeus Mora...old Herma-Mora himself. So he is the source of Miraak's power. Of course. We have many tales of Herma-Mora trying to trick us into giving up our secrets to him. And now he comes again for what we have long kept from him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He said that's the only way he'll teach me the final Word of Miraak's Shout.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So it falls to me to be the one to give up our secrets to our ancient enemy. I do not know if I have the strength to face him. The Tree Stone is still corrupted...the land is still out of balance. But with the other five restored...it may be enough. It will have to be.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You mean you'll give him what he wants?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. The Skaal also tell of the day when we must finally give up our secrets. When Herma-Mora finally wins. As shaman, it is my duty to guard these secrets, but also to decide when it is necessary to give them up. I believe that time is now. If I am wrong, may my ancestors forgive me. Give me the book. I will read it, and speak to old Herma-Mora myself. I will make sure he lives up to his part of the bargain.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What are the "secrets of the Skall"?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ancient lore, handed down from shaman to shaman since the All-Maker first gave Solstheim to the Skaal. How to talk to the wind, how to listen to the earth -- these are our secrets. Nothing of power or mastery.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why would Hermaeus Mora want your secrets?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We know him as Herma-Mora, the Demon of Knowledge. It is in his nature to hoard secrets for himself. Their value to him is of no consequence. The very fact that the Skaal have kept knowledge from him has merely increased his desire to have it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Herma-Mora? Why do you call him that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That is our name for him -- the Demon of Knowledge. He has always been our enemy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I hope you know what you're doing. (Give book)
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That is my hope as well. I am trusting that you will make this sacrifice worthwhile.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Father, you must not do this. That book is...wrong. Evil. Against everything that you have taught me my whole life.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I must, Frea. It is the only way to free Solstheim forever from Miraak's shadow. There comes a time when everything must change. Nothing that lives remains the same forever. Do not fear for me, my daughter. This is the destiny that the All-Maker has laid out for me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I stand beside you, father, as always.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am ready for whatever the foul master of this book has in store for me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He opens the book; dark tendrils dig into his mind as Herma-Mora manifests.
label: ACTION

dialogue: At last, the Skaal yield up their secrets to me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Father! No, stop!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You...liar...gah!...I won't...not...for you...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do something!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Dragonborn, you have delivered me the gift I requested. In return, I keep my promise, as befits a Prince of Oblivion: I give you the Word of Power that you need to challenge Miraak. You will be either a worthy opponent or his successor, as the tides of fate decree.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nooo...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Storn crumples to the floor, dead. Herma-Mora disappears.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Father! What have you done? Go. My father sacrificed himself so that you could destroy Miraak and lift his master's shadow from the land. Go, then. Kill Miraak. Do not fail.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The other Skaal come to pay their respects at the body.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Goodbye, old friend. We will miss you, but do not worry. Frea will guide us well, thanks to you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We won't forget what you did for us, Storn Crag-Strider. Walk with the All-Maker.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Frea...I'm sorry.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It can't be...please, All-Maker, send him back to us...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: May the All-Maker guide your soul to the next life.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Frea...what happened? What was that thing? I thought the village was safe now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Return to the All-Maker, old one. The Skaal will never forget your sacrifice.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't really understand what you did, but I trust you did it for the good of the village. So...thank you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: By the gods...I've never seen anything like it...I, uh...I don't think this will go in my book.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: With the full Thu'um attained, one reads the Waking Dreams book to reenter Bend Will Shout.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Hail, thuri. Your thu'um has the mastery. Climb aboard and I will carry you to Miraak.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The player hangs on as Sahrotaar heads for a distant, isolated tower.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Beware. Miraak is strong. He knew you would come here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They land on the tower. The enemy Dragonborn is patiently waiting.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Sahrotaar, are you so easily swayed?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sahrotaar talks again.
label: ACTION

dialogue: No. Not yet. We should greet our guest first. And so the First Dragonborn meets the Last Dragonborn at the summit of Apocrypha. No doubt just as Hermaeus Mora intended. He is a fickle master, you know. But now I will be free of him. My time in Apocrypha is over. You are here in your full power, and thus subject to my full power. You will die. And with the power of your soul, I will return to Solstheim and be master of my own fate once again. Kruziikrel! Relonikiv! Now!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Miraak's other two dragons appear, and Sahrotaar flies off to fight them.
label: ACTION

dialogue: So easily you betray me, after all these years.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: When weakened, Miraak calls to his dragon...
label: ACTION

dialogue: Kruziikrel, ziil los dii du!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...and steals its soul when it lands. He repeats this for his other helper.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Relonikiv, ziil los dii du!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He regains his health yet again.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Fate decreed that you had to die so that I could win my freedom.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Finally, he calls his final dragon to its demise.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Sahrotaar, ziil los dii du!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Finally, after all Miraak's embarrassing shenanigans, Hermaeus Mora stops him mid-teleport and raises him into the air.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Did you think to escape me, Miraak? You can hide nothing from me here. No matter. I have found a new Dragonborn to serve me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: May he be rewarded for her service as I am!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Herma-Mora's tentacle impales him, slaying him permanently.
label: ACTION

dialogue: Miraak harbored fantasies of rebellion against me. Learn from his example. Serve me faithfully, and you will continue to be richly rewarded.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: With the threat to Solstheim averted, the player returns triumphant. That ends the questline properly. If one revisits Skaal Village:
label: ACTION

dialogue: I can feel it. The Tree Stone is free again. The Oneness of the land is is restored. Does that mean...is it over? Is Miraak defeated?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's over. Miraak is dead.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then my father's sacrifice...it was not in vain. He died to free us. Tell me...was it the only way? Did he need to die?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I couldn't have defeated Miraak without Storn's help.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then...it was the All-Maker's will, as he said. I know I should not doubt it. But it is good to hear, all the same. Thank you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hermaeus Mora killed Storn, remember. Not Miraak.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know. The Skaal will not forget this. Storn's death will become another of the many tales of Herma-Mora's treachery.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hermaeus Mora wouldn't have helped me without Storn's sacrifice.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, his "help" which did not require him to kill my father. Such is the way of Herma-Mora, the eternal enemy of the Skaal.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Storn didn't die for nothing. Miraak will never threaten Solstheim again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you. Whatever your other reasons for acting, you have done the Skaal a great service. We will not forget what you've done.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I killed Miraak. But Hermaeus Mora is still out there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It was Miraak who threatened Solstheim. With him gone, Herma-Mora has been foiled once again. Tell me, though...my father's death...was it necessary? Was there no other way to destroy Miraak? One more thing, Skaal-friend, if you will. I know it is not my place, but...may I offer a word of advice...of warning?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sure, what is it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As shaman of the Skaal, I am charged with the spiritual well-being of my people. While you are not of the Skaal, you are Skall-friend, and so I give you this warning. Herma-Mora forced you to serve him in order to defeat Miraak. Do not let him lure you further down that path. The All-Maker made you Dragonborn for a higher purpose. Do not forget that. Walk with the All-Maker, Skaal-friend.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't need your advice.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I understand. Walk with the All-Maker, Dragonborn.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If one revisits Neloth to update him about the goings-on:
label: ACTION

dialogue: Hold still. Let me get a good look at you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What are you looking for?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Incipient madness. Loss of self-awareness. Black spots in the whites of the eyes. Any of the documented indications of Hermaeus Mora's permanent influence. Hmm, no, you look fine. Well, at least no different than when I first saw you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't you want to know what happened with Miraak?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who? Oh him. Well, I assume you killed him. Or Hermaeus Mora turned on him when you looked like the winning bet. Or a bit of both.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You don't need to worry about me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I wasn't worried. Just interested. I don't get to observe first-hand many people who've spoken to Hermaeus Mora.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: End
label: ACTION
